HowToMake: Add the tequila syrup and juice in a shaker with ice and shake. Shake and strain into a Collins glass. Fill the glass to the top with ice and top with grapefruit soda. Garnish with a rosemary sprig. *Rosemary simple syrup: Combine 2 tbsp fresh rosemary leaves (from about 1 sprig) and ½ cup water in a pot and bring to a boil. Add 1 cup sugar and stir constantly until fully dissolved. Strain rosemary leaves and let syrup cool to room temperature before using. Do not refrigerate to quicken cooling time as sugar may crystallize from cooling too quickly. Once cool use immediately or store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
Ingredients: Cazadores reposado tequila;Rosemary simple syrup;Fresh lime juice;Grapefruit soda

Name: Rumours
About: At New Orleans’ Root bartender Waites Laseter created this cocktail using tawny port and pisco drawn together in earthy nutty herbaceous harmony. This recipe originally appeared as part of “11 Hottest Cocktails to Drink in Bars Now: August 2017.”
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker and dry-shake (no ice). Add ice and shake until well-chilled. Top with 4 drops of El Guapo Love Potion No. 9 bitters and a splash of juice from a jar of Luxardo maraschino cherries. Garnish with a lemon twist and Luxardo maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Macchu pisco;Fresh orange juice;Fresh lemon juice;Regans’ Orange Bitters No. 6;Egg white

Name: Room Temperature Martini No. 3
About: At Cure
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass and stir. Strain into a slightly chilled coupe or Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Dolin dry vermouth;H&H five-year-old special dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Room Temperature Martini No. 2
About: At Cure
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass and stir. Strain into a slightly chilled coupe or Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Beefeater gin;Chilled water;Orange bitters

Name: Room Temperature Martini No. 1
About: At Cure in New Orleans co-owner Neal Bodenheimer believes Arctic temperatures aren’t the right way to approach such a nuanced drink. Instead he thinks the Martini should be served only slightly chilled and—gasp!—closer to room temperature.This recipe originally appeared as part of “Are Martinis Better at Room Temperature?”
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass and stir. Strain into a slightly chilled coupe or Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Booth's dry gin;Chilled water;Lemon bitters;Orange bitters

Name: M Gin & Tonic
About: Chicago’s RPM Steak
HowToMake: Fill a Burgundy wine glass halfway with cracked ice. Add the gin fernet and vermouth then top with the tonic water. Garnish with 2 dehydrated (or fresh) lemon wheels 1 cinnamon stick and 4 star anise. Express the oil from an orange peel over top.
Ingredients: Fernet-Branca liqueur;Oil from orange peel
Garnish: 2 dehydrated lemon wheels;1 cinnamon stick;4 star anise

Name: Appletini
About: Originally called Adam’s Apple Martini the Appletini became a crowd pleaser from the day it was invented at L.A. restaurant Lola’s in 1996. The original recipe simply used vodka and green apple schnapps but we updated the modern classic with calvados and fresh Granny Smith apple juice.This recipe originally appeared as part of The Appletini Is 21 Years Old. Is It Time to Rethink the Famous Cocktail?
HowToMake: Add crushed ice to a cocktail glass and set aside to chill. Add all the ingredients into a shaker with cubed ice and shake for about 10 seconds. Empty the ice from the cocktail glass and double-strain the mixture into it. Garnish with a skewered brandied cherry and 3 Granny Smith apple slices.
Ingredients: Vodka;Calvados;Fresh Granny Smith apple juice;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Valley of the Dark Lords
About: One part inspiration from a Blood & Sand
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Ingredients: Ancho Reyes chile liqueur;Heering cherry liqueur;Fresh orange juice;Turmeric powder;Chia seeds

Name: A Drink Yoda Is
About: The folks at Datz
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the 3 slices of the jalapeño pepper in the honey syrup lime juice and matcha concentrate. Add the mezcal coco liqueur and orange flower water and shake. Double-strain into a rocks glass over ice. Cut a small slit in 2 jalapeño peppers and anchor them on either side of the glass to create a Yoda ear garnish.
Ingredients: Jalapeño pepper sliced in half plus 3 fresh jalapeño slices;Honey syrup (1 part honey 1 part water);Fresh lime juice;Matcha tea concentrate;Montelobos mezcal;Orange flower water

Name: Bothan
About: Thoroughly testing the depth of Star Wars nerdiness Billy Nichols the bar manager at Faun
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and dry-shake to froth the egg white. Add ice then shake again. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with dried chamomile blossoms. *Chamomile-infused tequila: Add 4 standard tisane bags of chamomile tea to a 750 mL bottle of blanco tequila and allow to sit in a dry cool place for 1 1/2 hours. Then discard the tea bags and strain for any particles.
Ingredients: Chamomile-infused tequila;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup (1 part honey 1 part water);Egg white;Absinthe

Name: Sarlacc Pit
About: At The Sixth
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a Highball glass or Tiki mug with crushed ice and swizzle. Top with more crushed ice. Garnish with a mint sprig and 2 twisty straws. *Han’s mix: Combine 1 cup sugar 1 cup water 3 cinnamon sticks a few fresh grates of nutmeg and 3 and star anise in a small pot over medium heat. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Allow to cool. Add 2 cups fresh orange juice strain and store in a sealed glass container up to 1 week. **Ginger syrup: Peel and juice 1 part ginger and allow the juice to sit preferably overnight. Gently pour the ginger juice into a new container while leaving the sediment behind and strain the remaining juice through a fine-mesh sieve. Measure the remaining juice and add an equal amount of granulated sugar by volume. Heat the mixture over medium heat stirring until all the sugar is dissolved.
Ingredients: El Dorado five-year-old gold rum;Han’s mix;Ginger syrup;Fresh lime juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Flying Solo
About: Louis Hirsch the GM of Morels Steakhouse & Bistro
HowToMake: Combine the tequila agave nectar and juice into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Float with the white zinfandel. Cut a hole in the corner of a lemon wheel (so it looks like the Death Star) and garnish. Add a straw.
Ingredients: Partida blanco tequila;Agave nectar;Fresh lemon juice;White zinfandel

Name: Absolut Elyx Vodka Martini
About: Meet the crisp light two-ingredient Martini you’ve been waiting for.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with lemon zest.
Ingredients: Absolut Elyx vodka;Lillet Blanc apéritif

Name: Elyx Spritz
About: Meet your new favorite light effervescent spritz perfect for summer sipping.
HowToMake: Add the vodka and aperitif to a Highball glass filled with ice. Top with the tonic and stir gently. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Absolut Elyx  vodka;Lillet Rose  aperitif;Fever-Tree elderflower tonic water to top

Name: Fennel Countdown
About: Fennel and citrus pair beautifully in salads. So it makes sense they would in a cocktail too.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with grapefruit zest. *Fennel cordial: In a saucepan bring 10 oz water and .25 gram dried loose fennel seeds to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Add .7 lbs fine sugar and stir until dissolved. Fine-strain into bottles.
Ingredients: Absolut Elyx  vodka;Suze  liqueur;Fennel cordial;Fresh pink grapefruit juice;Fresh lime juice

Name: Cold Fashioned
About: Vodka sherry and Cynar liqueur are more interesting mixers than milk and sugar. Try them with your next cold-brew coffee in this spin on the Old Fashioned.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass filled with cubed ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass filled with large-format ice and garnish with orange zest. *Demerara syrup: Add 1/2 cup demerara sugar and 1/2 cup water to a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Strain into a jar and seal tightly with a lid. It will keep refrigerated for about 1 month.
Ingredients: Absolut Elyx  vodka;Oloroso sherry;Cynar  liqueur;Cold-brew coffee;Demerara syrup

Name: Raspberry Mule
About: Make your next Mule even more refreshing by adding a fruity twist and topper of effervescent ginger beer.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain over crushed ice in a copper mug then top with the ginger beer. Top with more crushed ice. Garnish with fresh raspberries. *Raspberry cordial: In a saucepan bring 10 oz water and .3 lb raspberries to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Add .7 lb fine sugar and stir until dissolved. Fine-strain the cordial into bottles.
Ingredients: Absolut Elyx  vodka;Fresh homemade raspberry cordial;Fresh lime juice;Ginger beer to top

Name: B&T
About: A Gin & Tonic is one of life’s simplest crispest pleasures and it doesn’t get any easier to make than this one.
HowToMake: Add the gin to a Highball glass then half-fill the glass with the tonic water. Fill the glass with ice then add a lemon and orange wheel. Top with more tonic and stir.
Ingredients: Beefeater London dry gin;Tonic water

Name: London Spritz
About: The Aperol Spritz was the drink of the summer a few years ago. Beefeater Gin has given it a London upgrade by combining the bittersweet flavors of Aperol with the classic notes of a Gin &  Tonic.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a goblet or large wine glass filled with ice. Garnish with an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Beefeater dry gin;Aperol liqueur;Tonic water (preferably Fever-Tree);Prosecco;Ice: Cubed Hand-chipped

Name: Watermelon Margarita
About: A little bit of muddling goes a long way in this fresh minty take on a watermelon Margarita.For more great summery Mexican-inspired drinks—and tacos too!—head right this way.
HowToMake: Add the mint leaves and agave to a shaking tin and gently muddle. Add the remaining ingredients plus ice shake and double-strain into a rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with fresh mint sprig and watermelon slice.
Ingredients: Mint leaves;Light agave nectar;Cazadores tequila blanco;Fresh lime juice;Watermelon juice

Name: Pink Frozen Margarit
About: A Frozen Margarita is a beautiful refreshing cocktail. But throw a little Campari in there and a good thing gets even better—and pinker. For more great Mexican-inspired drinks—and tacos too!—head right this way.Serves 6
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients with 2 cups crushed ice in a blender and blend on high speed for 30 seconds until there are no longer chunks of ice. Pour into six Highball glasses. Garnish with lime slices and serve immediately.
Ingredients: Campari liqueur;Fresh lime juice;Triple sec;Agave nectar;crushed ice

Name: Spanish Gin & Tonic
About: It’s time to give your G&T
HowToMake: Pour the gin into a wine glass filled 3/4 with ice. Top with the tonic. Place juniper berries a lemon wheel and thyme into the glass. *Suggested alternate garnish combinations:. Sliced fig lavender/verbena flower vanilla bean lemon wheel juniper berries. Sliced peach thyme saffron lemon wheel juniper berries.
Ingredients: London dry gin;Tonic water

Name: Teal-quila Sunrise
About: This fun summer take on the Tequila Sunrise knocks out the grenadine for homemade raspberry syrup (don’t worry it’s easy!) and a dash of blue curaçao for a drink that’s as tasty as it is colorful.
HowToMake: Pour the syrup into a Highball glass and fill with crushed ice. Add the rest of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Strain over the crushed ice. Garnish with a lemon twist and raspberry. *Raspberry syrup: In a small glass muddle 6 raspberries. Add 6 oz simple syrup and stir. Fine-strain into a separate glass to remove the seeds.
Ingredients: Tequila blanco;Grand Marnier liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Raspberry syrup;Blue curaçao
Occasions: Cinco de Mayo;Mexican Independence Day;Spring Break

Name: Commander in Chief
About: Jillian Vose the bar manager at The Dead Rabbit in New York City knows a thing or two about Irish whiskey and cocktails. This drink employs two expressions: Redbreast 12-year-old and Green Spot. Mix these with bitters passion fruit syrup and Lemorton Pommeau de Normandie brandy and enjoy.This recipe originally appeared as part of Irish Whiskey Is Very Good in Cocktails. Have You Had These 5 Ultimate Examples?
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Redbreast 12-year-old Irish whiskey;Green Spot Irish whiskey;Lemorton Pommeau de Normandie brandy;Passion fruit syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Eye Opener
About: For this cocktail Jameson
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the stout to a mixing tin and stir. Strain into a rocks or mini stout glass. Dry-shake (without ice) the stout and add to the top of the cocktail. *Ginger-brown-sugar syrup: Combine equal parts fresh ginger juice with dark brown sugar in a blender and blend until fully incorporated.
Ingredients: Jameson Caskmates whiskey;Ginger–brown-sugar syrup;Cold-brew coffee;Stout beer

Name: True Blue
About: This crowd-pleasing cocktail comes from Harrison Ginsberg at The Dead Rabbit
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with grated nutmeg. *Ginger syrup: Add 16 oz ginger juice and 16 oz white sugar to a stainless steel pot and heat at 160 degrees F for 45 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool at room temperature. Strain through a cheesecloth. Bottle label and store in a refrigerator. **White miso cane syrup: Place 16 oz water and 2 tbsp miso paste in a stainless steel pot and heat at 180 degrees stirring frequently until the paste is completely dissolved. Add 4 cups cane sugar and increase the temp to 210 degrees bringing to a boil and stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool at room temperature for 30 minutes. Bottle label and store in a refrigerator.
Ingredients: Tullamore D.E.W. 12-year-old Irish whiskey;Guinness draught;Ginger syrup;White miso cane syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Luck of the Irish
About: John O’Connell of West Cork Distillers in Cork Ireland recommends this Irish version of a Manhattan
HowToMake: Pour all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over ice.
Ingredients: West Cork Distillers 10-year-old single-malt Irish whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Green Chartreuse

Name: Black Barrel Old Fashioned
About: Jameson
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until cold. Strain into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel whiskey;Bénédictine liqueur;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: Franny and Joe
About: Some people would rather start their day with caffeine. Those drinkers will appreciate the Franny & Joe. The mix of authentic hazelnut liqueur and cold-brew coffee makes this cocktail perfect for brunch. Add cream to transform this cocktail into the right kind of morning starter.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the optional cream to a rocks glass with ice (or a coupe without ice) and stir. Express an orange peel over top. As an option add a dash a cream. Garnish with the orange peel.
Ingredients: Frangelico®;Cold-brew coffee;Simple syrup;Bitters;Cream (optional)

Name: Campari Orange
About: Think of this as a refined Italian alternative to a Screwdriver. The orange juice makes it a natural fit in the family of brunch cocktails while the Campari gives it Italian authenticity. The Campari Orange isn’t the most famous use of Campari—that distinction goes to the Negroni—but this aperitivo should really truly be a brunch staple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a Highball glass filled with ice and stir. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Campari® liqueur;Fresh orange juice

Name: Frangelico Frizzante
About: The Frizzante is a perfect sip for enjoying brunch alfresco. Crafted with wild Tonda Gentile hazelnuts from the Piedmont region of Northern Italy Frangelico adds the perfect nutty flavor with a hint of sweetness complemented by the lime citrus in the Frizzante cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail glass with ice and stir. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Frangelico® liqueur;Soda water;Fresh lime juice

Name: Americano
About: The name is misleading since this aperitivo is an Italian classic. It’s the perfect marriage of Campari and Cinzano two of the most delicious and historic Italian exports. Encourage customers to kick off their brunch with this Italian original and don’t settle for any knockoffs.
HowToMake: Add the liqueur and vermouth to a rocks glass with ice and stir. Top with a splash of soda water. Garnish with an orange slice and lemon twist.
Ingredients: Campari® liqueur;Cinzano® 1757 vermouth;Soda water

Name: Aperol Spritz
About: A lot of people like a little something bubbly with their brunch. Move past the Mimosa and the rosé and satisfy that craving with an Aperol Spritz. An Aperol Spritz is bubbly and low-proof making it the perfect cocktail for daytime drinking. This is one of the most popular cocktails in Italy. Soon enough it will be a favorite for your customers too.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a wine glass with ice and stir. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Cinzano® prosecco;Aperol® apéritif;Soda water

Name: Fernet About It
About: Lemon and lime start things up with the herbal notes of fernet bringing up the rear in this cocktail by Jerry Nevins from his book “Sloshies: 102 Boozy Cocktails Straight from the Freezer.”This recipe originally appeared as part of “You’re Going to Need Frozen Cocktails This Summer. These 3 Are the Ones to Make.”
HowToMake: Makes 4. Add all the ingredients in a medium-size metal bowl and stir. Pour the liquid into a large freezer bag and place it in the freezer until frozen for approximately 4 hours. When ready to drink massage the freezer bag by hand until it’s a wet slushy consistency. If it’s not breaking up run the bag quickly under hot water and massage some more. Divide among four coupe glasses.
Ingredients: Appleton Estate Jamaica rum;Fernet-Branca liqueur;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh lime juice;Water

Name: Whiskey Smashed
About: Give your Kentucky Derby party an extra kick with this smashing combination of small-batch Kentucky bourbon and citrus by Jerry Nevins from his book “Sloshies: 102 Boozy Cocktails Straight from the Freezer.”This recipe originally appeared as part of “You’re Going to Need Frozen Cocktails This Summer. These 3 Are the Ones to Make.”
HowToMake: Makes 4. Add all the ingredients into a medium-size metal bowl and stir. Pour the liquid into a large freezer bag and place it in the freezer until frozen for approximately 4 hours. When ready to drink massage the freezer bag by hand until it’s a wet slushy consistency. If it’s not breaking up run the bag quickly under hot water and massage some more. Divide among four Old Fashioned or rocks glasses. Garnish each glass with mint leaf and lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Simple syrup;Mint simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh lime juice;Water

Name: High on the Hog
About: Ginger maple and bourbon roll on your tongue while you fight the urge to just eat the bacon garnish first in this cocktail by Jerry Nevins from his book Sloshies: 102 Boozy Cocktails Straight from the Freezer (Workman $14.95).This recipe originally appeared as part of You’re Going to Need Frozen Cocktails This Summer. These 3 Are the Ones to Make.
HowToMake: Makes 4. Add all the ingredients in a medium-size metal bowl and stir. Pour the liquid into a large freezer bag and place it in the freezer until frozen for approximately 4 hours. When ready to drink massage the freezer bag by hand until it’s a wet slushy consistency. If it’s not breaking up run the bag quickly under hot water and massage some more. Divide among four Old Fashioned or rocks glasses. Garnish each glass with a strip of crispy bacon.
Ingredients: Buffalo Trace Kentucky straight bourbon;Ginger ale;Dolin Dry Vermouth de Chambéry

Name: Frozen Margarita
About: Purists keep walking! When the mercury climbs and the dog days of summer start barking at your heels the only proper cocktail is the one that keeps you cool and happy. This super simple Frozen Margarita recipe will have you bonding with your blender all season long. This recipe originally appeared as part of Sensational Frozen Cocktails: The 11 You Should Be Drinking in American Bars Now.
HowToMake: Salt the rim of a chilled Margarita glass and put aside. Add all the ingredients into a blender and top with 1 cup of ice. Blend until the mixture is smooth and frothy. Pour the contents into the salted Margarita glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice;Orange liqueur

Name: Hennessy Old Fashioned
About: Try a citrusy take on the legendary cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain over 1 large ice cube in a rocks glass filled with one large ice cube. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Campari liqueur;Amaro;Simple syrup;Orange bitters

Name: Southern Peach
About: This summer thirst quencher celebrates the bright sweet flavors of peaches.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the cognac to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain over 1 large ice cube in a highball glass then top with the cognac. Garnish with peach gummy rings and a lime peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Peach schnapps;Triple sec;Peach nectar;Sprite;Grenadine

Name: One Night Stand
About: This energizing blend of fruit and cognac has a fizzy ginger twist.
HowToMake: Rim a cocktail glass in a mixture of sugar and orange zest. Squeeze the juice of 1 orange slice into a shaker then add the remaining ingredients and ice. Shake and strain into the prepared cocktail glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Ginger beer;Pineapple juice;Orange
Garnish: Orange zest and sugar rim Mint sprig

Name: The Lion’s Den
About: Try an elegant tangy Martini for your next aperitif.
HowToMake: Rim a cocktail glass in sugar. Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Grand Marnier liqueur;Fresh lime juice;Cranberry juice

Name: Sazerac
About: Accentuate the subtle nuances of fine cognac in this boozy classic.
HowToMake: Fill a mixing glass with ice and stir briefly to chill. With one pull from from the dropper of a 1 oz bitter bottle carefully coat the inside of a chilled coupe glass with about 1/6 tsp absinthe allowing the excess absinthe to remain in the bottom of the glass. Strain excess water from mixing glass adding fresh ice if needed then add the cognac syrup and bitters to the mixing glass. Stir for 45 full rotations then strain with a Hawthorne strainer into the prepared coupe. To prepare the garnish use a vegetable peeler to create a 2- to 3-inch-long and 1- to 1-1/2-inch-wide peel from a room-temperature lemon. Express the lemon oils over the drink paint the rim of the glass with the peel and touch the stem of the glass once or twice with the peel. Using a paring knife or kitchen shears neatly trim the edges of the peel into an isosceles acute triangle then cut a 1-inch slit in the center of the peel about 1/8 inch from the base of the triangle. Starting from the tip of the triangle roll the peel at an angle slightly off axis into a barrel shape. Affix the rolled peel to the lip of the couple and release which will cause the peel to unfurl into a swan-like shape. *Demerara syrup: Combine equal parts demerara sugar and water in a saucepan. Heat and stir until the sugar dissolves. Let cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Demerara syrup;Peychaud’s bitters;Copper & Kings blanche absinthe rinse

Name: Bananas Foster Le Coupe
About: Add the flavors of the classic dessert to a sweet frothy cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the cognac syrup and liqueur to an ice-filled mixing glass. Stir and strain into a coupe. Froth the half-and-half to semi-stiff peaks (as you would a latte) and add to the top of the drink. Place a pulled sugar swizzle over the edges of the glass making sure not to submerge. *Banana cognac syrup: Chop 2 lbs bananas and add to 2 750 mL bottles of cognac leaving room at the top so you can see when the bananas float. After 2 to 3 days when all the bananas are floating strain and replace with another 2 lbs chopped bananas. Repeat the process and strain well. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar and 1 oz high-proof grain alcohol.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Banana cognac syrup;Hazelnut liqueur;Half-and-half

Name: C-4
About: This Sidecar variation celebrates the local producers of Detroit offering smooth citrus flavors and a tangy finish.
HowToMake: Muddle the large slice of ginger in a shaker. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake vigorously. Strain the drink into a cocktail glass. Use a lemon twist to rim the glass and discard.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Grand Marnier liqueur;Unity Vibration cranberry clementine kombucha;Mac Traders coffee bitters;Fresh ginger

Name: Sazerac
About: Add the warm bold spice star anise to your next Sazerac.
HowToMake: Add the Angostura bitters to a beaker then add the Peychaud's bitters simple syrup cognac and rye. Add ice to the beaker and stir for 10 seconds. Spray a snifter once with the absinthe. Strain the drink into the snifter. Garnish with 3 star anise pods.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Bulleit rye whiskey;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Peychaud’s bitters;spray rinse Vieux absinthe

Name: A Sweet & Spicy Desiree
About: This peach-jalapeño cocktail is sweet spicy and smooth all at once.
HowToMake: Add the mint leaves and peach-jalapeño syrup to a shaker and crush the mint and syrup with a muddler to release the oils. Fill the shaker almost to the top with ice. Add the cognac and lemon juice then shake and strain into a small ice-filled Mason jar. Garnish with diced peaches and jalapeño slices. *Peach-jalapeño syrup: Combine 1 cup sugar 1 cup water and 1 sliced jalapeño in a saucepan and heat until the sugar dissolves. Let sit for 1 hour or up to overnight then strain. Repeat the same process with 1 cup sugar 1 cup water and 1 diced peach. Combine the syrups once cooled and store in refrigerator until ready to use.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Peach-jalapeño syrup;Mint leaves muddled;Fresh lemon juice

Name: The Duchess of Detroi
About: Embrace the simplicity of a restrained layered cocktail.
HowToMake: Pour each of the ingredients in the order listed directly into a snifter. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Dry Sack sherry

Name: Mo Better Blues
About: A little bit tropical a little bit tart this is bound to be your next easy-drinking cocktail.
HowToMake: Muddle the pineapple and place in a Collins glass then fill it with ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the Collins glass. Garnish with a cherry orange slice and pineapple wheel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Lemon-lime soda;Grenadine;Pineapple

Name: French Coral
About: A little bit of Tiki meets cognac in this stirred cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain over a 2” x 2” ice cube in a rocks glass. Garnish with dehydrated clementine.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Amaro Nonino;Pierre Ferrand dry orange curaçao;Clementine sherbet;Orange bitters

Name: Black Car
About: Tea cocktails meet the Sidecar in this update of a classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with an orange peel. *Tea-infused Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac: Add 1 tea bag of Earl Grey tea to 8 oz Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac. Infuse for 1 week.
Ingredients: Tea-infused Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cointreau liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Orange blossom honey

Name: The Sidecar
About: Try a sweet-tart Sidecar made with cognac and Cointreau.
HowToMake: Rim a cocktail glass with sugar. Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake very gently. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cointreau liqueur;Sweetened lime juice;B&B

Name: Chocolate Covered Strawberry
About: This chocolate cognac coffee and berry cocktail hits all the best notes of the dessert course.
HowToMake: Dip the rim of a cocktail glass into simple syrup then press into the crushed nuts to coat. Drizzle chocolate syrup into the cocktail glass. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain carefully into the cocktail glass. Garnish with a sliced strawberry.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Baileys Irish cream;Kahlúa coffee liqueur;Strawberry purée;Simple syrup for coating;Crushed nuts;Chocolate syrup for drizzling

Name: Pilikia Smash
About: Try a refreshing cognac cocktail with lime juice and Thai basil leaves.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Double-strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a crown of Thai basil. *Honey syrup: Combine 1 1/2 parts honey to 1 part water. Bring to a simmer until the honey dissolves then let cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Honey syrup;Fresh lime juice;Thai basil leaves torn

Name: Banana Surfer
About: Hang 10 with a Tiki-inspired cognac cocktail laced with coconut and banana.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Tiki mug filled with crushed ice. Garnish with cacao dust. *Cinnamon-honey syrup: Bring 2 cups of water and 4 cinnamon sticks to a boil and let simmer for 15 minutes. Add 2 cups honey and stir to dissolve. Let cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Spiced rum;Banana cordial;Cinnamon-honey syrup;Coconut cream;Chocolate mole bitters

Name: Standard Summertime Punch
About: Cognac sherry and peach tea make this summery punch a year-round crowd-pleaser.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the lemon halves to a large punch bowl. Squeeze the juice from the lemon halves into the punch. Chill with a large block of ice. Serve in rocks glasses over solid cubes of ice or shaved ice. Garnish with lemon and peach slices. *Honey syrup: Combine 3 parts honey to 1 part hot water and stir until the honey has dissolved.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Amontillado sherry;Peach tea;Mineral water;Honey syrup;Peach bitters;Angostura bitters;lemons halved

Name: Perfect Storm
About: Warm spices and sweet apricot make this cocktail suitable for any weather (storm or not).
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until properly diluted. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with expressed citrus oils from an orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cocchi sweet vermouth;Dolin dry vermouth;Apricot liqueur;Baked apple bitters

Name: Uptown Ways
About: Bubbly and berries are cognac’s BFFs in this bright sparkling rosé cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the rosé to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Add the rosé and strain into a Champagne flute. Garnish with a lemon peel-wrapped blackberry. *Berry and pepper syrup: Muddle 1 cup water 1 cup sugar 6 strawberries 10 blackberries and 2 jalapeño peppers in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 14 to 18 minutes. Let cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Berry and pepper syrup;Pineapple juice;Fresh lemon juice;Rosé Champagne

Name: Top Down
About: This summery take on a Sidecar bright with Meyer lemons is sunshine in a glass.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled coupe. Top a lemon slice with red chile threads and use it to garnish the drink. *Meyer lemon syrup: Peel 6 Meyer lemons. Use a paring knife to get rid of any remaining white spots on the peels. Blanch them three times in boiling water then simmer in 1/2 L water and 1/2 L sugar for 20 minutes. Cool before using.
Ingredients: Cherrywood-infused Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Grand Marnier liqueur;Meyer lemon syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Hellfire bitters (or other spicy bitters)
Garnish: Sliced lemon wheel Red chile threads

Name: Broken Bread Crusta
About: Let the flavor of cognac shine in this sweet spicy interpretation of a Sidecar.
HowToMake: Coat half the rim of a coupe glass in superfine sugar. Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe. Express the oils of a Meyer lemon peel over top. *Peppercorn syrup: Toast 2 tbsp white peppercorns in a pan until they start popping. Let them cool then grind coarsely in a spice grinder. Add to a medium pot with 2 cups water and 2 cups white sugar. Bring to a boil and reduce for 15 to 20 minutes. Let cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Tubi 60;Blanc vermouth;Fresh lemon juice;Peppercorn syrup;Angostura bitters
Garnish: Half-rim superfine sugar Meyer lemon oils

Name: Stow Bana’nac Attack
About: You’ll go bananas for this tropical swizzle.
HowToMake: Add the mint leaves to a Collins glass and lightly muddle. Add the cognac liqueur syrup lemon juice and 3 dashes of the bitters and swizzle until diluted. Fill the rest of the glass with crushed ice. Add the 3 remaining dashes of bitters then garnish with a mint sprig lemon wheel and sliced bananas. *Demerara syrup: Combine 2 parts demerara sugar to 1 part water in a saucepan over low heat. Heat until the sugar dissolves. Cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Banana liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Demerara syrup;Angostura bitters;Fresh mint leaves
Garnish: Mint sprig Lemon wheel Sliced bananas

Name: Stow Away
About: Tawny port and cognac are a match made in after-dinner heaven in this simple cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with fresh grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Tawny port;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Fresh Thyme

Name: Dram Rickey
About: This Rickey by herbalist and cocktail specialist Lukas B. Smith at Washington D.C.’s Cotton & Reed showcases the rum distillery’s allspice dram. “The lime juice and soda water show off the lighter side of dram” says Smith.This recipe originally appeared as part of The Pioneering Return of the All-Important Allspice Dram.
HowToMake: Add the dram and juice to a Collins glass over ice. Top with the soda water. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Fresh lime juice;Soda water to top

Name: White Lion
About: This riff on a classic Daiquiri by herbalist and cocktail specialist Lukas B. Smith at Washington D.C.’s Cotton & Reed incorporates Cotton & Reed’s white rum and its allspice dram which has rum as a base resulting in a complex and spicy new take.This recipe originally appeared as part of The Pioneering Return of the All-Important Allspice Dram.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Nou-vieux Riche
About: Put a spicy twist on the Vieux Carré with this cardamom- and sherry-spiked Hennessy cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir. Add 1 large cube of ice to a rocks glass and strain the cocktail over it. Garnish with grated cardamom.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Rye Whiskey;East India sherry;Crème de cacao;Cardamom bitters

Name: Vieux Carré Sour
About: Welcome the summer with open arms by making a citrusy spicy spirit-forward spin on the classic Vieux Carré.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a dehydrated lemon wheel soaked in Angostura and Peychaud’s bitters.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Carpano Antica Formula sweet vermouth;Bénédictine;Egg white;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Peychaud’s bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: Furry Berry
About: Capture the bright flavors of blackberries in this simple cognac and cherry cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with frosted blueberries and an edible flower. *Blackberry syrup: Take 6 oz sugar 6 oz water and 6 oz blackberries and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Remove from heat strain and add salt to taste.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Combier Rouge Cherry liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Blackberry syrup

Name: Don’t Dance With the Orchids
About: Transport yourself to cognac with a Champagne cocktail inspired by the aromatics and spices of the region.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled coupe. Top with the Champagne. Garnish with a lemon twist. *Honey syrup: Add 1/2 cup honey and 1/2 cup water to a small saucepan over medium heat. (You can experiment and decide how much of a honey flavor you want in your syrup. The more honey you use the thicker the syrup and stronger in flavor it will be.) Stir until blended. Strain into a jar and seal tightly with a lid. Will keep for 1 month in the refrigerator.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Rich honey syrup;Lindera Farms honey vinegar;Clove tincture;Sea salt;Brut Champagne to top

Name: Perfect Thyming
About: This slightly boozier take on the classic Sangaree balances citrus and sweetness with a hint of spice.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with fresh grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Tawny port;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Fresh Thyme

Name: Broken Bastard
About: You won’t be suffering through this cognac-based update on the Suffering Bastard.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ginger ale to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into an ice-filled highball glass. Top with the ginger ale. Garnish with candied ginger and a mint bouquet.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Letherbee besk;St-Germain elderflower liqueur;Fresh lime juice;Ginger rose cordial;Ginger ale to top

Name: Horse’s Neck
About: A burst of C02 gives the traditional Horse’s Neck a breath of fresh air.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredient except the C02 to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Collins glass. Top with the C02 and lemon peel. *Honey ginger syrup: Combine 1 cup water 1 cup sugar 1 cup honey 5 cup ginger juice and 2 orange peels in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk until the sugar dissolves then cover and remove from the heat. Let cool to room temperature and fine-strain.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Honey ginger syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Angostura bitters;Co2

Name: PH Champagne Punch
About: This sparkling cognac and rum punch bursts with citrus flavor.
HowToMake: In a large punch bowl prepare an oleo saccharum by muddling the sugar and citrus peels gently for a few minutes every 10 minutes over the course of an hour. Meanwhile prepare the hot tea timing the tea steeping to complete just as the oleo saccharum is ready. Strain the tea into the punch bowl to melt the oleo into a rich aromatic syrup. Add the remaining ingredients except the Champagne to the punch bowl. Add the Champagne and an ice block just before service. Garnish with 3 orange wheels and fresh mint sprigs. *Darjeeling tea: Brew 1 tbsp of loose tea per cup of hot water and let steep for 5 minutes.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Jamaican rum;Moët & Chandon Champagne;Darjeeling tea hot;Fresh lemon juice fine-strained;White sugar;Orange bitters;Lemon peels;Orange peels

Name: Improved Brandy Daisy
About: Made with cognac and topped with bubbly this Brandy Daisy is improved indeed.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled coupe. Top with the Champagne then express the orange peel over top and discard.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Giffard Abricot du Roussillon liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Moët Impérial Champagne to top;Orange peel

Name: Hennessy Privilège Sidecar
About: The orange-kissed Sidecar is a classic that will never go out of style.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Combier liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Cognac Amaretto Stone Sour 75
About: This marriage of the Amaretto Sour and French 75 is a relationship that’s built to last.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass then top with Champagne.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Amaretto liqueur;Orange juice;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Brut Champagne to top

Name: Sidecar
About: Add a touch more sweetness to a traditional Sidecar with a sugar rim.
HowToMake: Rim a coupe glass in sugar. Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Combier liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Demerara syrup

Name: Rampart Rambler
About: Fresh citrus sparkling wine and premium cognac bring out the best in one another in this refreshing new cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Champagne flute. Top with dry sparkling wine and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Demerara syrup;Dry sparkling wine or cava to top

Name: Hello Good Sir
About: This take on the Sidecar is just peachy.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Peach liqueur;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Prime 75
About: When it’s blood orange season do yourself a favor and add it to this take on a classic French 75.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine and garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Simple syrup;Blood orange juice;Fresh lemon juice;Sparkling wine to top

Name: Tread Lightly
About: Start your evening (or your day) with a coffee-cognac concoction.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe. *Coffee syrup: Combine equal parts coffee and sugar. Heat until the sugar dissolves and let cool.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cynar liqueur;Coffee syrup;Egg white

Name: French 75
About: You need a French 75 in your life especially one that’s made with cognac.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Champagne flute. Top with dry sparkling wine and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Demerara syrup;Dry sparkling wine or cava to top

Name: Over the Top
About: This take on the classic Horse’s Neck uses premium cognac to add a whole new level of complexity and richness.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into an ice-filled Collins glass. Garnish with a lemon twist. *Rich simple syrup: Add 2 parts sugar to 1 part water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer until the sugar dissolves. Let cool before using.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Amaro Montenegro;Ginger beer;Meyer lemon juice;Rich simple syrup

Name: Talking Backwards
About: This Los Angeles–inspired cocktails has just the right amount of smoke and malt.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker and dry-shake (without ice) to froth the egg white. Add ice to the shaker and shake. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a dehydrated peach slice. *Chamomile-infused Chilean pisco: Add 1/4 cups loose chamomile tea to 750 mL Chilean pisco and let rest at room temperature for 20 minutes or until desired strength. **Blueberry-honey syrup: Thaw 12 oz frozen wild blueberries purée and fine-strain. Combine equal amounts purée and honey syrup (honey diluted with water for cocktail use). Add 1/8 tsp high-quality vanilla extract for every 2 cups syrup. Stir to combine.
Ingredients: Ardbeg 10-year-old scotch;Chamomile-infused Chilean pisco;Fresh lemon juice;Blueberry-honey syrup;Peach liqueur;Egg white

Name: Cailleach's Bath Collins
About: This cocktail is named for the Gaelic hag goddess of winter Cailleach Bheur to whom the great Corryvreckan serves as laundry basin. The use of preserved citrus and seed serve as ode to her season’s bounty with a crack of pepper to highlight the malt’s spice.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the soda water into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into Collins glass over two large chunks of ice and fill with the soda water being careful to pour directly onto the surface of the liquid to keep carbonation intact. Garnish with a dehydrated lemon slice a large frond of fresh fennel and a twist of freshly ground black pepper. *Rich fennel seed syrup: Pour 1 cup very hot water over 1 oz cracked fennel seeds. Add 2 cups granulated sugar and stir until dissolved. Let cool then strain. **Puréed preserved lemon: Purée store-bought or homemade preserved lemons. If you don’t have a blender muddle a small piece of preserved lemon.
Ingredients: Ardbeg Corryvreckan scotch;Rich fennel seed syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Puréed preserved lemon;Soda water

Name: Outlaws
About: This Washington D.C.–inspired cocktail has just the right amount of smoke and malt.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a couple glass and garnish with star anise.
Ingredients: Ardbeg Ten Years Old scotch;Fresh lime juice;Cocchi Americano aperitivo;Rothman & Winter orchard apricot liqueur;Bittermens Xocolatl Mole bitters

Name: Scottish Breakfast
About: This San Francisco–inspired cocktail has just the right amount of smoke and malt.
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake until appropriately diluted and chilled. Fine-strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with 1 or 2 dehydrated lime wheels floating on top.
Ingredients: Ardbeg Ten Years Old scotch;Pür Likör spice blood orange liqueur;Fresh lime juice;Apple butter;Fee Brothers Aztec chocolate bitters

Name: Burning Meadow
About: This Vegas-inspired cocktail has just the right amount of smoke and malt.
HowToMake: Chill a double Old Fashioned glass with ice discard the ice and set aside. Add all the ingredients to a shaker ice and shake. Strain into the chilled glass over a 1-inch-by1-inch ice cube and garnish with edible flowers skewered on a thyme sprig. Pour the warm jar of meadow flowers aroma into the flower pot ensemble. It will begin to mist out and volatilize the aromas. Quickly cover the misting flower pot ensemble with the terrarium to capture the delicate aromas. Lift the terrarium when serving. Place the inverted terrarium beside the ensemble and a wooden coaster in front of this assembly. *Himalayan honey pepper: Add .5 tsp fresh cracked black pepper to a small saucepan on low/medium heat until fragrant keeping it moving so it doesn't burn. Add 3 oz HoneyTree’s raw organic wildflower honey 1/8 tsp pink Himalayan salt and 2 oz water. Whisk thoroughly for 2 minutes and allow to simmer for 1 minute. Strain through 3 layers of ultra-fine mesh and allow to cool. Yield: 4 oz. **Meadow flowers aroma: To create a flower pot ensemble add dry ice to the bottom of a glass jar add twigs and flowers on top and set aside. In another glass jar add 2.5 oz water .5 oz rose water 1 bottle cap Luxardo maraschino liqueur and 5 drops honeysuckle essential oil and shake vigorously to combine. Close and set aside and warm before use.
Ingredients: Ardbeg Ten Years Old scotch;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Himalayan honey pepper;Taste Nirvana coconut water;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh lime juice;Meadow flowers aroma

Name: 10 Year Lifted Flip
About: This Dallas-inspired cocktail has just the right amount of smoke and malt.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the mineral water to a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or coupe and top with the mineral water. Let settle for a few seconds and garnish with grated dark chocolate.
Ingredients: Ardbeg Ten Years Old scotch;Burnt sugar syrup;Amontillado sherry;Topo Chico mineral water;Grated dark chocolate;Whole egg

Name: Bonfire Banana Alexander
About: This Chicago-inspired cocktail has just the right amount of smoke and malt.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to shaker with ice and shake. Strain into Julep cup and top with crushed ice. Garnish with freshly grated wild tonka bean.
Ingredients: Ardbeg Ten Years Old scotch;Giffard Banane du Brésil liqueur;Amaro Averna;Concentrated cold-brew coffee;Heavy whipping cream;Orgeat Syrup;The Bitter Truth chocolate bitters

Name: Early Start
About: This cocktail by Alex Negranza the bar manager at Houston’s Better Luck Tomorrow
HowToMake: Muddle the French sorrel leaf in a mixing tin. Add the rest of the ingredients dry-shake then shake with ice. Fine-strain into a coupe. Garnish with a red-veined sorrel leaf.
Ingredients: Fresh lime juice;Orgeat Syrup;Egg white;French sorrel leaf

Name: Promenade
About: Three French spirits combine for one elegant cocktail.
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients in a mixing glass and stir. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Green Chartreuse;Lillet Blanc

Name: Alyssum
About: Warm cinnamon syrup adds heat to this sweet-bitter cognac cocktail.
HowToMake: Combine the mint leaves cinnamon simple syrup and absinthe in the bottom of a Collins glass and gently press the mint. Add the remaining ingredients fill the glass with crushed ice and swizzle to combine. Top off the cocktail with crushed ice and garnish with a mint sprig and a wide grapefruit peel. *Cinnamon simple syrup: Bring 2 cups water 2 cups sugar and 6 crushed cinnamon sticks to a boil in a small saucepan. Reduce the heat and simmer 10 minutes. Strain and cool.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Luxardo bitter bianco vermouth;Fresh red grapefruit juice;Cinnamon simple syrup;Lemon Hart 151 demarara rum to top;Handful of mint leaves

Name: Inferno’s Spirit
About: A bit of heat goes a long way in this spicy cognac cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass with carved ice. Express an orange peel around the top and rim of the glass then garnish with the peel and a dried chile de arbol.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Grand Marnier liqueur;Amaro Meletti;Scrappy’s Firewater bitters;Miracle Mile Chocolate Chili bitters
Garnish: Orange peel Dried chile de arbol

Name: Top Hat
About: Sweet bitter and rich this cocktail hits all the right notes.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Noilly Pratt sweet vermouth;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Amaro Averna;Angostura bitters

Name: Top Down
About: Chartreuse and Bénédictine add herbal notes to cognac in this spirit-forward creation.
HowToMake: Rinse a Collins glass with the absinthe and fill it with crushed ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the Collins glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Green Chartreuse;Bénédictine;Peychaud’s bitters;Orange bitters;rinse Pernod absinthe

Name: Que Linda
About: This cognac cocktail packs a citrusy punch with lemon orange and grapefruit flavors.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Agave;Orange bitters;Grapefruit Zest

Name: Honey Sidecar
About: Add a little more depth to your next Sidecar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass then garnish with orange zest. *Honey syrup: In a saucepan bring 2 parts water to 1 part honey to a boil and simmer until the honey has dissolved. Cool and store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup

Name: Honey Sidecar
About: Sweet honey syrup adds another layer of flavor to the classic citrusy Sidecar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass then garnish with orange zest. *Honey syrup: In a saucepan bring 2 parts water to 1 part honey to a boil and simmer until the honey has dissolved. Cool and store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup

Name: Honey Sidecar
About: Sweet honey syrup adds another layer of flavor to the classic citrusy Sidecar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass. *Honey syrup: In a saucepan bring 2 parts water to 1 part honey to a boil and simmer until the honey has dissolved. Cool and store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Orange oil and chamomile tincture;Honey syrup

Name: Strawberry Fields
About: This strawberry-mint cognac cocktail is a perfect for drinking on a porch on a warm summer evening.
HowToMake: Muddle the strawberries and mint sprig in a shaker. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with a mint sprig and strawberry.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P. Privilège cognac;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Strawberries;Mint sprig

Name: Sidecar
About: This twist on the classic combines cognac Cointreau and fresh lemon juice.
HowToMake: Rim half of a coupe glass in raw sugar. Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the coupe.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice

Name: The Hennessy Highball
About: You can’t get much easier than this refreshing two-ingredient cognac cocktail.
HowToMake: Add 4 to 5 cubes of Kold-Draft ice to a Highball glass. Add the cognac. Top with the soda water. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Soda water

Name: St. Charles Punch
About: This no-nonsense four-ingredient cocktail created by the legendary Jerry Thomas is crisp citrusy and sweet.
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Port;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Blood Orange Sidecar
About: This cocktail is an updated Sidecar with bright blood orange flavor.
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients except the lemon peel in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Squeeze the lemon peel into the mixing glass and discard. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with a blood orange wheel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Ransom dry vermouth;Amara Amaro D'Arancia Rossa;Simple syrup;Fresh blood orange juice;Lemon peel

Name: The Henny Bee
About: Put a Margarita-ish spin on your next cognac cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a piece of honeycomb and 3 jalapeño wheels.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Asian pear puree;Triple sec;Fresh lime juice;Organic honey

Name: Ginger 75
About: Try a brighter fresher take on the French 75 with honey and ginger.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Champagne flute. Top with the Champagne. Garnish with a burnt lime wheel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Domaine de Canton ginger liqueur;honey;Fresh lime juice;Champagne to top

Name: Mother of Dragons
About: Named for a character in Game of Thrones this Sazerac update is full of warm masala spices.
HowToMake: Rinse a coupe with absinthe. Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir well. Strain the cocktail into the coupe. Garnish with an orange peel. *Masala spice syrup: Steep equal parts water and sugar with a combination of cinnamon cardamom clove anise sumac and pepper.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Masala spice syrup;Peychaud’s bitters;rinse of Absinthe

Name: Dauphine Special
About: Named for a street in New Orleans this herbaceous take on the Sazerac shines with maple and cardamom notes.
HowToMake: Fill a rocks glass with a hearty dash of the Chartreuse then fill with crushed ice and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a rocks glass with fresh ice and stir until well-chilled. Discard the crushed ice from glass ensuring it is adequately rinsed and strain in the cognac mixture. Express the oils from an orange twist and serve.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Maple syrup;Cardamom bitters;Rise of Green Chartreuse

Name: Jitter Bug
About: Green chile vodka adds a layer of heat to this lime-spiked cognac Swizzle.
HowToMake: Line a rocks glass with a banana leaf. Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and swizzle. Strain into the rocks glass and top with crushed ice. Garnish with an orchid.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;St. George Green Chile vodka;Lime cordial;Fresh lime juice;Curry bitters;Génépy

Name: The V.S.O.P Rickey
About: This cognac-based Rickey is tart bubbly and a perfect summertime sipper.
HowToMake: Place the lime wheel and ice in a Collins glass. Muddle the lime and raspberries in a shaker. Add the cognac with ice to the shaker and shake. Double-strain into the Collins glass and top with the Champagne. Garnish with an additional lime wheel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Lime;Raspberries;Lime wheels;Moët & Chandon Champagne to top

Name: K-Town Sidecar
About: A warmly spiced pineapple syrup adds extra dimension to an updated Sidecar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with a pineapple chunk and pineapple leaf. *Pineapple coriander allspice syrup: Toast ½ tsp coriander and ¼ tsp allspice in a sauce pan until fragrant making sure not to burn. In a saucepan bring 46 oz pineapple juice and 16 oz white sugar to a boil until the sugar has dissolved. Add the toasted spices to the pineapple syrup.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Giffard Crème de Pêche de Vigne liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Pineapple coriander allspice syrup;Peychaud's bitters

Name: Belle Amie
About: Bea’s twist on an Old Fashioned hits sweet tart and chocolate-y notes.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with a dehydrated orange wheel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Fig vodka;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Fee Brothers Aztec chocolate bitters

Name: Shiso Unusual
About: This play on the Mint Julep that’s named after Cyndi Lauper’s first album is guaranteed to be interesting.
HowToMake: Muddle the bitters shiso leaves and sugar cube in a goblet. Add crushed ice. Add the cognac and whiskey and top with more ice. Garnish with a shiso leaf.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Rye Whiskey;Orange bitters;Grapefruit bitters;Shiso leaves;Sugar cube

Name: Piedmont Boulevardier
About: Inspired by Italian apéritifs this crisp cocktail pairs well with handmade pasta.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until properly diluted. Strain into a chilled Martini glass. Express an orange peel over the top before placing it inside the cocktail.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Campari;Cinzano Rosso vermouth;Barrel-aged orange bitters

Name: Tequila Sour
About: A solid shake is required for this refreshing Tequila Sour. It’s worth every move.For more great summery Mexican-inspired drinks—and tacos too!—head
HowToMake: Makes 1. Add all the ingredients except the bitters to a shaker and dry-shake (without ice) for 15 seconds. Add ice shake and double-strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with 3 drops of the bitters.
Ingredients: Tequila Reposado;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh lime juice;Light agave nectar;Egg white
Garnish: Bittermens Xocolatl mole bitters (or Angostura bitters)

Name: Between the Sheets
About: Swap out the lemon juice for rum in this boozy update on the Sidecar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel set aflame.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Aged rum;Cointreau

Name: Sidecar
About: You can’t get much more simple or refreshing than this three-ingredient Sidecar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with cracked ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Orange liqueur;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Sazerac De Los Reyes
About: This cocktail is warm take on the Sazerac with cardamom bitters and Luxardo maraschino liqueur.
HowToMake: Place an ice sphere in a rocks glass. Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir well. Strain over the ice sphere in the rocks glass. Garnish with a sage leaf and lime peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Génépy;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Cardamom tincture;Absinthe;Orange bitters;Aromatic bitters;Fresh lime juice

Name: Sidecar
About: If you’re craving a classic cocktail pour yourself this three-ingredient stunner.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with cracked ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Busy Bee
About: When Allison Lindsey the head bartender at Baltimore’s Bar Vasquez is juicing cucumbers for this salty riff on the Bee’s Knees she starts with no more than a teaspoon or so of sea salt per quart. “You have your sweet your bitter your salty and the aromatics” she says. “It makes a great well-balanced cocktail and something a little unexpected.”
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a rosemary sprig. *Salted cucumber juice: Using a juicer juice peeled cucumbers to yield 1 quart. Strain juice to remove any pulp and add 1 to 1 1/2 tsp sea salt to add flavor and preserve the juice. Store the mixture in the refrigerator.
Ingredients: Salted cucumber juice;Honey;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Ti' Punch
About: The national cocktail of Martinique is as easy to make as it is to drink using just three ingredients including the island’s native spirit rhum agricole.
HowToMake: Squeeze a lime wheel into a chilled rocks glass. Add the remaining ingredients and top with ice. Stir with a barspoon and top with more ice.
Ingredients: Rhum agricole;Sugar cane syrup

Name: Navy Grog
About: The Big Daddy of high-octane Tiki
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker filled with crushed ice and shake until well-chilled (about 30 seconds). Strain into a chilled rocks glass with fresh crushed ice. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Gold demerara rum such as El Dorado;Dark Jamaican rum such as Appleton Estate;White Cuban or Puerto Rican rum such Bacardí Superior;Fresh lime juice;Fresh grapefruit juice;Soda water;Honey syrup (equal parts honey and water)

Name: Hotel Nacional
About: The signature drink at Havana’s historic Hotel Nacional
HowToMake: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake for 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: White rum (or aged rum);Apricot liqueur;Pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Apple Press
About: Jeremy Allen the head bartender and general manager at Los Angeles’ MiniBar
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a floating apple slice. Dust with grated cinnamon and star anise.
Ingredients: Four Roses bourbon;Laird’s apple brandy;Fresh apple juice;Apple cider vinegar;Fee Brothers walnut bitters

Name: Limoncello & Raspberry Whiskey Sour Popsicle
About: If you love popsicles and love cocktails there’s nothing better than these easy-to-make treats. Have these on hand at your next summer gathering!
HowToMake: Serves 6. Add the sorbet limoncello and 2 oz of the whiskey into a blender and blend until smooth. Set aside. Add the raspberries lemonade and 1/2 oz of the whiskey into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour the raspberry mixture into a liquid measuring cup or a cup with a spout for easy pouring. Fill popsicle molds wells 3/4 of the way up with the limoncello mixture. Slowly and carefully pour raspberry mixture against the sides of the molds for a layered effect. Cover the molds with foil and cut a tiny hole in the center of each mold. Place a popsicle stick through each hole. Place in the freezer until frozen.
Ingredients: Lemon sorbet;Limoncello;whiskey;Raspberries (16 regular-size berries);Lemonade

Name: Watermelon–Blackberry Margarita Popsicles Recip
About: If you love popsicles and love cocktails there’s nothing better than these easy-to-make treats. Have these on hand at your next summer gathering!
HowToMake: Serves 6. Place all the ingredients in a blender and purée until well-blended. Pour the mixture into popsicle molds. Cover the molds with foil and cut a tiny hole in the center of each mold. Place a popsicle stick through each hole. Place in the freezer until frozen.
Ingredients: Watermelon (1/2 a small watermelon);Blackberries (7–9 regular-size berries);Limeade;Triple sec

Name: Cucumber Snapper
About: With some tomato but also other ingredients to tone it down and chill it out this cocktail by Brian Bartels of New York City’s Fedora
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with the dill salt. Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and roll the mixture back and forth with another shaker 3 times. Strain the cocktail into the rimmed glass over ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel. *Cucumber juice: Either use a juicer or purée cucumber in a high-powered blender then strain through a fine-mesh sieve. **Dill salt: Stir together 1 sprig of dill and 1/4 cup salt in a bowl and let sit for at least 2 hours before using. Makes 1/4 cup enough to rim 12 glasses.
Ingredients: Hendrick’s gin;Fresh cucumber juice;Tomato juice

Name: Shannon’s Sangrita/Michelada
About: Lower alcohol than most Bloody Marys
HowToMake: Coat half of the rim of a chilled beer mug with salt. Combine the sangrita and lime juice in the glass. Top off with the beer. Garnish with 2 skewered lime wedges. *Carrot-papaya sangrita: Combine 9 oz Perfect Puree papaya puree 9 oz carrot juice 1 ¼ oz lime juice 1 1/4 oz orange juice 1 tsp ground guajillo chile powder 1/2 tsp ground chipotle chile powder and 3/4 tsp salt and let sit for 1 hour. Pass through a fine-mesh strainer lined with cheesecloth or a coffee filter. Transfer to a pitcher if serving immediately or store in a sealed container and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Makes 2 1/2 cups enough for 10 drinks.
Ingredients: Carrot-papaya sangrita;Fresh lime juice

Name: Bunny Mary
About: Carrots cayenne and caper brine yes. Tomatoes no! The Bunny Mary created by Extra Fancy’s Rob Krueger in New York City gets its vibrant hue from carrot juice punched up with savory carrot brine and a spicy cayenne-and-paprika rim for the glass.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a Collins glass with the pimenton salt and fill with ice. Combine all of the ingredients and stir until chilled. Garnish with a parsley sprig. *Pimenton salt rim: Combine 1 tbsp smoked sweet paprika 1 tbsp salt and 1/2 tbsp cayenne pepper in a small bowl enough to rim 14 glasses.
Ingredients: Aquavit or vodka;Carrot juice;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup (equal parts honey and water);Crystal hot sauce;Caper brine

Name: Sphered Fashioned
About: To make this cocktail served at The Circular
HowToMake: Partially freeze water in ice spheres for two hours. Poke a hole in the sphere and drain out the water. Mix all of the ingredients then add to the drained ice sphere using a syringe. Freeze until needed or serve immediately. To serve place the prepared ice sphere in a rocks glass and crack it using a mallet. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Maker’s Mark bourbon;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Aged orange bitters;Simple syrup

Name: Frosé
About: To think that a little more than a year ago frozen rosé aka frosé was on the fringes of summer refreshers. After all its very existence seemed more sorority house dare than sound cocktail concept. Wine was something to be sniffed swirled and studied not dumped mindlessly into a blender. America begged to differ. Today the adult slushie sensation appears on bar lists (and Instagram feeds) from coast to coast proving that sometimes the best rule to good imbibing is to just chill out and drink.
HowToMake: Serves 4. Pour the rosé into a 13 x 9” baking pan and place in the freezer for up to 6 hours or until almost solid. Remove the mixture and scrape into a blender chopping up the larger icy bits. Add the remaining ingredients along with 3/4 cup crushed ice to the blender and puree until thickened. Divide evenly into coupe glasses. Garnish with lemon twists.
Ingredients: Rosé (750mL something full-bodied and dark in color such as a pinot noir– or merlot-based rosé);Simple syrup;Aperol;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Duck Fat Sour
About: There’s a lot going on in this Sour at Bacari GDL at The Americana at Brand in Glendale Calif. but savory cocktails are often pretty complex and this is no exception. Using duck-fat-infused dry orange curaçao (made sous vide style) it’s mixed with rye fresh lemon juice simple syrup and egg white.
HowToMake: Rinse a coupe glass with absinthe. Add the rye curacao juice syrup and egg white to a shaker with ice and shake. Pour into the prepared coupe. Garnish with a few dashes of cranberry bitters and fresh grated cinnamon. *Duck-fat-infused dry orange curacao: Add 500mg dry curacao and 50g duck fat into a plastic bag seal and cook sous vide for 4 hours at 165 degrees F. Freeze then strain.
Ingredients: Absinthe rinse;Rye Whiskey;Duck-fat-infused dry orange curaçao;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Egg white

Name: Nam Chim Gimlet
About: At New Orleans’ delightful SoBou
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a speared basil leaf and lime peel. *Laura's Thai chili sauce (makes a large batch): Chop 10 cloves garlic 2 green peppers and 1/4 cup chopped ginger. Add all to a saucepan seasoned with 3 tbsp soybean vegetable or coconut oil. Add 1 tsp sesame oil and let simmer for 5 minutes. Pour 1 qt water and 1 1/2 qts rice vinegar into a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in 2 qts sugar 2 tbsp soy sauce and 1/8 cup red pepper flakes. Add ground pepper to taste. Simmer on low for 20 minutes. Stir in 1 tbsp cornstarch. Remove saucepan from stove to cool then transfer to an airtight jar. Save for cocktails or dipping sauce.
Ingredients: Oryza rice vodka;Laura’s Thai chili sauce;Fresh lime juice
Garnish: Speared basil leaf and lime peel

Name: Rich Coffee
About: This coffee cocktail by Tommy Quimby at San Francisco’s Rich Table is perfect post-dinner—or whenever you want a warming treat.
HowToMake: Add the fernet creme and coffee to a heat-proof glass and stir. Top with the cream. *Pistachio whipped cream: Combine pistachio nut paste sugar and heavy cream (to taste) and whip.
Ingredients: Fernet-Branca;Pistachio whipped cream to top

Name: How to Make NOLET’S Silver Raspberry Martin
About: This bright and refreshing spin on the Martini trades in olives for raspberries. It strikes the perfect balance between sweet and tart. Grab your muddler and a little mint to make it yourself.
HowToMake: Muddle raspberries simple syrup and mint in a shaker. Add remaining ingredients with ice and shake. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with two raspberries.
Ingredients: NOLET’S Silver Gin;Lemon juice;St Germaine Elderflower Liqueur;Simple syrup;Raspberries;Mint leaves

Name: High King Highball
About: At East Village cocktail destination Pouring Ribbons cocktails get “rated” on a scale of “refreshing” to “spirituous” “comforting” to “adventurous” to help guide you to the right drink.  (Chartreuse lovers ask for the bar’s vintage Chartreuse selection). On the refreshing side the High King Highball was created by bar-star Joaquín Simón and features Clontarf Irish whiskey and Aperol along with muddled raspberries lemon and grapefruit juices simple syrup Peychaud’s bitters and a splash of soda. The artful creation is then garnished with a skewered lemon wheel and raspberry.
HowToMake: Pour the soda water into Collins glass with ice cubes. Add all the other ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into the Collins glass. Garnish with a skewered lemon wheel and raspberry.
Ingredients: Clontarf Irish whiskey;Aperol;Simple syrup;Peychaud's bitters;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh grapefruit juice;Raspberries muddled

Name: The Smoked Old Fashioned
About: Spice up the Old Fashioned by bringing in smoke and single malt. This spin on the traditional recipe will make you fall in love with the classic all over again.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to mixing glass filled with ice and stir until cold. Smoke is added to the wine glass after the cocktail is strained into the glass. Smoke is added via a smoke gun such as this.
Ingredients: Aberlour 12 Year-Old Single Malt Scotch;Demerara syrup (1:1 water and sugar);Angostura bitters;Choose your smoke: Hickory Applewood Mesquite or Cherrywood;large ice cube

Name: The Scotch & Ginger
About: The Scotch & Ginger is better experienced than explained. The unforgettable blend of sweetness and spice defies description.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except ginger beer to mixing glass filled with ice. Stir until well chilled. Strain into an ice-filled highball glass and top with spicy ginger beer.
Ingredients: Malic acid;Fig syrup;Zucca Amaro;lemon sherbet;4 oz spicy ginger beer such as Blenheim’s Ginger Ale;Aberlour 12yr Single Malt Scotch

Name: The Aberlour 12-Year Highball
About: Of course Aberlour 12 year is good enough—by far—to stand on its own. Make a highball to open up the premium single malt even more.
HowToMake: Add the Aberlour 12-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch to an ice-filled highball glass. Top with soda water.
Ingredients: Aberlour 12-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch;High-quality soda water

Name: The Aberlour Highball
About: You might be surprised by what a splash of soda can add to a premium single malt. Toss in a slice of red apple to enjoy this highball in style.
HowToMake: Add the Aberlour 12-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch to an ice-filled highball glass. Top with soda water and garnish with a slice of red apple.
Ingredients: Aberlour 12 Year-Old Single Malt Scotch;High-quality soda water

Name: Rapscallion
About: The mouthwatering mix of spirits in the Rapscallion strike a delicate delicious balance. The result is proof that fine single malt loves company.
HowToMake: Rinse a rocks glass with the Laphroaig scotch. Add the rest of the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until cold. Strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Aberlour A'Bunadh scotch;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Absinthe;Laphroaig scotch to rinse

Name: The Horseapple
About: You don’t need to overthink things when you’re working with fresh high quality ingredients like fresh pressed apple juice and fine single malt whisky. The Horseapple is greater than the sum of its parts.
HowToMake: Add one large ice cube to a double rocks glass and pour in the Aberlour A’Bunadh Single Malt Scotch. Top with the  apple juice and stir. Grate fresh horseradish on top to finish.
Ingredients: Aberlour A’Bunadh Single Malt Scotch;Freshly pressed Granny Smith Apple Juice

Name: Robert Baratheon
About: Scotch as complex and rich as Aberlour can elevate almost drink. The Robert Baratheon shows how single-malt scotch and vermouth can bring out one another’s strengths.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until cold. Strain into a rocks glass over a large ice cube. Garnish with an orange peel and maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Aberlour 12-year-old single-malt scotch;Dry vermouth;Angostura bitters

Name: Charred Maple Wood Tipperary
About: This drink at Trifecta
HowToMake: Makes 3 quarts or 32 3-oz cocktails. Combine the three spirits in a sous vide bag and set aside. Char the sugar maple in a wood-fired oven or with a crème brulée torch. Once the wood has stopped smoking place it in the bag with the spirits then place that bag in another sous vide bag and set in a sous vide machine set at 150oF for three hours. Remove the wood after the infusion. For each cocktail combine 3 oz of the mix with ice and stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel Reserve Irish whiskey (750 mL);Dolin Génépy des Alpes or Green Chartreuse (750 mL);Sugar maple wood piece the size of a lemon

Name: Normandie Old Fashioned
About: This cocktail by Alex Day and Devon Tarby at The Normandie Club
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a dried apple slice. *Coconut bourbon: Toast 3 1/2 tbsp coconut flakes on medium heat for 5 minutes or until slightly golden. Combine flakes with a 750mL bottle of Old Forester
Ingredients: Coconut bourbon;Apple brandy;Spiced almond demerara syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Sous Vide Gin & Tonic
About: Making this sous vide G&T by A.J. Schaller at Sterling Va.’s Culinary Research & Education Academy (CREA) Cuisine Solutions’ research arm starts with a sous vide tonic syrup. Keeping infusions under 185°F is crucial says Schaller. “This is the temperature at which the flavor of the volatile oils will change on the fruit and thicken the product” she says. Starting with room temperature ingredients will also help with a more rapid transfer of flavors according to Schaller.
HowToMake: Add the gin to a Highball glass with ice. Top with the tonic water. Garnish with a lime wedge. *Sous vide tonic water: Add 4 cups water 4 tsp powdered cinchona bark 1 cup lemongrass 1 roughly chopped lemon (with zest added and juiced) 1 roughly cut lime (with zest added and juiced) 1 roughly chopped orange (with zest added and juiced 1 grapefruit (with zest added and juiced) 1 tsp allspice berries 1/4 cup citric acid 1/4 cup salt and half of 3/4 cup agave syrup to a sous vide bag.
