About: A coffee-flecked spin on the classic brunch cocktail the Bourbon Milk Punch this drink has quickly become a weekend favorite at New Orleans’ Cavan. The chicory liqueur adds an extra special New Orleans flourish.
HowToMake: Pour the bourbon Caffe Moka and chicory liqueur in a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with the cream to fill glass. Stir once and sprinkle with freshly ground espresso to garnish.
Ingredients: Evan WIlliams White bourbon;Varnelli Caffe Moka;Hoodoo chicory liqueur;Heavy cream

Name: Cranberry-Ginger Mimosa
About: This three-ingredient celebration cocktail from The Cookie Rookie couldn’t be simpler. It’s perfect for every winter holiday from Thanksgiving straight through to Valentine’s Day.
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients in a Champagne flute. Garnish with skewered sugared cranberries.
Ingredients: Ginger ale or ginger beer;Cranberry juice;Champagne to Top

Name: Smoke Sho
About: The bright fresh taste and warming herbal properties of this cocktail by bartender Liz Martinez at The Purple Pig bring to mind Christmas trees cold snowy mornings and evenings spent by a crackling fire.
HowToMake: Shake all of ingredients in a shaker with ice until chilled. Strain into a Martini glass and garnish with cinnamon shavings.
Ingredients: Mezcal;Cynar;Green Chartreuse;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Simple syrup;Egg white foam

Name: Robin Redbreast
About: If you’d like to make your drink a festive shade of red for the holidays try this vodka
HowToMake: Shake all of ingredients in a shaker with ice until chilled. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with an edible orchid and orange rind.
Ingredients: Absolut vodka;Blood orange juice or puree;Triple sec;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice

Name: Broadway Joe
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“The perennial losing ways of the New York Jets have inspired me to create a cocktail around the last time they were actually winners” says bartender Cody Goldstein of Mathews in Jersey City N.J. “The Broadway Joe era was both flamboyant and fabulous. I combined joe (coffee) flavors with herbaceous mint and alpine herbs to wake the team up along with coconut cream rum because they are always on vacation come playoff time.”
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker filled halfway with ice and shake for 5 seconds. Strain into a stemmed Collins glass filled with crushed ice and garnish with edible green glitter 3 mint sprigs and 3 chocolate-covered coffee beans. *Coffee-infused tequila: Combine 1 tsp whole coffee beans and 750 mL blanco tequila. Let sit for 1 hour then strain out the beans. **Vanilla simple syrup: Slice 2 vanilla beans down the middle with a paring knife. With a spoon scrape the vanilla into to a medium pot filled with 4 cups water. Bring to a boil and add 4 cups superfine sugar. Bring to a simmer and stir until the sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature then strain out the vanilla bean through a fine-mesh strainer. Keeps in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
Ingredients: Coffee-infused Espolón blanco tequila;Brinley Gold Shipwreck coconut rum cream;Dolin Génépy des Alpes liqueur;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Vanilla simple syrup
Garnish: Edible green glitter;3 mint sprigs;3 chocolate-covered coffee beans

Name: Green Holiday
About: If you’d like to make your drink a festive shade of green for the holidays try this vodka and wheatgrass recipe. “Wheatgrass shots are so shockingly green that I knew as a cocktail ingredient they would add some sweet fresh and lusciously vegetal flavors” says Kevin Denton the national mixologist for Pernod Ricard.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with 3 mint leaves and a watermelon radish slice.
Ingredients: Absolut Citron vodka;Wheatgrass juice;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: Flying Elvis
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.For the New England Patriots “this cocktail is a little taste of humble pie with the strength and resolve of some local navy-strength rum
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice until emulsified for about a slow 5 count. Add ice and shake vigorously for a slow 10 count or until the shaker frosts over. Fine-strain into a lowball glass without ice and garnish with a few dots of Angostura bitters in the shape of the Patriots’ Flying Elvis logo (to the best of your artistic ability).
Ingredients: Privateer Navy Yard rum;Amaro di Angostura;Giffard Banane du Brésil liqueur;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Egg white

Name: Spirit of ’72
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“A classic Margarita
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Cut an orange peel into the shape of a dolphin. Strain the mix into a rocks glass over ice and garnish with the orange peel. Jalapeño agave syrup: Combine 12 oz agave syrup 12 oz filtered water and 2 to 3 sliced jalapeños in a saucepot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes tasting periodically until reaching desired level of spiciness. Remove from heat and skim off and discard jalapeño slices. Cool to room temperature before using. Will keep in the refrigerator for about 1 month.
Ingredients: Reposado tequila;Blue curaçao;Florida orange juice;Pineapple juice;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Jalapeño agave syrup

Name: K.C. Wolf
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.The Reiger
HowToMake: Add the gin syrup lemon juice and vinegar to a shaker filled with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a tulip glass over ice top up with the ale and fill with more ice. Garnish with freshly grated cinnamon 1 cinnamon stick and a straw. *Wild plum syrup: Add sliced plums and sugar (2:1 plums:sugar by weight) in a small pot and cook over medium heat until the plums become very soft and the sugar is completely dissolved. Strain out the solids through a chinois and let cool.
Ingredients: J. Rieger & Co. Midwestern dry gin;Wild plum syrup;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Apple cider vinegar;Boulevard Tank 7 Farmhouse ale

Name: Manhattan On $15 A Day
About: Adam McDowell’s book Drinks: A User’s Guide
HowToMake: Add the whisky to a rocks glass with ice swirl it around a bit and fill the glass with the cherry cola.
Ingredients: Canadian whisky;Cherry cola

Name: Off-White Russian No. 1
About: Adam McDowell’s book Drinks: A User’s Guide
HowToMake: Pour the vodka into the chocolate milk carton close the spout and shake. Drink through a straw if available.
Ingredients: Vodka;8-oz Chocolate milk carton

Name: Un-Cosmopolitan
About: Adam McDowell’s book Drinks: A User’s Guide offers ways to enjoy a cocktail under less-than-ideal circumstances calling such a drink an ad-hoctail including this Un-Cosmopolitan.
HowToMake: Add the vodka and Kool-Aid into a child’s sippy cup with ice. Close the lid shake add a splash of orange soda and enjoy.
Ingredients: Vodka;Cherry Kool-Aid;Orange soda

Name: Broncos Sunset
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“Denver is known for these amazing orange-hued sunsets so I wanted to incorporate that into this cocktail says Bryan Dayton the beverage director and co-owner of Denver’s Acorn
HowToMake: Add the blue curaçao to the bottom of a rocks glass and top with crushed ice. Add all of the other ingredients into a shaker filled with ice and shake. Slowly pour into the glass over crushed ice and garnish with a blood orange slice.
Ingredients: Blue curaçao;Suerte silver tequila;Ancho Reyes chile liqueur;Campari;Aperol;Orange juice;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Tom Coughlin Collins
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“My father and I have had New York Giants season tickets for at least 20 years and we go to every home game” says bartender Greg Lipari of New York City’s Bua. “We get there at 8 in the morning and make breakfast—bacon egg and cheese sandwiches on English muffins sometimes pancakes—and tailgate for hours before the game starts at 1 p.m. It’s a full-day affair so you need a drink that it isn’t overpowering and won’t knock you over the head. If you start drinking with breakfast you want something light and refreshing. “I just got back from the Giants–L.A. Rams game in London so I was inspired to do a gin cocktail” he says of this variation on a Tom Collins. “It’s named for Tom Coughlin who was the Giants’ head coach for the 10 years when they won two Super Bowls. He’s the most successful coach they’ve ever had. All Giants fans love Coughlin. The blueberries are for Big Blue of course and the prosecco is to anticipate imminent victory.”
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blueberries lemon juice and simple syrup. Add the gin fill with ice and shake. Pour without straining into a highball glass top with the prosecco and garnish with 8 blueberries.
Ingredients: Blueberries;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Simple syrup;Old Tom gin;Prosecco

Name: Burgundy & Gold
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“Being a Washington Redskins’ fan in San Francisco is tough as I imagine it is for any foreign fan in a city that’s not their own” says Kevin Diedrich the owner and bartender of Pacific Cocktail Haven. Diedrich’s drink is a Whiskey Sour variation bolstered by citrusy kalamansi and balanced with a deep fruity ruby port float. It’s based on Copper Fox rye whiskey. “It’s a nod to rye whiskey which was one of the first spirits to be made in D.C.” he says. The kalamansi gives the cocktail a great gold color and the port float adds the burgundy echoing the team colors. “A gold-rimmed glass is a plus” he says.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except for the port to a shaker filled with ice and shake until frothy and chilled. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice and gently float the ruby port over the back of a barspoon on top of the drink.
Ingredients: Copper Fox rye whiskey;Simple syrup;Boiron unsweetened kalamansi puree;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Pomegranate molasses;Egg white;Ruby port

Name: Port Authority
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.For the Tampa Buccaneers bartender Daniel Guess of Tampa’s Fly says he decided to tap into Tampa’s rich centuries-old rum history by swapping the Port of Call
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the wine to a shaker filled with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice and float the wine over the back of a barspoon on top of the drink. Garnish with a lemon wheel dusted with Chinese five-spice powder. *Cinnamon syrup: Add 1 cup sugar 1 cup water and 2 cinnamon sticks to a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is fully dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Remove the cinnamon sticks and store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Ingredients: Foursquare Port Cask Finish rum;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Cinnamon syrup;Dry red wine;pomegranate grenadine

Name: Blue Steele Slushie
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. Every Friday of football season in honor of the Colts Indianapolis’ Spoke & Steele serves these electric-blue drinks from a slushie machine alongside its spicy “famous nug” meatballs during happy hour.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a blender blend until smooth and serve in a rocks glass. *Spiced simple syrup: Add 1 cup water 1 cup sugar 1 cinnamon stick 4 whole cloves freshly grated nutmeg and a couple of pieces of lemon peel to a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved and bring to a gentle simmer. Remove from heat allow to cool to room temperature and strain.
Ingredients: Effen vodka;Blue curaçao;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Spiced simple syrup;Plum bitters (or Angostura orange bitters);Saline solution (1:1 salt:water)

Name: Gjallarhorn
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.Jesse Held a bartender for Minneapolis’ Jester Concepts group felt a certain obligation to not only create a cocktail that represents the Vikings but also pays homage to Minnesota’s “fabric of heartiness.” “The color had to be purple for many reasons for our recent loss of our Prince and of course our gridiron gladiators the Minnesota Vikings” he says. “The gold leaf garnish is an atypical flash we Minnesotans aren’t accustomed to having but staying true to our purple people eaters by wearing purple and gold is only fitting when it comes to imbibing in the name of the Vikings.”This drink has a base of aquavit from Minneapolis’ Tattersall Distilling. “Using aquavit was essential to making a cocktail that was a true representation of the Great White North’” says Held. To sweeten the drink he uses a syrup and a shrub from his elixir company Earl Giles which can be subbed for homemade versions.
HowToMake: Add all of ingredients to a shaker with dense ice and shake vigorously. Double-strain into a cocktail glass over a chunk of hand-chipped ice. *Jalapeño-infused aquavit: Steep one large washed and slice jalapeño in a 750 mL bottle of aquavit for four to six hours then remove the jalapeño. **Homemade blueberry-thyme shrub: Make a syrup by combining 1 cup gently crushed blueberries 1 cup water 1 cup sugar and a few thyme sprigs of in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved and remove from heat. Strain when cooled. Combine 2/3 blueberry-thyme syrup with 1/3 apple cider vinegar. Store in the refrigerator until use. ***Homemade vanilla syrup: Combine 1 cup water 1 cup sugar and 2 halved vanilla beans in a small pot over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved and remove from heat. When cool strain into a plastic container and refrigerate until use.
Ingredients: Tattersall jalapeño-infused aquavit;Lustau amontillado sherry;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Earl Giles blueberry-thyme shrub;Earl Giles vanilla syrup;Truffle bitters;Pinch Black sea salt

Name: Buddy's Busy
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“This cocktail is an ode to the ’85 Bears and the fleeting Honey Bears cheerleaders. I have vivid memories of watching them both during that season even at six years old” says bartender Christiana DeLucca of Chicago’s Formento’s. “It’s also an homage to Buddy Ryan’s 4–6 defense. That man is a legend and this is my tip o’ the hat to him in cocktail form. Served Toddy style this cocktail is all about embracing the fall season. Make a large batch grab a thermos and you’ve got the perfect tailgating cocktail to impress your friends.”
HowToMake: Add heavy whipping cream to an empty bottle and shake until lightly whipped for about 1 minute. Add the bourbon liqueurs honey lemon juice and hot tea to a mug. Top the drink with the whipped cream and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Maker's Mark 46 bourbon;Bärenjäger liqueur;Jeppson’s Malört liqueur;Buckwheat honey (or clover honey);Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Hot-brewed Davids Tea Pumpkin Chai black tea (or any chai);Heavy whipping cream

Name: 12th Man Fizz
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.For the Seattle Seahawks says bartender Kelly Ronan of Seattle’s Lark “this is a perfect cocktail for morning games—not too boozy and bright and refreshing with the effervescent ginger beer. We use lots of local products at Lark even at the bar. OOLA is a fantastic local distillery—it’s right down the street actually—so we use its gin and Rachel’s Ginger Beer which is a super spicy locally made ginger beer that nearly every Seattleite is obsessed with. The berries and kiwi add a little extra flavor and of course our favorite colors.”
HowToMake: Add the gin apricot brandy lime juice simple syrup and mint leaves to a shaker with ice and shake until cold. Strain into a Collins glass filled with the blueberries kiwi and ice. Top off the drink with the ginger beer and garnish with a mint leaf and straw.
Ingredients: OOLA gin (or other bright floral gin);Apricot brandy;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Simple syrup;Rachel’s Ginger Beer (or other high-quality ginger beer);Mint leaves shredded;Blueberries;Kiwi fruit peeled and sliced in wheels

Name: Muddled Pine
About: Nothing says winter holidays like a pine-themed drink. This one by bartender Carmen Polcyn at the now-closed Bar Toma in Chicago also utilizes cranberries and lemon making it even more festive. Sip the nonalcoholic version all day or make the cocktail at night for a cool yet warming seasonal tipple.
HowToMake: Add the bitters lemon juice pine syrup and cranberries to a shaker and muddle the cranberries. Add the gin or vodka (optional) and ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over ice and top with the lemon-lime soda. Garnish with 3 cranberries and a sprig of pine. *Pine syrup: Bring 1 cup of water and 1 cup of sugar to a boil until dissolved. Reduce heat to low and add a handful of chopped pine needles. Stir and remove from heat and let sit for 2 hours. Strain and refrigerate. Keeps up to 3 weeks.
Ingredients: Angostura bitters;Fresh lemon juice;Pine syrup;Fresh cranberries;Gin or vodka;Lemon-lime soda

Name: Smoked Honey Toddy
About: There are two ways to make this warming winter drink: One involves smoking your own honey and the other involves a cheat and buying already smoked honey (a good option is Bee Local
HowToMake: Add the scotch (optional) lemon juice smoked honey and hot water to a tea cup and stir. Garnish with a rosemary sprig lemon wheel and grated nutmeg. *Smoked honey: Heat 1 cup of water to a boil and slowly stir in 2 cups of honey. Heat 1 hardwood charcoal briquette to white-hot temperature over a flame and submerge it into the honey water. Allow to cool. Remove the briquette and run the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer. Makes 4�"6 servings.
Ingredients: Famous Grouse Smoky Black blended scotch (optional);Smoked honey;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Hot water

Name: Christmas Punc
About: At the award-winning Greenhouse Tavern in Cleveland lead bartender Dave Taha has created the ultimate holiday tipple that tastes good with or without booze. “This one reminds me of Christmas at Grandma and Grandpa’s” says Taha. “The fresh ginger gives it a bit of zing and the tart cherry adds depth and balance while the allspice and nutmeg lend their holiday spirit.” Whether you decide to drink it clean or spiked it’s surely going to get you in the festive spirit.
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients except for the ginger ale and nutmeg in shaker with ice and shake. Strain into rocks glass over ice and top with the ginger ale. Gently stir and garnish with ground ginger.
Ingredients: Light rum (optional);Cranberry juice;Simple syrup (2:1);Tart cherry juice;Allspice;Grated fresh ginger;Freshly grated nutmeg;Ginger ale

Name: Pumpkin Spiced Latte
About: No matter how much we fight it as the weather turns cooler imbibers turn to pumpkin spiced lattes. But instead of heading to the coffee shop for an overly sweet version use the slow-cooker recipe by bartender Norma Beekman of Lexington Ky.’s Lockbox at 21c Museum Hotel Lexington and make your own at home. Since the drink stays hot in the pot you can serve it morning noon and night. And for the boozy kick you can spike it with a variety of spirits such as dark rum bourbon or Frangelico—the darker the better.
HowToMake: Serves 10-12. Add the liquor (rum bourbon or Frangelico optional) coffee pumpkin puree milk sugar vanilla extract pumpkin pie spice cinnamon stick and .5 cup of heavy whipping cream into a slow cooker and heat on high for at least 90 minutes. Whip the remaining .5 cup of cream until thick. Serve the slow-cooker mixture in a mug top with some of the whipped cream and garnish with grated cinnamon or nutmeg.
Ingredients: Dark rum bourbon or Frangelico (optional);Freshly brewed coffee;Pumpkin purée;Milk;Heavy whipping cream;Sugar;Vanilla extract;Pumpkin pie spice;Cinnamon

Name: Smoky Limeade
About: Though one thinks of limeade and lemonade as summer drinks bartender Carmen Polcyn at Chicago’s Bar Toma gives this tipple that’s good with or without booze a wintery hint of rosemary and warming smoky punch. You can spike the drink with tequila or mezcal the latter adding even more smoky fun to the drink.
HowToMake: Add the tequila or mezcal (optional) citrus juice and simple syrup to a rocks glass with ice and stir. Top with the club soda or for more sweetness the tonic water and garnish with a sprig of rosemary. *Citrus juice: Cut 1 lemon and 1 lime in half and dip the open sides in turbinado sugar to coat. Grill each half over high heat with the cut edge toward the flame until the sugar has charred on the citrus. Once cooled juice the fruit.
Ingredients: Tequila or mezcal (optional);Smoked citrus juice;Simple syrup;Club soda or tonic water

Name: Comrade
About: It’s hard to deny that spaghetti squash seems like a head-scratcher of a cocktail ingredient much like tequila
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients into a mixing glass and stir until the glass begins to cloud. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a cinnamon stick. *Spaghetti squash cordial: Add 1.5 cups of squash purée 1 cup of granulated sugar and 1 sprig of rosemary to a heavy-bottom saucepan and bring to a rolling simmer over medium heat stirring slowly. Remove from the heat and let cool. Strain through fine-mesh cloth into a clean bowl and stir in 1 cup of vodka to the mixture until combined. Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
Ingredients: Reposado tequila;Drambuie liqueur;Spaghetti squash cordial;Dry sherry;Chocolate bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: Hot Butter(nut) Rum
About: This Toddy recipe from New York bitters powerhouse Amor y Amargo
HowToMake: Brew the tea and pour it into a mug. Add the rum and falernum stir then swirl in the butternut squash butter steaming with a frothing wand if desired. Add maple syrup to taste. *Butternut squash butter: In a small mixing bowl combine  2.5 oz of squash purée 2.5 oz of room-temperature unsalted butter .5 tsp of ground cinnamon .5 tsp of ground nutmeg .5 tsp of allspice a pinch of ground cloves .75 oz of dark brown sugar .5 tsp of maple syrup and a pinch of salt; mix until smooth. Roll into a log in parchment or wax paper and store in the refrigerator.
Ingredients: Aged rum;Earl Grey tea hot;Velvet falernum;Butternut squash butter;Maple syrup to taste

Name: Block Party Punch
About: This surprisingly light grog is the crowd-pleasing autumn punch you didn’t even know you were missing. “Squash is amazingly flavorful and adds luscious texture to cocktails” says Alejandro De La Parra the bar manager at Teardrop Lounge. “[For this cocktail] we roasted the butternut squash with demerara sugar mace clove and allspice.”
HowToMake: Makes 6�"8 cups. Combine all of the ingredients except the club soda and brut in a shaker and shake gently. Strain into a punch bowl filled with ice top with the club soda and sparkling wine and garnish with hibiscus flowers and pomegranate seeds.
Ingredients: Buffalo Trace bourbon;Butternut squash purée;Hibiscus tea;Kronan Swedish Punsch;Sweet vermouth;Gomme syrup;Club soda;Brut sparkling wine

Name: Harvest No
About: This drink doubles as a dessert and cocktail in one. Two different approaches to preparing acorn squash allow the vegetable to flex its muscles in a couple of different directions. For the vegetable-cocktail skittish though never fear: Allspice and clove help the drink to retain a more traditional “nog” flavor profile while adding in a welcome dose of crispness.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker and shake vigorously. Double-strain into a double-rocks glass over ice and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg. *Green acorn squash cordial: Add 1.5 cups of squash purée 1 cup granulated sugar and .5 tsp of whole allspice into a saucepan and bring to a simmer stirring slowly. Remove from the heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Once cool strain through fine-mesh cloth into a clean bowl. Stir in 1 cup of vodka in the mixture until combined. Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 1 week. **Roasted white acorn squash purée: Quarter and deseed a whole squash then pierce the squash flesh with 10 to 12 cloves depending on the size of the squash. Roast at 414°F in an oven-safe pan until the flesh is tender. Allow to cool and remove the cloves. Place the cooled squash in a blender and pulse until smooth streaming in cold water until the desired purée consistency is reached. Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
Ingredients: Drambuie liqueur;Green acorn squash cordial;Roasted white acorn squash purée;1 scoop Vanilla ice cream

Name: Butte
About: At first glance rum might seem to be the key element in this butternut squash cocktail but one sip and you’ll know it’s the orange liqueur that steals the show. The cordial deftly balances the squash’s earthiness with the rum’s spice and the glittery cinnamon-sugar rim.
HowToMake: Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a shallow bowl. In a separate shallow bowl add 1 tbsp of rum. Dip the rim of a double-rocks glass into the rum bowl followed by the cinnamon-sugar to coat and set aside. Add the butternut squash base remaining 3 tbsp of rum orange liqueur simple syrup bitters and juice of 2 lemon wedges into a cocktail shaker filled with ice and stir then shake until well-chilled. Strain into the prepared glass. *Butternut squash base: Combine 1/2 cup of butternut squash puree (or pumpkin puree) 2 tsp of brown sugar 1 tsp of molasses and a pinch of salt. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl. Use immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
Ingredients: Dark rum;Orange liqueur;Ground cinnamon;Sugar;Butternut squash base;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Juice of 2 lemon wedges

Name: Guinness Chocolate Floa
About: Booze buzz meets sugar buzz in this decadent dessert cocktail. (Trust us you need this in your life.)
HowToMake: Scoop the chocolate ice cream into a chilled pint glass. Drizzle with chocolate syrup. Slowly pour the Guinness over the ice cream. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Premium chocolate ice cream;Chocolate syrup;Guinness Stout (chilled)

Name: Rise Up Red Sea
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“When you think about spirits in the desert of Arizona tequila
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake until cold. Strain into a coupe or cocktail glass and garnish with a dried lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Fortaleza blanco tequila;Campari;Watermelon syrup (1:1 watermelon juice:sugar);Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Peychaud’s bitters

Name: Autumn Wind
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“With 2.5 ounces of liquor this is the perfect cocktail for an Oakland Raiders fan” says bartender Martin Delgado of Prizefighter in Emeryville Calif. “Bold and strong while pleasantly refreshing that is always my take away from a Raiders tailgate and a Raiders win. And as we are the Raiders rum was without question the base spirit! Go Raiders!”
HowToMake: Add the tequila falernum and lime juice to a double rocks glass with crushed ice and stir. Top with the rum fill with more crushed ice and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Cruzan black strap rum;Silver tequila;Velvet falernum;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice

Name: On the Wings of Eagles
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. This drink by Matthew Polzin of The Olde Bar is inspired by the Philadelphia Eagles whose team color is represented by the Green Chartreuse and team’s eagle represented on the bottle of Fernet-Branca
HowToMake: Add the cognac rye Chartreuse and bitters to a mixing glass with ice and stir until cold. Add a splash of the fernet to a rocks glass roll the glass to coat the sides and discard the excess. Add one large ice cube to the glass strain the drink over the cube and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Cognac;Rye whiskey;Green Chartreuse;Lemon bitters;Splash Fernet-Branca

Name: Henderson's Mule
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team.“Fifty years ago the New Orleans Saints franchise was first announced right here at The Bayou Bar” says Benton Bourgeois a bartender at this Pontchartrain hotel bar. “Having been a Saints fan my entire life one moment stands in my memory above all others: announcer Jim Henderson’s iconic call at the end of the 2010 NFC Championship game. ‘Pigs have flown! Hell has frozen over! The Saints are on their way to the Super Bowl!’ I’ll never forget driving home down St. Charles Avenue after the game every horn in the city honking high-fiving the wall of exuberant fans that lined both sides of the street listening to local radio station WWL replay Jim’s call over and over. This drink is for you sir.”
HowToMake: Add the bourbon coffee simple syrup and ginger brew to a mixing glass. Open the charcoal tablet carefully empty it into the glass discard the capsule and stir until the charcoal has dissolved turning the drink black. Pour the mix into a copper mug filled with ice.
Ingredients: Buffalo Trace bourbon;Dark-roast cold-brew coffee;Simple syrup;Huhu’s Ginger Brew;Activated charcoal tablet

Name: Nutty Ocho Rios
About: This cocktail from Shane Paule the bar manager at Austin’s Isla sports the usual good stuff found in a Mai Tai but with an additional scrumptious nutty layer of macadamia nut liqueur.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Pour into a hurricane glass over crushed ice and sprinkle with fresh ground nutmeg.
Ingredients: White rum;Jamaican rum;Orgeat;Lime juice;Trader Vic’s macadamia nut liqueur;Fresh ground nutmeg

Name: The Only Margarita Recipe You Nee
About: The Margarita is one of the most popular cocktails in North America—for good reason. Combining the tang of lime and the sweetness of orange liqueur with the distinctive strength of tequila our classic Margarita strikes all of the right keys.Although many people reach for premade sour mix we highly recommend using fresh lime juice. The end result is—let’s face it—superior. When talking Margaritas it’s easy to get lost in stories about who invented the drink or get mired in debates over salt versus no salt; blended or frozen; triple sec Cointreau or Grand-Marnier. In our opinion this version is the tried-and-true recipe for the best Margarita you can make. Memorize it and you’ll always impress.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into the prepared rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel and kosher salt (optional).
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice;Orange liqueur;Agave syrup

Name: Mularkey's Secret Playbook
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. “The Mularkey’s Secret Playbook is named after the new head coach [Mike Mularkey] in hopes that he has the secret playbook to bring us a winning season” says Etch bartender Mark Kremper. “The main components of the drink are Tennessee whiskey and Chartreuse. It wouldn’t be a cocktail celebrating our Tennessee Titans if it wasn’t made with Mr. Tennessee Whiskey himself Jack Daniel’s. I chose to use its new single-barrel rye whiskey for its heat and spicy notes to give our team the kick it needs to beat the competition and paired it with Chartreuse for which the secret recipe is known only by a select few (hence the playbook). This cocktail embodies our hopes for the season.”
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until cold. Strain into a coupe and garnish with maraschino cherries skewered with bamboo in the shape of an X (making Xs with the skewer and Os with the cherries).
Ingredients: Jack Daniel’s single-barrel rye whiskey;Green Chartreuse;Dolin blanc vermouth;Dolin Rouge vermouth;Simple syrup

Name: Shandy Khan
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. This teal-blue Shandy named for Jacksonville Fla. Jaguars owner Shad Khan is made using some of Restaurant Orsay bartender Josh Strickland’s favorite local ingredients: beer from Intuition Ale Works (which is adjacent to Everbank Field home of the Jags) rum from Marlin & Barrel distillery in nearby Fernandina Beach and a fresh Florida orange slice. “This is perfect for those über-hot Florida tailgates early in the year. It’s bright and refreshing without being so boozy that you’re in trouble before the fourth quarter starts” says Strickland. “If you are a savvy tailgater you will cook up a batch beforehand and simply top them off with beer and ‘blue stuff’ as you go.”
HowToMake: Add the rum lemon juice syrup and bitters to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Collins glass (or red Solo cup) over ice and top with the beer. Float a pour of the blue curaçao on top and garnish with half an orange wheel. *Honey syrup: Add .25 cup water and .5 cup honey to a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until the honey completely melts. Strain into a jar and seal with a lid.
Ingredients: Marlin & Barrel amber rum;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Honey syrup;Regans' Orange Bitters No. 6;Local Intuition Ale Works Jon Boat ale;Blue curaçao

Name: Jabs & Dabs
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. Named after the Carolina Panthers’ signature dab move Kindred bartender Blake Pope uses small-batch gin  from nearby Sutler’s Spirit Co. in Winston-Salem N.C. to make this variation on a Tom Collins. “This drink is served long packs a mean punch and has a nasty bite” says Pope.
HowToMake: Add the gin sherry lemon juice and honey syrup to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a Collins glass over crushed ice top with strawberry shrub and garnish with a thyme sprig. *Honey syrup: Add .25 cup water and .5 cup honey to a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until the honey completely melts. Strain into a jar and seal with a lid. **Strawberry shrub: You can buy on here
Ingredients: Sutler's gin;Manzanilla sherry;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Honey syrup;Strawberry shrub

Name: Curse of Bobby Layne
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. “Introduced in 1930 Honolulu blue and silver have been the distinctive look of the Detroit Lions for almost the entire life of the franchise” says Selden Standard bartender Rob Wilson. “Inspired by those colors the cocktail features blueberries and [blue agave] silver tequila. The idea is to have the vinegar create a really pungent garnish kind of like a pickled onion on a Martini. Fresh berries will lack that zing so I’d definitely suggest pickling them or even just soaking them overnight in Champagne vinegar to at least get some of that flavor.”(As for the name in 1958 the Lions traded quarterback Bobby Layne to the Pittsburgh Steelers. Layne in response supposedly said the Lions would not win for 50 years—though this statement has been disputed as a hoax and was never published at the time. But for the next 50 years the Lions had the worst winning percentage of any NFL team.)
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass or coupe and garnish with 3 pickled blueberries on a toothpick. *Pickled blueberries: Gently warm blueberries in a small pot with a little Champagne vinegar salt and sugar and let cool overnight.
Ingredients: 100 percent blue agave silver tequila;Dolin blanc vermouth;Cocchi Americano apéritif;Maraschino liqueur;Grapefruit bitters

Name: Vecchia Passion
About: This cocktail is an eight-ingredient highly amplified riff on an Old Fashioned incorporating five Don Ciccio & Figli bottles and several additional ingredients.
HowToMake: Pour all of the ingredients in mixing glass and stir. Pour into a rocks glass over ice and garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Amaro Delle Sirene;Luna Amara;Amaro Donna Rosa;Amaro Don Ferné;Cinque Aperitivo;Cocchi Americano;Dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Carciofi Shandy
About: This cocktail incorporates Cynar with unfiltered apple juice cinnamon syrup and ginger beer transforming a summertime special into something more appropriately autumnal.
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients except the alcoholic ginger beer in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Fine-strain into a pilsner and top with the ginger beer. *Cinnamon syrup: In a small saucepan add 2 cups of water and 9 oz of broken-up cinnamon sticks (approximately 4 sticks) and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes and strain out the cinnamon sticks. Bring the water back to a boil add 1.5 cups of sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved.
Ingredients: Cynar;Unfiltered apple juice;Cinnamon syrup;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Alcoholic ginger beer

Name: Fall Into Italy
About: This cocktail brings Averna amaro to life with cognac Appleton Estate rum lemon juice simply syrup and chocolate bitters.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a rocks glass over pebble or crushed ice and garnish with an orange wedge.
Ingredients: Averna amaro;Cognac;Appleton Estate rum;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Simple syrup;Chocolate bitters

Name: Rye Bandit
About: This riff on a Boulevardier
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Pour into a rocks glass over ice and garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Amaro Delle Sirene;Luna Amara bitter

Name: Italian Bird
About: This cocktail is built around the comfortable confines of aged rum and Campari but then is taken into a new direction and layered with fino sherry honey water and salt.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir. Pour into a rocks glass over ice and garnish with pineapple sage. *Honey water: Pour honey into equal-parts water and shake well until no longer separated.
Ingredients: Aged rum;Campari;Fino sherry;Honey water;Pinch Salt

Name: Brown & Orange
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. “This cocktail is basically just whiskey
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir.
Ingredients: Old Overholt rye whiskey;Amaro Nonino Quintessentia;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: War Streets Spritz
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. “The War Streets Spritz is named in honor of Franco Harris’ Italian army and the historic Mexican War Streets neighborhood on Pittsburgh’s North Side” says bartender Michael Anderson of Butcher and the Rye. “Not far from the Steelers’ Heinz Field War Streets represents an ideal setting for a low-alcohol pregame cocktail before walking down the hill for tailgating. Incorporating premium agave spirits and made in an Italian style the War Streets Spritz is a great way to kick off a day of watching the Steelers dominate the competition.”
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the prosecco to a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a Collis glass over ice and top with the prosecco. Garnish with 2 lemon wheels 1 slice of fresh ginger root and 1 basil leaf. *Ginger syrup: Add 8 oz of cleaned (no need to peel it) roughly chopped ginger (each piece should be about the size of your pinkie tip) 8 oz of sugar and 8 oz of boiling water to a blender and blend on high until mixture is smooth then fine-strain through a sieve and let cool to room temperature.
Ingredients: Espolón reposado tequila;Aperol;Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Ginger syrup;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Peychaud's bitters;Splash Dry prosecco
Garnish: 2 lemon wheels;Fresh ginger root slice;Basil leaf;Straw

Name: Black-Eyed Rye
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. “Before Prohibition WWI and WWII Maryland was one of the largest producers of rye
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 25 seconds. Double-strain into a highball glass filled with ice and top off with the ginger beer. Garnish with a mint sprig and three blackberries. *Blackberry mint syrup: Add 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add 1.5 cups of blackberries and muddle the berries into the syrup. Add 2 cups of mint leaves and stir. Place in the refrigerator for 24 hours and strain into a jar. Keeps in the refrigerator for 1 month.
Ingredients: Sagamore Spirit rye whiskey;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Blackberry mint syrup;Mint leaves;Ginger beer

Name: Who Dey!
About: For football season we had a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown provide the perfect cocktail to represent their team. Molly Wellmann of Japp’s Since 1879
HowToMake: Cut 4 long and thin orange peels and press them firmly onto the inside of a coupe. Add the rum syrup and mint to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into the coupe carefully trying not to disturb the peels though some will undoubtedly float in the glass. Gently top with the stout and yell “Who Dey!”. *Vanilla simple syrup: Combine 1 cup water 1 cup sugar and 2 split vanilla beans in a small pot and stir. Bring to a rolling boil stirring to prevent scorching. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Strain through a fine sieve and discard the vanilla beans. Will keep in the refrigerator for 2 or 3 weeks.
Ingredients: The Kraken black spiced rum;Vanilla simple syrup;Left Hand Brewing milk stout;Fresh mint leaves
Garnish: 4 orange peels cut long and thin

Name: Long Zest
About: This house cocktail at Scotland’s Glenmorangie House
HowToMake: Add the scotch and bitters into a rocks glass over ice and stir. Top with the ginger ale flame an orange peel to express the oils then add as a garnish.
Ingredients: Glenmorangie Original scotch;Fever-Tree ginger ale

Name: My Golden Dram
About: This scotch
HowToMake: Place a napkin over the top of a Champagne flute place the sugar cube on top add 3 dashes of Angostura bitters onto the cube so it soaks into the sugar cube then flip the napkin so the sugar cube falls into the flute. Add the scotch stir lightly and top with the prosecco.
Ingredients: Aberfeldy 12-year-old scotch;Sugar cube;Prosecco float

Name: FEW Lion's Tail
About: This bourbon cocktail is perfect for fall.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass and garnish with lime zest peel.
Ingredients: FEW bourbon;Allspice dram;Demerara simple syrup;Lime juice

Name: Hebridean Shores
About: The Finnieston in Glasgow tabbed as a gin bar in a Gin & Tonic town puts Bruichladdich The Classic Laddie scotch to use in this light fruity drink topped with a floater of IPA.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except for the beer into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a Collins glass over ice. Top with the beer. Garnish with a grapefruit slice.
Ingredients: Bruichladdich The Classic Laddie scotch;Fresh pink grapefruit juice;Peach schnapps;Fino sherry

Name: Dramble
About: In this riff on the Bramble the honeyed fruits and floral notes of Dewar’s 12-year-old scotch play well with the Briottet crème de mûre liqueur while taking the drink in an entirely different direction.
HowToMake: Combine the scotch lemon juice and syrup in a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a hurricane glass over crushed ice and drizzle with the liqueur. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Dewar's 12-year-old scotch;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Monin orange syrup;Briottet crème de mûre liqueur

Name: Campbeltown
About: This scotch drink at Edinburgh’s Bramble Bar
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a Nick & Nora glass express the oil of a lemon peel and discard the peel.
Ingredients: Springbank 10-year-old scotch;Cherry Heering liqueur;Green Chartreuse

Name: Let's Pumpkin
About: Perfect for a Halloween or fall party this pumpkin punch includes a six-spice syrup and little meringue tops.
HowToMake: Serves 8 to 12. With a jagged edge cut open the top of a pumpkin scoop out the seeds and rinse out the pumpkin. Add all of the ingredients into the pumpkin with ice and stir. Add 5 lemon wheels thinly sliced and 3 pineapple wheels thinly sliced to the bowl for garnish. Serve in a mini hollowed-out harvest pumpkin or glass mug top with Marshmallow Fluff or meringue that’s then toasted with a hand torch and garnish with a cinnamon stick. *Fall spice syrup: Toast 2 tsp of cardamom in a saucepan at medium heat. Add 5 whole star anise 1 tsp of nutmeg 5 diced stems of whole ginger root 3 cinnamon sticks 3 cloves 1 whole orange twist 2 cups of fine white sugar and 2 cups of water and stir until the sugar has completely dissolved. Let it cool for 30 minutes and use a fine-mesh sieve to strain into a Mason jar. (Keeps in the refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.). **Toasted meringue: Separate 5 whole eggs and place the whites in a large bowl. Beat the egg whites with an electric or handheld mixer until they become soft. Add 3 tsp of sugar gradually as the egg whites are beaten to stiff peaks. Use a large spoon to transfer the meringue into a plastic-coated pastry bag to squeeze the meringue onto each punch-filled glass mug or mini pumpkin.
Ingredients: Elijah Craig bourbon;Domaine de Canton ginger liqueur;Farmer’s Market organic pumpkin purée;Fall spice syrup;Apple juice;Pineapple juice;Lemon juice;Marshmallow Fluff or toasted meringue

Name: Sour T-iesel
About: This CBD hemp oil  and tequila
HowToMake: Place all of the ingredients except for the CBD oil and aquafaba in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Fine-strain into a 64 oz container and add the CBD oil and aquafaba. Emulsify the liquid for 5 seconds with a handheld emulsifier on turbo. Transfer the liquid back into the cocktail shaker and strain the liquid into a coupe glass with a Hawthorne strainer. To create a pot leaf image atop the cocktail use a stencil and ceremonial-grade matcha.
Ingredients: Tequila blanco;Organic fresh-pressed lime juice;Organic agave nectar;Pink sea salt;Organic mint leaves (without stems);Organic cold-pressed CBD oil (extracted from industrial hemp);Organic aquafaba

Name: Butternut Squash Old Fashioned
About: The orange flesh of butternut squash has a natural sweetness to it which gets sweeter still when roasted with a bit of maple syrup making it an ideal veg to infuse into robust bourbon in the fall.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass combine all of the ingredients with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh cracked ice and garnish with an orange peel. *Squash-infused bourbon: Cut 2 cups of butternut squash into chunks. Add the squash 1/4 cup of maple syrup and 1 tsp of cinnamon. Spread the squash on a baking sheet and bake in the oven at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until soft. Allow to cool. In a large Mason jar combine the squash with 1 750mL bottle of bourbon (like Buffalo Trace) and set the empty bottle aside until later. Cover tightly and allow it to infuse for two to three weeks. Strain the bourbon funnel back into the empty bottle (be sure to label the bottle) and cap tightly. The infused bourbon should keep for five to seven days.
Ingredients: Squash-infused bourbon;Maple syrup;Giffard Banane Du Bresil liqueur;Walnut bitters

Name: X-Mas Sin
About: OK sure the name of this cocktail has a naughty Christmas sort of vibe. But that doesn’t mean you can’t sip this steamy drink all throughout the colder months enjoying the pick-me-up hint of coffee paired with the rich bite of Armagnac.
HowToMake: In a small saucepan combine all of the ingredients except for the water and heat without bringing to a boil. Strain the mixture into a toddy glass and top with hot water to fill.
Ingredients: Coffee liqueur;Chestnut liqueur;Génépy liqueur;Coffee beans;Hot water

Name: Folle Blanche Crusta
About: Blanc Armagnac is a relative newcomer to the scene and has only been officially recognized by the Armagnac powers-that-be for a handful of years. Its youth in a world of grand dames though means it serves as a fine introduction to the spirit for those not quite ready to take the VSOP plunge. This fruity play on a traditional Brandy Crusta
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass with ice and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Château du Tariquet Folle Blanche Armagnac;Leopold Bros. American orange Liqueur;Leopold Bros. maraschino liqueur;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Magic Cotton Candy Daiquir
About: This cocktail is pure boozy magic. Watch the fluff of sugar disappear before your very eyes!
HowToMake: Place a big fluff of cotton candy in the cocktail glass. Add rum and lime juice to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake then strain into the glass dissolving the cotton candy. Top with Champagne. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Gourmet cotton candy;Light rum;Juice of 1 lime;Champagne

Name: Adonis
About: Give this easy-drinking low-alcohol sipper a spin. Made with equal parts sherry and vermouth it pairs beautifully with tapas and other savory bites.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Pour into a coupe glass and garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Fino sherry;Sweet vermouth

Name: Corpse Reviver No. Blue
About: Bacardí brand ambassador Jacob Briars created this drink as a joke but it’s become a popular order so he gets the last laugh. It is similar to the Corpse Reviver No. 2 but swaps Cointreau for blue curaçao.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled coupe or Martini glass with absinthe and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Fine-strain into the prepared glass and garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: London dry gin;Blue curaçao;Lillet Blanc;Lemon juice;Absinthe rinse

Name: Bourbon Sweet Te
About: Make a batch for your next party. Or just spend the weekend sitting on the porch rocking your cares away.Makes about 1 gallon (16 glasses)
HowToMake: Combine the boiling water and sugar in a heatproof container. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add the tea bags and steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and discard. Pour the tea base into a heatproof pitcher or serving jar. Add the cold water ice and bourbon. Stir well and refrigerate until serving. To serve pour into an ice-filled highball glass or Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with mint and lemon slices.
Ingredients: Boiling water;Sugar;Black tea bags;Cold water;Crushed ice plus more for serving;Bourbon (about one 750ml bottle)

Name: Alaska
About: This gin cocktail made with Yellow Chartreuse and orange bitters “dances between spirit-driven and citrus-forward” according to Keli Rivers of San Francisco’s Whitechapel. “It’s good moving from one side of the spectrum to the other.”
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass express the oil of a lemon peel over the drink and garnish with that lemon peel.
Ingredients: Gin;Yellow Chartreuse;Orange bitters

Name: Saturn
About: This gin-based Tiki cocktail “carries the regality of a Mai Tai with the drinkability of a Tom Collins” according to Garret Richard of New York City’s Slowly Shirley and The Happiest Hour.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a blender with crushed ice and blend until smooth. Pour unstrained into a Tiki mug or highball glass. Garnish with a parasol edible flower and orange peel. Serve with a straw. *Passion fruit syrup: Mix 6 parts simple syrup to 1 part passion fruit purée.
Ingredients: Gin;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Passion fruit syrup;Orgeat;Falernum

Name: Jack Rose
About: This classic cocktail from the 1920s and ’30s takes its name from its main ingredient of applejack and the resulting color from grenadine.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Fine-strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a lime or lemon twist.
Ingredients: Applejack brandy;Fresh lime or lemon juice;Grenadine

Name: Coronation Cocktail No. 1 Recip
About: This classic sherry cocktail recipe hails from Harry Craddock’s 1930 book The Savoy Cocktail Book<.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir for 30 seconds. Fine-strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Fino sherry;Dry vermouth;Orange bitters;Maraschino liqueur

Name: Whiskey Drinks We Love: The Seelbac
About: The glittering mixture of local bourbon orange liqueur two kinds of bitters and Champagne is the signature drink of Louisville’s Seelbach Hotel. Once thought to be a classic rediscovered in the ’90s after decades of obscurity the drink’s inventor recently confessed to having fabricated the vintage backstory. Regardless the elegant sip is sure to be delighting guests (and faraway strangers) for years to come.
HowToMake: Stir together bourbon Cointreau and bitters in an ice-filled mixing glass. Strain into a chilled Champagne flute. Top with cold Champagne or sparkling wine and garnish with twist.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Cointreau orange liqueur;Angostura bitters;Peychaud’s bitters;Champagne or sparkling wine

Name: Bramble
About: Famed bartender Dick Bradsell invented this classic at Fred’s Club in London’s Soho in the ’80s inspired by the fresh blackberries he used to get as a child on the Isle of Wight.
HowToMake: Add the gin lemon juice and simple syrup into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into an Old Fashioned glass over crushed ice. Lace over top with the creme de mure. Garnish with a lemon half-wheel and a fresh blackberry.
Ingredients: Gin;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Simple syrup;Crème de mure

Name: Tommy’s Margarita
About: This classic tequila cocktail was created by Julio Bermejo in the early ’90s at Tommy’s Mexican Restaurant in San Francisco where it’s still offered.
HowToMake: Prepare a rocks glass with a salt rim. All all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain over ice into a rocks glass.
Ingredients: 100% agave blanco tequila;Lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: Bamboo
About: Sherry cocktails are getting a lot of love from the bartender community and this underrated 19th-century drink is a delicious way to go.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a mixing glass with cracked ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Dry sherry;Dry vermouth;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: Mezcal Mule
About: Try this smoky variation of the gingery refresher the Moscow Mule by Jim Meehan of New York City’s PDT.
HowToMake: Add the lime juice and cucumber slices to a mixing glass and muddle. Add the rest of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Stain into a rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with a cucumber slice and a piece of candied ginger and top with a pinch of ground chile.
Ingredients: Sombra mezcal;Ginger beer;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar;Cucumber slices

Name: 20th Century
About: All aboard for this legendary gin libation!
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake until chilled for about 15 seconds. Fine-strain into a chilled coupe and top with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Lillet Blanc;White crème de cacao;Freshly squeezed lemon juice

Name: Old Cuban
About: Bartender Audrey Saunders is best known for her work at Soho’s Pegu Club where her drink credits include this Mojito-meets–French 75 classic.
HowToMake: Muddle the lime juice syrup and mint in a mixing glass. Add the rum bitters and ice and shake. Double-strain into a coupe glass and top with the Champagne.
Ingredients: Rum;Freshly squeezed lime juice;Simple syrup;Whole mint leaves;Angostura bitters;Champagne

Name: Gin-Gin Mule
About: This gingery cocktail found in “New York Cocktails” (Cider Mill Press $19.95) by Amanda Schuster was created by Audrey Saunders for NYC’s Pegu Club as a gateway gin drink for vodka lovers. Not only did it succeed it inspired many variations around the world. Homemade ginger beer won’t be fizzy and thus can be shaken. If you’re using carbonated ginger beer pour that ingredient directly into the glass to top up the drink.
HowToMake: In a mixing tin muddle the simple syrup lime juice and 1 mint sprig. Add the gin ginger beer and ice and shake well. Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Garnish with 1 mint sprig and serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Simple syrup;Fresh lime juice;Mint sprig;Tanqueray London dry gin;Audrey Saunders' Ginger Beer

Name: Game Day Sangria
About: Made with white wine and hard apple cider it’s the perfect football party cocktail.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher or punch bowl. Serve in a Mason jar over ice with a straw. Garnish with lemon wheels and apple slices.
Ingredients: Unfiltered apple cider or apple juice;White wine;Hard apple cider;Ginger ale;Juice of 1 lemon;Apple slices

Name: Brancamenta Frappe
About: Mint liqueur mocha gelato and a whole lotta love go into this frozen drink from New Orleans’ Erin Rose.
HowToMake: Blend the Brancamenta gelato and milk in a blender until smooth. Serve in a 12 oz plastic cup and top with coffee.
Ingredients: Brancamenta liqueur;Mocha gelato;Whole milk;Coffee float

Name: Daiquiri No. 6
About: This twist on the New Orleans favorite goes down easy.
HowToMake: Prepare an Old Fashioned glass with a rim of smoked salt. Blend all of the ingredients in a blender with 1 cup of cracked ice until smooth and pour into the Old Fashioned glass.
Ingredients: Bacardí Ocho rum;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Granulated sugar;Grapefruit pitted and peeled;Dark crème de cacao

Name: Brown Bag Daiquiri
About: Mezcal is the smoky secret to this hopped-up Daiquiri twist from New Orleans’ Balise.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a coupe wrapped in a piece of a brown bag held together with a spear. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: El Silencio mezcal;Tempus Fugit Alessio vermouth bianco;Fresh lime juice;Fresh lemon juice;Malt honey syrup;Bittermens hopped grapefruit bitters

Name: Deadbeat Daiquiri
About: We got the recipe for this modern classic from Beachbum Berry’s Latitude 29 in New Orleans.
HowToMake: Blend all of the ingredients in a blender with 1.5 cups crushed ice for up to 20 seconds until frappéd. Pour unstrained into a Cocktail Kingdom Pearl Diver glass and garnish with an edible orchid pineapple wedge and straw.
Ingredients: Caña Brava 7-year-old grand reserve añeja rum;lychee nuts shelled (drained if canned);Freshly squeezed lime juice;Simple syrup;Maraschino liqueur;Rhum Clément Mahina Coco liqueur;Fee Brothers Aztec chocolate bitters

Name: El Crepúsculo de Nicaragua (Nicaraguan Twilight)
About: Violet liqueur gives this pineapple Daiquiri
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients and 1 lime wedge into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a chilled Martini glass and garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Flor de Caña rum;Crème de violette;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Pineapple juice;Lime wedge

Name: Good Ships / Wood Ships
About: Aged rum
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a coupe and garnish with a speared grapefruit peel.
Ingredients: El Dorado 5-year-old gold rum;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;Dolin Génépy Des Alpes;Giffard Crème de Pamplemousse Rose;Simple syrup

Name: Italian Cookie
About: This Daiquiri twist from New Orleans’ Three Muses ain’t your nonna’s creamy nightcap.
HowToMake: Blend all of the ingredients with ice in a blender. Pour into a highball glass and garnish with Italian sprinkles (jimmies) and a straw.
Ingredients: Black Magic black spiced rum;Heavy whipping cream;Herbsaint liqueur;Crème de noyaux;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Rouses fig preserve

Name: Stone & Co.
About: Gin and cucumber get a Daiquiri twist from The Mayhaw at St. Roch Market.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth. Garnish with a cucumber wheel. *Plum syrup: Chop 12 plums removing seeds. Add 12 cups of water and 12 cups of sugar to a pot. Once the sugar dissolves add the plums and bring to a boil. After it reaches a boil turn the heat down and let it simmer for approximately 2 hours until the plums are soft. Strain out the plums and transfer to a bottle with a second strain. **Cucumber syrup: Follow the same steps as the plum syrup but using 8 cucumbers instead.
Ingredients: Hendrick's gin;Freshly squeezed lime;Plum syrup;Cucumber syrup

Name: Viking Vacation
About: Swap out the rum in this Daiquiri twist from New Orleans’ Vessel.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a coupe and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Reyka vodka;Freshly squeeze lime juice;Orange oleo saccharum;Iris liqueur;Regans' Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Torrents of Summer
About: If you like a good Daiquiri try this gingery upgrade from New Orleans’ Kingfish.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into coupe and garnish with a speared lime peel and cherry.
Ingredients: Bacardí Maestro de Ron;Freshly squeezed lime juice;Ginger shrub;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Angostura bitters

Name: Rum Cannonball
About: Tea-infused booze makes this frozen Daiquiri from New Orleans’ Catahoula Upstairs Bar deluxe.
HowToMake: Blend all of the ingredients in a blender with 1.5 cups of crushed ice. Serve in a hurricane glass and garnish with an orchid and straw. *Butterfly pea flower tea liqueur: Mix 2 parts Cane Run rum 1 part honey 1 part hot green tea and 1 tbsp pea flower powder.
Ingredients: Cane Run rum;Pineapple juice;Falernum;Freshly squeezed lime juice;Simple syrup;Butterfly pea flower tea liqueur

Name: Snapsvisa Sour
About: Aquavit gives this Daiquiri-inspired sip from New Orleans’ Josephine Estelle a Scandinavian accent.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a coupe and garnish with a thyme sprig.
Ingredients: Krogstad aquavit;Cardamaro amaro;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Jasmine
About: This underrated gin cocktail is perfect if you’re looking for something refreshing citrusy and not too sweet. It also works well with other spirits besides gin.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake to chill. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Campari;Orange liqueur;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Mezcal Negroni
About: This underrated mezcal cocktail takes a classic Negroni and adds the smoke of mezcal.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass and fill with ice. Stir until cold and garnish with an orange half-wheel.
Ingredients: Mezcal;Campari;Sweet vermouth

Name: Ressikan Flute
About: This pear brandy cocktail is a nod to the Star Trek episode “The Inner Light.” In it Captain Picard loses consciousness for 20 short minutes but winds up experiencing decades of a double life in his altered state on the planet of Kataan a dying planet with water issues in the village of Ressik. In this new reality he’s known as a flute-playing family man named Kamin.
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients in a coupe and serve.
Ingredients: St. George pear brandy;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Mas Peyre Le Démon de Midi Rancio Sec (or similar rancio sec);Champagne

Name: Where No Man Has Gone Before
About: This Star Trek–inspired brandy cocktail uses a bunch of ingredients that might make a cocktail aficionado turn up a nose. And honestly this recipe from Paul Gustings of Broussard’s  in New Orleans might be a joke. (It wasn’t exactly delicious when we tested it.)
HowToMake: Prepare the instant vanilla pudding and combine all of the ingredients with the pudding minus the water in a mug. Add the hot water stir until the instant pudding is dissolved and serve warm.
Ingredients: Brandy;Dekuyper Pucker sour apple schnapps;Fireball cinnamon whiskey;Instant vanilla pudding;Hot water

Name: Stovokor
About: Bartender Alexandra Kuechler-Caffal is pretty devoted to her love of all-things Trekkie. She created this Star Trek–inspired rum cocktail to show her intergalactic love.
HowToMake: Stir all of the ingredients and serve in a chilled coupe. Garnish with a port-soaked prune.
Ingredients: Appleton Estate rum;Cocchi barolo chinato;Pierre Ferrand curaçao;port-soaked prune for garnish

Name: Captain’s Holiday
About: It’s a seriously stressful job to sit in the captain’s chair (and wear those tight pants too) on Star Trek’s Enterprise—be it Pike Kirk Picard Sisco Janeway Archer or any of the others who’ve helmed that position briefly or not. So here’s a much-deserved absinthe and Chartreuse sipper for an otherworldly vacation from the deck.
HowToMake: Blend the absinthe Chartreuse juices Bénédictine and Angostura in a blender with ice on high for 7 seconds or until slushy. Add 4 dashes of Peychaud's bitters and swirl with a straw until pretty. Garnish with a paper umbrella.
Ingredients: Pernod absinthe;Yellow Chartreuse;Pineapple juice;Lime juice;Bénédictine liqueur;Peychaud’s bitters

Name: Prime Directive
About: It’s the guiding principle for all members of Star Trek’s Starfleet: Don’t mess with other civilizations and sully up their worlds. Which is a pretty good rule to follow for drinks too. Keep things light and herby with this gin cocktail.
HowToMake: Stir all of the ingredients and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Plymouth gin;Bianco vermouth;Bénédictine liqueur

Name: Guinan’s Negroni
About: As El-Aurians Star Trek: The Next Generation’s Guinan and her people are known for their talent as great listeners—just like those people who make nice things for you behind the stick. Inspired by that notion is this sprightly Negroni riff.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a mixing glass along with 1 2-inch-by-1-inch piece of lemon peel and stir over ice. Serve over a large piece of ice in a double rocks glass. If you want an extra spacey touch garnish with 3 cornflowers express with an additional lemon peel and serve.
Ingredients: Brennivin aquavit;Montenegro amaro;Dolin dry vermouth;Bittermens Orchard Street celery shrub;Lemon

Name: Pearl Harbo
About: This melon pineapple inspired drink is easy to make for those warm Summer days.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with Maraschino cherry and pineapple slice.
Ingredients: Vodka;Melon liqueur;Pineapple juice

Name: Ghost Captain
About: This cocktail is inspired by the classic Jack Rose cocktail (apple brandy lime grenadine) and uses Amaro di Angostura instead of brandy. The bracing drink named for a character in pirate legends (Angostura is from Trinidad hence the name) is all about the balance of the spice and bitterness of amaro vibrant lime and the sweet-tart grenadine.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice shake vigorously and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lime wedge and serve.
Ingredients: Amaro di Angostura;Lime juice;Grenadine

Name: Suzie Americano
About: For this white version of the classic Americano bartender Tristan Willey mixes Suze a gentian-based herbal apéritif from Switzerland with Carpano Bianco a lightly sweet round white Italian vermouth. The resulting drink is fragrant and low-alcohol perfect for day drinking.
HowToMake: Add the Suze and Carpano Bianco to a Collins glass filled with ice and stir. Top with soda water and garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Suze;Carpano Bianco;Club soda to top

Name: Ranye West
About: For this slightly bitter and super refreshing drink bartender Jeff Steiner uses Rainier beer (named for Seattle’s Mt. Rainier) which is a lager-style brew but feel free to swap it out for your favorite lager.
HowToMake: Fill a wine glass with ice add all of the ingredients and stir. Garnish with a lemon peel and serve.
Ingredients: Rainier beer or other lager;Aperol;Lemon juice

Name: Ruby
About: “The Ruby is a fruit-centric drink” says bartender Tony Abou-Ganim. “I use a vodka with a good structure rich mouthfeel and diverse fruit flavors. A potato-based vodka is ideal to help soften and moderate the drink’s bitter and floral elements.”
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a mixing glass and shake with ice until well-mixed and the egg white is emulsified. Strain into a chilled coupe and garnish with the oils of a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Vodka;Aperol;St-Germain elderflower liqueur;Freshly squeezed ruby red grapefruit juice;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Egg white

Name: Caesar
About: The Canadian answer to the Bloody Mary this vodka cocktail originally hails from the Calgary Inn where it may be the only cocktail recipe inspired by a pasta dish.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a mixing glass add ice and roll the contents between mixing glass and a shaker tin until well-blended. Rim the lip of a double Old Fashioned glass with lime and dip it into a mixture of the pepper and salt. Strain into a prepared ice-filled double Old Fashioned glass and garnish with a carrot sliced lengthwise.
Ingredients: Vodka;Freshly squeezed lime juice;Tabasco sauce;Worcestershire sauce;Kosher salt;Coarsely ground black pepper;Tomato juice;Clam juice

Name: Caipiroska
About: Similar to Brazil’s famed Caipirinha but made with vodka in place of cachaça this fresh citrusy drink matches best with “a clean neutral vodka with fruity floral notes—something made from corn wheat or mixed grain something gentle” according to bartender Tony Abou-Ganim.
HowToMake: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with cracked ice to chill. In a mixing glass add the simple syrup (or sugar) and lime quarters. Muddle to extract the juice without forcing the rind from the lime. Dump the ice from the glass into the mixing glass add the vodka and shake. Pour the entire drink with the ice into the chilled glass and garnish with 4 lime quarters.
Ingredients: Vodka;Simple syrup (or 1 tbsp granulated white sugar);Lime cut in quarters

Name: Cocoa À Trois
About: This dessert-y sipper in bartender Tony Abou-Ganim’s “Vodka Distilled” has rich chocolaty underpinnings so “the drink will pair best with a New-World corn-based or wheat-based vodka rich in vanilla or cocoa elements” according to Abou-Ganim.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a mixing glass and shake vigorously until blended (long enough to dissolve the cocoa powder). Strain into a chilled Nick &  Nora glass and dust with the grated chocolate.
Ingredients: Vodka;Godiva chocolate liqueur;Simple syrup;Sweetened cocoa powder;Egg white

Name: Vodka Soda
About: This super easy vodka cocktail is popular with those trying to cut calories.
HowToMake: In a Collins glass add the vodka fill with ice top with the club soda and add a squeeze of lemon. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Vodka;Club soda to top;Lemon

Name: Lillet on the Rocks
About: Every home bar should have a bottle of Lillet Blanc. And a glass of Lillet on the rocks makes for a perfect afternoon.
HowToMake: In a rocks glass add the Lillet Blanc and fill with ice. Garnish with a speared orange peel.
Ingredients: Lillet Blanc

Name: Beermosa
About: This version of a Brass Monkey made famous by the Beastie Boys uses a chilled glass and cold beer instead of a warm 40-ounce bottle.
HowToMake: Fill a chilled beer glass with the lager and top with the orange juice. Garnish with an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Light lager;Fresh orange juice

Name: Vodka Tonic
About: This classic vodka cocktail couldn’t be easier to make.
HowToMake: In a Collins glass add the vodka fill with ice top with the tonic water and add a squeeze of lemon. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Vodka;Tonic water to top;Squeeze Lemon

Name: 50/50 Martini
About: This cocktail is made with equal proportions of spirit and vermouth. Some swear by gin in their 50/50s but it’s great with vodka because it doesn’t compete with the subtle aromatics of the vermouth.
HowToMake: Stir the vodka and vermouth in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Vodka;La Quintinye Vermouth Royal Blanc

Name: Pickled-Tomato Blue-Cheese Martini
About: A Blue-Cheese–Olive Martini is a steakhouse classic that’s arguably more appetizer than cocktail. This modification uses pickled green tomatoes and Atsby Amberthorn
HowToMake: Stir the vodka and vermouth with ice and strain into a picnic glass. Slice the Martini pickle lengthwise stuff with the blue cheese skewer the pickles with a toothpick and balance on the rim of the glass.
Ingredients: Vodka;Atsby Amberthorn vermouth;Rogue Creamery Caveman blue cheese for garnish

Name: Prince Edward Martini
About: This Vodka Martini is a variation typically made with gin and Atholl Brose a Speyside single-malt scotch
HowToMake: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Vodka;Drambuie

Name: Summer Bumme
About: Moscow’s Delicatessen led by Vyacheslav Lankin turns out old classics with new twists and brings surprising new ingredients into the mix like this vodka cocktail made with beetroot shrub.
HowToMake: Combine the vodka orange juice and apple juice in a mixing tin and stir. Top with the beetroot shrub and absinthe.
Ingredients: Vodka;Orange juice;Apple juice;Beetroot shrub;Absinthe

Name: ¡A Huevo!
About: This mashup of a Michelada and Margarita is a big ¡a huevo! (or “hell yeah”). Tequila gets a sweetening assist from Bud Light Lime-A-Rita fresh lime juice pushes the acid forward and hot sauce (I’m a Valentina guy but follow your heart) leaves a gentle burn on the end.
HowToMake: Salt the rim of a rocks glass. Add the tequila and lime juice and hot sauce to a shaker with plenty of ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds. Strain into the prepared glass and top with Bud Light Lime-A-Rita.
Ingredients: Tequila;Lime juice;Hot sauce;Bud Light Lime-A-Rita;Kosher salt

Name: Bodega Dog
About: The classic cocktail of gin and grapefruit is called a Greyhound. Add a salt rim and it’s a Salty Dog. Mess it up with grapefruit beer and spicy seasoning salt and you get a Bodega Dog.
HowToMake: Rim a highball glass with the Tajín and fill with ice. Pour in the gin or vodka and top with the Schofferhofer.
Ingredients: Gin or vodka;Schofferhofer beer;Tajín Clásico seasoning

Name: Sanka Ya Dead?
About: This variation on a Guinness Punch has ice cream stepping in for condensed milk and a splash of Appleton Estate rum for extra hair on the chest. It’s dedicated to fictional Olympic bobsledder Sanka Coffie.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Serve in a chilled pilsner glass.
Ingredients: Guinness beer;Appleton Estate rum;Vanilla ice cream;Cinnamon;Allspice

Name: High School Friends
About: This drink a tart and boozy riff on a Whiskey Sour. The sweet-sourness of Mike’s Hard Lemonade plus the alcoholic bite of Jim Beam bourbon is heaven in a cup.
HowToMake: Fill a Julep cup with crushed ice add the bourbon and stir for 30 seconds. Add the Mike’s Hard Lemonade and top off with more crushed ice.
Ingredients: Jim Beam bourbon;Mike’s Hard Lemonade

Name: Big Red
About: The snap of ginger the smoke of scotch
HowToMake: Pour all of the ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice.
Ingredients: Johnnie Walker Red Label Scotch whiskey;Budweiser;Ginger beer

Name: Vladimiry
About: If you’re getting tired of the same old Bloody Mary recipe it’s time to meet her distant cousin from the East the Vladimiry.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into a highball glass over ice and stir lightly. Garnish with a pickle spear and 2 sprigs of dill.
Ingredients: Vodka;Carrot juice;Fresh lemon juice;Celery salt;Black pepper;Caraway seeds;Horseradish;Shallot roughly chopped

Name: Joan Collins
About: This drink is delicately pink and 100 percent spa day which is exactly how I imagine the life and times of Joan Collins.
HowToMake: In a cocktail shaker muddle the lime cucumber and mint. Add the syrup and vodka with plenty of ice and shake until chilled. Strain over ice into a Collins glass and top with soda water. Serve with a cucumber wheel for garnish. *Honey-hibiscus syrup: Bring 1/2 cup of honey and 1/2 cup of water to simmer stirring to incorporate. Remove from heat add 1 hibiscus tea bag and let cool. Remove the tea bag and store in the refrigerator for up to a month.
Ingredients: Lime sliced;Cucumber;Mint leaves;Vodka;Soda water;Honey-hibiscus syrup

Name: Summer Fridays
About: The coconut key lime and cilantro in this vodka cocktail can immediately send you somewhere warm and sunny with sparkling waters.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with 2 sprigs of cilantro.
Ingredients: Vodka;Coconut milk;Simple syrup;Key lime juice

Name: How to Make Real Alcoholic Butterbeer from 'Harry Potter
About: No need for a trip to Three Broomsticks! Harry Potter’s favorite boozy beverage is easy to make at home. Grown-up wizards and adult muggles can make this famously boozy Diagon Alley treat right in their own cauldron. (No spells required.)
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into frosty mug. Top with a generous dollop of whipped cream and butterscotch syrup drizzled on top or top with butterscotch whipped cream. *Butterscotch whipped cream: In a mixing bowl combine 1/4 cup heavy whipping cream and 1 oz butterscotch sundae topping. Using a hand mixer whip until soft peaks form.
Ingredients: Butterscotch schnapps;Vanilla vodka;Cream soda

Name: Bacardi 8 Años Old Fashioned
About: Created in New York in the early 1900s the iconic Old Fashioned is deemed “the original cocktail.” But even the most established classics can do with a refresh every now and then. Try it with Bacardí 8 Años rum instead of whiskey and call yourself a visionary.
HowToMake: Add the sugar water and bitters with a barspoon into an Old Fashioned glass. Add half of the rum and 2-3 large ice cubes stirring repeatedly. Pour in the second half of the rum and 2-3 more ice cubes continuing to stir. Express the oil of an orange peel over the drink and drop in the peel.
Ingredients: Bacardí 8 Años rum;Sugar;Angostura bitters;Water

Name: Traditional Old Fashioned
