About: So popular they named a glass after it this whiskey cocktail is a classic go-to.
HowToMake: Fill a mixing glass with ice and add all of the ingredients. Stir until chilled and diluted and strain into an Old Fashioned glass with fresh ice. Garnish with an expressed orange peel and 2 cherries.
Ingredients: Templeton rye whiskey;Demerara syrup;Angostura aromatic bitters

Name: Templeton Manhattan
About: This cocktail is the ultimate three-ingredient classic.
HowToMake: Fill a cocktail shaker half full with ice add all of the ingredients and stir until well chilled and diluted. Garnish with a cherry. Serve in a coupe.
Ingredients: Templeton rye whiskey;Carpano Antica Formula;Angostura aromatic bitters

Name: Iowa Buck
About: This version of a Buck or cocktail using ginger beer uses rye whiskey.
HowToMake: Fill a Tom Collins glass with ice add the whiskey top with ginger beer and add a squeeze lime. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Templeton rye whiskey;Ginger beer

Name: Templeton Boulevardier
About: This classic three-ingredient cocktail is the rye whiskey version of a Negroni.
HowToMake: Fill a mixing glass with ice add all of the ingredients and stir until diluted and chilled for about 30 stirs. Strain and serve up or on the rocks in an Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with an expressed orange peel.
Ingredients: Templeton rye whiskey;Carpano Antica Formula;Campari

Name: Pepin
About: This rum cocktail by Emil Åreng of Umeå Sweden’s Open/Closed was created for the Bacardi Legacy competition.
HowToMake: Shake all of the ingredients strain and top with the corn foam. *Corn foam: Make 8 cups of simple syrup add two pre-boiled corn cobs and let it rest at medium heat for about 1 hour. Strain and add two leaves of gelatin. Pour into a cream siphon and add 2 cream chargers. Let it sit in the fridge for 1 hour.
Ingredients: Bacardi Gold;Maple syrup;Lime juice;Topper of corn foam;Ear of microplaned dried sweetened corn for garnish

Name: Mamie Taylor
About: Use a blended scotch that’s not too mild such as Compass Box Great King Street or The Famous Grouse Smoky Black in this cocktail from Whiskey: A Spirited Story with 75 Classic & Original Cocktails
HowToMake: Add the scotch and lime juice to a highball glass full of ice top with the ginger ale and stir briefly. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Blended scotch (Compass Box Great King Street or The Famous Grouse Smoky Black);Lime juice;Spicy ginger ale or ginger beer as a topper

Name: Monte Carlo
About: Enjoy this variation on the classic Manhattan from “Whiskey: A Spirited Story with 75 Classic & Original Cocktails.”
HowToMake: Add all ingredients in a mixing glass filled 2/3 with ice and stir for about 30 seconds until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled rocks glass.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey;Bénédictine

Name: Toronto
About: In this cocktail from Whiskey: A Spirited Story with 75 Classic & Original Cocktails
HowToMake: Fill a mixing glass 2/3 full of ice and add the rye Fernet-Branca simple syrup and bitters. Stir for 15 seconds until chilled and diluted strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Canadian rye whiskey (Alberta Dark Batch);Fernet-Branca;Simple syrup

Name: Godfather
About: This 1970s-era drink named for the popular film “The Godfather” is often made with equal parts but this version from “Whiskey: A Spirited Story with 75 Classic & Original Cocktails” dials down the sweetness.
HowToMake: Fill a mixing glass 2/3 full of ice add the ingredients and stir until chilled. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass.
Ingredients: Blended scotch or bourbon;Amaretto

Name: Godfather
About: This 1970s-era drink named for the popular film “The Godfather” is often made with equal parts but this version from “Whiskey: A Spirited Story with 75 Classic & Original Cocktails” dials down the sweetness.
HowToMake: Fill a mixing glass 2/3 full of ice add the ingredients and stir until chilled. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass.
Ingredients: Blended scotch or bourbon;Amaretto

Name: Hwayo Negroni
About: This riff on the Negroni is made with jasmine-infused soju Korea’s white spirit usually distilled from rice or sweet potatoes.
HowToMake: Stir all ingredients with ice strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice and garnish with an orange peel. *Jasmine Hwayo: Pour 1 cup of hot water over 8 grams of jasmine tea leaves. After five minutes discard the tea reserving the “washed” tea leaves. Steep the tea leaves in 1 cup of Hwayo Soju 41 for 25 minutes fine-strain and discard the leaves. Strain a second time through cheesecloth to catch any remaining particles. Makes enough jasmine-infused soju for several drinks.
Ingredients: Jasmine Hwayo;Sweet vermouth;Campari;Aperol;Fee Brothers West Indian orange bitters

Name: Demi Peche
About: This take on a Shandy is the French version of the classic Radler.
HowToMake: Combine the beer and syrup in a pilsner glass. *Demi peche syrup: Peel pit and slice 4 ripe peaches and lightly salt with a pinch of kosher salt. Heat in a saucepan over medium high heat allowing peaches to lightly caramelize. Add 2 cups refined sugar and 2 cups water and stir. Bring to a simmer stirring frequently for 2 minutes remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Strain (preferably through a cheesecloth) and refrigerate.
Ingredients: Wheat beer or lager;Demi Peche syrup

Name: The Professor
About: This Shandy served at San Francisco’s  Homeroom is ideal for those completely green to mixing cocktails who want something light for summer.
HowToMake: Combine the kölsch and limeade in a Mason jar and enjoy.
Ingredients: Fort Point kölsch ale;Limeade

Name: Stone’s Shandy
About: Ruby-red-grapefruit-infused vodka makes this Shandy served at Stone’s Throw in Houston a spirit-driven delight while the peach bitters add a soothing dose of juiciness to round out the drink’s flavor profile.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the ale into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a pint glass. Top with the ale. Garnish with a speared lemon twist. *Ruby-red-grapefruit-infused vodka: Add 1 L vodka and 1 peeled grapefruit into a large container seal with a lid or stopper and let stand for 3-4 days then strain out solids.
Ingredients: Ruby-red-infused vodka;Fresh lemon juice;Peach bitters;Pale ale to top

Name: Coppa Shandy
About: This version of a Shandy served at Boston’s Coppa
HowToMake: Combine all of the ingredients except for the beer in a mixing glass and stir. Strain over fresh ice in a tall beer mug (or pilsner glass) and top with beer.
Ingredients: Yellow Chartreuse;Green Chartreuse;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Lager to top

Name: Crimson King
About: This drink takes the subtle flavors in a Boulevardier and adds dark cherry and bitter roasted coffee liqueur. Spicy Rittenhouse rye and Campari bring balance for a deep and complex cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all of ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a Nick & Nora glass or serve in a rocks glass with a large hunk of ice. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Rittenhouse rye;Campari;Punt e Mes;Cherry Heering;St. George NOLA coffee liqueur

Name: Zombie
About: This tropical drink by legendary Donn Beach of Don the Beachcomber restaurant kicked off the Tiki craze.
HowToMake: Put all of the ingredients in blender adding 6 oz of crushed ice last. Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds. Pour into a glass add ice cubes to fill then add the garnish. *Donn’s mix: Bring 3 crushed cinnamon sticks 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a boil stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Simmer for 2 minutes then remove from the heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle. Then add 1 part of the syrup and 2 parts of fresh grapefruit juice together.
Ingredients: Jamaican rum;Gold Puerto Rican rum;151-proof demerara rum;Herbsaint or Pernod;Falernum;Donn’s mix;Grenadine;Fresh lime juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Three Dots & a Dash
About: This Tiki drink is what an exotic cocktail is all about with citrus sweeteners spice and of course rums.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a drink mixer tin. Fill with 12 oz of crushed ice and 4 to 6 small “agitator” cubes. Flash-blend then open pour with gated finish into a footed pilsner glass and add the garnish.
Ingredients: AOC Martinique rhum agricole vieux;Blended aged rum;John D. Taylor’s Velvet falernum;St. Elizabeth allspice dram;Fresh lime juice;Fresh orange juice;Honey syrup;Angostura bitters;3 maraschino cherries on a cocktail pick and 1 pineapple frond (representing Morse Code—three cherries as the three dots and the frond as the dash) for garnish

Name: Shandy Maker
About: This beer cocktail adds a hoppy IPA to 100-proof bourbon some citrus and the kicker: muddled fresh marjoram resulting in a variety of summery flavors that blend together nicely.
HowToMake: Dry-muddle the marjoram. Add all of the other ingredients except the beer and give it a quick stir. Strain into a pint glass and add ice. Top with the beer and garnish with the grapefruit peel.
Ingredients: Old Forester 100-proof bourbon;Grapefruit juice;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA;Fresh marjoram

Name: Crownberry Apple
About: This whisky cocktail is pretty simple—sort of like an alcoholic version of Ocean Spray Cran-Apple.
HowToMake: Add the whisky to a rocks glass over ice. Top with cranberry juice and stir. Garnish with an apple wheel.
Ingredients: Crown Royal Regal Apple whisky;Cranberry juice

Name: Harper’s Bet
About: This citrus-infused cocktail takes the idea of a Manhattan and builds upon the classic. Grenadine citrus and orange bitters combine with bourbon for a slightly sweet slightly sour concoction.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a shaker and strain over ice in an Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: I.W. Harper Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey;Grenadine;Lemon juice;Grapefruit juice;Orange bitters

Name: Keeneland Breeze
About: Bourbon and orange don’t usually go together unless it’s a slice dropped into an Old Fashioned but this cocktail adds a splash of orange liqueur to bourbon and tops it off with ginger ale to counter the sweetness.
HowToMake: Fill rocks glass with ice. Add the bourbon orange curaçao liqueur and a squeeze of fresh orange and stir. Top off with ginger ale and garnish with an orange wedge.
Ingredients: Maker’s Mark bourbon;DeKuyper orange curaçao liqueur;Ginger ale

Name: Northern Harvest Buck
About: This take on the Whiskey Ginger (a.k.a the Irish Buck) adds a squeeze of lime and some bitters which complement the slightly spicy but smooth Crown Royal Northern Harvest rye.
HowToMake: Add the rye and lime juice into a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Add the bitters and top with the ginger beer. Garnish with a lemon wheel and mint sprig.
Ingredients: Crown Royal Northern Harvest rye;Fresh lime juice;Ginger beer;Angostura bitters

Name: Emerald
About: You could say this is the Irish version of a Manhattan.
HowToMake: Stir the whiskey vermouth and bitters with cracked ice for 30 seconds then strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Irish whiskey;Sweet Italian vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Corpse Reviver 21
About: Presented by Chivas Ben Rojo is this year’s Chivas Masters Champion.
HowToMake: Combine Chivas Regal 12 Year Old coconut water cold brew coffee and palm sugar syrup in a mixing glass. Separately use a hand blender or dry shake to lightly whip and combine heavy cream and vanilla salt then set aside. Add ice to mixing glass stir gently to chill and lightly dilute then pour contents into a chilled pousse-café glass. Using the back of a bar spoon float the vanilla salted cream over the top of the drink then garnish with additional vanilla salt.
Ingredients: Chivas Regal 12 Year Old;Coconut water;Cold brew coffee;Palm Sugar Syrup;Heavy cream;Vanilla Salt

Name: Rampart Ramble
About: This cocktail was created by Steven Lucas at Raised for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Cut off one third of the vanilla bean (reserve the rest for another use) scrape the seeds into a mixing glass and add the remaining ingredients. Fill with ice and stir. Strain into a coupe and garnish with an orange peel and the spent vanilla bean fragment.
Ingredients: Vanilla bean;Hennessy VSOP cognac;High West Double rye whiskey;Carpano Antica;Bénédectine;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Peychaud's bitters;Bittermens Elemakule Tiki bitters

Name: Zen Café Race
About: This cocktail was created by Nahm Kim at Sunda for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a snifter glass. To garnish twist an orange peel over the surface of the glass to express its oils then discard. Float the star anise in the glass.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Breckenridge bitters liqueur;Nectarine–bay-leaf syrup;Peychaud's bitters

Name: Vieux Carr
About: This cocktail was created by Dustin Drankiewicz at Moneygun for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a bucket glass with 1 fresh ice cube. Garnish by twisting a lemon peel over the surface of the drink to express its oils then drop the peel into the glass.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Rye Whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Bénédictine;Peychaud's bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: The Classi
About: This cocktail was created by Colleen Healy at Pops for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Place the sugar cube in a chilled coupe glass and saturate with the bitters. Add the cognac to the glass and top with the Champagne. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Sugar cube;Angostura bitters;Hennessy VSOP cognac;Brut Champagne

Name: French 7
About: This cocktail was created by Dustin Drankiewicz at Promontory for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add the cognac lemon juice and sugar to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a flute and top with the Champagne. Garnish by twisting the lemon over the surface of the drink to express its oils then drop the peel into the drink.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Lemon juice;Sugar;Moët & Chandon Champagne

Name: La Grande Dam
About: This cocktail was created by Patrick Henaghan at Roka Akor for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add the mint leaves lemon juice syrup and bitters to a shaking tin and muddle. Add the cognac and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass. Fill with crushed ice and top with Champagne. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Mint leaves;Lemon juice;Black-tea–demerara syrup;Miracle Mile yuzu bitters;Hennessy VSOP cognac;Moët & Chandon Imperial Champagne

Name: Démod
About: This cocktail was created by Angie O’Neil at Binny’s for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass with 1 fresh ice cube. Garnish with the orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy Privilège VSOP cognac;Jo Snow tangerine lavender honey syrup;Angostura bitters;Fee Brothers orange bitters

Name: The Japanes
About: This cocktail was created by Jon Harris at Virgin for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Sesame orgeat;Dr. Adam Elmegirab’s Teapot bitters

Name: Sidecar #
About: This cocktail was created by James Urycki at Langham for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Rim a chilled coupe with sugar. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Flame the orange disc over the surface of the drink then drop into the glass.
Ingredients: Superfine sugar;Hennessy VSOP cognac;Lemon juice;Tobacco curaçao

About: This cocktail was created by Michael Page at Acanto for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a snifter and garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Lemon juice;Pineapple syrup;Walnut orgeat

Name: Mind Eraser
About: The cares of the day just simply disappear. It might just be your new favorite nightcap.
HowToMake: Add the coffee liqueur and vodka into a rocks glass over ice. Top with the club soda. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Vodka;Coffee liqueur;Club soda to top

Name: Sangria
About: This fruity drink from Spain has many variations but sometimes tradition is the way to go.
HowToMake: In a large pitcher add the sugar oranges apples and lemon and muddle for 30 seconds. Add the brandy and orange juice and muddle again for 30 seconds. Add the red wine stir add ice and serve in a red wine glass.
Ingredients: Dry red wine like Rioja;Brandy;Orange juice;Sugar;Orange cut into wedges;Apple cored and diced;Lemon cut into wedges

Name: Santa Marea
About: This cocktail served at Barcelona gin joint Bobby Gin is perfect for day drinking.
HowToMake: Shake all ingredients with ice strain and serve neat in a double rocks glass. Garnish with a mounted lemon peel.
Ingredients: Farigoule thyme liqueur;Aromatic wine syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Celery bitters

Name: Delorean
About: This cocktail is the gin-based day-drinking sipper of choice at Barcelona’s Polaroid Bar.
HowToMake: Shake all ingredients with ice strain and serve in double rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with 2 bendy straws.
Ingredients: Gin;Blue curaçao;Lime juice;White sugar

Name: Ginger Gin Fizz
About: This brunch cocktail served at Barcelona’s popular Xixbar is ideal for an early-morning pick-me-up.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a highball glass over 2 ice cubes.  Fill with the club soda. Garnish with an orange peel. Serve with 2 bendy straws.
Ingredients: Ginger-infused gin;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Egg white;Ginger bitters;Club soda to fill

Name: Salty Dog
About: This classic cooler can be made with vodka or gin and is perfect for a warm sunny day.
HowToMake: Rim a highball glass with salt. Shake the vodka (or gin) and grapefruit juice pour over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with a grapefruit slice.
Ingredients: Vodka or gin;Grapefruit juice;Coarse sea salt

Name: Lucy Colada
About: Making your own cannabis-infused liquor that’ll give you a buzz in two ways isn’t as hard as you think. After decarbing your cannabis and infusing your spirit you can then use that liquor to make this rum and coconut milk cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the rum cannabis-infused coconut milk pineapple and lemon juice into a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and serve.
Ingredients: White or gold rum;Cannabis-infused coconut milk;Pineapple juice;Lemon juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Chill Wave
About: Making your own cannabis-infused liquor that’ll give you a buzz in two ways isn’t as hard as you think. After decarbing your cannabis and infusing your spirit you can then use that liquor to make this mezcal cocktail.
HowToMake: Rim a rocks glass with lime juice and press into a plate of tajín spice.  Set aside. Add the cannabis-infused mezcal lime juice and agave into a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into the tajín-rimmed rocks glass with fresh ice. Add drops of the bitters and serve in a rocks glass.
Ingredients: Cannabis-infused mezcal;Lime juice;Agave nectar;Mole bitters
Garnish: Lime wheel and tajín spice rim

Name: VSO Peac
About: This cocktail was created by Jeff Bell at PDT for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe. Top with the Champagne and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège cognac;Blandy's Sercial Madeira;Lemon juice;Rare Tea Cellar Champagne Peach Shrubbery;Simple syrup;G.H. Mumm Champagne brut

Name: The Midnight Ride
About: This cocktail was created by Jimmy Palumbo at Belle Shoals for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir then strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a brandied cherry.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Tawny port;Noilly Prat dry vermouth;Crème de cacao;Bittermens orange cream citrate

Name: Ginger Shandy
About: Most popular in western Europe especially Germany this two-ingredient beer cocktail is easy to make and refreshing.
HowToMake: In a pint glass combine the lager and ginger ale (or ginger beer).
Ingredients: Lager;Ginger ale (or ginger beer)

Name: Lemon Shandy
About: Most popular in western Europe especially Germany this two-ingredient beer cocktail is easy to make and refreshing.
HowToMake: In a pint glass combine the lager and Sprite (or 7Up).
Ingredients: Lager;Sprite (or 7Up)

Name: Kalimotxo
About: This simple drink sometimes spelled calimotxo or calimocho is wildly popular in the Basque Country.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a red wine glass with ice. Garnish with a lemon slice.
Ingredients: Rioja wine;Coca-Cola;Lemon

Name: G.C.S.
About: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness and the shrub makes a fantastic mixer in this gin and Campari cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the gin Campari maple beet shrub and ice to a cocktail shaker and shake well. Strain into a rocks glass or coupé if you're feeling fancy.
Ingredients: Gin;Campari;Maple beet shrub

Name: Shrub Julep
About: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness and the shrub makes a fantastic mixer in this riff on a Mint Julep.
HowToMake: Muddle the mint sprig in a Julep tin (or rocks glass). Add the maple beet shrub bourbon and a small scoop of crushed ice and stir. Top with more crushed ice to fill the glass. Garnish with a mint sprig. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Mint;Maple beet shrub;Bourbon

Name: Shrubarita
About: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness and the shrub makes a fantastic mixer in this riff on a Margarita.
HowToMake: Add the mezcal maple beet shrub lime juice and ice to a cocktail shaker and shake well. On one plate pour the maple syrup. On another plate mix the salt and pepper. Dip the rocks glass in the maple syrup and gently shake to remove excess before dipping into the salt and pepper mixture. Strain the drink into the prepared glass and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Mezcal;Maple beet shrub;Lime juice plus lime wheel for garnish;Maple syrup;Kosher salt;Freshly cracked pepper

Name: Maple Beet Shrub Recip
About: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. From there your imagination can run wild. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness. Once your shrub is ready (the longer you let it sit the better) it’s a fantastic mixer in a variety of cocktails including these three favorites: the Shrub Julep the Shrubarita and the G.C.S.
HowToMake: Peel the beets - cut each into eight wedges and add to a 1-quart jar along with the ginger mustard seeds and bay leaf. In a saucepan combine the vinegar maple syrup and salt with 1 cup of water. Stir to combine and bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour enough liquid into the prepared jar to cover the beets and let cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for at least 12 hours and up to 2 weeks shaking the jar every few days to distribute the flavors. Makes 1 quart.
Ingredients: Medium beets;1-inch piece of ginger peeled and thinly sliced;Mustard seeds;Bay leaf;Apple cider vinegar;Maple syrup;Kosher salt

Name: Hennessy Sazera
About: This cocktail was created by Frank Torres at Del Frisco’s Double Eagle Steakhouse for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled Martini glass with absinthe discarding any excess and set aside. Add the cognac simple syrup and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with the lemon peel.
Ingredients: Pernod absinthe;Hennessy Privilège VSOP cognac;Simple syrup;Peychaud's bitters

Name: Hennessy Crust
About: This cocktail was created by Nazarene Garcia at Hudson Bar & Books for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled snifter glass with the whisky discarding any excess and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass over fresh cracked ice. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Bowmore 12 single-malt whisky;Hennessy VSOP cognac;Bénédictine;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Regan’s Orange bitters

Name: Golden Sazera
About: This cocktail was created by Giuseppe González at Suffolk Arms for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe discarding any excess and set aside. Add the cognac bitters and syrup to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish by twisting the lemon peel over the surface of the drink to express its oils then discard.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Hennessy VSOP cognac;Peychaud's bitters;Lyle's Golden syrup

Name: Japanese Harvard Fiz
About: This cocktail was created by Kenta Goto at Bar Goto for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add the cognac plum wine and bitters to a highball glass. Fill with ice and top with the soda. Stir gently to combine.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Plum wine;Fee Brothers plum bitters;Club soda

Name: Napoleon Jule
About: This cocktail was created by Nicholas Bennett at Porchlight for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a Julep cup or double Old Fashioned glass. Fill halfway with crushed or pebble ice then swizzle to chill. Pack the glass with more ice forming a mound at the top. Garnish with the mint and finely grated lemon zest over the surface of the drink.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;St-Germain;Green tea syrup;Bittermens Xocolatl Mole bitters

Name: Monkey Hear
About: This cocktail was created by Scott Kennedy at Distilled for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled coupe with absinthe discarding any excess and set aside. Add the cognac grenadine and orange juice to a shaking tin. Fill with ice and shake well to chill. Double-strain into the prepared coupe and garnish with the orange peel.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Grenadine;Orange juice

Name: Hell’s Potio
About: This cocktail was created by Sarah Smith at Putnam’s Pub for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Rinse an Old Fashioned glass with the Chartreuse discarding any excess and set aside. Add the cognac molasses syrup and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the prepared glass. Flame the lemon peel over the surface of the drink then drop into the glass.
Ingredients: Chartreuse;Hennessy VSOP cognac;Molasses syrup;Bittermens Hellfire Habanero shrub

Name: Corn ’n’ Oil
About: This traditional drink from Barbados uses dark oil-like blackstrap rum.
HowToMake: Combine rum falernum and lime juice in a rocks glass. Top with crushed or cracked ice. Add the bitters and stir ingredients until well chilled. The glass should be frosty. Top with bitters and serve with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Black strap or aged Barbados rum;Falernum;Fresh lime juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Matcha-Sesame Punch
About: By adding a jolt of sesame to this milk punch with matcha the cocktail becomes fuller and rounder a harmony of fresh green and deep nutty flavors. Just as sesame successfully amplifies food it provides another subtle layer to drinks.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a shaker tin and dry shake to aerate. Shake with ice and fine-strain into a teacup.
Ingredients: Sencha-tea-infused vodka;Sesame-infused vodka;Cane syrup;Half-and-half;Matcha powder

Name: Gentleman Jack Whiskey Slin
About: Whiskey SlingClassic Drink. Modern Taste.When a drinker from long ago found his spirit to be a bit lacking in flavor eggs and sugar were mixed in and the result was the “Flip” cocktail. Another fellow solved the same problem by adding baking spices. Creating the “Toddy.”  But eventually someone was lucky enough to come across an exceptional whiskey and the subtle understated “Whiskey Sling” was born. It’s a cocktail crafted to highlight a spirit’s taste. Like the crisp balanced flavor of Gentleman Jack. Twice mellowed for exceptional smoothness. It’s just the whiskey the Sling was made for.
HowToMake: Shake all ingredients with ice. Then strain into an ice-filled glass.
Ingredients: Gentleman Jack;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Orange bitters

Name: Goldeney
About: This cocktail was created by Ray Quinones at 48 Lounge for Cognac Classics Week presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.
HowToMake: Add the cognac honey-ginger syrup lemon juice and bitters to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice. Top with the whisky and garnish with the piece of candied ginger on a skewer.
Ingredients: Hennessy VSOP cognac;Ginger-honey syrup;Lemon juice;Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel-Aged bitters;Ardbeg Ten Years Old single-malt Scotch whisky

Name: Penicillin Cocktai
About: This classic has ginger spice and everything nice.
HowToMake: Add the blended scotch juice and syrup into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Top with the single-malt scotch. Garnish with a piece of candied ginger. *Honey-ginger syrup: Combine 1 cup honey 1 6-inch piece of peeled and thinly sliced ginger and 1 cup water in a saucepan over high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 5 minutes. Place in the refrigerator to steep overnight. Strain with a cheesecloth. .
Ingredients: Blended scotch;Fresh lemon juice;Honey-ginger syrup;Islay single-malt scotch

Name: Snap Chat & Rum Cocktai
About: Did you know that sugar snap peas belong in your cocktails? Here’s a cocktail for your arsenal. It seems like a simple Daiquiri but adds fennel bulb and pressed snap peas to take it to peak freshness. Those ingredients and a high-quality rum will make this one of the best Daiquiris you’ve ever had.
HowToMake: Shake and strain all ingredients into chilled coupe glass. Garnish with fennel frond.
Ingredients: Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Pressed sugar snap pea with fennel bulb

Name: Whisky in Churc
About: Though a bit rare this smoky whisky cocktail is delicious when made well.
HowToMake: Stir all ingredients together with ice. Serve over fresh ice and add a lemon twist for garnish.
Ingredients: Ardbeg 10 yr Islay Scotch;Oloroso sherry;Grade-b maple syrup;Smoked cherry bitters

Name: Pisco Sour
About: The addition of gum syrup lends silky richness to this frothy classic.
HowToMake: Combine the first five ingredients in a shaker. Dry shake for 15 seconds then add ice and shake again to chill. Double strain into a chilled coupe glass. Dot the top with drops of Angostura bitters.
Ingredients: Pisco Quebranta;Gum syrup (or simple syrup);Fresh egg white;Lime juice;Lemon juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Wagyu
About: This inventive cocktail could only come from the mind of Richard Woods at Sushisamba London where he puts a richly flavored spin on the Old Fashioned with wagyu-beef-fat–washed Japanese whisky.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker and lightly mix. Add ice and stir to chill. Strain and pour into rocks glass over fresh ice. *Wagyu-beef-fat-washed Hibiki Japanese Harmony whisky: Melt 4 1/2 oz wagyu fat in a pan. Add 1 750 mL bottle of Hibiki Japanese Harmony whisky into a container and pour fat over. Seal and gently shake to mix over the course of 30 minutes. Chill in freezer overnight. Strain liquid through a coffee filter into a bottle. Filter twice to remove any unwanted fat. **Salted caramel liqueur: Add 1 cup sugar and 1 large pinch of salt to a pan over a medium-high heat. Allow sugar to melt and caramelize. Add 2 cups vodka (or neutral spirit) and stir to mix. Return to a low heat and add 1 cup sugar while continuing to stir to dissolve any residual solids. Allow to cool and bottle.
Ingredients: Wagyu-beef-fat-washed Hibiki Japanese Harmony whisky;Maple syrup;Salted caramel liqueur

Name: The Dana Scully
About: The Dana Scully is a smoky spirit-forward sipper. Like its namesake agent the Mezcal Cynar Cointreau and raspberry liqueur creation is a striking burnt vermillion. It’s a no-nonsense recipe for a no-nonsense agent.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass over ice. Stir and strain into a coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Alipus Mezcal;Cynar;St. George Raspberry Liqueur;Cointreau;Fernet

Name: The Fox Mulder
About: This X-Files–inspired cocktail is a classic Whiskey Sour with a pineapple twist. A Green Chartreuse float gives the drink an ethereal appearance but the high-proof medicinal bite keeps it grounded.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the Green Chartreuse to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Top with a float of Green Chartreuse.
Ingredients: Rye Whiskey;Lemon juice;Pineapple juice;Simple syrup;Green Chartreuse

Name: Salty Ginger-Ade - Mocktail Recip
About: There’s a longstanding tradition of spiking citrus-y drinks with salt in Southeastern Asia as a means of battling intense heat temperatures (electrolytes and all that). In India jaljeera has a similar makeup but with the specific addition of cumin (jeera translates to cumin in Hindi). The base of the drink is usually a spice mix (cumin black salt ginger mint and fruit powder such as amchoor) sometimes with the addition of muddled dates or tamarind.We took our cues from the latter creating an inspired mocktail with what we had on hand in our pantry. The date gives the drink rich sweetness while the salt and cumin commingle to create a distinct almost shrublike effect.
HowToMake: Add the date salt cumin and lime juice to a shaker. Let sit for 5 minutes then muddle well so the date is pulverized. Add ice and shake until chilled then pour the contents of the shaker into a tall glass. Fill to the rim with ginger beer and stir well to combine. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Medjool date pitted;Fine sea salt;ground cumin;Lime juice;High quality ginger beer

Name: Puerto Vallarta
About: Tequila and verjus make fine bedfellows in this fragrant glass topped with bubbles.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients except club soda in a wine glass.  Top with soda and garnish with lemongrass and mandarin peel.
Ingredients: Tequila Don Julio Blanco;Verjus;Tonic syrup;Lime juice;Club soda

Name: Fennel 75
About: Turn the French 75 on its head by swapping in tequila fennel liqueur and honey syrup and topping with bubbles.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except sparkling wine to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a flute over ice. Top with sparkling wine and garnish with a fennel frond.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice;Raw honey syrup;Orange bitters;Sparkling wine

Name: Celery Daisy
About: Fresh celery juice adds bright earthy undertones to this tequila-based cocktail made with elderflower liqueur and Fino sherry.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube. Garnish with lime wheel and celery leaf.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Elderflower liqueur;Fino sherry;Fresh lime juice;Fresh-pressed celery juice;Raw honey syrup;Salt;Celery and orange bitters

Name: Lawless Liter
About: Meet the ensemble cast critics will cheer for featuring heavy-hitters like tequila Yellow Chartreuse and velvet falernum.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a pitcher. Briefly stir with ice strain and funnel into an empty punch bowl. Refrigerate remaining punch for later use.
Ingredients: Patrón Silver;Lime juice;Yellow Chartreuse;Agave nectar;Velvet falernum;16.5 oz Chilled water;Peychaud’s Bitters to taste

Name: Pear Brandy Sidecar
About: This simple yet delicious cocktail shows off the fruitier side of fall.
HowToMake: Rim a cocktail glass with sugar and set aside. Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into preparred glass.
Ingredients: Stone Barn Brandyworks pear brandy;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Sparkling Apple Punch
About: A smoked honey syrup and spicy bitters lend subtle heat to this tequila-based party punch that serves eight to ten people.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients except sparkling wine in a punch bowl with two cups of ice. Stir to combine and chill. Top with sparkling wine and apple slices for garnish. Add large chunks of punch ice to the bowl to keep it cold while minimizing dilution.
Ingredients: Patrón Silver;Lemon juice;Smoked honey;Grapefruit juice;Sparkling wine

Name: Sandeman Sparkler
About: Port and sparkling wine make a perfect holiday duo that’s easy as can be.
HowToMake: Add port to a Champagne flute and top with sparkling wine.
Ingredients: Sandeman Founders Reserve Porto;Sparkling wine

Name: Ciderhouse Punch
About: Entertaining a crowd? This port-based punch will happily serve a group of 20.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a punch bowl with ice and stir well. Garnish with sliced apples and lemons.
Ingredients: Sandeman Porto Founders Reserve;Apple cider;Fresh lemon juice;Ginger syrup

Name: Beelzebub
About: Mezcal lends a note of fire and brimstone to this bittersweet bourbon cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupette. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: I.W. Harper Kentucky straight bourbon;Fresh lemon juice;Orgeat;Lucano amaro;Mezcal

Name: 5 Keys
About: Earthy Cynar and Maraschino liqueur balance each other in this smooth bourbon-based coupe.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a coupette.
Ingredients: Blade & Bow Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Cynar;Maraschino cherry liqueur

Name: Blue Milk of Tatooine
About: Channel the alien planet from Star Wars with this creamy combination of gin coconut cream and blue curaçao.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a milk bottle or Collins glass.
Ingredients: Beefeater 24 gin;Coconut cream;Blue curaçao;Orgeat Syrup;Pineapple juice;Lime juice

Name: Planet Hoth Toddy
About: Recall Planet Hoth the world of snow and ice with this rum-based coupe laced with lime juice and maraschino liqueur.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and double strain into a coupe. Garnish with nutmeg.
Ingredients: Lime juice;Simple syrup;Maraschino liqueur;Egg white

Name: Jubilee
About: This festive vodka creation is cause for celebration thanks to the additions of red wine spiced pear liqueur and maple syrup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except seltzer to a glass over ice. Stir and top with seltzer. Garnish with a pear fan and grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Elit by Stolichnaya;Dry red wine;St. George Spiced Pear Liqueur;Maple syrup;Lemon juice;Seltzer

Name: Psycho Kille
About: White cacao and banana liqueur balance the dry bitter duo of cocoa nibs and Campari in this elegant Irish whiskey cocktail from The Dead Rabbit.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a Nick & Nora glass.
Ingredients: Redbreast 12-year-old Irish whiskey;Cocoa nib–infused Campari;White Cacao Marie Brizard;Giffard Banane du Brésil;Absinthe

Name: Tea & Sympathy
About: Forget the whiskey. This warming Toddy replaces the brown spirit with cachaça laced with chai and spicy ginger liqueur.
HowToMake: Soak one tea bag in a half mug of hot water for 30 seconds. Remove the tea bag add the rest of the ingredients and top with more hot water. Garnish with lemon wheel stuffed with four to five cloves and a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Chai tea;Avuá Amburana Cachaça;Freshly squeezed lemon juice
Garnish: Lemon wheel stuffed with cloves and cinnamon stick

Name: Patrinos
About: Give your winter Toddy a Greek vacation by adding tentura a Greek liqueur spiced with cinnamon nutmeg and cloves.
HowToMake: Add the tentura and coffee into a mug. Stir in the steamed milk and top with 2 tbsp of the foam. Sprinkle with ground cinnamon.
Ingredients: Tentura;Hot brewed coffee;Steamed milk with foam

Name: Thistle
About: Cardamaro’s spice and nuttiness are perfect complements to the fresh apple flavor of the Calvados and warming spice of the rye whiskey in this cold weather cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a footed rocks glass.
Ingredients: Cardamaro amaro;Calvados;Rye Whiskey;Pedro Ximénez sherry;Angostura bitters;Lemon juice

Name: More Cowbell
About: Bitter amaro bites through this otherwise “spritzy” drink made with gin Aperol and silky gum syrup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with lemon peel.
Ingredients: Sloane’s Gin;Lemon juice;Aperol;Cardamaro amaro;Gum syrup;Lemon

Name: Fall to Pieces
About: The spirit-forward nature of this cocktail makes it perfect for enjoying slowly by the fireside.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with oils expressed from an orange peel.
Ingredients: Laird’s apple brandy;Rittenhouse rye;Cocchi Vermouth de Torino;Averna amaro;Angostura bitters

Name: Stranger in the Alps
About: This riff on the Negroni features an Italian alpine amaro that adds a minty pine essence to this fall cocktail.
HowToMake: Rinse a rocks glass with Douglas Fir brandy. Combine remaining ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and strain over fresh ice into the rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon pigtail.
Ingredients: Clear Creek Douglas Fir brandy;Juniper gin;Campari;Braulio Amaro;Salt

Name: Hobnail
About: Smoky Scotch is tempered with a hint of bitter amaro and a slick of spicy ginger syrup in this straightforward glass.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with oils expressed from an orange peel.
Ingredients: Cutty Sark Prohibition Scotch;Ginger syrup;Lemon juice;Averna amaro;Angostura bitters
Garnish: Orange peel oil or candied ginger

Name: Rudolph's Nose
About: Anchor’s Christmas Spirit is the merry result of distilling Anchor Brewing’s Christmas ale which creates a smooth winter-spiced spirit that’s ideal for holiday cocktails like this one mixed with maraschino cognac and bitters.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.
Ingredients: Anchor Christmas Spirit;Luxardo Maraschino;Chateau Montifaud Pineau de Charentes Rosso;Gran Classico bitters

Name: Snow Bunny
About: Anchor’s Christmas Spirit is the merry result of distilling Anchor Brewing’s Christmas ale which creates a smooth winter-spiced spirit that’s ideal for holiday cocktails like this one mixed with ginger liqueur honey syrup and allspice bitters.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except for the ale and bitters to a cocktail shaker. Dry shake then add ice and shake again. Double-strain into a fizz glass and top with ale. Garnish with shaved nutmeg and three drops of bitters.
Ingredients: Anchor Christmas Spirit;The King’s Ginger Liqueur;Lemon juice;Honey syrup;Egg white;Anchor Christmas Ale;Dale DeGroff’s Allspice Bitters

Name: Embarcadero
About: Meet the trifecta of perfectly balanced bittersweet flavor: amaro sweet vermouth and rye.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass over large ice cube. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Lo-Fi Gentian Amaro;Lo-Fi Sweet Vermouth;Rye Whiskey

Name: Point Reyes Punch
About: Who doesn’t love an equal-parts cocktail? Pineapple syrup lends a silky thread to this sunny blend of rum and dry vermouth.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Lo-Fi Dry Vermouth;Dry white rum;Pineapple syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Golden Gate Spritz
About: Want to lighten up? Try this refreshing glass of amaro and grapefruit capped with bubbly.
HowToMake: Add amaro and grapefruit juice to a coupe and top with chilled sparkling wine. Garnish with grapefruit peel.
Ingredients: Lo-Fi Gentian Amaro;Fresh grapefruit juice;Chilled sparkling wine

Name: Type Eh
About: Canadian whisky teams up with earthy Cynar to create this burly coupe with a hint of smoked salt.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.  Stir and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Forty Creek Barrel Select Canadian whisky;Cynar;Cinzano sweet vermouth;Lemon juice;Small pinch of smoked salt

Name: Don Sherry
About: Canadian whisky mezcal and sherry combine to form a smooth smoky trio in the glass.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Forty Creek Copper Pot;Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Pedro Jimenez Sherry

Name: RCMPiñ
About: You’ll find whisky spice and everything nice inside this tall glass of Canadian whisky ginger syrup and Chinese bitters.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker over ice. Shake and strain over fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a piece of crystallized ginger.
Ingredients: Forty Creek Barrel Select;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh Ginger syrup;Fresh pineapple juice;Chinese bitters

Name: Autumn -
About: This fall-forward combination of pear brandy applejack and sherry is versatile enough to be served cold or as a warm Toddy.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain over one large hand-carved ice cube. Spray with allspice tincture garnish with pear crisp and serve on a burning maple leaf.
Ingredients: Laird’s Applejack;Amontillado sherry;Clear Creek Pear Brandy;Maple syrup;Apple bitters

Name: Pear & Elderflower Collins
About: Pear puree and pear liqueur add a double dose of fall flavor to this bubbly highball.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except club soda to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain over fresh ice. Top with club soda and stir. Garnish with a slice of pear and grated cinnamon.
Ingredients: Vodka or gin;Pear liqueur;Pear puree;Fresh lemon juice;Elderflower liqueur;Honey syrup;Club soda
Garnish: Thin slice of pear and grated cinnamon

Name: Poached Pear & Ginger Daiquiri -
About: For super intense flavor poach your pears in a simple syrup flavored with warming winter spices like clove cinnamon and star anise.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a blender with a scoop of crushed ice. Blend until smooth.
Ingredients: White rum;Spiced poached pear;Fresh grated ginger root;Lime juice;Syrup from poached pears

Name: Spiced Pear Bellini -
About: Need a last-minute fall cocktail? This four-ingredient stunner will satisfy any pear-loving party guests.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except sparkling wine into mixing glass with 2 ice cubes. Add the sparkling wine and stir well for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled Champagne flute. Garnish with a pear slice.
Ingredients: Pear purée or nectar;Pear brandy;Cinnamon and nutmeg;Sparkling wine

Name: Falling Leaves -
About: Pear eau de vie and dry Riesling make natural mates in this gently spiced coupe.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into coupe. Garnish with star anise.
Ingredients: Dry Riesling;Poire William Eau de Vie;Orange curaçao;Honey syrup;Peychaud’s bitters

Name: Apples & Pears -
About: Applejack pear brandy and hard pear cider? That’s a perfect formula for autumn cocktail fans everywhere.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except hard pear cider to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain over fresh ice. Top with hard pear cider.
Ingredients: Laird’s Bonded Applejack;Clear Creek Pear Brandy;Ginger syrup;Lemon juice;Hard pear cider

Name: Spiced Cocoa
About: Spice up your next cup of cocoa with this cayenne-spiked recipe mixed with nutty walnut liqueur and bourbon.
HowToMake: Preheat mug by filling it with hot water. Discard water after 30 seconds. Add bourbon and walnut liqueur to the heated mug. Add the spicy hot cocoa and gently mix together. Garnish with chile peppers.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden's Bourbon;Nocello Walnut Liqueur;2 oz Spicy Hot Cocoa

Name: Montgomerie Smoked Cider
About: The formula for a perfectly balanced glass of fall flavor? Smoky Scotch sweet cider and tart lemon juice.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a glass over ice. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Laphroaig 10 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky;Apple cider;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Trilby
About: A unique sherry-cask-mellowed gin adds depth and richness to this three-ingredient stunner.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Booth’s Finest Dry Gin Cask Mellowed;Dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Mother Flower
About: Soju and Genepy the traditional herbal liqueur meet with Cocchi Americano to produce this earthy yet refreshing cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a glass rinsed with mezcal and absinthe over a large ice cube. Garnish with an edible flower.
Ingredients: Hibiscus Hwayo;Génépy;Cocchi Americano;Mezcal rinse;Absinthe rinse

Name: Smoke House
About: Lapsang tea lends its signature smokiness to this cocktail through an infused gin which is balanced with bittersweet Cynar and Chartreuse.
HowToMake: Add ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a glass. Garnish with orange peel.
Ingredients: Lapsang-infused Beefeater Gin;Cynar;Chartreuse

Name: Berry Barracuda
About: Leave it to the pros at The Dead Rabbit to create a cocktail that pairs Irish whiskey with strawberries and tart balsamic vinegar. Lillet Rose and sherry complete this ingenious coupe.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and double-strain into a coupe. Garnish with a strawberry.
Ingredients: Knappogue Castle Single Malt Irish Whiskey 12-Year;Strawberry syrup;Lillet Rose;Fino sherry;Dead Rabbit Orinoco bitters;Aged balsamic vinegar

Name: Rock Your Face Off Hot Todd
About: This Toddy is the perfect vehicle for Mister Katz’s Rock & Rye from New York Distilling Company. Combine the flavorful rye with honey syrup lemon juice and bitters for a dram that will keep you warm all winter.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a Toddy or 6-ounce juice glass. Add 3 ounces of hot water and stir. Garnish with half a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Mister Katz's Rock & Rye;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup (2:1);Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel Bitters

Name: Pumpkin Pie Brew
About: Pumpkin fans will love this easy blend of pumpkin beer and freshly-brewed black tea laced with chai spices coconut and pineapple.
HowToMake: Combine ingredients in a chilled glass. Garnish with fresh ginger.
Ingredients: Owl’s Brew Coco-Lada;Pumpkin beer (recommended: Southern Tier Pumking)

Name: Apple Crisp Toddy
About: Craving gooey apple crisp? Create the drinkable version with a base of freshly-brewed English breakfast tea laced with lemon peel plus spicy ginger bourbon apple slices and cinnamon.
HowToMake: Combine Owl’s Brew bourbon bitters cinnamon stick and two apple slices in a saucepan and heat until warm but do not boil. Pour into a mug and garnish with fresh apple slices and a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Owl’s Brew The Classic;Virgil Kaine Ginger Bourbon;Bittercube Jamaican #1 bitters;Cinnamon;Fresh apple
Garnish: Fresh apple slices and a cinnamon stick

Name: Cranberry Sauced
About: This base of freshly brewed Darjeeling tea spiked with hibiscus strawberry and lemon peel is a bright match for vodka and cranberry bitters.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a rosemary sprig.
Ingredients: Owl’s Brew spiked Darjeeling tea;Vodka;Fee Brothers cranberry bitters

Name: French 75
About: This bright and bubbly glass of gin lemon juice simple syrup and Champagne is a timeless classic for good reason.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except Champagne to an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously. Uncap shaker and add Champagne. Strain mixture into a Champagne glass and garnish with an expressed lemon twist.
Ingredients: 1.5 oz Bluecoat American Dry Gin;.75 oz Fresh lemon juice;.25 oz Simple syrup;2 oz Champagne

Name: Barrel Finished Egg Nog
About: Gin and cognac give this Egg Nog double the heft while a spiced syrup lends rich winter flavor.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously (20-30 sec). Double-strain into a 10-ounce rocks glass filled with fresh ice and garnish with a star anise pod.
Ingredients: Bluecoat Barrel Finished Gin;Cognac;Holiday syrup;Almond milk;Heavy cream;Egg

Name: Autumn Apple
About: Autumn’s favorite flavor takes center stage in this festive glass of apple cider gin honey syrup and cinnamon.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Double-strain into a coupe glass. Express the oil from a lemon twist and garnish with the twist.
Ingredients: Bluecoat American dry gin;Apple cider;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup;Cinnamon;Bitters

Name: Perfect Pear
About: Fresh pear puree lends fall flavor to this bubbly blend of gin elderflower liqueur and Champagne.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except Champagne to an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously. Double-strain into a 5.5-ounce coupe. Top with a splash of Champagne and garnish with a fresh slice of pear.
Ingredients: Bluecoat American Dry Gin;St-Germain;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Fresh pear puree;Champagne

Name: Local Option
About: During his shift at Miami’s Broken Shaker Alex Renshaw of Chicago’s Drumbar served this balanced blend of Bacardi 8 rum bitter amaro apple juice and Demerara syrup as a tribute to his home city’s brisk climate.
HowToMake: Shake and strain on 1x1 cubes.
Ingredients: Bacardi 8 Rum;Luxardo Amaro Abano;Fresh pressed apple juice;Lemon juice;Demerara syrup

Name: A Famous Captai
About: This cocktail is Vince Toscano’s ode to Miami’s Broken Shaker where he was blown away by the high quality cocktail ingredients. Made with a combination of Bacardi Gran Reserva Maestro de Ron cinnamon syrup lime and pineapple juices and sweet vermouth the Captain is a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker. Shake and strain over fresh ice.
Ingredients: Bacardí Gran Reserva Maestro de Ron;Lime juice;Cinnamon syrup;Pineapple juice;Noilly Prat Rouge

Name: Brandy Crust
About: During his Bar Shift in New York City Daniel Victory’s Brandy Crusta served as a reminder of his native New Orleans. The legendary cocktail was invented there and has been the base formula of countless other drinks that have inspired Victory since.
HowToMake: Rim a coupe with sugar and set aside. Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Brandy;Curaçao;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Maraschino liqueur;Angostura bitters;Lemon twist

Name: New Orleans: #RA
About: Pam Wiznitzer’s bubbly New Orleans: #RAD was inspired by her favorite moment during the annual Tales of the Cocktail convention. Following the last Tales event on Sunday night the industry takes over a local bar and breaks out the sparkling rosé to the chant of “rosé all day.” Wiznitzer captured the energy of this moment with her specialty cocktail made with cognac St-Germain strawberry puree and absinthe and topped with a float of sparkling rosé.
HowToMake: Shake all ingredients except for the sparkling rosé. Pour into a white wine glass. Top with sparkling rosé. Garnish with mini tiny rubber duckie.
Ingredients: D’USSÉ Cognac;Lemon juice;St-Germain;Strawberry purée;Absinthe;Sparkling rosé

Name: Spin Mov
About: One of Yael Vengroff’s signature Bar Shift hits this warmly spiced coupe is made with Dewar’s White Label scotch D’ussé cognac St-Germain green cardamom pods fresh lemon juice and Angostura bitters. The addition of aromatic cardamom was inspired by Vengroff’s time spent in Mumbai India and a playful green-apple fan provides the finishing touch.
HowToMake: Smash the green cardamom pods and add them into a shaker. Add the rest of the ingredients and ice and shake. Double-strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Green cardamom pods;Dewar’s White Label scotch;D’ussé cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;St-Germain;Angostura bitters

Name: Mangapeñ
About: The spicy Mangapeño put Enzo Cangemi on the map. Inspired both by his early years in Los Angeles and his Italian heritage the Mangapeño combines Grey Goose Vodka Aperol mango syrup lemon juice and a slice of muddled jalapeño.
HowToMake: Shake with ice and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Grey Goose Vodka;Aperol;Mango syrup;Lemon juice

Name: Southernmost State of Min
About: While in Chicago for his Bar Shift Gui Jaroschy scored local lemongrass and marigolds for his signature cocktail while exploring Millennium Park. A sunny glass of Bacardi Heritage lime juice and a kaffir-citrus cordial mixed with rosemary and St-Germain the Southernmost State of Mind personified Jaroschy’s native Miami perfectly.
HowToMake: Shake first 3 ingredients and strain into collins glass with collins spear ice if possible. Drop thin sliced clementine wheel inside glass top with soda and garnish rim with another clementine wheel and a sprig of rosemary.
Ingredients: Bacardi Heritage rum;Sunshine Mix (kaffir and citrus cordial mixed with rosemary and St-Germain);Lime juice;Soda

Name: Buttery Nippl
About: Build drink directly in glass.
HowToMake: Pour buttershots liqueur into a chilled shot glass. Carefully layer the rest of the glass with Irish cream.
Ingredients: Buttershots liqueur;Irish cream

Name: Savory Eyeball
About: These eyeballs will give your guests—and cocktails—a scary night to remember.
HowToMake: With a small paring knife hollow out a small hole in the cocktail onion. Insert a piece of olive into the cocktail onion (with additional cutting to make sure it fits). Dip a toothpick into the red food dye and trace along the cocktail onion to create veins. Place the onions in the freezer for 5 to 10 minutes to set the dye then slip into a cocktail.
Ingredients: Cocktail onions;Small green or black olives chopped;Red food dye

Name: Chai Tea Fizz
About: You won’t find this grown-up chai latte at Starbucks.
HowToMake: Shake all with ice for a minute. Serve long without ice and top with soda. Garnish with lemon swath.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Chai tea syrup;Almond milk;Egg white

Name: Matador Norteño
About: A few drops of habanero tincture transform this sotol-and-pineapple cocktail—for the better.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Sotol;Pineapple juice;Fresh lemon juice;Rich agave syrup (2 parts agave nectar 1 part water);Habanero tincture

Name: Schlitzie
About: This spicy serrano-infused cocktail can be made with interchangeable base spirits like tequila or rye whiskey.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Tequila;Fresh lemon juice;Grenadine;Serrano-infused amontillado sherry

Name: Cold Comfort
About: This autumnal cocktail from Chicago’s Sable Kitchen & Bar head bartender John Stanton pairs bourbon with black walnut–rosemary syrup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a rosemary sprig.
Ingredients: Evan Williams;Fresh pineapple juice;Black walnut–rosemary syrup;Amaro Montenegro;Fresh lemon juice;Bittercube Jamaican Bitters

Name: First Frost
About: Despite its chilly temperature this brandy cocktail offers warming notes of spice-infused vermouth maple syrup and cardamom.
HowToMake: Add Concord grapes to a shaker and muddle. Add remaining ingredients to the shaker with a small amount of crushed ice and whip shake. Pour into a Julep glass and top with crushed ice. Garnish with grated cinnamon and nutmeg cinnamon stick lavender and frozen Concord grapes.
Ingredients: Concord grapes;Le Panto Brandy;House-made syphoned blanc vermouth;Vermont maple syrup;Cardamom bitters;Cinnamon stick;Lavender;Frozen concord grapes

Name: Train’s A Comin’
About: In celebration of New York’s historic 7 subway line extension this cocktail salutes the purple route emblem of the 7 train and marries essential characteristics of the Sazerac and Aviation.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and double strain into an absinthe-rinsed glass filled with ice.  Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Cognac;Dolin blanc vermouth;Crème Yvette;Lemon juice;Concord grape syrup;Absinthe

Name: The Bacchus
About: Pisco is a natural partner for Concord grapes which are muddled along with blackberries to create this frothy coupe.
HowToMake: Place the Concord grapes and blackberries in a shaker and muddle. Add the rest of the ingredients and ice. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with Concord grapes and lemon peel twisted to release oils.
Ingredients: Concord grapes;Blackberries;Barsol Primero Pisco;Crème Yvette;Lemon juice;Egg white

Name: Harvest Moon
About: Inspired by the harvest season in late September this cocktail embodies fall’s coziest flavors.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice. Stir vigorously until the mixing glass becomes frosty. Strain into a rocks glass over two-inch ice cube.
Ingredients: Tincup whiskey;Concord grape shrub;Fernet Branca;Cherry Heering;Madeira;Concord grapes soaked in pomegranate molasses brandy and toasted almond

Name: Mezcal Concord Grape Citrus Market Mint
About: Mezcal and Concord grapes? The surprising duo create a smoky fall-forward cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Concord grape mint syrup;Lime juice;Cocchi Rosa;Muddled mint leaves

Name: Luminoso
About: Concord grapes give this cocktail a clean crisp autumn flavor while Cocchi Americano and dry vermouth balance out the sweetness of the grape and rosemary syrup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except club soda to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and double strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with club soda and garnish with Concord grapes and rosemary sprig.
Ingredients: Siete Leguas Tequila;Cocchi Americano;Contratto Dry Vermouth;Lime juice;Concord grape rosemary syrup;Club soda

Name: Paper Plane
About: Invented by Aussie bartender Sam Ross in 2007 the Paper Plane is a modern variation on the Last Word—this time made with equal parts bourbon Amaro Nonino Aperol and lemon juice. Supposedly inspired by M.I.A.’s smash hit “Paper Plane” (which was also released in 2007) the cocktail strikes a beautiful balance between bitter sour and herbal notes.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe glass.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Aperol;Fresh lemon juice

Name: The Coco Chanel Martin
About: This two-ingredient take on the classic Martini is named for the fashion icon.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass.
Ingredients: Ciroc Coconut Vodka;St-Germain

Name: Concord Grape Margarita
About: Concord grapes are perfect for cocktails thanks to their sweetness and pleasantly dry finish. Paired with clean agave flavor from the tequila Concord grapes create your new favorite flavored Margarita.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain over fresh ice.
Ingredients: Cimarron Blanco Tequila;R.W. Knudsen Organic Concord Grape Juice;Lemon juice;Barspoon Smuckers Concord Grape Jelly

Name: Back to Capistrano
About: Built on a base of malty genever and pisco this cocktail gains warm fall flavor from homemade Demerara and cinnamon syrups and a handful of Concord grapes.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker. Shake and strain over a glass filled with crushed ice.
Ingredients: Bols Genever;Capurro Pisco;Sorghum syrup;Demerara syrup;Cinnamon syrup;Lemon juice;Angostura bitters;Concord grapes

Name: Sacred Grape
About: Concord grape puree and a homemade basil syrup complete this fizzy gin cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the gin grape puree basil syrup and lime juice to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and pour into an Old Fashioned glass. Top with club soda and garnish with Concord grapes and basil leaves.
Ingredients: Gin;Concord grape puree;Thai basil syrup;Lime juice;Club soda

Name: The Purple One
About: This pleasantly purple gin cocktail features a fermented Concord grape soda that Bar Tartine makes with local organic grape juice. (At home you can use a good-quality grape soda like Boylan’s in its place.)
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass. Top with .75 to 1 ounce Concord grape soda.
Ingredients: Vivacity Native Gin;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Carpano Bianco Vermouth;Fermented Concord grape soda

Name: Concord Grape Negroni
About: The secret ingredient behind this new age Negroni? Concord grape–infused vermouth.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except bitters to a mixing glass with ice. Stir 45 turns for proper dilution. Strain contents into a rocks glass and add one large ice cube.  Finish with one dash of lavender bitters.
Ingredients: Barr Hill Gin;Concord grape–infused Dolin Blanc Vermouth;Bittermens Amére Nouvelle;Bar Keep Organic Lavender Bitters

Name: Transfusion
About: The Transfusion is a golf club standard made with vodka ginger ale and grape juice. This twist combines homemade ginger syrup with Concord grape juice ice cubes that slowly infuse the drink with fall flavor.
HowToMake: Add the vodka ginger syrup and lime juice into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over the Concord grape juice ice cubes. Top with the club soda. Garnish with a Concord grape and piece of crystallized ginger. *Ginger syrup: Add 1 cup fresh-pressed ginger juice and 2 cups sugar to a pot over medium heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves and remove from heat.
Ingredients: Vodka;Ginger syrup;Fresh lime juice;Concord grape juice ice cubes;Club soda

Name: Amai Doku #2
About: This soju cocktail’s name translates to “Sweet Poison #2.”
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass. Top with soda and garnish with half a kumquat.
Ingredients: Raicilla;Soju;Grapefruit juice;Kumquat shrub;Soda

Name: Hwayo Vieux Carre
About: This take on the New Orleans classic uses popular Korean spirit soju.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into an Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hwayo 41;Sweet vermouth;Cognac;Dom Benedictine;Angostura bitters;Peychaud's Bitters

Name: Hwayo Negroni
About: This take on the classic Italian aperitif uses popular Korean spirit soju instead of gin.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Hwayo 41;Sweet vermouth;Campari;Orange bitters

Name: Nail in the Coffin -
About: This spirit-forward cocktail from San Francisco’s Dirty Habit combines Italian bitter amaro and Portuguese wine with Japanese whisky and Spanish liqueur.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir. Strain into a Nick & Nora or coupe glass and garnish with freshly shaved black cardamom.
Ingredients: Dry Madeira wine;Licor 43;Fernet-Branca

Name: Highball Mizuwari
About: This Japanese cocktail is all about the whisky—and the ritual. Make sure you count your stirs.
HowToMake: Stack several large cubes of ice in a highball glass. Pour the whisky into the glass and slowly stir it 13 and a half times.  Fill the glass with ice again and top with sparkling water. Stir three and a half more times to finish the drink.
Ingredients: Japanese whisky;Sparkling water

Name: Washington Apple
About: This crisp apple and cranberry cocktail is ridiculously easy to drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Canadian whisky;Sour apple schnapps;Cranberry juice

Name: Maryum’s Grass Skirt
About: Rum and rye play nicely with rosehip liqueur and pineapple juice in this drink from Atwood Restaurant in Chicago.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with mint sprig.
Ingredients: Caña Brava Rum;Rittenhouse rye;Koval Rosehip Liqueur;Fresh pineapple juice;Peychaud’s bitters;Juice from brandied cherries;Mint leaves

Name: Elyx Pineapple
About: This picturesque pineapple and vodka concoction is served at Edition Hotels.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a copper pineapple glass or Collins glass over crushed ice. Garnish with dried pineapple and a sprig of torched rosemary.
Ingredients: Absolut Elyx;Boiron Pineapple Puree;Fresh lemon juice;Oloroso sherry;Rosemary syrup;Salted caramel syrup;Bittermens Tiki Bitters

Name: 606 Swizzle
About: Sherry pineapple juice and a rummy homemade mix are the stars of this cocktail from Sable Kitchen & Bar in Chicago.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the pilsner to a hurricane glass filled with crushed ice. Mix well and top with pilsner.  Garnish with a mint sprig and 3 dashes of Angostura Bitters.
Ingredients: East Indian sherry;Amontillado sherry;Blackstrap banana mix;Fresh pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Pilsner

Name: Bumboat
About: This eclectic cocktail from San Francisco’s Smuggler’s Cove uses pineapple almond whiskey and rum.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the 151 to a hollowed out pineapple and fill with crushed ice. Blend well and float the 151 or Lemon Hart on top.
Ingredients: Fresh pineapple juice;Fresh lemon juice;Cinnamon syrup;Rye Whiskey;Light rum;Almond extract;Tiki bitters or Angostura Bitters;Lemon Hart or Hamilton 151
Glass: Hollowed pineapple with hole for straw;;Collins

Name: Twist My Arm(agnac)
About: After one sip of this pineapple-spiked drink from San Francisco’s Dirty Habit you won’t need any more coaxing.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube. Garnish with a compressed pineapple core or a cube of pineapple.
Ingredients: Belvedere vodka;Tariquet Classique VS Armagnac;Fresh pineapple juice;Fresh lemon juice;Rich demerara syrup
Garnish: Compressed pineapple core or cube of pineapple.

Name: Piha Spritz
About: You can find this pineapple and gin concoction at The Musket Room in New York.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a wine glass filled with fresh ice and top with the sparkling rosé. Garnish with a sage flower and/or leaf.
Ingredients: Greenhook Beach Plum gin liqueur;Palm sugar rooibos syrup;Fresh pineapple juice;Tempus Fugit Kina L'Aréo d'Or apéritif;Fresh lime juice;Sparkling dry rosé

Name: Al Pachilli
About: This fruity cocktail from MAMO in New York gets a hint of spice.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a coupe glass.
Ingredients: Y Chilli liqueur;Passion fruit juice;Pineapple juice;Grenadine

Name: Choose-Your-Own-Base-Spirit Piña Colada
About: Not a fan of rum? Try this classic tiki drink with Chartreuse instead.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with crushed ice. Fill the top of the glass with crushed ice and top with nutmeg.
Ingredients: Base spirit (rum Green Chartreuse Campari or mezcal);Pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Coco Lopez cream of coconut;Simple syrup
Garnish: Nutmeg cube of pineapple with two pineapple leaves

Name: Snake Bit Sprout
About: Chamomile gin and pineapple juice? This cocktail from Houston cocktail bar Julep is delightfully unexpected.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the apple cider to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh crushed ice. Fill the top of the glass with crushed ice and layer the apple cider on top. Garnish with chamomile buds and serve with a long straw.
Ingredients: Chamomile-infused dry gin;Pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Apple cider

Name: Tepache Mod
About: The secret to this summery cocktail? Tepache liqueur based on the traditional Mexican beverage that’s made with fermented pineapple unrefined brown sugar and spices.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into Martini glass. Garnish with freshly-grated cinnamon.
Ingredients: Dos Lunas tequila;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Sin Nombre
About: The secret ingredient in this blushing glass? A hint of refreshing aloe vera juice.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain contents into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with an orange or lemon twist.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Fresh lemon juice;Aloe vera juice;Pomegranate juice;Maraschino liqueur;Orange bitters;Peychaud's bitters;Orange or lemon

Name: Miss Me Not
About: A fresh celery and sugar snap pea syrup brightens this tequila-based Highball complete with an absinthe mist.
HowToMake: Combine Don Julio Blanco Tequila sherry fresh lemon juice celery and sugar snap pea syrup into a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain contents into a highball glass over ice and top with seltzer. Garnish with mint sprig and absinthe mist.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Sherry;Fresh lemon juice;Celery and sugar snap pea syrup;Seltzer

Name: Pils Al Pastor
About: Ancho chile liqueur tart drinking vinegar and a cap of Pilsner give this cocktail its fizzy kick.
HowToMake: Combine Don Julio Blanco Tequila ancho chile liqueur fresh lime juice and Pok Pok Pineapple drinking vinegar in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain contents into a rocks glass rimmed with La Boite 37 Spice and Salt blend over ice. Top with Pilsner.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Ancho chile liqueur;Lime juice;Pok Pok Pineapple Drinking Vinegar;Pilsner
Garnish: La Boite 37 Spice and Salt Blend

Name: Grapefruit Sazerac
About: Grapefruit adds a welcome citrus note to this New Orleans specialty.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir for approximately eight seconds. Spray absinthe into a cocktail glass with a spritzer. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with grapefruit peel.
Ingredients: Rye Whiskey;Bitters;Purely Syrup Grapefruit;Absinthe

Name: Maple Leaf
About: Vanilla bean maple and bourbon compliment each other in this heart-warming concoction.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake for approximately 12 seconds. Strain into a chilled Nick and Nora glass and garnish with vanilla bean.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Purely Syrup Vanilla Bean;Organic maple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Bitters

Name: Hanalei Su
About: This infusion makes a fast-as-lightning cocktail. Just let pineapple chunks and rum hang out together for a few days. Then shake strain and sip.
HowToMake: Place the pineapple pieces and the vodka or rum in a large nonreactive metal or glass container with a lid. Cover and let sit for one week in the refrigerator stirring it once a day. Strain the liquid through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl allowing the fruit to sit in the strainer for 30 minutes so as to get all the liquid. Discard the fruit and funnel the infusion back into the  original bottle and label. The infusion will keep for two weeks in the refrigerator. To serve pour 3 ½ ounces of the pineapple infusion into a shaker and shake with ice until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a pineapple wedge.
Ingredients: Pineapple peeled cored and cut into one-inch pieces;750 ml bottle Vodka or white rum

Name: Suey’s Sangrit
About: Julie Reiner sees the value in drinking tequila straight. If you want to have your cake and eat it too pair your bottle with her recipe for Sangrita a tomato-based citrus concoction that can be enjoyed on the side.
HowToMake: In a pitcher combine the jalapeño juices Tabasco Cholula salt paprika and pepper. Stir cover and let the mixture sit in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Remove the jalapeño. To serve pour five ounces of the Sangrita into a Collins glass filled with ice and serve alongside a two-ounce shot of blanco tequila.
Ingredients: Jalapeño sliced in half and seeded (leave the seeds in for a spicier Sangrita);Tomato juice;Orange juice;Grapefruit juice;Lime juice;Tabasco hot sauce;Cholula hot sauce;Salt;Pinch Smoked paprika;Pinch White pepper;Partida Blanco tequila

Name: NOLET’S Bramble
About: This gin cocktail from Tim Wells of Chicago’s Revival Social Club gets a seriously fruity twist with pomegranate syrup and raspberry liqueur.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake hard for 10 seconds and strain into a Double Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon slice and fresh basil leaves.
Ingredients: NOLET'S Silver Gin;Pomegranate syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Raspberry liqueur;Orange bitters
Garnish: Lemon slice and fresh basil leaves

Name: Liquor.com’s Piña Colada
About: The chilly coconut-y drink is having (another) delicious moment. And this recipe might be the best there is.
HowToMake: Pour all ingredients into a shaker filled with ice. Shake well for a good 30 seconds or so. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a wedge of fresh pineapple.
Ingredients: Dark rum (recommended: Don Q Anejo Rum);Fresh pineapple juice;Fresh orange juice;Fresh lime juice;Coconut milk;Heavy cream;Demerara simple syrup

Name: Inside Scoop
About: You’ve never tasted a root beer float this good.
HowToMake: Spritz a rocks glass with the Chartreuse. Add the Jägermeister and root beer. Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Add the bitters on top of the ice cream. Express the oil from an orange peel over top and discard the peel.
