Ingredients: Yellow Chartreuse;Jägermeister chilled;Root beer;Vanilla ice cream;Devil’s Larder root beer bitters

Name: Precision Timepiece
About: Jäger amaro and Aperol create one handsome cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Jägermeister;Amaro Montenegro;Aperol;Dale DeGroff's Pimento Bitters

Name: Stag’s Leap
About: Who said Jäger can’t be fancy? Mix it with bitters and sweet vermouth for a craft cocktail you’ll love.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a Collins glass and fill with ice. Top with seltzer.
Ingredients: Jägermeister;Sweet vermouth;Devil’s Larder Root Beer Bitters;Seltzer

Name: German Vacation
About: Who couldn’t use a nice getaway? This Jäger and rum cocktail will take you to faraway lands.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with pebble ice. Mound more ice on top like a snow cone and garnish with a few heavy dashes of Peychaud's Bitters.
Ingredients: Jägermeister;Flor de Caña 4-Year-Old Gold Rum;Domaine de Canton;Orgeat;Fresh lemon juice

Name: The Rose Garden
About: Strawberry pineapple and rose combine in this refreshing gin cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberry and three rose petals. Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and double strain into a tulip glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a rose petal.
Ingredients: NOLET’S Silver Gin;Rose syrup;Pineapple juice;Fresh lemon juice;Strawberry;Egg white;Rose petals

Name: NOLET’S Mango Crush
About: Cool down this summer with a frosty gin and mango cocktail at Blackbird Ordinary.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a blender and fill with crushed ice. Blend thoroughly and pour into a pint glass.
Ingredients: NOLET’S Silver Gin;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Fresh mango puree;Fee Brothers Rhubarb Bitters

Name: Voodoo Eyes
About: This frothy chamomile and gin recipe is on the the menu at San Francisco cocktail bar Oddjob.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker. Dry shake until the ingredients emulsify. Fill the shaker with ice and shake again until well chilled. Double strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with chamomile dust and burnt rosemary.
Ingredients: Chamomile-infused NOLET’S Silver Gin;Turbinado sugar;Fresh lemon juice;Egg white

Name: Grapefruit Hemingway
About: Gin and citrus combine to make one seriously refreshing tipple. Created by Dante Alston and can be found at Stanton Social.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the grapefruit wheel. Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass.
Ingredients: NOLET’S Silver Gin;Maraschino liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Lemon simple syrup;Fresh grapefruit wheel

Name: Pistachio Mule -
About: This classic cocktail has a seriously nutty twist.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.  Shake hard and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Pistachio shell–infused vodka;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Fresh ginger juice;Ginger beer

Name: Dans Le Nuit -
About: In this cocktail from Sable Kitchen & Bar in Chicago pistachios pay a nice complement to cognac.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass over crushed ice. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Pierre Ferrand Ambre Cognac;Pistachio syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Marie Brizard Orange Curaçao;Simple syrup

Name: Cardamom
About: Inspired by the earthy flavors of cardamom this cocktail combines espresso pistachio vodka and cardamom syrup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a punch cup. Garnish with 3 cardamom pods. *Pistachio-fat-washed vodka: Combine 120 g pistachio oil and 1 750 mL bottle of vodka in a covered jar. Shake mixture every 10 minutes for 2 hours. Plack mixture in the freezer for 4-6 hours. Strain mixture and store in a sealed container for up to 1 month. **Cardamom syrup: Bring 1 cup water and 1/4 cup cardamom pods to a boil. Stir in 1 cup sugar until fully dissolved. Remove mixture from heat and allow to cool. Keep in refrigerator for 3 days then strain and discard cardamom. Store refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
Ingredients: Pistachio-fat-washed vodka;Brazilian espresso;Cardamom syrup

Name: EVOL -
About: Pistachio-infused sherry? Seattle’s Shaker + Spear knows how to make an innovative cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into an Irish coffee glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Pistachio-infused Oloroso sherry;Luxardo Bitter Liqueur;Four Roses Yellow Label Bourbon;Rhubarb bitters

Name: Cream of the Crop -
About: Mezcal and pistachios whisper sweet nothings in this cocktail from Dirty Habit in San Francisco.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a piece of candied ginger and an espelette pepper.
Ingredients: Del Maguey Vida Mezcal;King’s Ginger;Coconut-pistachio puree;Fresh lemon juice
Garnish: Candied ginger and an espelette pepper

Name: Lychee -
About: Pistachios coconut lychee and rum combine to make one tasty drink that’s on the menu at BDK in San Francisco.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Belgian beer glass over cobbled ice. Garnish with toasted coconut and lime zest.
Ingredients: Absolut Wild Tea vodka;Coconut-lychee milk;Salted pistachio syrup;Fresh lime juice

Name: John the Baptist
About: This Irish whiskey  take on Tiki  combines flavors of pistachio apricot matcha and more.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Strain into a Tiki mug or Collins glass over fresh ice. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and fresh mint sprigs.
Ingredients: Green Spot Irish whiskey;Pernod absinthe;Coco Lopez mactha green tea powder mix;Pineapple juice;Pistachio syrup;Crème de cacao;Apricot eau-de-vie;Half-and-half

Name: Lone Oa
About: This cocktail from New York’s Dead Rabbit combines Irish whiskey and pistachio syrup for a truly nutty concoction.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a fresh curry leaf.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel Irish Whiskey;Green Chartreuse;Dead Rabbit Orinoco bitters;Lemon juice;Pistachio syrup;Fresh curry leaves

Name: Oaks Lily
About: The Oaks Lily is the official cocktail of the Bluegrass State’s other big horse race the Kentucky Oaks. Light and refreshing the vodka drink takes its inspiration from the Cosmopolitan the pink hue a nod to the stargazer lilies placed on the race’s winning filly.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a highball fill with ice and stir. Garnish with a lemon wheel and 2 skewered blackberries.
Ingredients: Vodka;Orange liqueur;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Cranberry juice

Name: Vanilla-Orangecell
About: The creamsicle might have begun as a childhood sweet on a stick but its base flavors can become a very adult beverage: Bright orangecello laced with vanilla beans.
HowToMake: Use a vegetable peeler or zester to remove the peels from all of the oranges avoiding peeling the bitter white pith. Place the orange peels and vanilla beans in a large jar and cover with alcohol. Allow to steep for one week somewhere dark like a closet or cabinet. Strain the infused vodka into a large bowl and discard the orange peels and vanilla beans. Add one cup of simple syrup to the vodka and stir. Taste for sweetness adding more simple syrup as desired. Use a funnel to bottle the vanilla-orangecello and set aside in a dark area for one more week for the flavor to mellow. Chill thoroughly in the freezer before serving.
Ingredients: Large Oranges;Vanilla beans split open;100-proof vodka;Simple syrup

Name: Limoncell
About: Limoncello is produced with equal passion in multiple areas of Italy: in Sorrento along the Amalfi coast and on the island of Capri. It’s a staple apéritif after many a dinner in Italy and most restaurants hawk their own brand. Craving the sweet-tart pucker of this golden liqueur? It’s sublimely easy to make at home.
HowToMake: Use a vegetable peeler or zester to remove the peels from all of the lemons avoiding peeling the bitter white pith. Place the lemon peels in a large jar and cover with alcohol. Allow the peels to steep for four weeks somewhere dark like a closet or cabinet. Strain the infused vodka into a large bowl and discard the lemon peels. Add one cup of simple syrup to the vodka and stir. Taste for sweetness adding more simple syrup as desired. Use a funnel to bottle the limoncello and return to a dark area for two more weeks for the flavor to mellow. Chill thoroughly in the freezer before serving.
Ingredients: Lemons;100-proof vodka;Simple syrup

Name: Alma Blanca
About: Tequila ginger pineapple and corn all show up to class in this spicy cocktail from Austin Texas’s La Condesa.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the corn kernels then add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake hard and double strain into a hibiscus-rose salt�"rimmed coupe glass. Mist with two to three sprays of Herbsaint.
Ingredients: Habanero-infused Siembra Azul Blanco Tequila;Domaine de Canton;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh pineapple juice;Organic agave nectar;Fresh yellow corn kernels
Garnish: Hibiscus-rose salt rim and mist of Herbsaint

Name: Yum Kaax
About: This corn and mezcal cocktail was named after the eponymous Mayan god of maize.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the salt-rimmed rocks or cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Mezcal;Mexican sweet corn juice (one ear of corn yields about 3 oz juice);leaves of Epazote and Hoja Santa;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar
Garnish: Pitiona leaves and a salted rim

Name: Cornelia
About: This tequila and mezcal cocktail from New York bar Wallflower was inspired by chilled corn soup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with 4 dashes of basil oil. *Jalapeño-infused Del Maguey Vida mezcal: Steep one large washed and slice jalapeño in a 750 mL bottle of Del Maguey Vida mezcal for 4 to 6 hours then remove the jalapeño. **Corn puree: Juice the fresh kernels from 5 to 6 ears of corn (approximately 1 L) in a juicer. In a saucepan over low heat reduce the corn juice to half the volume stirring occasionally. Allow to cool and store refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
Ingredients: Cimarrón reposado tequila;Jalapeño-infused Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Corn puree;Agave syrup (3 parts agave nectar; 1 part water)

Name: Hakushu Highball
About: This smoky modern cocktail is stirred exactly 13.5 times to honor Japanese tradition.
HowToMake: Fill a highball glass with large ice cubes. Pour the Hakushu over the ice. Gently stir the whisky with a bar spoon 13 and a half times. Pour the club soda over the back of the bar spoon and into the highball glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Club soda

Name: Sakura-chan
About: This sake-based cocktail from Warren Lindsay of Andaz Tokyo is inspired by beautiful cherry blossoms.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the Kirsch to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a sake glass over one large piece of ice. Float the Kirsch over top and garnish with a sakura flower and cherry.
Ingredients: Hakkaisan Premium Japanese Sake;Sakura Liqueur;Lemon juice;Kirsch with Griotte Cherries

Name: Kentucky Mule
About: Who says you can’t have your copper mug and your bourbon too? This twist on the Moscow Mule pairs American whiskey and ginger beer for a refreshing summer cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the bourbon and lime juice to a Moscow Mule mug or a highball glass. Fill the mug or glass with ice and top with ginger beer. Add mint sprigs for garnish.
Ingredients: Woodford Reserve bourbon;Fresh lime juice;Ginger beer to top

Name: Prospector
About: This bourbon-and-amaro drink pairs well with holiday spices and can be served warmed up or chilled.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir for 15 seconds and strain into a coupe glass. Express the oils of the lemon twist over the drink and gently drop the twist into the cocktail.
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Averna amaro;Pedro Ximénez sherry;Angostura bitters

Name: Tipperary
About: Put an Irish twist on the Bijou with a little Jameson Irish Whiskey and Green Chartreuse.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Express the oils from an orange peel over the glass and discard.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel Irish whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Green Chartreuse;Angostura bitters;Orange peel

Name: Isaiah Rynders
About: This savory take on the Dark and Stormy has quite a punch—just like its namesake.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a highball glass over one large ice cube. Top with the vanilla soda. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel Irish whiskey;Cardamaro;Connemara cask-strength peated Irish whiskey;Fresh lime juice;Ginger syrup;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco bitters;Tamarind chutney;Vanilla soda

Name: Irish Old Fashioned
About: This cocktail from top bartender Jack McGarry puts an Irish twist on the “original” old fashioned cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel Irish Whiskey;Bénédictine;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: Irish Maid
About: The Irish Maid makes a convincing case for why there should be more whiskey-cucumber cocktails. A riff on the Sam Ross classic the Kentucky Maid the drink is part of a versatile cocktail family that combines a base spirit of your choice with fresh seasonal ingredients. Floral and refreshing the Irish Maid is at your service with a beautiful blend of Irish whiskey St.-Germain citrus and cucumber.
HowToMake: Muddle the cucumber slices in a shaker. Add remaining ingredients and ice to the shaker and shake vigorously. Fine-strain into a chilled rocks glass over ice. Garnish with a cucumber slice.
Ingredients: Cucumber (1/4-inch slices);Irish whiskey;St-Germain;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Rumskey Cocktail -
About: White whiskey and rum join forces in this simple sour cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: White Rumskey;Lemon juice;Ginger liqueur;Simple syrup

Name: Spicy Negron
About: A twist on the classic a little mezcal and ancho chile liqueur gives the Negroni a smoky and spicy finish.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into an Old Fashioned or rocks glass over fresh ice.
Ingredients: Gin;Mezcal;Campari;Sweet vermouth;Ancho chile liqueur;Mole bitters

Name: Taylored Black Russian -
About: Liz Taylor once said that this unlikely combination of ingredients was her favorite cocktail.
HowToMake: Heat the chocolate syrup until warm. Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir. Fill with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. .
Ingredients: Absolut vodka;Kahlúa;Hershey's chocolate syrup

Name: House of Friends -
About: Cocktail consultant Brian Van Flandern created this cocktail in honor of Casamigos creators and friends George Clooney and Rande Gerber.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Casamigos Blanco Tequila;Yellow Chartreuse;Cointreau;Agave nectar;Lime juice

Name: Champagne Passion -
About: This elegant mixture of Champagne and passion fruit was inspired by award-winning actress Ingrid Bergman.
HowToMake: Add the passion fruit puree to a mixing glass. Stir and add in simple syrup then ice. Still stirring slowly add in the Champagne. Strain into a flute and float the Alizé on top.
Ingredients: Passion fruit puree;Simple syrup;Champagne;Alizé

Name: Vickers Valian
About: This vodka cocktail is both sweet and tart.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Double-strain into cocktail glass. Top with splash of grapefruit soda. Garnish with grapefruit peel.
Ingredients: Boru Irish vodka;Celtic honey;Suze;Crème d’framboise;Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice;sugar syrup;Grapefruit soda

Name: Shoe Maker
About: Irish whiskey gets a lighter treatment when paired with fino sherry sugar syrup orange bitters raspberries and orange.
HowToMake: Add the bitters raspberries orange slice and sugar syrup into shaker tin and muddle. Add the whiskey sherry and ice and shake. Double-strain into an Old Fashioned glass over crushed ice. Express the oil from an orange peel and discard. Garnish with 3 mint sprigs and a raspberry.
Ingredients: Knappogue Castle 12-year-old single malt Irish whiskey;Fino sherry;Sugar syrup;Orange bitters;Raspberries;Orange slice;Orange peel

Name: St.Valentine's Tipple
About: Bet you never thought you’d see maple syrup and pineapple juice become best friends?
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Hard shake and strain into coupe glass. Garnish with three drops of Angostura Bitters.
Ingredients: Woodford Reserve Rye Whiskey;Dark maple syrup;Yuzu juice;Pineapple juice

Name: The American Poet
About: Absinthe gives this rye whiskey cocktail something to brag about.
HowToMake: Rinse a Nick and Nora glass or a coupe glass with absinthe. Add remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the Nick and Nora glass or coupe glass rinsed with absinthe. Spray additional absinthe on top if desired. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Woodford Reserve Rye Whiskey;Dolin Sweet Vermouth;Zucca Rhubarb Amaro

Name: The Ambassador
About: You’ll want this complex cocktail representing your interests.
HowToMake: Shaken and served in a cocktail glass. Garnished with lemon oils and a sprig of fresh rosemary.
Ingredients: Woodford Reserve Rye;Lime juice;Orgeat;Fernet Branca;Olorosso sherry;Boker's bitters;Absinthe

Name: Bloody Sherry
About: This cocktail combines blood orange and lemon oleo saccharum with gin and a little sherry to cut the sweetness.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube. Garnish with a rosemary sprig.
Ingredients: Gin;Blood orange oleo saccharum;Fresh lemon juice;Oloroso sherry

Name: Sour Take 2 -
About: Make a homemade sour mix with oleo saccharum and lemon juice to give this drink the punch it deserves.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe glass. *Oleo saccharum sour mix: Using a vegetable peeler or similar tool peel the entire surfaces of 1 grapefruit and 1 lemon into a bowl. Add 4 oz sugar and muddle ensuring that the sugar is worked into the peels well. Let stand for 4 to 6 hours. Push the peels away to the sides of the bowl allowing the oils to gather in the center. Remove the peels and transfer the oleo saccharum into a jar. Add 1/2 cup fresh lemon juice seal and shake until fully combined. Chill before using.
Ingredients: Gin vodka rye whiskey or tequila;Oleo saccharum sour mix

Name: Kumquat Smash -
About: Created by Dimitris Kiakos of the Gin Joint in Athens Greece the Kumquat Smash muddles the small yet flavor-rich citrus fruit into a refreshing gin base.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the kumquats. Add remaining ingredients and ice and shake. Double-strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice. Garnish with 2 kumquats.
Ingredients: Kumquats halved;Fresh lemon juice;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Nutmeg

Name: Smash of the Titans -
About: Bourbon kumquats and oregano make unlikely yet delicious associates in this herbaceous Smash.
HowToMake: Muddle the kumquats and simple syrup in a shaker. Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with 6 Kold-Draft ice cubes. Pour into a frozen rocks glass. Garnish with a wreath of oregano.
Ingredients: Four Roses bourbon;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Kumquats;Oregano leaves

Name: Ginger Smash
About: Top bartenders Jason Kosmas and Dushan Zaric of Employees Only created this complex tequila Smash that melds the bittersweet qualities of kumquats with the inherent spiciness of ginger.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the ginger kumquats and sugar. Add remaining ingredients and fill the shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and pour unstrained into an Old Fashioned glass.
Ingredients: Tequila Cabeza;Rhum Clement Creole Shrub;Lime juice;Ginger root (thin slice);Kumquats;Superfine sugar;Dale DeGroff Pimento Bitters

Name: Kumquat Syru
About: Kumquats are perfect partners for brown spirits. Turn the bittersweet fruit into an inspired cocktail syrup and shake it into a fresh Whiskey Sour or a warming Hot Toddy.
HowToMake: Add the water and sugar to a medium sized saucepan and bring to a low boil. Add the kumquats. Press down using a potato masher to release more flavor from the fruit. Bring back to a low boil and turn the heat off. Allow the mixture to cool and strain it into a clean container. Mix in the vodka to preserve for up to one month.
Ingredients: White sugar;Water;Kumquats cut in quarters;Vodka

Name: Waiting Roo
About: For the cocktail lover on hiatus the Waiting Room offers a sophisticated mocktail inspired by the soda fountain. Pineapple gomme syrup delivers a silky mouthfeel similar to that of booze and acid phosphate provides all the acidic punch of citrus with none of the sugar.
HowToMake: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice add the syrup acid phosphate and bitters. Shake well until chilled. Add the cream and more ice and shake again for about 20 seconds. Strain into a Collins glass and top with the seltzer. .
Ingredients: Pineapple gomme syrup;Acid phosphate;Pimento bitters;Heavy cream;Seltzer

Name: Hemingway Daiquiri
About: Ernest Hemingway is inspiration not author of the Hemingway Daiquiri aka Papa Doble. His request for a Daiquiri made with half the sugar and double the booze created an unbalanced drink: one that bartenders couldn’t help but right through the eventual addition of maraschino liqueur and grapefruit juice. To reinstate some of Hemingway’s influence this recipe uses key lime juice and goes for a whir in the blender as the earliest Daiquiris were served over crushed ice.
HowToMake: Serves 8. Add all ingredients into a blender with ice and pulse the blender until the drink has a slushy consistency. Divide the contents of the blender between 8 wine glasses. Garnish each with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: White rum;Key lime juice;Grapefruit juice;Maraschino liqueur;Simple syrup

Name: Dulce Y Picant
About: Want something spicy? Sweet? This cocktail gives you both.
HowToMake: Rim a double Old Fashioned glass with paprika sea salt. Muddle the cilantro in a mixing glass then add the jalapeño slice and gently muddle again. Add the remaining ingredients to the mixing glass and shake well. Double-strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a pineapple leaf.
Ingredients: Cilantro;Jalapeño slice;Hornitos Plata tequila;Green Chartreuse liqueur;Pineapple juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water);Fresh lime juice

Name: Hornitos Watermelon Palom
About: Rim a Collins glass with a paprika sea salt mixture. Add all ingredients to a mixing glass except the seltzer and fill with ice. Shake well and add the seltzer to the mixing glass. Double strain into the rimmed Collins glass and garnish with watermelon wedge.
HowToMake: Rim a Collins glass with a paprika sea salt mixture. Add all ingredients to a mixing glass except the seltzer and fill with ice. Shake well and add the seltzer to the mixing glass. Double strain into the rimmed Collins glass and garnish with watermelon wedge.
Ingredients: Hornitos Plata Tequila;Watermelon juice;Agave nectar;Fresh lime juice;Cilantro;Sea salt;Seltzer
Garnish: Watermelon wedge and paprika sea salt rim

Name: The Paloma
About: Think the Margarita is the ultimate Mexican cocktail? Think again. The Paloma is a quick and easy classic that can be made right in the glass. Whether drinking solo or with company this drink will fulfill all your tequila needs.Make it a meal with this taco soup recipe.
HowToMake: Add the tequila lime juice and salt into a highball glass over ice. Top off with the grapefruit soda and stir. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Tequila;Fresh lime juice;Pinch of salt (to taste);Grapefruit soda to top (Jarritos or Squirt work best)

Name: Brillig Rosemary-Pomegranate Soda -
About: Swap that tired vodka-cranberry combo for a refreshing glass of this fizzy pomegranate mocktail instead.
HowToMake: Fill a Collins glass one-third of the way with ice. Add the pomegranate juice and simple syrup. Fill the glass to the rim with seltzer and stir gently.  Add more juice or syrup to taste. Garnish with a rosemary sprig and serve.
Ingredients: Pomegranate juice;Rosemary simple syrup;Seltzer

Name: Black Magic -
About: The hangover-smashing Black Magic cocktail combines beet juice with activated charcoal—the latest detox trend that claims to help dispel unwanted toxins. Don’t be turned off by the jet-black hue the charcoal itself is tasteless.
HowToMake: In a small bowl break apart the charcoal capsules and discard the outer layer. Whisk together the charcoal and honey syrup until combined (it will be jet black in color). In a shaker combine the charcoal-honey syrup with the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: mg Activated charcoal (two 260mg capsules);Honey syrup (one part honey one part water);Fresh lime juice;Beet juice

Name: Cave Creek -
About: The Cave Creek cocktail is made with New York Distilling Company’s Rock & Rye—a bottled combination of rye whiskey sugar and citrus that was all the rage in the 19th century when it was made with rock candy.
HowToMake: Shake all ingredients over ice. Add one ounce of chilled club soda and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon twist and serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Mister Katz’s Rock & Rye;Glenlivet 12-Year Scotch Whisky;Fresh lemon juice;Real grenadine;Campari

Name: Gin-Free & Tonic
About: Swearing off the sauce for a while? This surprising mocktail mimics the herbal quality of a Gin & Tonic minus the booze with help from a simple syrup made with juniper berries lemon peel and loose black tea.
HowToMake: Combine the juniper syrup and lemon juice in a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with the tonic water and stir to combine. Garnish with a lemon wheel and serve.
Ingredients: Juniper syrup;Lemon juice;High quality tonic water

Name: Not So Innocent
About: Chicago cocktail consultant Revae Schneider is fond of anything with rum lemon maple syrup and a little bit of bitters served warm. Set this fragrant punch on the stovetop before guests arrive and let the comforting scent waft as they walk in the door. Or transfer to an ice-filled punch bowl if the weather’s still warm.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the bitters into a large saucepan over medium heat and stir to blend. Once warm transfer to a punch bowl for serving or ladle into glasses directly from the pot. Add 2 dashes of the bitters to each punch cup. Serve warm or transfer to an ice-filled punch bowl for warmer weather. *Maple simple syrup: Add 1/2 cup maple syrup and 1/2 cup water to a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Strain into a jar and seal tightly with a lid. Syrup will keep refrigerated for about one month.
Ingredients: Rum;Maple simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Apple cider;Angostura bitters

Name: All-Purpose Eggnog -
About: This interchangeable eggnog recipe allows you to swap in your favorite base spirit or mix of spirits to create the perfect personalized punch. It’s easily multiplied to serve any size party which means it’s the only ‘nog you need this season.
HowToMake: In the bowl of a stand mixer or with a hand mixer beat egg yolks at medium-high speed until thick and pale yellow. Slowly add two-thirds of a cup of the powdered sugar (save one-third for later) and beat until fully dissolved. Add the rum (or other spirits) milk heavy cream nutmeg and almond extract and stir to combine.In a separate bowl beat the egg whites until they maintain soft peaks. Gradually add the remaining one-third cup of powdered sugar and beat until incorporated and stiff peaks form. Gently whisk the egg whites into the eggnog mixture. Chill and serve in a punch bowl. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg sprinkled on top.
Ingredients: Large eggs separated;Powdered sugar;Dark rum (can substitute bourbon or brandy or a mix);Whole milk;Heavy cream;Nutmeg;Almond extract

Name: Ready Fire Aim - Mezcal
About: Mezcal shoots to kill in Steve Schneider’s smoky cocktail that’s bolstered by chile-tinged bitters and a homemade honey-pineapple syrup for sweet balance.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a grind of pink peppercorn.
Ingredients: Joven mezcal;Honey-pineapple syrup;Pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Bittermens Hellfire habanero shrub

Name: Spiced Pumpkin Fli
About: This seasonal riff on the classic Flip features pumpkin flavor in two forms.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker and dry-shake until combined. Add ice and shake very hard until chilled and frothy. Strain into a rocks glass. Top with grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Amaretto;Pumpkin ale;Agave nectar;Pumpkin butter;Whole egg

Name: Tomahawk Punc
About: The ultimate bubbly fall punch best served in a pumpkin punch bowl.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a large punch bowl or hollowed-out pumpkin. Add large ice cubes and top with the sparkling cider. Float thinly sliced lime and lemon wheels on top. Garnish with grated nutmeg and cinnamon.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur;Honey syrup;Fresh lime juice strained;Angostura bitters;Sparkling cider;Large pumpkin top sliced off and insides removed

Name: The Joy Divisio
About: With gin cointreau and a touch of absinthe this pleasure won’t remain unknown for long.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Beefeater London dry gin;Dolin dry vermouth;Cointreau;Vieux Pontarlier Absinthe

Name: Flannel
About: Cognac and apple cider are shaken into this ice-cold but warming cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass over a large ice cube. Garnish with an orange peel. *Apple cider syrup:​ ​In a medium saucepan bring 4 cups​ freshly pressed ​​​a​pple cider​ to a boil. Reduce heat and continue to simmer uncovered stirring occasionally until liquid has reduced to ​1 cup (about 1 hour). Remove from heat and ​let​ cool. Store refrigerated for up to ​2 weeks. ​Makes 8 ​servings.​.
Ingredients: Cognac;Apple cider syrup;Allspice dram;Orange juice

Name: Proven Perfect
About: Port Fernet Branca and cardamom-infused bitter liqueur take a bourbon cocktail to uncharted territory.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the lemon peel to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail or coupe glass. Express lemon oils over cocktail and discard the peel. Garnish with a cherry.%Oolong teainfused ruby port:I steeped loose tea (Wuyi Oolong tea and a small amount of rooibos tea) into Graham's 6 grapes port.For every 20 ounces of port I added 8 ounces of dry oolong tea and 1 ounce of rooibos (measured out by my jigger I am not sure how the conversion of wet to dry ounces are). I let this steep for about 18 minutes. The oolong flavor is definitely prominent by the end.%Cardamom-infused Amèr Nouvelle:For this I added a crushed (green) pod to each ounce of liqueur and let it steep about 25 minutes. I would taste as I infuse though as cardamom pods can vary in strength. One infusion timing test I did went only 19 minutes. The flavor added is very light and gentle.
Ingredients: Woodford Reserve bourbon;Oolong teainfused ruby port;Cardamom-infused Amèr Nouvelle;Fernet Branca;Lemon peel

Name: Black & Ginger
About: This rum-based drink takes less than five minutes to prepare.
HowToMake: Add the rum to a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with ginger ale and bitters and garnish with a lime wedge. .
Ingredients: Mount Gay Black Barrel Rum;Ginger ale;Angostura bitters

Name: Black Barrel Sazerac
About: We’ll bet you never expected this tasty twist on the traditional New Orleans recipe.
HowToMake: Rinse a rocks glass with absinthe and discard the extra liquid leaving a light coating in the glass. Add remaining ingredients to a separate mixing glass filled with ice. Stir and strain into the absinthe-rinsed rocks glass (no ice). Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Mount Gay Black Barrel Rum;Agave syrup (one part agave nectar one part water);White crème de cacao;Peychaud's Bitters;Angostura bitters;Absinthe

Name: The Black Key
About: Drinking this rum-based cocktail is a dark rich experience.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and shake (without ice) for 10 to 15 seconds. Add ice and shake again for 30 to 45 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass over a large piece of ice and garnish with a lemon peel and a maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Mount Gay Black Barrel Rum;Pure maple syrup;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: The Mount Gay Old Fashioned
About: Prefer rum to whiskey? This twist on the old timey classic will cure all your ailments.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass lightly muddle the orange peel with the rum and sugar. Remove the peel and add bitters and ice. Stir and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with the orange slice and cherry.
Ingredients: Mount Gay Extra Old Rum;Angostura bitters;Sugar;Orange peel

Name: The Mount Gay Black Barrel Manhattan
About: Try this Caribbean take on the classic rye whiskey drink.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled rocks glass (no ice). Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Ingredients: Mount Gay Black Barrel Rum;Sweet vermouth;Dry vermouth;Bitters

Name: NOLET’S Silver Clover Club -
About: Sweet tart citrusy and delicious.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker. Dry shake until emulsified (about one minute). Add ice and shake again vigorously. Double strain into a chilled Martini or coupe glass and garnish with three raspberries.
Ingredients: NOLET'S Silver Dry Gin;Fresh lemon juice;Raspberry simple syrup ;Egg white

Name: House of Payn
About: This recipe from all-star New York bartender Phil Ward appears in Death & Co Modern Classic Cocktails with More Than 500 Recipes.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass gently muddle the raspberries. Add the remaining ingredients to the mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and double strain into a double rocks glass over a few fresh ice cubes. Garnish with a raspberry.
Ingredients: Raspberries;Beefeater dry gin;Plymouth Sloe Gin;Campari

Name: The Celfi
About: This light and refreshing cocktail is perfect for brunch.
HowToMake: Add cardamom pod and cucumber wheel to a shaker and muddle.  Add remaining ingredients (except for the soda) and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with soda water leaving room for garnish.Make a small lengthwise cut in the half celery stalk and place on the rim of the cocktail. Slap the remaining mint sprigs on the palm of your hand to release the aromas and use them to garnish the drink.
Ingredients: Cardamom pod;Cucumber wheel;Mint sprigs;NOLET\'S Silver Dry Gin;Green Chartreuse;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Celery juice;Soda
Garnish: 1 Half of a celery stalk and a few mint sprigs

Name: Dizzy Blonde Negron
About: Pre-batch this fizzy cocktail in a soda siphon and serve at a fall party.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to an ice-cold one-quart soda siphon. Charge the siphon with a CO2 charger shake then pour into a rocks glass filled with cracked ice. Garnish with a grapefruit twist a star anise pod and a cinnamon stick.Note: Keep all ingredients cold as it helps with the fizz.
Ingredients: Gin;Aperol;Dry vermouth;Cointreau;Water
Garnish: 1 Grapefruit twists star anise pods cinnamon sticks

Name: Gotham
About: Even whiskey drinkers can enjoy vodka with this Manhattan-inspired concoction.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Hangar One Straight vodka;Cocchi Americano Rosa vermouth;Ramazzotti amaro;Orange bitters

Name: Weekend Getaway -
About: Transport yourself to tropical island with this vodka cocktail that has just a hint of tiki.
HowToMake: In a shaker briefly muddle the basil leaves. Add remaining ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a basil leaf.
Ingredients: Basil leaves;Club soda;Absolut vodka;Pineapple syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Golden Handcuffs -
About: Vodka and peach liqueur combine to create a cocktail so enticing you won’t want to let it out of your sight.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon twist. .
Ingredients: Regan's No. 6 Orange Bitters;Dry vermouth;Rothman & Winter Orchard Peach Liqueur;Dry curaçao;Absolut vodka

Name: Hubble’s Law -
About: Absolut Vodka makes an unexpected friend of Amaro Montenegro in this finely balanced libation.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel. .
Ingredients: Absolut vodka;Fresh lime juice;Amaro Montenegro;Brown sugar syrup (1 part brown sugar 1 part water)

Name: Celebrity Crush -
About: This cocktail is the next best thing to a bouquet of roses.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Absolut vodka;Pamplemousse Rose Liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh grapefruit juice

Name: Falken’s Maz
About: Absolut Vodka is a sturdy base for this unique concoction of lime vanilla and Crème Yvette.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Orange bitters;Vanilla syrup;Crème Yvette;Fresh lime juice;Absolut vodka

Name: Van Leer Rose
About: This bourbon-based cocktail is on the menu at Louisville Kentucky’s watering hole The Monkey Wrench.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass express lemon over top. For a lighter version serve the drink over fresh ice with a slice of lemon.
Ingredients: Bonded bourbon;Esprit de June liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Grenadine (Wilks and Wilson or any traditional grenadine with a touch of rose water);Angostura bitters;Abbots bitters

Name: Queen Rose -
About: Absolut Vodka and the bitter aperitif Aperol combine to make this complex citrusy cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with an orange wheel. .
Ingredients: Club soda

Name: Frosty Mule
About: Yellow Chartreuse adds extra spice to this classic ginger-and-vodka cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a copper mug filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Club soda to top;Fresh lemon juice;Ginger syrup;Yellow Chartreuse;Vodka

Name: Kamikaze
About: The Kamikaze was designed to cut to the chase. Invented on an American naval base in Japan after World War II and made popular during the great reign of vodka of the 1970s and ’80s the Kamikaze isn’t the kind of cocktail bartenders sit around contemplating in hushed reverent tones.In fact it’s not really a cocktail at all. The combination of vodka lime juice and orange liqueur is served ice-cold as a shot and consumed more often than not in less time than it takes to assemble.Which is not to suggest you approach the task haphazardly. The key to mixing a great shooter is to strip out the loose ends and focus on the bold and bracing. Its journey after all is a fast one. This recipe calls for a full two ounces of vodka and fresh lime juice as opposed to sour mix or Rose’s lime cordial neither of which delivers the same tangy bite that gives the Kamikaze its backbone. Be sure to shake thoroughly for at least 10 seconds and double-strain to sift out any ice shards. In the end you’ll have enough for two shots because cutting to the chase is a team sport.
HowToMake: Makes 2 shots. Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake thoroughly until well-chilled. Double-strain into two shot glasses.
Ingredients: Vodka;Orange liqueur;Fresh lime juice

Name: Piña Colada
About: The Piña Colada gets a bad rap among cocktail connoisseurs. For years it was the poster child of the blender boom a symbol of poolside bars and booze cruises. But the tropical classic—a blend of rum coconut pineapple and lime juice—dates back more than a half century when it was the drink of the day in San Juan Puerto Rico. Our recipe silences the blender blades and instead calls for pebble ice and a nice sturdy shake.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously (20-30 seconds). Strain into a chilled Hurricane glass over pebble ice. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and pineapple leaf.
Ingredients: Light rum;Cream of coconut;Pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice

Name: Whiskey Sour
About: Spirit sugar citrus—the original big three—come together in the Whiskey Sour whose history stretches back to the Lincoln administration. Few drinks in the cocktail canon are as quick to satisfy and endlessly mutable as the Whiskey Sour. Add a flourish to any component and you have your own personal spin on the classic. We like our Whiskey Sour thickened with egg white and a few dashes of aromatic bitters for a complementary spice note.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with 3 dashes of Angostura bitters.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Egg white (optional)

Name: D’USSÉ Angel’s Shoulde
About: This complex cognac cocktail might just become your new favorite drink.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube. Top with a red wine float.
Ingredients: D'Ussé V.S.O.P. Cognac;Lemon juice;Rosemary simple syrup;Amaretto;Combier Crème de Pêche;Bénédictine;Red wine (Côtes du Rhône)

Name: D’USSÉ Motow
About: One sip of this cognac-based sipper and you’ll be dancing the night away to your favorite Motown tunes.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a slice of lemon peel.
Ingredients: D'Ussé V.S.O.P. Cognac;Lemon juice;Luxardo Amaretto;Rothman & Winter Orchard Apricot

Name: The Swindle -
About: Don’t worry; you won’t be swindled out of a great night if you have this riff on the traditional Whiskey Sour in hand.
HowToMake: Add bourbon simple syrup and fresh lemon juice to a Collins glass filled with crushed ice. Top with bitters and garnish with mint. .
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Simple syrup;Lemon juice;Angostura bitters;Peychaud's Bitters

Name: Pressing Charges -
About: This bourbon cocktail will get you out of any sticky situation.
HowToMake: Add bourbon ginger ale and soda water to an old fashioned glass and fill with ice. Float bitters on top.
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Ginger ale;Soda water;Peychaud's Bitters

Name: The Lock Pick -
About: This iced tea-and-bourbon cocktail is the key to great night.
HowToMake: Add bourbon PAMA and lemon juice to a Collins glass and fill with ice. Top with the tea (and simple syrup if necessary) and garnish with a lemon slice.
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Pama Pomegranate liqueur;Lemon juice;Iced tea (recommended: orange pekoe);Simple syrup optional

Name: 5 to 10 -
About: This riff on the classic Manhattan will make you feel like you’re up to no good.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Sweet vermouth;Angostura bitters;Regan's Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Smoky Sour
About: This tantalizing cocktail is a smoky and frothy twist on the traditional Whiskey Sour.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake for 10 seconds until drink is frothy and strain into a coupe glass.
Ingredients: Tincup whiskey;Fresh lemon juice;Cinnamon bark syrup;Lapsang souchong tea syrup;Egg white

Name: Creole Crusta
About: For football season we have presented a drink by a bartender from each NFL team’s hometown. Bartender Alba Huerta is a major player in the Houston eating and drinking scene (Anvil Julep The Pastry War) and reps hometown pride for the Houston Texans with this chile-flake-infused cocktail.
HowToMake: Mix together the turbinado sugar and toasted benne seeds. Coat the rim of a cocktail glass with lemon juice and coat it in the sugar and seed mixture. Add remaining ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Double-strain into the rimmed cocktail glass and garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Demerara rum;Chile-flake-infused Clement Créole Shrubb orange liqueur;Turbinado sugar syrup (2 parts sugar 1 part water);Bittercube Bolivar bitters;Toasted benne seeds;Turbinado sugar;Freshly squeezed lemon juice

Name: Silver Clou
About: Lavender peach and gin makes this cocktail perfect for any sunny day.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and dry shake. Add ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a sprig of dried lavender.
Ingredients: NOLET'S Silver Dry Gin;Peach shrub;Lavender simple syrup;Lemon juice;Egg white

Name: Classic Bijou
About: This classic gin drink named for the French word for “jewel” will put a twinkle in your eye.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Sweet vermouth;Green Chartreuse;Orange bitters

Name: Basil Hayden's Maple Sour
About: This unique twist on a Whiskey Sour uses maple syrup port and Bittermens Molé Bitters.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a double Old Fashioned glass with ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cherry.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden\'s Bourbon;Tawny port;Lemon juice;Grade B maple syrup;Bittermens Molé Bitters

Name: Bijou
About: This boozy classic is named for the French word for jewel.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Sweet vermouth;Green Chartreuse;Campari

Name: Tarragon Simple Syrup Recip
About: This garden-fresh simple syrup recipe will add a hint of tarragon to your favorite cocktails.
HowToMake: Combine the sugar and boiling water. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the tarragon leaves and steep in hot simple syrup for 20 minutes. Strain into a clean jar cover and refrigerate for up to two weeks.
Ingredients: Turbinado sugar;Boiling water;large tarragon leaves

Name: Mint Simple Syrup Recip
About: This garden-fresh simple syrup recipe will add a refreshing hit of mint to your favorite cocktails.
HowToMake: Combine the sugar and mint in a bowl. Add 1/2 cup boiling water and stir until sugar is dissolved. Steep the mint leaves for 15 minutes. Strain into a jar cover and refrigerate for up to 2 weeks.
Ingredients: Turbinado sugar;Fresh mint leaves

Name: Basil Simple Syrup Recip
About: This garden-fresh simple syrup recipe will add a hint of basil to your favorite cocktails.
HowToMake: Combine the sugar and boiling water. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the basil leaves and steep in hot simple syrup for 15 minutes. Strain into a clean jar cover and refrigerate for up to two weeks.
Ingredients: Turbinado sugar;Boiling water;Packed fresh basil leaves

Name: Green Derby
About: This Rocky Mountain variation on the traditional Brown Derby recipe combines TINCUP Whiskey and grapefruit juice.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Tincup whiskey;Grapefruit juice;Grade A maple syrup;Ginger syrup;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco Bitters

Name: Jewel Mine
About: This sweet and tart cocktail is made with a blend of whiskey and pomegranate liqueur.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients except for the tonic water in a rocks glass. Fill with ice and top with tonic water. Garnish with a cucumber wheel.
Ingredients: Tincup whiskey;Pama pomegranate liqueur;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco bitters;Tonic water to top

Name: Rocky Manhattan
About: Try this fresh take on the timeless Manhattan.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a rocks glass and fill with ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Tincup whiskey;Leopold Bros. Georgia Peach whiskey;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco bitters

Name: Amsterdam 75
About: Swap gin for genever to get this twist on the classic French 75.
HowToMake: Add the genever simple syrup and lemon juice into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Champagne flute. Top with the Champagne or sparkling wine. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Genever;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice strained;Champagne or sparkling wine to top

Name: VEEV Collins - cocktail recip
About: Give the classic Collins cocktail an update with a measure of VEEV Spirit.
HowToMake: Add VEEV lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass. Fill glass with ice and top with the soda. Garnish with a lemon wedge and mint sprig.
Ingredients: VEEV spirit;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Soda

Name: Greyhound
About: Think a Greyhound is just grapefruit juice and gin? Think again.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.
Ingredients: VEEV spirit;Aperol;Grapefruit juice;Peychuad's Bitters

Name: Martini 2.0
About: A twist on the classic.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Express orange and lemon oils over the drink and garnish with the peels.
Ingredients: VEEV spirit;Martini Bianco Vermouth;Gary Reagan's Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Revive Lemonade
About: Take your boozy lemonade to the next level.
HowToMake: Muddle ginger in cocktail shaker. Add all other ingredients and fill shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass. Fill glass with fresh ice and garnish with ginger candy or lemon wedge.
Ingredients: VEEV spirit;Ginger;Fresh lemon juice (juice of 2 wedges);Agave nectar;Coconut water
Garnish: 1 Skewered ginger candy or lemon wedge

Name: Martinez
About: Part Manhattan and part Martini the Martinez has appeared in cocktail books going all the way back to 1884. The recipe that most resembles the one served today comes from legendary bartender Jerry Thomas and includes Old Tom gin a sweeter take on the juniper spirit. The story goes that Thomas himself might have invented the cocktail for a customer traveling to the port city of Martinez Calif. The city of Martinez however insists that a local bartender concocted the drink. It’s a juicy mystery and one best pondered over what else but a Martinez.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Gin preferably Old Tom style;Sweet vermouth;Angostura bitters

Name: Courvoisier Smash
About: This cognac cocktail is as easy-to-make as it is delicious.
HowToMake: Muddle the mint and lemon in a highball glass then fill with ice. Add the cognac and mint syrup. Stir and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Courvoisier VS cognac;Mint syrup;Lemon cut into quarter;Mint leaves

Name: An Afternoon in France
About: A bit of honey syrup is the secret to this summer cognac and citrus punch.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube. Garnish with grapefruit and a lemon twists.
Ingredients: Courvoisier VS cognac;Fresh grapefruit juice;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup (one part honey one part water)

Name: Por Mi Amante -
About: Strawberry-infused rum is a must in this summer cocktail with just a hint of spice.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Strawberry-infused Rhum Barbancourt;Lemon juice;Strawberry demerara syrup;Tabasco

Name: El Chapo
About: You’ve never had a strawberry cocktail like this before.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice. Top with the beer. Garnish with 2 speared fresh strawberry slices.
Ingredients: Strawberry-infused Aperol;Stiegl-Radler grapefruit beer to top

Name: Wild Strawberry Amaro -
About: You’ll gain a new appreciation for amaro in this cocktail with hints of strawberry and vanilla.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: Strawberry-infused blanco tequila;Campari;Cocchi Americano Rosa;Vanilla extract

Name: Strawberry Pisco Sour
About: Like the traditional Pisco Sour? You’ll really love this fruit-filled take on the classic.
HowToMake: Add pisco lime juice and the strawberry-rose syrup to a blender and add two scoops of ice. Blend for 20 seconds. Add egg white and blend again for five to 10 seconds. Strain through a coarse strainer into glasses.
Ingredients: Pisco;Fresh lime juice;Strawberry-rose syrup;Egg white

Name: Cosmopolitan 1934 -
About: With some homemade raspberry syrup and NOLET’S Finest Gin you can take this classic to the next level.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into a large coupe. Garnish with zest from a flamed orange peel and a dehydrated orange wheel (a fresh orange wheel can also be used).
Ingredients: NOLET'S Silver Gin;Cointreau;Lemon juice;Raspberry syrup;Dehydrated orange wheel
Garnish: 1 Orange zest from a flamed orange peel

Name: Spiced Apple Fizz -
About: In this cocktail from all-star New York mixologist Naren Young ZU pairs wonderfully with pear brandy cider fresh lemon juice and honey syrup. You’ll crave this delightful drink on boiling hot afternoons.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients (except the cider) to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Top with hard apple cider and garnish with an apple fan and fresh grated cinnamon.
Ingredients: ZU Bison Grass Vodka;Poire Williams Pear Brandy;Lemon juice;Honey syrup;Hard apple cider;Fresh grated cinnamon

Name: The Count of Żubrówka -
About: What do you get when you combine ZU Bison Grass Vodka Amaro Montenegro and hard apple cider? This regal cocktail thought up by respected Denver bartender Sean Kenyon. It’s piquant and coolingboth qualities of a great summer drink. Plus when you drink it you’ll feel like nobility.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients (except the cider) to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Top with Ace Hard Apple Cider and garnish with an apple fan. .
Ingredients: ZU Bison Grass Vodka;Amaro Montenegro;Lemon juice;Ace Hard Apple Cider

Name: Absinthe Frappe -
About: New to absinthe? This classic cocktail is for you.
HowToMake: In a cocktail shaker add the absinthe and anisette. Fill with ice and shake well until chilled. Strain into a julep cup filled with crushed ice. Top with additional ice and garnish with the mint sprig.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Anisette

Name: Symphony
About: It’s a very simple drink on all fronts yet very complexand some might say that’s the beauty of it.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and stir. Strain into a goblet.
Ingredients: Laird's Applejack brandy;Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Lustau Pedro Ximénez sherry
Brands: Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Laird's Applejack brandy;Lustau Pedro Ximénez Sherry

Name: The Mary Mac -
About: The botanicals of Pimms No. 1 play ping-pong with hard cider and ZU Bison Grass Vodka’s notes of vanilla and coconut to make a refreshing cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients (except the cider) to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds and strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Top with cider. Garnish with a cucumber slice a blackberry a strawberry and a blade of bison grass.
Ingredients: Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Dolin Blanc;Pimms No. 1;ZU Bison Grass Vodka;Angry Orchard Hard Cider
Garnish: 1 Cucumber slice;Blackberry;Strawberry;1 Blade of bison grass (optional)

Name: Grassland Wallow - cocktail recip
About: Combine ZU Bison Grass Vodka with hard apple cider for a seasonal vodka cocktail that is citrusy crisp and ultra refreshing.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the cider to a pilsner glass. Add pebbled ice and stir until the outside of the glass frosts. Top with more ice and the cider. Garnish with a sprig of mint and seasonal berries.
Ingredients: ZU Bison Grass Vodka;Carpano Bianco Vermouth;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Square Mile Hard Cider

Name: Rosé Cobbler
About: This refreshing cocktail is low in alcohol and high in flavor.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a stemmed cobbler glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with mixed berries a mint sprig and powdered sugar.
Ingredients: Aperol;Rhubarb shrub;Strawberry purée;Fresh lemon juice;Rhubarb bitters

Name: Garden Gin & Tonic
About: This Gin & Tonic is summer in a glass.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the tonic to a goblet or wine glass and fill with fresh ice. Top with tonic water and garnish with grapefruit and lemon wheels cucumber slices strawberries and a lavender sprig.
Ingredients: Beefeater gin;Dolin blanc vermouth;Orange bitters;Tonic water to top

Name: Bee's Knees
About: Gin lemon juice and honey create a buzzworthy cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist. *Honey syrup: Add 1/2 cup honey and 1/2 cup water to a small saucepan over medium heat. (You can experiment and decide how much of a honey flavor you want in your syrup. The more honey you use the thicker the syrup and stronger in flavor it will be.) Stir until blended. Strain into a jar and seal tightly with a lid. Will keep for 1 month in the refrigerator.
Ingredients: Gin;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup

Name: RumChata on the Rock
About: There’s no easier way to drink RumChata than on the rocks.
HowToMake: Pack a rocks glass with ice and add RumChata.
Ingredients: RumChata

Name: RumChata Martin
About: You’ll savor every flavorful sip of this Martini.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: RumChata;Vanilla vodka

Name: RumChata Root Beer Floa
About: Try RumChata’s take on the classic Root Beer Float.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a Rocks glass filled with fresh ice and stir to combine.
Ingredients: RumChata;Root beer (A&W or Dad’s Root Beer)

Name: Two-Step Easy Brandied Cherrie
About: You won’t find a simpler recipe for flavor-packed brandied cherries.
HowToMake: Drain the liquid from the contents of the jar of cherries by suspending a strainer over a container or bowl. Dis­card the liquid (or save it to use in another drink) and return the cherries to the jar. Add the cognac amaretto and maraschino liqueur. Reseal the jar and shake gently to combine the ingredients. Add a label with the date and store the jar in the fridge for at least one month before using.
Ingredients: Jar of Amarena cherries;Cognac or brandy;Amaretto;Maraschino liqueur

Name: Daniel Shoemaker’s Brandied Cherrie
About: These flavorful brandied cherries are worth the extra work.
HowToMake: Clear away anything that you don't want to get spattered with cherry juice. It sprays and it stains even when you're careful so wear an old t-shirt. Pull off the stems and punch out the pits of the cherries with a cherry pitter. Bring to a simmer stirring just until the sugar is dis­solved. Add the spice bundle and continue to simmer for about 5 minutes.	Add the cherries. Using the slotted spoon stir the cherries until they are all soaked in the syrup and are thor­oughly warmed. (You don't want to actually cook the cherries just let them absorb the syrup.) Return the liquid and cherries to a simmer and pour in the brandy rum and bourbon stirring to mix. When the liquid is warmed through remove the pot from the heat. (Be sure not to boil the liquid because you don't want to cook off too much alcohol.)	Using a wide-mouth funnel or jar filler and a slotted spoon pack each canning jar with cherries filling it to the top. Give the jar a good tap on the counter to settle the fruit so there are minimal air gaps. Ladle the hot syrup into the jars up to about half an inch from the rim. Place the flat part of the lid on the jar and screw the band on lightly. Allow them to cool and let the seals form properly. You'll hear a nice pop as the vacuum forms and the lid is sucked down. Tighten the rings of all the jars that have sealed properly.
Ingredients: Ripe firm sweet Cherries;Juniper berries whole;Allspice berries whole;Cinnamon sticks lightly crushed;Star anise whole;Sugar;Fresh lemon juice strained;Water;Brandy;White rum;Bourbon

Name: Santa Catarina Shandy Drink Recip
About: Shandies and other simple beer cocktails are popular in Germany where they are called Biermischgetränke.
HowToMake: Add the cachaça lemon juice and honey syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass. Add 5 or 6 ice cubes to the glass and top with beer pouring gently so it doesn't foam over. Stir briefly and garnish with a few grinds of pink peppercorn.
Ingredients: Leblon cachaça;Fresh lemon juice;Honey syrup (2 parts honey 1 part water);Leipziger Göse Beer

Name: Tea & C Time
About: This drink combines England’s deep history and ties with tea with the Brazilian sugarcane spirit cachaça.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and shake without ice. Fill with ice shake again and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda.
Ingredients: Leblon cachaça;Lime juice;Earl Grey tea syrup (1 part sugar 1 part brewed Earl Grey tea);Giffard Vanille de Madagascar Liqueur;Cream;Egg white;Fever Tree Club Soda

Name: The Pineapple Mint Caipirinha
About: Try this recipe for an extra summery twist on the classic Caipirinha.
HowToMake: Muddle the pineapple mint and sugar in a shaker. Fill the shaker with ice and add Leblon Cachaça. Shake vigorously. Serve in a rocks glass. Garnish with a pineapple wedge.
Ingredients: 1.5 inch Pineapple chunks;Mint leaves;Simple syrup;Leblon cachaça

Name: Peppermint Tea Syru
About: This easy-to-make peppermint syrup is a versatile base for spring entertaining.
HowToMake: In a saucepan bring the water to a boil. Add peppermint tea bags and steep for 3 minutes. Remove the tea bags and add the sugar stirring until it dissolves. Let the syrup cool; it can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Ingredients: Peppermint tea;Water;Sugar

Name: Bone Machine
About: Try this bourbon and sherry creation from a top San Francisco bartender.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass filled with ice add the bourbon sherry amaro Bénédictine and both bitters and stir. Strain into an old- fashioned glass filled with one large ice cube. Flame the orange peel over the glass and add. Serve.
Ingredients: Bulleit bourbon;La Bodega Oloroso Sherry;Amaro Nonino;Bénédictine;Angostura bitters;Regan's orange bitters

Name: Greenhouse
About: This tequila cocktail made with snap pea shrub and mint is a true culinary masterpiece.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake very hard and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Green Chartreuse;Dry vermouth;Pea Shrub;Lime juice;Mint leaves

Name: Green Margarita -
About: This twist on the classic Margarita recipe uses a delicious sugar snap pea puree.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Combier;St-Germain;Fresh lime juice;Pea purée

Name: Spring 2014 -
About: This cocktail combines spring flavors like lemon thyme verjus and sugar snap peas.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the pea pods. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and double-strain into a large coupe glass. Garnish with a sprig of lemon thyme resting across the rim.
Ingredients: Sugar snap pea pods;Krogstad Aquavit;Pernod absinthe;Manzanilla sherry;Lime juice;Lemon Thyme Syrup%;Verjus;Maldon salt or other sea salt

Name: Green Giant -
About: Prepare to be hit with a wave of perfect spring refreshment.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the pea pods tarragon and simple syrup. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and fine-strain into a frozen rocks glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with 2 sugar snap pea pods.
Ingredients: Sugar snap pea pods;Hayman's Old Tom Gin;Simple syrup;Tarragon leaves;Dry vermouth;Lemon juice

Name: Grasshopper
About: The Grasshopper cocktail is a minty classic that is better than your traditional dessert.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Grate fresh nutmeg directly over the center of the drink.
Ingredients: Green crème de menthe;White crème de cacao;Heavy cream

Name: Holy Guac-a-Mary Bloody Mary Recip
About: Tequila and tomatillo “salsa” take this Bloody Mary to Mexico.
HowToMake: Add the tequila to a Collins glass. Fill glass with crushed or pebble ice add the tomatillo salsa mixture and stir well. Garnish with a tomatillo wheel.
Ingredients: Casa Noble Silver;Tomatillo "salsa"

Name: New York Sour
About: Top a classic Whiskey Sour with red wine to get this delicious pre-Prohibition tipple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the wine to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Carefully pour the wine over the back of a spoon so it floats on top of the drink.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey or bourbon;Simple syrup;Lemon juice;Egg white (optional);Red wine

Name: Lemon Drop
About: The Lemon Drop first squeezed to life in San Francisco sometime during the 1970s. Its inventor Norman Jay Hobday an out-of-work Vietnam vet turned saloon owner is also credited with opening the country’s first fern bar a concept that mixed house plants and Tiffany lamps with throngs of upwardly mobile urbanites. Both were an instant hit. And for two-plus decades the Lemon Drop dominated cocktail menus from North Beach to Bangkok hooking a generation of bargoers on its boozy-tart-sweet melange of vodka citrus and sugar. Oprah famously served one to Rachel Ray on her show.Some mislabel the Lemon Drop a Martini. But the drink’s closest cocktail kin is the Crusta a New Orleans invention that dates back to the 1850s and like the Lemon Drop is distinguished by its sugared rim. It’s tempting while whipping up a batch of Lemon Drops to skip this important step. Don’t. That first saccharine brush against the lips before the onrush of orange lime and booze fill your mouth is the Lemon Drop’s calling card. If you don’t believe us just ask Oprah.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a cocktail glass with sugar and set aside (do this a few minutes ahead of time so the sugar can dry and adhere well to the glass).  Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Vodka;Triple sec;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Louisville Jockey Club Julep
About: This banana puree julep doesn’t monkey around.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a Julep cup filled with ice. Swizzle and top with crushed ice. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Four Roses Yellow Label Bourbon;Lemon juice;Spiced Banana Syrup;Lemon bitters

Name: Bananarac
About: The New Orleans classic Sazerac gets a clever upgrade with banana liqueur.
HowToMake: Pour a little absinthe into a chilled rocks glass. Swirl to coat the inside discard any excess and set the glass aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the prepared glass. Twist a swatch of lemon peel over the drink and discard.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Old Overholt Rye Whiskey;Tariquet VSOP Armagnac;Giffard Banane du Brésil liqueur;Demerara syrup;The Bitter Truth Old Time Aromatic Bitters

Name: Iz Bananaz
About: Try this zippy cachaça-based banana drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and add a single ice cube. Shake briefly to mix and strain into a Collins glass filled with pebble ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Avuá Amburana cachaça;Amaro Montenegro;Giffard Banane Du Bresil liqueur;Lemon juice (optional);Hella Bitters aromatic bitters
Brands: Amaro Montenegro;Avuá;Giffard Banane du Brésil Liqueur;Hella Bitter

Name: Dirty Oaxacan Martin
About: Mezcal in a Martini? Try this olive juice-spiked concoction.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with Kalamata olives.
Ingredients: Del Maguey Santo Domingo Albarradas mezcal

Name: Trato Hecho
About: The classic Last Word cocktail goes south of the border.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.
Ingredients: Pineapple-Infused Mezcal;Green Chartreuse;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur;Lime juice

Name: Blackberry Mint Julep Margarita
About: Celebrate Cinco de Mayo and the Kentucky Derby at the same time.
HowToMake: In a shaker add all ingredients and muddle. Add ice and shake. Strain into a Julep cup over fresh ice. Garnish with 2 speared blackberries and a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Añejo tequila;Blackberries;Mint leaves;Fresh lime juice;Honey syrup (one part honey one part water)

Name: Girls Next Door
About: Inspired by spring this fruity vodka  drink combines floral and strawberry flavors.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker and dry-shake (without ice). Fill with ice shake again and strain into a coupe glass. Spritz the top of the drink with lemon bitters in a spray bottle or atomizer.
Ingredients: Ultimat vodka;Pear liqueur (such as Merlet Crème de Poire William);Hibiscus-strawberry syrup;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Bittermens Burlesque bitters;Egg white

Name: Green & Amber
About: Bring together East & West in the form of Scotch whisky and Japanese green tea.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a Collins glass and fill with ice. Stir and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Ultimat vodka;Laphroaig Single Malt Scotch Whisky;Honey syrup (one part honey one part water);Lemon juice;Brewed green tea (Ito En)

Name: Ascot
About: The Ascot is a sophisticated sipping cocktail smooth in texture but worldly in manner.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Ingredients: Ultimat vodka;Pierre Ferrand Ambre Cognac;Carpano Antica formula vermouth;Dolin dry vermouth

Name: White Dragon
About: Try this lemon twist on the classic Margarita with an egg white for extra richness.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice. Fill with ice shake again and strain into a coupe glass. Twist a swatch of orange peel over the drink and discard.
Ingredients: Casa Dragones Blanco Tequila;Cointreau;Lemon juice;Egg white

Name: Cacao Old Fashioned
About: A delicious chocolate-flavored rum is the base for this spin on the classic.
HowToMake: In an Old Fashioned glass muddle the sugar bitters and a splash of club soda. Fill with ice and add the rum. Stir and garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Sugar;Angostura bitters;Club soda;Selvarey Cacao Rum

Name: Cafe Panama
About: This coffee-chocolate-rum drink is tasty hot or cold.
HowToMake: To serve hot add all the ingredients to a small saucepan over medium heat and cook stirring until hot. Pour into a mug and garnish with a cinnamon stick.To serve cold add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice. Stir and garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Selvarey Cacao Rum;Espresso cold-brew or other strong brewed coffee;Unsweetened coconut milk;Simple syrup

Name: Improved Bronx
About: Make the classic gin cocktail better by replacing orange juice with tangerine.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Sweet vermouth;Dry vermouth;Tangerine juice;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: Ten Aviation
About: Take flight with this gin classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist or maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Maraschino liqueur;Lemon juice;Crème de violette

Name: Ten French 75
About: Break out the bubbly for this classic cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the gin lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Champagne flute. Fill with Champagne and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Champagne

Name: Ten Southside Fizz
About: Refresh yourself with this fizzy gin tipple.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint lime juice and simple syrup. Add the gin and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice. Stir until frost appears on the outside of the glass. Fill with club soda and garnish with another mint sprig.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Mint;Club soda

Name: Ten Negroni
About: This gin classic (and bartender favorite) is bitter and sweet.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir to combine. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Bitter liqueur;Sweet vermouth

Name: Head of Steam -
About: This combination of Irish whiskey vermouth and sherry will get you going.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Express the oil from an orange peel over top and discard the peel.
Ingredients: Irish whiskey;Noilly Prat Ambré vermouth;Pedro Ximénez sherry;Bittermens Xocolatl Mole bitters;Orange peel oil

Name: 50/50 Martini
About: Go heavy on the vermouth for this tasty variation on the classic Martini.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Perfect Ten Martini
About: It only takes one ingredient to make this classic a perfect ten. Tanqueray No. Ten is distilled with whole citrus instead of dried citrus peel and includes grapefruit orange and lime along with juniper coriander and a hint of chamomile. Don’t forget the perfect garnish to match: a grapefruit twist.
HowToMake: Add the gin to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a wide grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin

Name: Mimosa
About: Bring elegance to any brunch.
HowToMake: Add the orange juice to a Champagne flute. Fill with sparkling wine.
Ingredients: Orange juice;Sparkling wine chilled

Name: Ten Rickey
About: This classic gin drink is simple and refreshing.
HowToMake: Add the gin lime juice and sour mix to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the club soda and garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Lime juice;Sour mix;Club soda

Name: Bramble #10
About: Looking to get a little fruity? Try this blackberry-and-gin cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the gin lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Drizzle the crème de mûre on top and garnish with a blackberry and a lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Tanqueray No. TEN Gin;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Crème de mure

Name: Bourbon Rickey
About: Though its cousin the Gin Rickey is more common today this classic cocktail recipe can also be made with bourbon.
HowToMake: Fill a highball glass with cracked ice. Squeeze the lime half into the glass and drop it in. Add the bourbon and fill with sparkling water. Stir briefly to combine.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Lime;Sparkling water to top

Name: No. 3 Gin Martini Recip
About: It doesn’t get more elegant than a classic gin Martini.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: No. 3 London Dry Gin frozen;Dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Black Widow
About: Don’t fear: This crimson cocktail gets its bite from bold blanco tequila not venom. Agave nectar and muddled blackberries soften that bite with a hint of sweetness and give the Black Widow its signature spooky hue. Don’t forget the fresh basil and blackberry garnish for the full effect. Its bite brings pleasure not pain.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blackberries and basil. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake well. Strain into a stemless Martini glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a blackberry and basil leaf on a toothpick.
Ingredients: Blackberries;Basil leaves;Blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: Café Corrección Ponche
About: This rum punch plays off cold-brew coffee’s bright orange-peel and spice flavors.
HowToMake: In a large bowl or pitcher muddle the sugar and orange peel. Let stand for an hour or so to extract the oils. Add the remaining ingredients and a little cracked ice. Stir and strain into a punch bowl filled with a large ice block. Top with a sprinkling of ground cinnamon. Serve in teacups garnished with cinnamon sticks cracked in half the long way.
Ingredients: Demerara sugar;Orange peel;Diplomático añejo rum;Punt e Mes;Cold-brew coffee;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water);Fresh orange juice;Ground cinnamon

Name: Mudslide
About: People know the Mudslide as the quintessential boozy milkshake: sweet creamy and rich. Its popularity harks back to a time when we took our cocktail cues from the laminated menus of chain restaurants. Which is to say it’s not generally an exercise in balance and craftsmanship. Most versions are drowned in ice cream and served in circus-size glassware resulting in a five-digit-calorie cocktail. This Mudslide cuts a bit leaner showcasing the spirits in place of the brain freeze.  If you really want to dress up your Mudslide swap the vodka for your favorite French brandy.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled Fizz glass. Garnish with chocolate shavings.
Ingredients: Vodka;Coffee liqueur;Baileys Irish cream;Heavy cream

Name: Zapatero
