About: This mezcal-spiked spin on the classic Old Fashioned cocktail is a south-of-the-border delight.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice. Garnish with grated cinnamon an orange twist and a Lounge Attire cocktail cranberry.
Ingredients: El Silencio mezcal;Booker's bourbon;Orgeat;Angostura bitters;Fee Brothers Aztec chocolate bitters

Name: Smokin’ Mary
About: Love savory flavors? Four different smoky ingredients combine in a tasty liqueur that’s the base for this Bloody Mary variation.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a pint glass filled with ice and stir to combine. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Smokin' liqueur;V8 vegetable juice cocktail;Chipotle hot sauce

Name: Blushing Spritzer
About: Make your own hibiscus-rose liqueur for this bubbly refresher that’s perfect for an afternoon picnic.
HowToMake: Place one large ice cube in a wine glass and add all the ingredients. Stir and garnish with 3 rose petals or 6 pomegranate arils.
Ingredients: Ruby Slippers liqueur;Chardonnay wine;Club soda

Name: Rooster-Tail
About: This raspberry-and-mint tipple is delicious all year round.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a small goblet filled with fresh cracked ice. Garnish with a mint sprig and a raspberry or two.
Ingredients: Peach brandy (not peach liqueur; may substitute 1.5 oz bonded applejack and .5 oz peach liqueur);Rainwater Madeira;Lemon's juice;Raspberry syrup;Peychauds Bitters

Name: White Walker Flip
About: Love Game of Thrones and sophisticated drinks? Try this Scotch cocktail. Winter is coming.
HowToMake: Add the egg to a shaker and shake without ice until emulsified. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake very well and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Whole egg;The Glenrothes Select Reserve Single Malt Scotch Whisky;The King's Ginger;Green Chartreuse;Sweet (non-alcoholic) apple cider;Baked apple bitters

Name: Sin Cyn
About: Try this simple but sophisticated scotch-and-Cynar cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Ingredients: The Macallan 12-year-old single-malt scotch;Carpano Antica Formula vermouth

Name: Chopin Harvest Martini
About: This pear cocktail gets a boost from bubbly.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a chilled Martini glass with the red sugar and set aside. Add the vodka and pear purée to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Top with Champagne and float a pear slice on top.
Ingredients: Red sugar;Chopin Vodka;Pear purée (one or two fresh pears pureed with a dash of sugar or simple syrup);Moët & Chandon Nectar Impérial Champagne

Name: Polar Bear
About: You don’t need to be in the Arctic to enjoy this mezcal cocktail recipe.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: La Puritita Verdá Mezcal;Dolin blanc vermouth;Tempus Fugit Spirits Crème de Menthe;Angelica Tincture or celery bitters

Name: 10 Cane Hemingway Daiquiri
About: Try the delicious and simple rum-based Hemingway Daiquiri. Papa approved!
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wheel and black cherry on a skewer.
Ingredients: 10 Cane Rum;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur;Fresh grapefruit juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Michael Collins Honeysuckle
About: Bring out Irish whiskey’s sweet side.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail or stemless wine glass. Garnish with a thin apple slice.
Ingredients: Michael Collins Blended Irish Whiskey;honey;Sauvignon blanc wine;Fresh apple juice;Passion fruit syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Rhubarb Fi
About: Get refreshed with this icy-cold rhubarb sherry and gin cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over crushed ice. Garnish with a mint sprig. *Rhubarb syrup: Add 4 cups roughly chopped rhubarb 8 cups sugar and 2 qt (64 oz) water into a saucepan and cook over low heat stirring until sugar dissolves. Cook for 5 minutes more turn off heat and let cool completely. Strain and store in refrigerator up to a month.
Ingredients: Gin;Manzanilla sherry;Rhubarb syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Breakfast Martin
About: This tart-and-sweet gin drink is good at any time of day.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake very hard and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Float a lemon wheel on top.
Ingredients: Gin;Combier;Fresh lemon juice;Rhubarb marmalade

Name: Rhubarb & Strawberry Collins Recip
About: Two of springtime’s most delicious ingredients combine in this tart and refreshing tipple.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Top with club soda. Garnish with a pickled rhubarb stalk and lemon wheel. *Rhubarb ​s​yrup​: Add ​2 qt water 8 cups sugar and 4 cups roughly chopped rhubarb ​in​to a saucepan and cook over low heat stirring until​ ​sugar dissolves. Cook for 5 minutes more turn of​f​ heat and let cool. Strain and store in refrigerator for up to ​1​ month. **Pickled ​r​hubarb​ stalk​​: Toast ​2 tbsp coriander and ​3 tbsp pink ​peppercorns for ​1-2 minutes in a saucepan over medium heat. Add ​4 cups sugar and ​1 qt raspberry ​vinegar stirring until sugar dissolves. Chill mixture in refrigerator until cold and pour over ​4 cups rhubarb​ trimmed and chopped into 3-inch lengths​. Refrigerate for at least a few hours before using.
Ingredients: Gin or vodka;Aperol;Rhubarb syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Strawberry juice;Club soda to top

Name: Spiced Rhubarb Gimle
About: A coriander-pink peppercorn rhubarb shrub makes this tasty treat a complex spring cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double-strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a pickled rhubarb stalk.
Ingredients: Bombay Sapphire East Gin;Lime juice;Spiced Rhubarb Shrub;Rhubarb bitters;Peychaud's Bitters

Name: Raspberry Caipirinha
About: A tasty twist on a Brazilian classic.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the sugar raspberries and lime. Add the cachaça and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass. Garnish with an additional raspberry.
Ingredients: Superfine sugar;Raspberries;Lime cut into wedges;Cachaça

Name: Neighborhood Negroni
About: It would be rude not to introduce yourself to the neighborhood with this delightful Negroni recipe.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a flamed orange twist.For the Italian version add all the ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir and garnish with an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Junipero Gin;Campari;Martini and Rossi Sweet Vermouth

Name: Guadalajara Silver
About: This tequila apple grapefruit juice and ginger cocktail is no runner-up.
HowToMake: Mix equal amounts of sugar and cinnamon on a small plate and use to coat the rim of a rocks glass. Fill the glass with ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with Granny Smith apple slices.
Ingredients: Sugar;Ground cinnamon;Don Roberto Tequila Plata;Agave nectar;Fresh lime juice;Fresh pink grapefruit juice;Ginger liqueur;Fresh Granny Smith apple juice

Name: Ancho Old Fashioned
About: Put some chile fire in your Old Fashioned.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with one large ice block. Cut long swatches of orange and lemon peels with a vegetable peeler. Twist both over the drink rub along the rim of the glass and roll together into a rosette to use as garnish.
Ingredients: Milagro Silver Tequila;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur;Rich simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Angostura Orange Bitters

Name: Ancho Margarita
About: Add some spice to the classic tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: Rub the lime wedge along the rim of an Old Fashioned glass and dip the rim into salt to coat it. Fill the glass with ice and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice. Shake and double-strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with the lime wedge.
Ingredients: Lime wedge;Salt;Milagro Silver Tequila;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur;Lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: Conquistador
About: This complex combo of tequila and sherry with chocolate and spice is sophisticated and delicious.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Cut a long swatch of orange peel with a vegetable peeler twist over the drink rub along the rim of the glass and use as garnish.
Ingredients: Milagro reposado tequila;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur;Crème de cacao;Manzanilla sherry;Angostura Orange Bitters

Name: Milagro Ancho Paloma
About: Add a little heat to the Paloma cocktail with this ancho-chile spin on the classic.
HowToMake: Run the lime wedge along the rim of a highball glass and coat half of the rim the salt. Squeeze the lime wedge into the glass and discard it. Fill the glass with ice and add the remaining ingredients. Stir to combine and garnish with a thin grapefruit wheel.
Ingredients: Lime wedge;Salt;Milagro reposado tequila;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur;Lime juice;Grapefruit soda

Name: Tamarind Margarita
About: Add a little Indian flavor to the Mexican classic with this deliciously tangy cocktail.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt fill with ice and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Salt;Tequila;Tamarind concentrate;Sour mix;Simple syrup

Name: The Estridentista Cocktai
About: Try this intriguing cocktail featuring an ancho chile liqueur from central Mexico.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Dry vermouth;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur;Elderflower liqueur;Grapefruit bitters

Name: Chalchihuitl
About: This spicy Southwestern take on the Margarita is something altogether new with roasted poblano-infused tequila.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. *Roasted-poblano-infused Sauza Blue silver tequila:Combine 1/4 cup diced fresh poblano pepper 1/4 cup diced roasted poblano pepper and 1 750 mL bottle of Sauza Blue silver tequila in a large jar or other container with a lid. Cover and let stand for one week. If the infusion is not spicy enough add 3 thin slices of habanero pepper and let stand for one more day. Strain before using.
Ingredients: Roasted-poblano-infused Sauza Blue silver tequila;Triple sec;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: Barbacoa Mezcal Cocktai
About: Two types of peppers combine with mezcal citrus and ginger in this sweet-and-savory concoction.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the bell pepper slices and lime wedges. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and pour (unstrained) into a double Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with a piece of beef jerky.
Ingredients: Bell pepper;Lime wedges;Puree chipotle pepper;Lemon juice;Ginger syrup;Agave nectar;Mezcal

Name: The Burgundy
About: Ron would definitely approve.
HowToMake: Add the whisky and ginger ale to a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with a splash of cranberry juice.
Ingredients: Canadian Club Whisky;Ginger ale;Cranberry juice

Name: Rum Rangoon
About: This powerful cocktail is like an instant Caribbean vacation.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange wedge.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Fresh lime juice;Clément Créole Shrubb liqueur;Martinique sugar cane syrup;Angostura bitters;Angostura orange bitters

Name: Nouveau Sangaree
About: The old-timey version of sangria features American applejack.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with thin apple slices and grated cinnamon.
Ingredients: Beaujolais nouveau wine (you may substitute another red wine);Laird's Straight Bottled in Bond Apple Brandy;Plymouth Sloe Gin;Grade B maple syrup (you may substitute other dark maple syrup);Angostura bitters
Garnish: 1 Thin apple slices and grated cinnamon

Name: Floradora
About: This tall sweet and spicy gin drink is straight from the Lone Star State.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish. Garnish with a raspberry. *Raspberry syrup: In a bowl or other large container muddle 1 12-oz pack of frozen raspberries and 25 oz simple syrup (one part sugar one part water). Let stand for 12 hours at room temperature. Strain and refrigerate before using.
Ingredients: Beefeater gin;Raspberry syrup;Ginger syrup;Fresh lime juice;Club soda to top

Name: Hot Buttered Rum Batte
About: Use this base to make the perfect Hot Buttered Rum in a snap.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ice cream to a bowl and stir to combine. Add the ice cream and stir again. Transfer to a container with a lid seal and store in the freezer. Refer to the Hot Buttered Rum recipe to build the drink.
Ingredients: Butter;Brown sugar;Sugar;Ground cinnamon;Ground clove;Ground nutmeg;Vanilla ice cream softened slightly

Name: South Side
About: A simple minty classic the South Side is the perfect introduction to gin cocktails.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint and simple syrup. Add the lemon juice and gin and fill with ice. Shake and double-strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: No. 3 gin;Mint leaves;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Bloody Bul
About: The addition of beef broth turns the classic Bloody Mary into this cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and roll the shaker back and forth until everything is well-mixed. Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Vodka;Tomato juice;Prepared beef bouillon;Fresh lemon juice;Worcestershire sauce;Tabasco sauce;Kosher salt;Coarsely ground black pepper

Name: Serpent-less Swizzl
About: The classic Caribbean Rum Swizzle gets an Irish whiskey makeover for a tropical St. Patrick’s Day drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a Pilsner glass. Fill with crushed ice and swizzle vigorously until slightly frothy. Garnish with a large sprig of mint and a pickled cherry.
Ingredients: Powers 12 Year Old Special Reserve Irish Whiskey;Dolin blanc vermouth;Lemon juice;Grenadine

Name: Emerald Isle of the Caribbean
About: The classic Irish Coffee goes Tiki with this hot cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a large mug and stir. Top with a dollop of Tiki whipped cream. *Cinnamon syrup: Add 1 cup sugar 3 sticks of Ceylon cinnamon (crumbled) and 1 cup water into a small saucepan set over medium heat stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat let cool for 20 minutes and refrigerate overnight. Strain before using and store in the refrigerator for up to a week. **Tiki whipped cream: Add 8 oz heavy cream 1/2 oz St. Elizabeth allspice dram 1/4 oz Angostura bitters and 1 tbsp demerara sugar into a bowl and whip with a stick blender for 30 seconds or until frothy and thickened.
Ingredients: El Dorado Special Reserve 15-year-old rum;Cinnamon syrup;B.G. Reynolds Don's Spices #2;Velvet falernum;Brewed dark-roast coffee hot

Name: The Good Cork
About: The unexpected pairing of mezcal and Irish whiskey stars in this clever concoction.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass filled over ice. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Del Maguey Vida mezcal;Redbreast 12-year-old Irish whiskey;Bénédictine;Peychaud's bitters

Name: Baileys Mocha Monkey
About: This cocktail is bananas. B-A-N-A…you get where this is going.
HowToMake: Swirl the inside of a highball glass with chocolate syrup. Add the remaining ingredients to a blender and fill with ice. Blend until smooth and pour into the prepared glass. Garnish with a banana slice and 3 coffee beans.
Ingredients: Chocolate syrup;Baileys with a Hint of Coffee;Vanilla ice cream (softened);Banana peeled and sliced

Name: Disaronno Sour
About: This three-ingredient classic is a great way to highlight amaretto. The recipe dates back to the 1970s when this cocktail was a staple on cocktail menus and this version made with Disaronno will have you yearning for the days of bell bottoms and disco. Try this recipe for the Disaronno Sour.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a cherry.
Ingredients: Disaronno;Simple syrup;Lemons squeezed for juice

Name: Painkiller
About: A twist on the Piña Colada the Painkiller cocktail is a rich and fruity tropical drink that is a specialty of the British Virgin Islands and was trademarked in the 1980s by Pusser’s. Coconut cream orange juice and pineapple juice join rum  in this drink that brings the tropics right to your glass.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a hurricane glass or snifter over crushed ice. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a pineapple wedge. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Pusser's rum;Pineapple juice;Orange juice;Cream of coconut

Name: Perfect Pearl Manhattan
About: Try the classic bourbon and vermouth Manhattan with just a hint of smoky Scotch.
HowToMake: Rinse a cocktail glass with the Scotch and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until chilled and strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Lagavulin 16-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky;Bulleit bourbon;Dolin Rouge vermouth;Dolin dry vermouth;Regans Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Ginger Beer Margarita
About: This sweet and fizzy pitcher cocktail is a great excuse to throw a party.
HowToMake: In a small bowl stir together the agave nectar and lime juice until the agave nectar dissolves. Add to a pitcher along with the tequila and ginger beer and stir well. Add 2 cups ice and stir until cold. Serve in highball glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Agave nectar;Limes squeezed for juice;Casa Noble Crystal tequila;Jamaican ginger beer

Name: Slim Organic Margarita (La Flaca)
About: Organic tequila makes this simple version of the classic Margarita extra-special.
HowToMake: If desired coat the rim of a Martini or Margarita glass with salt and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Kosher salt;Casa Noble Crystal Tequila;Lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: El Tequiletto
About: Tequila amaretto and OJ combine in this sweet treat.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. If desired garnish with a lime wheel and a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Casa Noble Reposado Tequila;Amaretto;Orange juice

Name: The Casa Noble Old Fashioned
About: This south-of-the-border spin on the classic Old Fashioned calls for tequila and agave nectar.
HowToMake: In an Old Fashioned glass lightly muddle the agave nectar bitters and orange peel. Add the tequila and one large ice cube and stir. Garnish with a fresh slice of orange peel.
Ingredients: Agave nectar;Angostura bitters;Orange peel;Casa Noble Añejo Tequila

Name: Strawberry & Ginger Bellini
About: This sophisticated spin on the classic Bellini is a great brunch drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and stir briefly. Pour into a Collins or flute glass.
Ingredients: Strawberry purée;Ginger juice;Prosecco chilled

Name: Hazel's Brandy Old Fashioned
About: The Brandy Old Fashioned is a classic Wisconsin cocktail that puts a brand new spin on the age-old recipe by using brandy instead of whiskey and just a touch of 7Up. Here’s how top bartender Misty Kalkofen’s mom in Green Bay likes hers.
HowToMake: Add the cherry orange wedge sugar bitters and water into a double Old Fashioned glass. Muddle until the sugar dissolves adding a splash of water if needed. Fill with ice and add the brandy. Top with the Sprite or 7Up. Garnish with a fresh cherry and orange wedge.
Ingredients: Maraschino cherry;Orange wedge;Sugar;Angostura bitters;Water;Brandy;Sprite or 7UP

Name: Necromancer
About: This absinthe tipple holds powerful magic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Tenneyson Absinthe;Lillet Blanc;Pür Likör Blossom Elderflower Liqueur;Lemon juice;Gin

Name: Fortune Teller
About: While this sophisticated tequila cocktail can’t actually see your future it is delicious.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with a sprig of tarragon stuck through a small swatch of lemon peel.
Ingredients: Suerte Blanco Tequila;Manzanilla sherry;Avèze Gentian Liqueur;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur;Tarragon Tincture

Name: Boilermaker
About: Go old-school with this straightforward whiskey and beer concoction.
HowToMake: Pour the whiskey into a shot glass. Fill a pint glass halfway with beer. Drop the shot glass into the beer.
Ingredients: Bourbon or rye whiskey;Beer

Name: Grand Coffee
About: A spot of coffee never sounded so good.
HowToMake: Pour all the ingredients into a mug or heat-proof highball glass and stir. Spoon about 2 tbsp of whipped cream on top.
Ingredients: Grand Marnier warmed;Hot brewed coffee;Brown sugar syrup if desired

Name: Bloody Maria
About: Tequila shoulders out vodka in this south-of-the-border spin on the brunch-favorite Bloody Mary. Laced with two brands of hot sauce the Bloody Maria gains extra kick from a hefty dose of horseradish and is generously garnished with a cucumber spear jalapeño slices and queso fresco. Make your next brunch a fiesta with this tequila-spiked Bloody Mary.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake briefly and strain into a pint glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge a lemon wedge a cucumber spear and a skewer of sweet pepper slices jalapeño slices and queso fresco..
Ingredients: Tequila;Tomato juice;Fresh lemon juice;Worcestershire sauce;Tabasco sauce;Tapatio hot sauce;Prepared horseradish to taste;Celery salt;Ground black pepper
Garnish: Lime wedge;Lemon wedge;Cucumber spear;Sweet pepper slices;Jalapeño pepper slices;Queso fresco

Name: Bermuda Rum Swizzle
About: No it’s not a dance. But it just might spark some killer moves. To prepare a Rum Swizzle it’s best to use an authentic swizzle stick. Real swizzle sticks are long stems snapped off a tree native to the Caribbean and feature multiple prongs that stick out horizontally. When spun rapidly between your hands inside a cold cocktail the swizzle stick will create a thick layer of frost on the outside of a glass—the sign of a perfect swizzle.
HowToMake: Fill a pitcher a third of the way with crushed ice and add all the ingredients. Churn vigorously until frothing (or shake in a large shaker) and strain into 4 rocks glasses filled with fresh ice. Garnish each with an orange slice a pineapple cube and a cherry.
Ingredients: Gosling's Black Seal rum;Goslings Gold Seal rum;Pineapple juice;Orange juice;Grenadine;Angostura bitters

Name: Blackthor
About: This Irish-whiskey Manhattan has a subtle anise note.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Michael Collins Blended Irish Whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Angostura bitters;Absinthe

Name: Sidra House
About: A tasty mix of rum cider sherry pear brandy and an exotic allspice liqueur.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with an apple fan.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Apple cider;Gonzalez Byass Solera 1847 Oloroso Dulce Sherry;Clear Creek Pear Brandy;St. Elizabeth allspice dram

Name: RumChata by Elvis
About: The King of Rock & Roll’s favorite snack has become the stuff of junk food legend. Channel that indulgent sandwich with this equally rich combination of Rumchata’s creamy cinnamon-laced liqueur peanut butter banana liqueur and chocolate syrup. Elvis would surely approve.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a blender. Blend until smooth and pour into a tall glass. Drizzle with chocolate syrup.
Ingredients: RumChata;Spiced rum;Banana liqueur;Peanut butter;banana peeled;Vanilla ice cream

Name: English Ros
About: With strawberries and rhubarb syrup this gin concoction just screams spring.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberries. Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice. Fill with ice and shake again for 20 seconds. Double-strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Ingredients: Strawberries;Plymouth gin;Dolin blanc vermouth;Rhubarb syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Small egg white;Bittermens Burlesque Bitters

Name: Chocomole
About: Add tequila to spicy Mexican hot chocolate and you’ll get this delicious shot recipe.
HowToMake: Coat the rims of 2 shot glasses with chile powder and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glasses. Garnish each with a corn chip.
Ingredients: Chile powder;Reposado tequila;Chocomole Mixture;Agave nectar

Name: Plum Toddy
About: Warm up with this modern twist on the traditional Hot Toddy.
HowToMake: Add liqueur and bitters into a mug. Top with hot water. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Zwack Unicum plum liqueur;Aromatic bitters

Name: Shirley Temple
About: Kids and teetotalers alike love the non-alcoholic Shirley Temple cocktail. Believe to have been originated in 1930s Hollywood the name comes from the iconic former child star. These days it’s a staple cocktails for children. Not into the sober life? Just add vodka or rum to booze up this classic.
HowToMake: Fill a Hurricane or Collins glass with ice and add the grenadine. Fill with ginger ale 7UP or Sprite. Stir and garnish with a maraschino cherry and lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Grenadine;Ginger ale 7UP or Sprite

Name: Old Oaxacan
About: Celebrating a happy occasion? Try this Champagne-topped mezcal concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and muddle briefly. Fill with ice shake for 10 seconds and strain into a coupe glass. Top with the Champagne and garnish with a lime wheel and a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Mezcal El Silencio;Simple syrup;Lime juice;Mint leaves;Angostura bitters;Champagne

Name: Cousin Eddie
About: This complex spin on Eggnog includes rum armagnac and fernet.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice. Fill with ice and shake again. Double-strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with a large piece of ice. Garnish with grated nutmeg and cinnamon and cracked black pepper.
Ingredients: Armagnac;El Dorado 5 Year Old Cask Aged Rum;R. Jelinek Fernet;Whole egg;Heavy cream;Sugar;Grated nutmeg

Name: I Left My Heart in Jalisco
About: This warm spicy and romantic tequila  cocktail makes enough for two.
HowToMake: Add the milk cocoa powder and chocolate to a saucepan over medium heat and cook stirring until the chocolate melts. Add the sugar star anise vanilla bean Cayenne pepper and salt reduce the heat to low and cook for about 10 minutes. Strain the mixture into two mugs and add 1.25 ounces of tequila and .25 ounces of Ancho Reyes to each. Stir and garnish with orange twists and a sprinkle of cocoa powder.
Ingredients: Whole milk;Unsweetened cocoa powder;Unsweetened chocolate chopped;Demerara sugar;Star anise pod;Vanilla bean split in half;Cayenne pepper;Salt;Ancho Reyes ancho chile liqueur

Name: Romancing the Stone
About: Build some romance with this sophisticated take on the classic French 75  cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne into a shaker filled with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a Champagne flute and top with Champagne.
Ingredients: Blume Marillen apricot eau-de-vie;Freshly squeezed lemon juice;Honey syrup (2 parts honey 1 part water);Peychaud's bitters;Sparkling wine

Name: Little Kiss
About: You’ll fall in love with this Champagne cocktail that tastes of strawberry and chocolate.
HowToMake: Add the strawberry shrub and crème de cacao to a chilled Champagne flute. Slowly pour in the Champagne and garnish with a woodland strawberry or a tiny regular strawberry.
Ingredients: Strawberry shrub;White crème de cacao;Champagne

Name: Gin on Gin Julep
About: This chilly and refreshing drink calls for both gin and genever.
HowToMake: In a Julep cup muddle the simple syrup and mint. Fill with crushed or pellet ice and add the genever and gin. Top with the club soda and stir until combined. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar 1 part water);Large mint leaves;Bols genever;Plymouth gin;Club soda

Name: Last Resort
About: Pear brandy and absinthe combine to make this a truly unique tipple.
HowToMake: Add the absinthe to a coupe glass swirl to coat the inside discarding any excess and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice. Fill with ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds. Strain into the prepared glass and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a drop of Peychaud's Bitters.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Massenez Poire Williams;Fresh lime juice;Rich simple syrup (two parts sugar one part water);Egg white

Name: World’s Greatest Hotel Nacional
About: Add a touch of pineapple juice and apricot brandy to a classic Daiquiri to get this delicious concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with large cold ice cubes. Shake and double-strain into a coupe glass.
Ingredients: Caña Brava Rum;Fresh lime juice;Petite Canne Sugar Cane Syrup;Fresh pineapple juice;Blume Merillen Apricot Eau-de-Vie;Angostura bitters

Name: Colletti Royale
About: Blood orange and Champagne lend delicious elegance to this tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a wine glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the Champagne and garnish with a blood orange wheel.
Ingredients: Partida reposado tequila;Cointreau;St-Germain;Blood orange juice;Fresh lime juice;Orange bitters;Rosé Champagne

Name: Cunningham
About: Scotch is a most unusual base for this fruity cocktail recipe.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with brandied cherries and a flamed blood orange twist.
Ingredients: The Famous Grouse Scotch Whisky;Lemon juice;Blood orange juice;Bénédictine;Cherry Heering
Garnish: 1 Brandied cherries and a flamed blood orange twist

Name: Blood Sage
About: Seasonal blood orange and fresh sage make this gin cocktail a wintry delight.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the orange and sage. Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice. Fill with ice and shake again very hard. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a sage leaf.
Ingredients: Sage leaves;Blood orange wedges;Aviation Gin;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Egg white

Name: Blood Orange Margarita cocktail recip
About: Blood orange juice and Campari transform the classic Margarita cocktail.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt fill with ice and set aside. Add remaining ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a blood orange slice.
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Combier triple sec;Campari;Blood orange juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Cupid's Champagne Potion
About: Celebrate a romantic night in with this festive sparkling drink recipe.
HowToMake: Add the vodka and peach puree into a shaker and fill with ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled Champagne flute. Top with Champagne.
Ingredients: Belvedere vodka;Peach puree;Veuve Clicquot Yellow Label Champagne

Name: Italian Love Affair
About: Add some bite to your Spritz and enjoy this vodka cocktail with your best gal pals.
HowToMake: Add the vodka and Aperol to a wine glass and fill with ice. Stir gently and top with Champagne. Garnish with a pink grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Belvedere Pink Grapefruit Vodka;Aperol;Moët & Chandon Champagne

Name: Malibu Mudslide
About: Indulge in this white hot cocktail drink spiked with coconut rum.
HowToMake: Add the milk and chocolate to a mug and stir until the chocolate melts completely. Stir in the rum and top with whipped cream. Garnish with ground cinnamon.
Ingredients: Steamed milk;White chocolate chips;Malibu coconut rum;Whipped cream

Name: Rose-Colored Glass
About: Bring some romance to your glass with this easy bubbly cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the bitters lemon juice and simple syrup into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a coupe glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Garnish with red rose petals.
Ingredients: Angostura bitters;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Crémant d'Alsace rosé sparkling wine to top

Name: Bloody Bulldog
About: No reason vodka should have a monopoly on tomato-juice cocktails.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass fill with ice and stir. Garnish with any of the following: a celery stalk pickled okra a dill pickle spear an asparagus spear a skewer with 3 olives a skewer with 3 cherry tomatoes or a carrot stick.
Ingredients: Bulldog gIn;Tomato juice;Lemon juice;Garlic clove minced;Prepared horseradish;Balsamic vinegar;Worcestershire sauce;Celery salt;Black pepper;Tabasco sauce
Garnish: Celery;Pickled okra;Dill pickle;Asparagus;Olives;Cherry tomatoes or carrot

Name: Hopped-Up Bloody Mary
About: Hops-infused vodka makes this a brunch drink for beer lovers.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a highball glass with sea salt. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Fill with ice and stir again briefly. Garnish with a cocktail shrimp a fennel stalk lemon zest and freshly ground pink peppercorns.
Ingredients: Sea salt;Hophead Vodka;Tomato juice;Demitri's Bloody Mary Seasoning;Lemon juice
Garnish: 1 Shrimp lemon zest fennel and pink peppercorns

Name: The Lookout
About: Improve on the classic Hot Buttered Rum with sherry and mulled cider.
HowToMake: Add the rum and butter to a mug and slowly pour in the mulled cider. Sprinkle the five-spice powder on top.
Ingredients: 12-year-old rum;PX Sherry-Infused Butter;Mulled cider hot (use your favorite recipe or packaged mix);Chinese five-spice powder

Name: Moët Golden Night
About: This sparkling pear-and-cardamom elixir is the official cocktail of the 2014 Golden Globes.
HowToMake: In a small saucepan bring the sugar water and cardamom to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer for 5 minutes remove from the heat and let cool for 20 minutes. Strain and stir in the pear brandy. (This mixture can be made up to 2 days ahead of time.) Add half an ounce of the pear-cardamom mixture to each of 6 white wine or coupe glasses. Top each glass with 4 ounces of Champagne. To garnish core 2 Forelle or Seckel pears and cut into eighth-inch slices. Garnish each glass with 3 pear slices spread into a fan shape.
Ingredients: Unrefined granulated sugar;Water;Cardamom pods crushed with the side of a knife or a mortar and pestle;Pear brandy;Moët & Chandon Imperial Brut Champagne chilled

Name: One-Two Punch
About: Smoky Scotch whisky is the unexpected base for this fruity and fizzy punch.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the pilsner to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a pilsner glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the pilsner and garnish with a pinch of La Boîte Borneo N. 26 Spice Mix and a grapefruit half-wheel.
Ingredients: Johnnie Walker Double Black Scotch Whisky;Lemon juice;Grapefruit juice;Citrus Oleo-Saccharum;Victory Prima Pils Pilsner;Grapefruit half-wheel
Garnish: La Boíte Borneo N. 26 Spice Mix

Name: Manzanasada
About: This tequila-and-mezcal drink with apple cider and ginger beer is a delicious tipple for the fall or winter.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a Collins glass with Spice Sugar fill with ice and set aside. Add the tequila mezcal cider and lemon juice to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Fill with ginger beer and garnish with diced red apple.
Ingredients: Spice Sugar;Tequila;Mezcal;Apple cider;Lemon juice;Ginger beer

Name: Apple Dandy
About: Keep the holidays classy with this seasonal tequila tipple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel studded with cloves.
Ingredients: Espolón Reposado Tequila;Pommeau de Normandie;Chamomile syrup;Lemon's

Name: Set the New Year on Fire
About: This New Year’s Eve-inspired libation comes with all the pyrotechnics.
HowToMake: Add the lime juice syrup and mint leaves to a Collins glass and press gently with a muddler. Add the scotch and fill with crushed ice. Float the Campari on top and fill with more crushed ice. Garnish with a flaming lime shell.
Ingredients: Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Mint leaves;Bowmore 12-year-old single-malt scotch;Campari

Name: Under the Mistletoe
About: This gin-and-cranberry Christmas cocktail just might earn you a kiss.
HowToMake: In a Collins glass muddle the cranberries and orange. Add the gin and simple syrup and fill with ice. Top with a mixture of two parts cranberry juice to one part club soda. Stir with a thyme sprig and garnish with three additional cranberries.
Ingredients: Bombay Sapphire gin;Orange half-wheels;Simple syrup;Cranberry juice;Club soda;Thyme

Name: Ponche Navideñ
About: An essential part of Christmas in Mexico sweet fragrant Ponche Navideño can be found simmering away on stovetops and at traditional outdoor markets all across the country from December 12 through January 6 the period during which the holiday is celebrated. Featuring traditional Mexican flavorings such as fresh sugar cane guavas and tejocotes (a crabapple-type fruit) the punch is spiked with a healthy dose of rum and served piping hot to ward off any winter chills. Here in the U.S. it can be hard to find these items fresh. So this recipe relies on easy-to-find ingredients that lend their Mexican flair to an irresistible rum punch.
HowToMake: In a large stockpot add the water piloncillo cinnamon sticks cloves and tamarind paste and bring to a boil. Drop to a simmer and stir to completely dissolve the tamarind paste. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the apples pear raisins and hibiscus flowers and simmer for 15 minutes until the fruit is soft and raisins are rehydrated. Squeeze the remaining liquid out of the cheesecloth packet and discard. Remove the cinnamon sticks and cloves and discard. Stir in the lemon juice and rum. Ladle the punch between 12 punch glasses thinly slice 2 lemons and garnish each glass with a slice.
Ingredients: Light rum;Piloncillo (Mexican-style unrefined brown sugar) grated (or 1 cup packed dark brown sugar);Cinnamon sticks;Whole cloves;Tamarind paste;Tart apples peeled cored finely chopped;Ripe pear peeled cored finely chopped;Packed raisins or golden raisins;Dried hibiscus flowers (also known as jamaica or sorrel) tied inside a square of cheesecloth;Juice of 1 lemon;Water

Name: Tea and Krampus
About: Forget tea and crumpets. This drink is named for the mythical dark companion to St. Nicholas.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a pint glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Appleton Estate Reserve Rum;Coruba Original Blend Rum;Leopold Bros. Rocky Mountain Blackberry Liqueur;St. Elizabeth allspice dram;Lime juice;Pineapple juice;B.G. Reynolds' Vanilla Syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Trick Nog
About: Try this modern and boozy twist on the classic Eggnog recipe.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into 2 punch cups. Garnish with grated nutmeg a cinnamon stick and an orange peel.
Ingredients: Wild Turkey 81 bourbon;Orange juice;Cream;Brown sugar syrup;Whole egg;Cherry Heering

Name: Revolver
About: Arm yourself with this bourbon  and coffee liqueur cocktail. Introduced by San Francisco bartender Jon Santer in the early 2000s the Revolver is locked and loaded with the spicy bite of rye-heavy Bulleit bourbon and a slug of coffee liqueur. Orange bitters lend subtle brightness to that dark and mysterious duo. Go ahead and pull the trigger.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a wide strip of orange peel.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Coffee liqueur;Orange bitters

Name: Joe & Misses Doe Celery Soda
About: Recreate the deli favorite Dr. Brown’s Cel-Ray Soda in cocktail form with this unique recipe.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with a mix of celery salt and sugar. Fill with ice and add the gin Celery Syrup and lime juice. Top with club soda and stir briefly.
Ingredients: Celery salt;Sugar;DH Krahn Gin;Celery Syrup;Fresh lime juice;Club soda

Name: The Grey Goose Martini Recip
About: Take a lesson in suave drinking with this classic Martini recipe.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass.
Ingredients: Grey Goose Vodka;Noilly Prat dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Grey Goose Parisian Martini
About: This twist on the classic Vodka Martini recipe will transport you to the City of Light.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a Martini glass with sugar and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a blood orange wheel and a pinch of grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Sugar;Grey Goose Vodka;Martini & Rossi Rosso Vermouth;Blood orange juice

Name: Grey Goose L’Orange Winter Sangria Martini Recip
About: With hints of elderflower and pomegranate this Martini recipe is delicious all year round.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a rose petal.
Ingredients: St-Germain;Pomegranate juice;Lemon juice

Name: Hurricane
About: The Hurricane is not a cocktail of subtlety. Its double serving of rum and suite of fruit juices and sweeteners have been packing a punch since the early 1940s when it was invented at Pat O’Brien’s in New Orleans. Besides keeping your jigger busy this high-octane fruit bomb is an excuse to sip from a Hurricane glass the tall curved and alarmingly wide vessel inspired by the hurricane lamp. Though in the French Quarter where public alcohol consumption is legal you’re more likely to see it served in a disposable plastic cup.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a large Hurricane glass over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange half-wheel and a preserved cherry.
Ingredients: Light rum;Dark rum;Fresh lime juice;Orange juice;Passion fruit purée;Simple syrup;Grenadine

Name: Basil Hayden's 8th Night Toddy
About: This hot bourbon cocktail is perfect for Hanukkah or any wintertime celebration.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker (do not add ice). Shake and strain into a mug or Toddy glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden's Bourbon;Hot water;honey;Lemon peel;Orange peel;Star anise pods;Cinnamon sticks

Name: Après-Turkey
About: Mix up this spiced concoction after a decadent Thanksgiving meal.
HowToMake: Add the applejack and simple syrup to a snifter and stir. Season to taste with grated cinnamon and nutmeg and garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Cornelius Applejack;Simple syrup;Cinnamon;Nutmeg

Name: Hornitos Tequila Todd
About: Swap out whiskey for tequila in this twist on the classic Hot Toddy.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mug. Stir and let steep for one minute.
Ingredients: Hornitos Plata Tequila;honey;Agave nectar;Lemon wedge;Cinnamon stick;Cloves;Hot water

Name: Hornitos Holiday Horchata Shot Recip
About: This tequila shot recipe is perfect for the holidays.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a shot glass with cinnamon and sugar and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Cinnamon;Sugar;Hornitos Plata Tequila;Coconut water;Almond milk

Name: The Maple Man
About: This citrus maple syrup and cognac cocktail is hard not to love.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lime and mandarin. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Lime;mandarin;Hennessy V.S. cognac;Oloroso sherry;Maple syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Holiday Sauce
About: Cranberry sauce pairs perfectly with cognac in this fruity holiday tipple by Hennessy master mixologist Jordan Bushell.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a Martini or coupe glass with a mixture of equal-parts cinnamon and sugar and set aside. Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Hennessy V.S. cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Cranberry sauce;Fee Brothers cranberry bitters

Name: Smashing Pumpkin
About: Homemade lemon-pumpkin soda is easy to prepare in just a few minutes and lends the Smashing Pumpkin fresh fall flavor. A base of aged rum and allspice liqueur add warming contrast making this the perfect way to incorporate the season’s favorite squash in your cocktails.
HowToMake: Add the rum and liqueur into a Collins glass with ice. Top with the lemon-pumpkin soda. Garnish with a bay leaf. *Lemon-pumpkin soda: Add 12 oz pumpkin puree (use canned or roast seeded pumpkin at 350° for 45 minutes and puree in a food processor) 4 oz fresh lemon juice and 2 oz water into a soda siphon and charge with 1 CO2 cartridge.
Ingredients: Spiced rum;Allspice liqueur;Lemon-pumpkin soda

Name: Citius Altius Fortius
About: Prepare for Olympic glory with this multinational cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange half-wheel.
Ingredients: Bluecoat Gin;Noilly Prat Dry Vermouth (France);Martini & Rossi Rosso Vermouth (Italy);The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters (Germany);Kübler Absinthe (Switzerland);Crown Royal Whisky (Canada);Simple syrup

Name: Forbidden Apple
About: This twist on the classic Champagne Cocktail is spiked with apple brandy and orange liqueur.
HowToMake: Add the first three ingredients to a Champagne flute and top with the Champagne. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Angostura bitters;Grand Marnier;Calvados;Champagne

Name: Champagne
About: This simple classic cocktail is the best way to improve a flute of bubbly.
HowToMake: Place sugar cube on a spoon and douse with bitters. Drop into a Champagne flute and fill with Champagne. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Sugar cube;Angostura bitters;Champagne

Name: Rusty Apple Toddy
About: One sip of this hot apple-and-Drambuie cocktail will warm you to the core.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mug and garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Apple juice hot;Drambuie;Lemon wedge's juice

Name: Cider Delighter
About: You’ll be thoroughly delighted after one sip of this autumnal vodka tipple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a red apple slice.
Ingredients: Vikingfjord Vodka;Allspice liqueur;Lemon juice;Apple cider;Baked apple bitters

Name: Bloody Mason
About: This spicy Bloody Mary recipe won Absolut’s 2013 America’s Best Bloody award.
HowToMake: Dip the rim of a pint glass or Mason jar in Tabasco Chipotle Sauce and coat with sea salt. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake 3 or 4 times and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass. Garnish with cocktail onions a spicy pickled green bean a celery stalk a pickled okra pod a crispy strip of bacon and a beef straw.
Ingredients: Tabasco Chipotle Sauce;Sea salt;Absolut Peppar Vodka;Tomato juice;Lime wedge's juice;Lemon wedge's juice;Prepared horseradish;Sriracha;Tabasco sauce;Worcestershire sauce;Celery salt
Garnish: 1 Cocktail onions spicy pickled green bean celery stalk pickled okra bacon and beef straw

Name: Apple Toddy
About: Childhood memories of apple cider with a little something extra to remind you why being an adult is OK too.
HowToMake: Fortunately the labor-intensive part of this drink lies solely in baking the apples. Take half as many Macintosh apples as you'd like to make drinks core them peel them and wrap them in wet parchment paper. Bake them in a 350-degree oven for 30 to 45 minutes until completely soft. Set aside until cool. For each drink warm a heatproof mug by rinsing it with boiling water. Put in half a baked apple and a heaping teaspoon of sugar and muddle them quickly together. Add 1 ounce of boiling water and stir. Add the applejack cognac or bourbon and stir again. Add 1 ounce of boiling water. (The staggered addition of the water keeps the drink as hot as possible). Grate nutmeg over the top and serve.
Ingredients: Boiling water;baked Macintosh apple;Sugar (heaping tsp);Bonded applejack (Laird’s)  cognac or bourbon

Name: Vieux Carré
About: The Vieux Carré is pure Old New Orleans and was invented at the city’s famed Carousel Bar. This cognac and rye whiskey cocktail packs a powerful punch and is delightfully complex.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey;Cognac;Sweet vermouth;Bénédictine;Peychaud’s bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: Ginger Smash
About: The crispness and spice of this tasty elixir will help stimulate your appetite.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the ginger cranberries and sugar. Add the remaining ingredients and enough ice to fill a rocks glass. Shake hard but briefly and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass. Garnish with grated cinnamon.
Ingredients: Fresh ginger;Fresh whole cranberries;Sugar;Plymouth gin;Apple cider;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Fernando
About: This rich drink should both revive you and settle your stomach after a big holiday meal.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass. Add large ice cubes and stir for 40 revolutions. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with the top of a mint stalk.
Ingredients: Fernet-Branca;Cinzano Bianco Vermouth (may substitute 1.5 oz of a different Italian dry vermouth);Galliano L'Autentico

Name: Vermillion
About: Date molasses thai chiles and citrus? We guarantee you’ve never tasted a mocktail so good.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Fill with club soda and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Grapefruit juice;Lime juice;Sour Orange Sherbet;Date molasses syrup;Thai Chile Syrup;Club soda

Name: Orgeat Lemonade
About: This nutty lemonade cocktail is so good you won’t even notice it’s liquor-free.
HowToMake: Add the lemon juice and Orgeat Syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake until frost forms on the outside of the shaker and strain into a tulip or wine glass. Fill with crushed ice and top with club soda. Stir briefly and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Orgeat Syrup;Club soda

Name: Iced Caramel Coffee
About: A three-note combination of creamy caramel rich java and smooth vodka.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a rocks glass over ice. Stir to combine.
Ingredients: Van Gogh Dutch caramel vodka;Iced coffee

Name: Stoli Gala Temptress
About: She always leaves you wanting more.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Stoli Gala Applik Vodka;Lemon juice;Simple syrup (or agave nectar);Bitters;Fresh mint leaves

Name: The Oaxacan Punch
About: Serve a big bowl of this festive mezcal concoction at your next party.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a punch bowl and fill with ice. Garnish with grapefruit and lemon slices.
Ingredients: Sombra mezcal;Fresh grapefruit juice;Fresh lemon juice;Agave nectar;Ginger beer;Cold water

Name: Corpse Reviver No. 1
About: This old-timey cognac drink is a classic cocktail for hair-of-the-dog hangover relief. The Corpse Reviver family of cocktails was traditionally consumed as hair-of-the-dog hangover relievers meant to refresh after a night of heavy drinking. Revivers were popular during the late 19th and early 20th century but faded away after Prohibition. Unlike its brother the No. 2 the Corpse Reviver No. 1 has a rich mixture of spirits with a strong Cognac base.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Cognac;Calvados;Sweet vermouth

Name: Glögg
About: This warming Scandinavian tipple is just what you need during chilly winter months.
HowToMake: Add the water brandy orange peel vanilla extract ginger and spices a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for one minute stirring until the sugar dissolves. Strain out the cloves and orange peel and decant into a serving vessel leaving behind as much of the other spices as possible. Serve in mugs garnished with raisins and sliced blanched almonds.
Ingredients: Water;Brandy or spiced rum;Large orange's peel cut into large strips;Vanilla extract;Fresh ginger peeled and crushed slightly with the back of a spoon;Whole cloves;Cardamom pods;Freshly grated nutmeg;Cinnamon;Dry red wine;Vodka;Dark brown sugar

Name: Inside Job
About: Nobody will suspect a thing if you just sit quietly and enjoy this sophisticated bourbon cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice. Garnish with two cherries and an orange twist skewered.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Absinthe

Name: Vertigo
About: Get dizzy with this Averna and lemon cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lemon and lime wheels.
Ingredients: Averna amaro;Lemon juice;Ginger ale

Name: Brown Derby
About: The classic bourbon Brown Derby cocktail is named for the eponymous hat-shaped Los Angeles diner. It’s both sweet and sour with a hefty dose of grapefruit juice and a touch of honey syrup. Try this recipe now to find out what all the hype is about.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Fine-strain into a cocktail glass. Express the oil from a grapefruit twist and drop in to garnish (or garnish with a grapefruit wedge). *Honey syrup: Add 1/2 cup honey and 1/2 cup water to a small saucepan over medium heat. (You can experiment and decide how much of a honey flavor you want in your syrup. The more honey you use the thicker the syrup and stronger in flavor it will be.) Stir until blended. Strain into a jar and seal tightly with a lid. Will keep for 1 month in the refrigerator.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Fresh grapefruit juice;Honey syrup

Name: London Toddy
About: Try this spiced summertime take on the classic cold-weather toddy.
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients in a pitcher and stir to combine. Garnish with whole star anise pods and thinly sliced lemon wheels. (This recipe makes 4 servings.).
Ingredients: Gin;Lemon juice;Cardamom Rock Candy Syrup;Hot water;Angostura bitters;Peychauds Bitters

Name: Mezcal & Mayhem
About: Bring a little mayhem to your mouth with this beer cocktail’s complex combination of sweet sour smoky bitter and bubbly.
HowToMake: Add the mezcal Campari and Mayhaw Syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a pint or highball glass half-filled with fresh ice. Top with the beer and garnish with an orange wheel or twist.
Ingredients: Del Maguey Chichicapa Mezcal;Campari;Mayhaw Syrup;Vicaris Tripel-Geuze

Name: Jell-O Shots Recip
About: Who says Jell-O Shots have to end at college? These tried and true party drinks are fun easy to make and instant crowd pleasers. Pro tip: Jell-O Shots are a blank canvas for creativity so mix it up with different colors flavors and shapes. Your friends will love them.
HowToMake: In a medium bowl stir together the Jell-O and boiling water until the Jell-O dissolves. Add the vodka or rum and cold water and stir to combine. Pour 1 oz of the mixture into each of 16 shot glasses (small plastic or paper cups will also work) and chill until solid.
Ingredients: Jell-O or other flavored gelatin (any flavor will work but do not use unflavored);Boiling water;Vodka or white rum;Cold water

Name: Spiced Rum Milk Punch
About: New Orleans watering hole SoBou serves this subtle twist on the classic Brandy Milk Punch.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with a light dusting of freshly grated nutmeg and cinnamon.
Ingredients: Spiced rum;Simple syrup;Pure vanilla extract;Milk

Name: McGlashan
About: This tasty Irish whiskey concoction combines whiskey sherry and orange marmalade with a soothing ginger syrup.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Knappogue Castle 12 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey;Oloroso sherry;Fresh lemon juice;Ginger syrup;Orange-ginger marmalade;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco Bitters

Name: Dieci E Lode
About: We give this simple gin-and-Campari drink an A-plus.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Gin;Campari;Grapefruit juice

Name: Devil Went Down to Georgia
About: Whether you’re a saint or a sinner you’ll like this spicy concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and double-strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Ingredients: Bulleit bourbon;Crème de pêche;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Tabasco sauce

Name: La Cola Nostra
About: You can’t refuse this complex beverage.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a highball glass with ice. Top with the prosecco. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Averna amaro;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Pimento dram

Name: Michelada Recip
About: The classic Mexican Michelada recipe kicks up the flavor of a cold beer. We break down the steps to the Michelada to make it easy.
HowToMake: Rub the lime wedge along half the rim of the pint glass and dip into a mix of equal parts salt and cayenne pepper. Add the remaining ingredients except the beer. Fill with beer and garnish with a fresh lime wedge.
Ingredients: Salt;Cayenne pepper;Lime juice;Tabasco sauce;Worcestershire sauce;Ground black pepper;Celery salt;Mexican lager beer (such as Tecate chilled)

Name: Last Word Fizz
About: This tasty gin drink mashes up the classic Last Word and Gin Fizz. Try the Last-Word Fizz cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and shake without ice for 20 seconds. Add a few crushed ice cubes and shake again for 15 seconds. Strain into two cocktail glasses and top each with a splash of club soda. Drizzle both drinks with the cherry juice. Rub each rim with a lime twist and use as garnish.
Ingredients: Gin;Green Chartreuse;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur;Lime juice;Powdered sugar;Egg white;Club soda;Cherry juice

Name: Paloma Jimador
About: The tequila-based Paloma is perfect after a hard day of work.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a tall glass and fill with ice.
Ingredients: El Jimador Reposado Tequila;Grapefruit soda;Fresh lime juice;Salt

Name: Nick & Nora Dry Martini
About: Drink like the husband-and-wife detective team in The Thin Man.
HowToMake: Add both the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a small Spanish olive without pimento.
Ingredients: Beefeater gin;Noilly Prat dry vermouth

Name: Soda Jerk
About: Spike your old-timey cream soda with tequila and Campari.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the cream soda into a shaker and dry-shake (without ice). Fill with ice and shake again vigorously. Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Top with the cream soda. Garnish with lime zest. *Vanilla-bean-infused agave syrup: Stir together 4 oz raw agave nectar and 4 oz water until fully combined. Add 1 vanilla bean split in half lengthwise and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Campari;Lime juice;Passion fruit purée (unsweetened);Vanilla-bean-infused agave syrup;Egg white;Cream soda

Name: Pink Plymouth Gin & Tonic
About: Spike a classic G&T with lime and bitters to create this simple but delicious concoction.
HowToMake: Add the gin bitters and lime juice to a tall glass filled with ice. Top with tonic water and stir briefly.
Ingredients: Plymouth gin;Angostura bitters;Lime juice;Fentimans Tonic Water

Name: Gaelic Flip
About: Fortify yourself with the Irish-whiskey-and-egg Gaelic Flip cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker and dry-shake (without ice) to emulsify. Fill with ice and shake again. Strain into an Irish Coffee mug or rocks glass. Garnish with grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Bushmills Irish whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Allspice liqueur;Simple syrup;Egg

Name: Tootsie Roll
About: This inspired chocolaty libation is for adults only.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until ice-cold and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.
Ingredients: Bulleit Rye Whiskey;Lustau Pedro Ximenez Sherry;Scrappy's Chocolate Bitters

Name: Stinger
About: Feel the sweet sting of cognac and crème de menthe in the classic Stinger cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass over crushed ice.
Ingredients: Cognac;White crème de menthe

Name: A Thief in the Night
About: No need to feel guilty for mixing up this sweet and sour whiskey concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Larceny Kentucky Straight Bourbon;Averna amaro;Lemon juice;Honey syrup  (one part honey one part water)

Name: Bourbon Old Fashioned Recip
About: When you get right down to it the Bourbon Old Fashioned is little more than a slug of whiskey seasoned and sweetened. Yet for all of its suave simplicity the drink remains as relevant today as it was when it first captured drinkers’ hearts 200 years ago.In truth you could draw a straight line connecting this drink to the first recorded definition of the cocktail category in general (circa 1806) which calls for spirits sugar water and bitters. You could also skip the history lesson and simply make the drink. Do the latter.Start by using good bourbon the rule being that if you wouldn’t sip it by itself it has no place at the helm of a Bourbon Old Fashioned. (There are other whiskey drinks for masking subpar booze—this isn’t one of them.) From there the cocktail-minded seem to break into two camps: simple syrup or muddled sugar. While a barspoon of syrup can cut your prep time in half it robs the drink of some of the weight and texture that makes it so appealing. And anyway what’s the big rush? The Bourbon Old Fashioned isn’t going anywhere.
HowToMake: Add the sugar bitters and water into a rocks glass and stir until sugar is nearly dissolved. Fill the glass with large ice cubes add the bourbon and gently stir to combine the flavors. Express the oil of an orange peel over the glass then drop in.
Ingredients: Sugar;Angostura bitters;Water;Bourbon

Name: The Brotherhood
About: An alliance of Irish and French spirits yields one delicious concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the top and drop into the drink.
Ingredients: Michael Collins Blended Irish Whiskey;Grand Marnier;Bénédictine;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Peppermelon
About: The balance of sweet watermelon and spicy pepper makes this cocktail undeniably refreshing.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake for 10 seconds and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a watermelon cube coated on one side with ground black pepper.
Ingredients: London dry-style gin;Black Pepper Honey Syrup;Watermelon juice;Lemon juice

Name: Canadian Punch
About: This drink recipe first appeared in Jerry Thomas’ seminal 1862 The Bon Vivant’s Companion.
HowToMake: Combine the whiskey rum lemon and pineapple in a punch bowl and let stand for at least 3 hours (overnight is best). Dissolve the sugar in the water and stir into the whiskey mixture. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. To serve slide the ice block into the bowl and grate about a quarter of a whole nutmeg over the top. Ladle out 3-ounce servings into punch cups. (This recipe makes about 24 servings).
Ingredients: Rye Whiskey;Smith & Cross Traditional Jamaica Rum;Lemons sliced thinly;Pineapple peeled cored and cut into half-inch rings;Sugar;Water;Quart-sized ice block (fill a quart bowl with water and freeze overnight);Nutmeg

Name: Honey Kumquat Caipirinha
About: Whip up a batch of clover honey syrup for this fruity Caipirinha-inspired tipple.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the kumquats and lime. Add remaining ingredients and ice and shake lightly. Pour (unstrained) into a double Old Fashioned glass.
Ingredients: Kumquats;Lime cut into pieces;Leblon cachaça;Velvet falernum;Clover honey syrup

Name: Champagne Cobbler
About: Break out the bubbly and the pineapple juice for a tasty Champagne Cobbler.
HowToMake: Add the orange juice pineapple juice and maraschino liqueur to a mixing glass and stir to combine. Add the Champagne and fill with ice. Stir again gently and strain into a Champagne flute. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Orange juice;Pineapple juice;Maraschino liqueur;Champagne

Name: The Coppe
About: Strong black tea and spices give this Irish-whiskey-and-apple-juice tipple a kick.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: Jameson Black Barrel Irish Whiskey;Lemon juice;Irish Spiced Tea Syrup;Pressed apple juice (or non-alcoholic apple cider)

Name: Lagerita
About: Add a light Mexican beer to get a super-refreshing Margarita.
HowToMake: If desired coat the rim of a highball glass with salt fill with ice and set aside. Add the tequila Cointreau and lime juice to a shaker and fill with fresh ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Top with the beer and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Salt (optional);Tequila;Cointreau;Lime juice;Modelo Especial Beer

Name: Autumn Rickey
About: Add some maple syrup to the classic Bourbon Rickey to get this sophisticated fall cocktail recipe.
HowToMake: Fill a highball glass with ice and insert the lime wheels. Add the maple syrup lime juice and bourbon and then fill with club soda. Stir briefly to combine.
Ingredients: Lime wheels;Grade-b maple syrup;Lime juice;Larceny bourbon;Club soda

Name: The Dead Rabbit Coffee
About: Try this twist on the classic Coffee Cocktail which calls for a pair of Irish spirits.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a small chilled wine goblet. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Brady's Irish Cream Liqueur;Graham's Late Bottled Vintage Port;Clontarf Irish whiskey;Simple syrup;Egg;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco Bitters

Name: Tough to Hea
About: Hollywood bartender Chris Hewes would serve this spicy absinthe-based shot to a movie star who didn’t win an Oscar.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a shot glass.
Ingredients: Chile de árbol-infused St-Germain;Leopold Brothers Absinthe Verte;Lime juice

Name: Spa Cooler
About: This cucumber-and-mint refresher is the next-best thing to a massage.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice or double-strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cucumber slice and a mint sprig.
Ingredients: VEEV spirit;Fresh mint;Cucumber;Lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Elixir Bloody Mary Recip
About: San Francisco bartender and Liquor.com advisory board member H. Joseph Ehrmann says this is the world’s best Bloody Mary recipe.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a pint glass with Old Bay Seasoning. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake lightly�-you want to mix the ingredients without melting too much of the ice�-and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass. Garnish with a kosher dill pickle spear and a cooked slice of thick-cut bacon. Don't use a straw; drink from the rim in order to get a little of the Old Bay with each sip.
Ingredients: Old Bay Seasoning;Square One Organic vodka;Dried dill;Ground white pepper;Celery salt;Worcestershire sauce;Tabasco sauce;Elixir Juice (a mixture of olive brine dill pickle brine and various other pickle brines);Lemon wedge's juice;Prepared horseradish;Tomato juice
Garnish: Kosher dill pickle;Cooked thick-cut bacon slice

Name: Bulleit 7 Hand
About: If you love your bourbon drinks bitter and boozy the Bulleit 7 Hands cocktail is for you.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail or coupe glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Bulleit bourbon;Bitter liqueur;Cocchi Vermouth di Torino;Miracle Mile Hedonism Bitters

Name: Coal Miner's Daughter
About: Ginger lavender and honey grace this Southern bourbon drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with a large ice cube. Garnish with a slapped lavender sprig.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Ginger syrup;Lemon juice;Honey;Lavender

Name: Floral
About: Raid your herb garden to make this simple but delicious vodka cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the rosemary thyme cucumber lime juice and simple syrup. Add the vodka and fill with ice. Shake and double-strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a cucumber slice and a sprig of thyme.
Ingredients: Rosemary;Thyme;Cucumber slices;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Vodka

Name: Golden Dream
About: Try the creamy citrusy Golden Dream dessert drink after your next meal.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Galliano L'Autentico;Cointreau or other orange liqueur;Orange juice;Cream

Name: Bullet Rye's Up
About: Spicy rye whiskey gets a little sweet in this Manhattan-esque drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Bulleit Rye Whiskey;Cognac;Elderflower liqueur;Sweet vermouth;Angostura bitters;Peychaud Bitters

Name: Spicy Watermelon Coole
About: This fiery and refreshing concoction is ideal for summer.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with honey sugar fill with ice and set aside. In a shaker muddle the watermelon and chiles. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a watermelon wedge a whole serrano chile and a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Honey sugar;Watermelon;Small serrano chiles;VeeV Açaí Spirit;Agave nectar;Fresh lime juice

Name: Rye Swizzle
About: Spicy ginger syrup takes center stage in the delicious Rye Swizzle.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Angostura and Peychaud's bitters to a shaker. Shake (without ice) and pour into a highball glass. Fill with crushed ice and swizzle keeping the mint on the bottom of the glass. Fill with more crushed ice and top with the bitters. Garnish with a mint sprig and a piece of candied ginger.
Ingredients: Rye Whiskey;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Ginger Syrup (such as Fee Brothers Warm Ginger Cordial Syrup);Mint sprigs;Angostura bitters;Peychaud's Bitters

Name: Good Morning Brasili
About: Wake up to this orangey tipple.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a highball glass with açaí sugar fill with ice and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with fresh ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a slapped mint sprig.
Ingredients: Açaí sugar;VeeV Açaí Spirit;Orange juice;Agave nectar;Mint sprigs

Name: Apple Business
About: Love apples? Try the Apple Business an autumnal gin cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with 3 skewered apple slices. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Nolet's silver dry gin;Fresh apple juice;Fresh lime juice;Honey

Name: Mancini - Bourbon
About: The Mancini is a bourbon cocktail that’s stirred and strong.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a flamed orange peel.
Ingredients: Bulleit bourbon;Barolo chinato;Tempus Fugit Creme de Cacao;Angostura orange bitters

Name: Bulleit Bourbon Kentucky Buck
About: Love bourbon? Don’t miss this simple and delicious whiskey drink.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lemon juice and strawberry. Add the bourbon simple syrup bitters and ice and shake. Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Top with the ginger beer. Garnish with a skewered lemon wheel and a thinly sliced strawberry.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Medium strawberry;Bulleit bourbon;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Ginger beer to top

Name: Stone Cold Larceny
About: We won’t squeal on you if you make this apple ginger and bourbon drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice and stir briefly. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Apple juice;Ginger beer or ginger ale

Name: Master Cleanse Shot Recip
About: Our take on the lemon juice and maple syrup detox craze has a special spirited twist.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into 2 small tumblers or 2 large shot glasses.
Ingredients: Pisco;Fresh lemon juice;Grade-A maple syrup;Ground cayenne pepper;Chili powder

Name: Beggar's Banquet
About: You’ll be begging for this Maker’s Mark maple syrup and beer cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the beer to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with beer and garnish with an orange half-wheel.
Ingredients: Angostura bitters;Fresh lemon juice;Maple syrup;Makers Mark Bourbon;Old Speckled Hen Beer

Name: New New York Sour
About: This is a refreshing twist on the classic New York Sour.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Dorothy Parker American Gin;Combier;American Fruits Sour Cherry Cordial;Lemon juice;Club soda

Name: New York Sour
About: The secret to this Whiskey Sour variation is a bit of red wine.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the wine into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Slowly pour the wine over the back of a bar spoon so that it floats on top of the drink.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey or bourbon;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Egg white (optional);Red wine

Name: The Watchman
About: Whether or not the watchman is on duty you’ll want to fix this rich bourbon cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice. Fill with ice and shake again. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with 8 drops of Angostura Bitters in the shape of a clock face.
Ingredients: Larceny Kentucky Straight Bourbon;Lemon juice;Orange juice;Simple syrup;Egg white

Name: Crime and Punishmen
About: This bourbon drink is a lot more enjoyable than trying to read Crime and Punishment.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Larceny Kentucky Straight Bourbon;Aperol;Punt e Mes;Regans' Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Tennessee Two Step
About: A strong whiskey concoction and a fizzy lemon-juice mix combine in an elegant dance.
HowToMake: Add the Gran Gala Punt e Mes whisky and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir to combine. Add the remaining ingredients to a second mixing glass and fill with ice. Strain the contents of both mixing glasses simultaneously into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel and grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Gran Gala;Punt e Mes;George Dickel Old No. 8 Tennessee Whisky;Angostura bitters;Lemon juice;Sugar;Seltzer

Name: London Lemonade
About: Once the mercury starts rising it’s officially time to wheel out the lemonade. Since summer cocktails should be simple to stir together in the heat of the moment there’s no better duo than Bulldog Gin and tart lemonade over ice. This simple tipple is a must when the temperature starts to rise.
HowToMake: Add the gin and lemonade to a double Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir and garnish with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Bulldog gIn;Fresh lemonade

Name: Maker's Mark Collins
About: Swap gin for bourbon to create a tasty spin on the classic Tom Collins.
HowToMake: Add the bourbon lemon juice and sugar to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with an orange wheel and a maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Maker's Mark Bourbon;Lemon juice;Sugar;Club soda

Name: Orange Blossom
About: During Prohibition the simple gin-and-orange-juice Orange Blossom tipple was a big hit among illicit imbibers. The recipe which is very similar to a Screwdriver was a perfect way to disguise booze. Try one for yourself to find out why it was such a hit with the flapper set.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Gin;Sweet vermouth;Orange juice

Name: All Betts Are Off
About: This mezcal cocktail is a sure thing.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze a grapefruit twist over the drink and use as a garnish.
Ingredients: Sombra mezcal;Dolin blanc vermouth;Yellow Chartreuse;Grapefruit bitters (The Bitter Truth)

Name: The Kilbeggan Secret Sour
About: An elegant spin on the classic Whiskey Sour the Kilbeggan Secret Sour uses Irish whiskey lemon and grapefruit.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Kilbeggan Irish Whiskey;Dry vermouth;Fresh lemon juice;Grapefruit juice;Simple syrup;Club soda;Orange bitters

Name: Shiso Gimlet
About: This Asian twist on the classic Gimlet recipe is the signature cocktail of the Hakkasan restaurant chain. Shake up a Shiso Gimlet tonight.
