HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a shiso leaf.
Ingredients: NOLET'S Silver Dry Gin;Pierre Ferrand Dry Curaçao Ancienne Methode;Lime juice;Lychee juice;Shiso leaves;Yuzu marmalade

Name: Montauk
About: Love vermouth? Try the Montauk a gin cocktail that includes both sweet and dry.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice. Stir to combine and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: NOLET\'S Silver Dry Gin;Sweet vermouth;Dry vermouth

Name: Nolet's Silver Dutch Mule
About: This two-ingredient cocktail is a simple gin concoction. Try the NOLET’S Silver Dutch Mule now.
HowToMake: Add both ingredients to a wine glass filled with ice. Garnish with a large grapefruit wheel and a sprig of mint.
Ingredients: Nolet's Silver Dry Gin;Ginger beer

Name: Tazza di Vita
About: Herbal and complex Averna from Italy combines with bright and crisp Death’s Door Gin from Wisconsin in a refreshing sip-on-the-patio beverage.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint cucumber and simple syrup. Add the Averna gin and lime juice and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a mint sprig and cucumber wheel.
Ingredients: Chopped cucumber;Mint sprigs;Simple syrup;Averna amaro;Death's Door Gin;Fresh lime juice;Club soda

Name: Not Manhattan
About: Don’t believe your eyes: There’s no whiskey or vermouth in this cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Martinelli's Apple Juice;Peychaud's Bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: A Lonely Island Lost in the Middle of a Foggy Se
About: This tiki cocktail recipe from Paul McGee of Chicago’s Three Dots and a Dash combines pineapple coffee and three types of rum into one tasty concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds and strain into a tiki mug filled with crushed ice. Garnish with pineapple leaves and coffee beans.
Ingredients: Rhum J.M Agricole Blanc;Cruzan Black Strap Rum;Old Port Deluxe Matured Rum;Pineapple juice;Lime juice;Demerara syrup (1 part demerara sugar 1 part water);La Colombe Pure Black Cold Press Coffee

Name: Rub & Rye
About: With rye whiskey Belgian beer and a beef-jerky garnish this is the manliest cocktail recipe we know of.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a pint or double Old Fashioned glass with mesquite salt or dry rub. Fill halfway with ice and set aside. Add the rye lemon juice maple syrup and egg white to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass. Top with the beer and bitters and garnish with a piece of beef jerky.
Ingredients: Mesquite salt or your favorite barbecue dry rub spice mixture;Bulleit Rye Whiskey;Lemon juice;Maple syrup;Egg white;Scaldis Pêche Mel beer;Barbecue bitters

Name: Death in the Afternoon
About: Champion drinker Ernest Hemingway claimed to have invented the Death in the Afternoon a risky pairing of absinthe and Champagne himself. His exact instructions suggested adding iced Champagne to a jigger of absinthe until it attained “the proper opalescent milkiness” then proceeding to drink three to five of the cocktails in one sitting.
HowToMake: Pour the absinthe into a coupe glass. Top with the Champagne.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Champagne

Name: Improved Holland Gin
About: The Improved Holland Gin Cocktail is an old-school recipe from mixology legend Jerry Thomas.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Bols genever;Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar 1 part water);Angostura bitters;Dry orange curaçao;Absinthe

Name: Citrus Thaipiroshka
About: Thai basil adds an irreplaceable accent to this vodka-and-ginger-ale concoction.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lime and sugar. Add the vodka syrup and lemon juice and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a Collins glass. Add a bit more ice and top with 1 to 1.5 oz of ginger ale. Stir and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Lime wedges cut in half (4 small pieces);Sugar in the Raw;Ketel One Vodka;Thai Basil Syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Ginger ale

Name: Tegroni
About: Love the Negroni? Try its south-of-the-border tequila cousin.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Tequila blanco;Sweet vermouth;Campari

Name: Rob Roy
About: Celebrate the Scottish folk hero with the classic whisky-based Rob Roy cocktail. This recipe is similar to the beloved Manhattan but uses Scotch instead of rye whiskey and Angostura bitters instead of aromatic bitters. The difference is delicious—try it for yourself.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass over ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with 2 speared brandied cherries.
Ingredients: Scotch;Sweet vermouth;Angostura bitters

Name: Two-Hit Fig Punch
About: Whiskey and spiced rum spike this fresh-fruit punch.
HowToMake: In a small bowl muddle the figs well and add the simple syrup. Place a large block of ice in a punch bowl and add the fig mixture and the remaining ingredients. Garnish with thinly cut lime wheels and freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Fresh figs halved;Simple syrup;Fresh navel orange juice;Fresh lemon juice;Sailor Jerry spiced rum;Hudson Baby bourbon;Grated nutmeg

Name: Rodriguez Sou
About: Fiery jalapeño syrup kicks up this sweet and fruity tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a long slice of jalapeño.
Ingredients: Espolón Blanco Tequila;Green Chartreuse;Pineapple juice;Lime juice;Jalapeño Syrup

Name: Oh Gos
About: You’ll be saying “oh gosh” after you taste Tony Conigliaro’s extra-citrusy version of the Daiquiri.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake hard and double-strain into a large chilled coupette. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: 3-year-old rum;Triple sec;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Strawberry Basil Lemonade Recip
About: What’s not to love about this fresh and fruity gin tipple?
HowToMake: In a double Old Fashioned glass muddle the strawberry and basil leaves in a double Old Fashioned glass. Fill with ice and set aside. Add the gin and lemonade into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass. Top with a splash of club soda. Garnish with a strawberry slice and basil leaf.
Ingredients: Gin;Basil leaves;Large strawberry;Lemonade;Club soda to top

Name: La Valencia
About: Mix tea with more than just hot water. Try this chamomile infused whiskey cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Chamomile-Infused Rye Whiskey;La Gitana Manzanilla Sherry;Lemon juice;Yellow Chartreuse;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Uncle Buck
About: This is one relative you’ll actually want to spend a lot of time with.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Pineapple juice;Lime juice;Ginger syrup;Green Chartreuse

Name: Lucid Frappe
About: Expand your mind with this absinthe cocktail.
HowToMake: Muddle the mint leaves in the bottom of a frappe style glass. Add the absinthe simple syrup and fill with crushed ice. Pour the mixture into a shaker and shake vigorously. Pour the contents back into the glass.
Ingredients: Lucid absinthe;Simple syrup;Fresh mint leaves;Club soda

Name: Ward Eight
About: The Ward Eight a turn-of-the-20th-century concoction is one of Boston’s major contributions to mixology.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with 2 speared cherries.
Ingredients: Rye Whiskey;Lemon juice;Orange juice;Grenadine;Speared cherries for garnish

Name: London Light
About: The subtle botanicals in gin pair well with the fruit juices in this easy-to-make tipple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a highball glass filled with ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Bulldog gin;Grapefruit juice;Pomegranate juice;Club soda

Name: Strawberry Crush
About: Forget crush this has turned into a full-blown love affair.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberries mint lime juice and simple syrup to a juicy pulp. Pour (unstrained) into a tall Collins glass. Fill with crushed ice and top with ginger beer. Garnish with an additional strawberry and mint sprig.
Ingredients: Fresh strawberries cut in half;Fresh mint sprigs;Lime's juice;Simple syrup;Ginger beer

Name: Brian Boru
About: Appreciate vodka in a whole new light with this complex cherry-lemon-tea concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Boru vodka;Fresh lemon juice;Celtic honey liqueur;Cherry Heering liqueur;Lemon sherbet;Pernod absinthe;Chamomile tincture

Name: Classic Rum-Brandy Punch Recip
About: This historic summer punch brings back the good ol’ days.
HowToMake: In a 1-gallon punch bowl muddle the lemon peels with the sugar and let stand for 3 or 4 hours. Add the lemon juice and stir until the sugar dissolves. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Slide in a 1-quart block of ice and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg. Ladle into punch cups in 3-ounce portions. (This recipe makes about 30 servings).
Ingredients: Lemon peels;Fine-grained raw sugar;Fresh lemon juice;VSOP cognac or Armagnac;Jamaican dark rum;Cold water

Name: Frohito
About: Throw a classic Mojito in the blender to get this frozen tropical concoction.
HowToMake: Add .25 ounce of the Mint Syrup to each of two chilled cocktail glasses and set aside. Add the rum lime juice and ice to a blender and blend until a uniform frappé consistency. Divide the mixture evenly between the two glasses and top each with an additional .25 ounce of the Mint Syrup. Garnish each glass with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Mint syrup;Light Virgin Islands rum;Lime juice;Crushed ice (about 2.25 cups)

Name: Gin Fizz Recip
About: Love the Tom Collins? Try its frothy bubbly cousin the Gin Fizz. The secret to creating the perfect creaminess and froth is to shake shake shake—and then shake some more.
HowToMake: Add the first four ingredients to a shaker and dry-shake (without ice) for about 10 seconds.  Add 3 or 4 ice cubes and shake very well.  Double-strain into a chilled fizz glass and top with club soda.
Ingredients: Gin;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Egg white (about 1/2 oz);Club soda

Name: Kilbeggan Waterwheel
About: Irish whiskey puts on its summer wardrobe in this fruity tipple.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blueberries and sugar. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake well and double-strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with blueberries on a cocktail pick.
Ingredients: Sugar;Kilbeggan Irish Whiskey;Apple juice;Pineapple juice;Cherry bitters

Name: Hard Water Presbyterian
About: A slightly spicier version of the classic Presbyterian this bourbon drink has a real ginger kick.
HowToMake: Fill a Collins glass with ice add the club soda and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake briefly and double-strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a piece of candied ginger.
Ingredients: Club soda;Old Forester Bourbon;Lemon juice;Ginger syrup

Name: Eclipse
About: No need to look away from this potent and tasty cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the mezcal to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass containing a 2-inch ice cube. Float the mezcal on top.
Ingredients: Don Julio 70 Añejo Claro Tequila;Cherry Heering;Aperol;Lemon juice;Mezcal

Name: Maison Premiere Sazerac Recip
About: Try this simple twist on the classic Sazerac recipe.
HowToMake: Add a few ice cubes and the absinthe to a double rocks glass. Stir a few times liberally splashing the sides of the glass. Tilt the glass so the absinthe reaches the rim and turn slowly to coat the entire glass. Discard the ice and excess absinthe and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass. Garnish with lemon twist.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Bulleit Rye Whiskey;Simple syrup;Bitters

Name: Whiskey Smash
About: Like Mint Juleps? You’ll love the Whiskey Smash a citrusy 19th-century cooler. Legendary bartender Dale DeGroff at the Rainbow Room in New York modified the classic recipe by adding muddled lemon wedges. DeGroff calls the citrus-and-mint combination the perfect cocktail for those who say they’ll never drink whiskey.
HowToMake: Muddle the lemon in a shaker. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake. Double-strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube. Slap a mint sprig between your hands and use as garnish. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Lemon;Mint leaves;Simple syrup;Bourbon

Name: VEEV Basil Gimle
About: Add some herbal freshness to the classic lime cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Float a basil leaf on top of the drink.
Ingredients: Basil leaves torn into pieces;VeeV Açaí Spirit;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Flying Dutchman
About: Three different herb-infused spirits flavor this easy-to-make cocktail with complex flavors.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled large cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Bols genever;Bénédictine;Yellow Chartreuse;Lemon juice

Name: Sweet Tea Smash
About: Fix this summery cocktail and then find a nearby porch to sip it on.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lemon wedges and mint leaves. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a sprig of mint.
Ingredients: Lemon wedges;Mint leaves;Unsweetened iced tea;George Dickel No. 12 Tennessee whiskey;Strega;Cane syrup

Name: Pharaoh Cooler
About: Looking for a refreshing drink? Try this tequila watermelon and grenadine cooler.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Fill with chilled club soda.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Watermelon juice;Fresh lime juice;Grenadine;Orange flower water;Club soda

Name: Shifting Sands
About: This tasty gin and citrus cocktail comes from master mixologist Sasha Petraske.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a grapefruit wedge.
Ingredients: Beefeater 24 Gin;Maraschino liqueur;Grapefruit juice;Fresh lemon juice;Club soda

Name: Gypsy Queen
About: One of the earliest vodka-cocktail recipes created in the US this simple tipple dates back to 1938.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel over the top and discard.
Ingredients: Russian Standard Vodka;Bénédictine;Angostura bitters

Name: 24 Sour
About: Pucker up for this gin Bénédictine and lemon juice combo.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with an orange wedge and cherry.
Ingredients: Beefeater 24 Gin;Fresh lemon juice;Bénédictine;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters;Egg white

Name: Betsy Ross
About: No the famed flag-maker Betsy Ross did not create this brandy- and port-based tipple. But it’s delicious nonetheless.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Brandy;Ruby port;Orange curaçao;Angostura bitters

Name: Rhode Island Red
About: The smallest state in the union is the namesake for this big-time tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with crushed ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with a splash of ginger beer and garnish with lemon and lime zest.
Ingredients: Blanco tequila;Chambord;Fresh lemon juice;Agave nectar;Orange bitters;Ginger beer

Name: Fall & Summer
About: Toast the seasons with this tasty tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle all ingredients except the ginger syrup. Add the syrup and ice and shake well. Strain into a highball glass (or stemless Champagne flute). Garnish with a rosemary sprig. *Ginger syrup: Bring 1/2 cup water to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Add 1 cup sugar and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely. Place 1 2-inch piece of ginger (finely chopped) in a mesh strainer and pour mixture over top. Press ginger with a muddler or back of a spoon to remove as much liquid as possible.
Ingredients: Don Julio añejo tequila;Fig preserves;Orange juice;Rosemary;Ginger syrup

Name: Berri Ricky
About: A fruity version of an old classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice. Stir and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Absolut Berri Açaí;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar;Club soda

Name: Chilcano
About: The refreshing snap of lime and pisco with the fizz of ginger ale is what makes the Chilcano delicious.
HowToMake: Add the pisco and lime juice to a highball glass filled with ice. Top with ginger ale and add the bitters. Garnish with a lime twist.
Ingredients: BarSol Primero Pisco;Fresh lime juice;Ginger ale;Angostura bitters

Name: Aviation
About: A classic gin sipper dating back to the turn of the 20th century the Aviation was all but forgotten until about a decade ago. That’s when its secret-weapon ingredient crème de violette reappeared on the American market. Today the cocktail is distinguished by its purple-bluish hue and floral citrus flavors. And to that everyone say welcome back!
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a brandied cherry.
Ingredients: Gin;Maraschino liqueur;Crème de violette or Crème Yvette;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Basil Fizz
About: Bourbon and Champagne make beautiful music together.
HowToMake: Add the bourbon and Champagne into a flute.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden's bourbon;Champagne

Name: Absinthe Drip
About: Enjoy the once-illicit absinthe in an old-fashioned Absinthe Drip.
HowToMake: Fill an absinthe fountain with ice water. Pour the absinthe into an absinthe glass and place an absinthe spoon topped with the sugar cube across the rim. Position the glass under a spigot of the fountain and slowly drip water over the sugar cube until the sugar dissolves and the absinthe turns completely opaque. (You will need roughly 5 ounces of water per ounce of absinthe). Stir briefly before serving.
Ingredients: Ice water;Absinthe;Sugar cube

Name: Winter Sour
About: This delicious low-alcohol cocktail recipe is bitter sweet and seasonal.
HowToMake: Strip the leaves from the rosemary sprig and add them to a shaker. Muddle and then add the Meyer lemon juice and egg white. Shake without ice for 5 seconds. Add the Campari and honey syrup and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a short rosemary sprig.
Ingredients: Meyer lemon juice;Egg white (around 1 egg's worth);Campari;Clover honey syrup (1 part clover honey 1 part simple syrup)

Name: Whatamelon
About: This watermelon cooler is perfect for a day at the beach.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the watermelon juice or cubes and mint. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a mint leaf slapped between your palms.
Ingredients: Watermelon juice;Mint;Square One cucumber vodka;St-Germain;Lime juice;Agave nectar;Bright crisp white wine such as Sauternes or verdejo (optional)

Name: The Tender Knob
About: Apple bourbon and cinnamon create the perfect autumn tipple.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the apple slice. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake for 10 seconds and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. (Do not double-strain; you want some apple bits in the finished drink). Garnish with an additional apple slice.
Ingredients: Organic Granny Smith or Fuji Apple (eighth inch);Knob Creek Bourbon;Alcoholic apple cider;Agave nectar;Cinnamon

Name: Red White & Night
About: Celebrate the Fourth of July year-round with this ruby-red punch.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strin into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with 3 blueberries or black raspberries coated in powdered sugar.
Ingredients: Cabernet sauvignon wine;Vodka;Simple syrup;Freshly squeezed lemon juice
Garnish: 3 Blueberries or black raspberries (coated in powdered sugar)

Name: The Murphy Sour
About: Try this citrusy twist on the classic South American Pisco Sour.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the cilantro and clementine. Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice for 5 seconds. Fill with ice and shake well. Double-strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a cilantro sprig.
Ingredients: Chopped fresh Cilantro leaves;Clementine peeled;Campo de Encanto Acholado Pisco;Lime juice;Clover honey syrup (one part clover honey one part water);Egg white (or 1 egg white)

Name: Front Porch Swing
About: In this refreshing Sangria variation vodka and elderflower play off the bright flavors of fruit and white wine.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill three-quarters of the way with ice. Shake for 10 seconds and pour (unstrained) into a large wine glass. Garnish with a mint or tarragon sprig.
Ingredients: Square One Cucumber Vodka or Square One Botanical Spirit;White wine (sauvignon blanc Sancerre albariño or verdejo);St-Germain;Mint;White or green grapes halved;Orange wheel;Red grapes;berries
Garnish: 1 Mint or tarragon (use the same herb as in the drink)

Name: Manhattan
About: The Manhattan was the most famous cocktail in the world shortly after it was invented in New York City’s Manhattan Club some time around 1880 (as the story goes). Over the years the whiskey classic has dipped in and out of fashion before finding its footing as one of the cornerstones of the craft cocktail renaissance. Amazingly the drink that socialites tipped to their lips in the 19th century looks and tastes pretty much the same as the one served today at any decent cocktail bar. The Manhattan’s mix of American whiskey and Italian vermouth perked up with a few dashes of aromatic bitters is timeless and tasty—the very definition of what a cocktail should be. Early versions call for rye with its spicier edgier profile. Purists claim that it’s not a Manhattan without it but who has ever had fun drinking with a purist? We find that bourbon creates a beautiful if mellower drink. And while Angostura bitters are a must in any variation a single dash of orange bitters helps brighten the cocktail’s edges bringing the whiskey and vermouth together seamlessly.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a brandied cherry.
Ingredients: Bourbon or rye;Sweet vermouth;Angostura bitters;Orange bitters

Name: Kyoto Sour
About: Sake isn’t just for sipping. Try this spicy cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the grapefruit and Tabasco. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a grapefruit slice and a fresh mint sprig.
Ingredients: Grapefruit;Green Tabasco Sauce;Gekkeikan Haiku Sake;Lemon juice;Agave nectar
Garnish: 1 Grapefruit slice and fresh mint sprig

Name: Smash and Grab
About: You don’t need a crowbar to fix this tasty bourbon cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker lightly muddle the orange mint and simple syrup. Add the bourbon and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and double-strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Larceny bourbon;Orange wheels;Mint sprigs;Simple syrup

Name: No. 3 French 75
About: The bubbly French 75 is perfect for celebrating a large or a small occasion.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Champagne flute. Fill with Champagne and garnish with a brandied cherry.
Ingredients: No. 3 London Dry Gin;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Champagne

Name: Dale’s Rainbow Planter’s Punc
About: An instant-party-in-a-punchbowl for six dreamed up by cocktail legend Dale DeGroff.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher or bowl. Before serving shake individual drinks in a shaker with ice and strain into punch cups or large goblets filled three-quarters of the way with ice. Garnish each drink with pineapple orange and lime slices.
Ingredients: Myers's dark rum;Appleton white rum;Orange curaçao;Fresh orange juice;Pineapple juice;Simple syrup;St. Elizabeth allspice dram;Fresh lime juice;Grenadine;Angostura bitters

Name: Boat House Punch
About: The citrusy bubbly Boat House Punch is both gorgeous and delicious.
HowToMake: In a large pitcher muddle the lemon peel and sugar. Let stand for at least 30 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients fill with ice and stir briefly. Garnish with orange wheels.
Ingredients: Dorothy Parker American gin;Sugar;Lemon;Aperol;St-Germain;Fresh lemon juice;Orange juice;Grapefruit juice;Rosé Champagne (6 oz)

Name: Maker's Mark Old Fashioned
About: Muddled fruit gives this version of the classic Old Fashioned an extra kick of sweetness.
HowToMake: In an Old Fashioned glass muddle the orange cherry and sugar. Fill three-quarters of the way with ice and add the bourbon and club soda. Garnish with an additional orange wheel and maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Orange wheel;Maraschino cherry;Sugar;Maker's Mark Bourbon;Club soda

Name: Caipirinha Recip
About: Chances are high you encountered Brazil’s national drink the Caipirinha if you’ve ever traveled to the South American country. Refreshing and easy to make the cocktail contains fresh lime juice sugar and cachaça—a spirit as central to Brazilian identity as samba soccer and carnival. First made in the 1500s from the fermented juice of sugar cane cachaça is similar to rum yet distinct for its funky grassy flavors setting the Caipirinha apart from other sweet-and-sour cocktails.
HowToMake: In a double Old Fashioned glass muddle the sugar and lime. Fill with ice add the cachaça and stir briefly. Garnish with a lime wheel (optional).
Ingredients: Lime cut into wedges;Sugar;Cachaça

Name: Gentleman's Pres
About: The simplest pairings are often the most satisfying. A perfect showcase for Gentleman Jack Rare Tennessee Whiskey The Gentleman’s Press melds naturally with the bubbly freshness of ginger beer and a hint of lime.
HowToMake: Add both ingredients to a Collins glass filled with ice. Stir briefly and garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Gentleman Jack Rare Tennessee Whiskey;Ginger beer

Name: Jalisco Flor
About: Mix up this flower of a cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass and fill with ice. Stir and garnish with a few orange slices.
Ingredients: Gran Centenario Rosangel Tequila;La Pinta Pomegranate Tequila;Fresh lime juice;Ginger ale

Name: Duke's Martini
About: This classic Martini uses a classic London dry-style gin.
HowToMake: Chill the gin and a cocktail glass in the freezer for at least two hours. Add the gin and vermouth to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the frozen cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of lemon peel.
Ingredients: No. 3 gin;Dry vermouth

Name: Ginger Smash
About: A delicious mix of three spirits pineapple lime juice and of course ginger.
HowToMake: Muddle the pineapple ginger and sugar in a shaker until they form a paste. Add the remaining ingredients and fill halfway with ice. Shake briefly and pour (unstrained) into a rocks or Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with a pineapple leaf.
Ingredients: Fresh pineapple;Fresh ginger root;Sugar;10 Cane rum;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Fresh lime juice

Name: Wild Turkey Mint Tea
About: Try this summertime favorite with a bourbon punch.
HowToMake: In a large saucepan boil 2 cups of water and the sugar. Remove from the heat and add the tea bags. Steep for 8 minutes and then discard the bags. Add the remaining 2 cups of water. Transfer to a pitcher and chill. Add the mint and crush with a wooden spoon until fragrant. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Serve in tall glasses filled with ice. Garnish each glass with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Water divided;Sugar;Black tea bags;Fresh mint leaves;Wild Turkey Bourbon;Juice of half a lemon;Juice of half a lime

Name: Yerba Buena
About: Mojito + ginger beer = refreshing and delicious.
HowToMake: In a highball glass muddle the mint lime juice and agave nectar. Add the tequila and fill with ice. Top with ginger beer and stir. Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Mint leaves;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar;Partida reposado tequila;Ginger beer

Name: Caribeno
About: Go tropical with this coconut water lime and rum drink.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Squeeze a lime wedge into the glass and drop it in the drink to garnish.
Ingredients: Fresh lime juice;Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar 1 part water);Coconut water;Puerto Rican white rum

Name: Basil Hayden's Bloody Mary
About: A bourbon Bloody Mary? Try this unusual concoction for brunch.
HowToMake: Rub the lime wedge around the rim of a pint glass and coat with celery salt. Fill with ice and add 2 dashes of celery salt and the remaining ingredients except the tomato juice. Fill with tomato juice and stir well. Garnish with a celery stalk lime wedge and blue cheese-stuffed olives.
Ingredients: Lime wedge;Celery salt;Basil Haydens Bourbon;Hot sauce;Worcestershire sauce;Wasabi;Tomato juice
Garnish: Celery stalk lime wedge and blue cheese-stuffed olives;Lime wedge;Blue cheese-stuffed olives

Name: Gimlet
About: Who says medicine can’t taste amazing? This essential cocktail was created for sailors as a way to prevent scurvy. It didn’t take long to realize that this preventative drink was also delicious. While scurvy may be of the past it seems like this tart tipple is here to stay. It doesn’t get much simpler or more refreshing than the classic Gimlet.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel. (You can substitute 1 oz lime cordial such as Rose's lime juice for both the lime juice and simple syrup.).
Ingredients: Gin;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Chambord Kir Royale
About: The Kir Royale is a swanky Champagne and black raspberry cocktail that is sure to class up your night. The subtle twist on the fruity French Kir Royale combines Champagne and black raspberry liqueur rather than the traditional creme de cassis. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or need a bubbly brunch drink mix up this swanky recipe for the Kir Royale.
HowToMake: Add the Chambord to a flute and top with Champagne. Garnish with a raspberry and a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Chambord;Champagne

Name: Karlsson’s Summer Bloody Mary Recip
About: This spicy gingery spin on the brunch classic is perfect for a warm day.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a Collins glass with a mixture of sea salt and black pepper. Fill with ice and add the remaining ingredients. Stir to combine and garnish with a lemon wedge olive cocktail onion and celery stalk.
Ingredients: Sea salt;Black pepper;Bloody Mary Mix

Name: Rosie Lee
About: Gin rose petals and exotic lychee team up to make this tasty summery tipple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a teacup filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon wedge or an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Hendrick's Gin;Rose petal syrup;Lychee juice;Fresh lemon juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Herradura Tequila Mojito
About: The short trip from Cuba to Mexico makes for a drastic change in flavor for the classic Mojito. Blending mint and tequila this warm weather drink is an excellent Cinco de Mayo cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint leaves. Add the tequila lime juice and agave nectar and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda.
Ingredients: Mint leaves;Herradura Blanco Tequila;Herradura Blue Agave Nectar;Lime juice;Club soda

Name: Dutchman's Daiquiri
About: Genever lime and a chile pepperapparently they like it spicy in Holland.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the chile. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and double-strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a red chile pepper.
Ingredients: Bols genever;Red chile pepper seeded and sliced;Lime juice;Rich sugar syrup (2 parts sugar 1 part water)

Name: Royal Smash
About: Drink like a blue blood for the evening.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint and lemon. Add the Royal Combier and fill with ice. Shake hard and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a fresh mint sprig.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon quartered;Mint leaves;Royal Combier

Name: Bourbon Lift
About: The cocktail equivalent of a New York egg cream this rich and fizzy bourbon drink is absolutely delicious.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Double-strain into a Collins glass. Fill with the club soda pouring from about 6 inches above the glass. Wait a few seconds and then add another splash of soda. This will lift the foam above the top of the glass. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Heavy cream;House Spirits coffee liqueur;Orgeat;Club soda to top

Name: La Estrella
About: This spicy and sweet cocktail will have you seeing stars.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass muddle the sugar cubes and 1 oz of the club soda until they dissolve. Add several 1-inch pieces of watermelon and muddle again. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled. Strain into a snifter with one large ice cube inside. Top with the remaining 2 oz club soda and garnish with a pineapple slice and a strawberry.
Ingredients: Sugar cubes;Club soda divided;Seedless watermelon cut into 1-inch pieces;Cayenne pepper;Lime juice;Flor de Caña 4 Year-Old Rum

Name: Off to the Races
About: Homemade peach-apricot-chipotle syrup takes this drink way beyond the Julep.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the shiso leaves. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake well and double-strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a shiso leaf.
Ingredients: Shiso leaves;Buffalo Trace Bourbon;Peach-Apricot-Chipotle Chile Agave Nectar;Fresh lemon juice;Peach bitters

Name: Ginger Ale Highball Recip
About: The spicy notes of rye whiskey and ginger pair beautifully in the simple and classic Ginger Ale Highball.
HowToMake: Fill a highball glass with ice and add the whiskey. Fill with the ginger ale.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey;Ginger ale to fill

Name: Gin Buck
About: The simple sweet and bubbly Gin Buck was a popular summer cooler during the Roaring ’20s.
HowToMake: Fill a Collins glass with ice and add the gin and lemon or lime juice. Fill with ginger ale and stir briefly. Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge.
Ingredients: Gin;Juice of half a lemon or lime;Ginger ale to top

Name: Rosemary & Rhubarb
About: Rhubarb’s uniquely tart flavor is an ideal backbone for this complex vodka cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an apple fan on a cocktail pick.
Ingredients: Stoli Gala Applik vodka;Rhubarb syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh rosemary

Name: Bushmills Black Bush The Black Nail
About: A long name for a simple drink.
HowToMake: Add Bushmills Irish Whiskey and Irish Mist to a rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Bushmills Black Bush Irish Whiskey;Irish Mist

Name: Sazerac
About: A close cousin to the Old Fashioned the Sazerac has been kicking around in one form or another since 1838 (and was trademarked in 1900 by Sazerac Co.). In 2008 it was crowned the official cocktail of New Orleans a designation more suited to marketers than drink mixers. The truth is the Sazerac has always belonged to the Crescent City.Up until the late 1800s it was made with French brandy as a base—Sazerac de Forge et Fils to be exact—before bartenders switched to rye the spirit newly arriving by the barge-load down the Mississippi. A well-made Rye Sazerac is indeed a tasty thing full of spice and depth though perhaps we think a hair too much muscle. Which is why Liquor.com’s house recipe combines equal parts cognac and rye not as a gestural homage to a lost classic but because the two work together so perfectly. The coupling is a boozy yin-yang that when accented by the licorice flavors of absinthe produces a cocktail that’s simultaneously soft and bold smooth and brash and so unmistakably New Orleans.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe discarding any excess and set aside. In a mixing glass muddle the sugar cube water and both bitters. Add the rye and cognac fill with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into the prepared glass. Twist a slice of lemon peel over the surface to extract the oils and then discard.
Ingredients: Absinthe to rinse;Sugar cube;Cold water;Peychaud’s bitters;Angostura bitters;Rye whiskey;Cognac

Name: St-Germain
About: Created in 2007 by late spirits pioneer Rob Cooper St-Germain is a French elderflower liqueur that has quickly become a staple in craft cocktail bars around the world (so much so that it once earned the nickname “bartender’s ketchup”). Throughout history aromatic elderflower blossoms were widely praised for their medicinal properties. You don’t need a prescription to enjoy this delicious cordial today. Fresh and delicate St-Germain combines well with white wine or Champagne making its namesake cocktail the perfect apéritif for a breezy summer evening.
HowToMake: Add the St-Germain and wine into a Collins glass over ice and stir. Top with club soda. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: St-Germain;Dry white wine or Champagne;Club soda to top

Name: Distrito Federal (AKA Tequila Manhattan) Recip
About: Named for Mexico’s largest city this is an aged-tequila twist on the classic Manhattan.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist or a cherry.
Ingredients: Reposado tequila;Sweet vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Summer Rye
About: It’s also good for winter spring and fall.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a tumbler filled with fresh ice. Top with the Champagne and garnish with some apple cubes.
Ingredients: Sazerac Rye Whiskey;St-Germain;Simple syrup;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh Fuji apple juice;Champagne

Name: Pyrat Punch
About: Hoist one to the skull and bones. Arrr!
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake gently and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the soda and garnish with grated nutmeg and cherries.
Ingredients: Pyrat XO Reserve Rum;Juice of half a lime;Pineapple juice;Grapefruit juice;Bitters;Club soda

Name: Grand Marnier’s Smash Recip
About: Grand Marnier’s Smash is so simple but so refreshing.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lemon and mint. Add the Grand Marnier and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Lemon wedges;Mint leaves;Grand Marnier

Name: Drinks for a Crowd: The Port Royal Punch Recip
About: Throwing a big party? This tropical spiced rum punch recipe serves 25.
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl or large pitcher and stir. Serve in punch glasses filled with ice.
Ingredients: 46-oz cans of pineapple juice;Mango juice;Captain Morgan Original spiced rum (750mL);Grenadine;Oranges sliced thinly and quartered;Sprite

Name: The Bowery
About: The tasty ginger liqueur Domaine de Canton doesn’t need much dressing up.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Domaine de Canton;Fresh lemon juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Ruby Partida
About: Mix up this tequila cassis and grapefruit cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the cassis to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Dribble the .5 oz of French Cassis down the inside of the glass so it settles at the bottom.
Ingredients: Partida Reposado Tequila;Fresh ruby red grapefruit juice;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice;French cassis

Name: The Lanesborough
About: A sparkling cocktail that’s a big step up from a Mimosa.
HowToMake: Add the Grand Marnier cranberry juice and passion fruit juice or puree to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Champagne flute. Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange spiral twist.
Ingredients: Grand Marnier;Cranberry juice;Passion fruit juice or puree;Moët & Chandon Champagne

Name: House-made Clover Club
About: Turn leftover jam into a delicious drink with the Clover Club cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Gin (Tanqueray or Beefeater);Dry vermouth;Lemon juice;Raspberry jam;Egg white

Name: USS Richmond Punch
About: All hands on deck for the historic quadruple-liquor USS Richmond Punch.
HowToMake: Place a 2- or 3-quart bowl of water in the freezer and let freeze overnight. Peel 6 lemons with a swivel-bladed vegetable peeler trying not to get any of the white pith. In bowl muddle the peels with 1 1/2 cups superfine sugar and let stand for an hour for the lemon oil to leach out. Juice the peeled lemons and add the juice to the sugar mixture along with the tea. Strain out the peels and pour into a 1-gallon container. Add the rum cognac port and Grand Marnier and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. To serve unmold the block of ice into a 2-gallon punch bowl. Add the chilled punch stock and top off with the club soda (or if feeling adventerous Champagne). Garnish with grated nutmeg and 1 thin lemon slice. Serves 20.
Ingredients: Lemons;Superfine sugar;Strong-brewed black tea (2 teabags 16 oz water);Dark Jamaican rum (such as Smith & Cross or Myers’);V.S. or V.S.O.P.-grade cognac;Graham’s Six Grapes ruby port;Grand Marnier;Club soda or Champagne

Name: Mayahuel
About: A great orange-and-ginger twist on the classic Margarita.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a wine glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Herradura Reposado Tequila;Domaine de Canton;Fresh orange juice;Fresh lime juice;Agave syrup (one part agave nectar one part water);Mint leaves;Angostura Orange Bitters

Name: Virgin Ad Lib
About: This herb-and-lemon concoction is a recipe you can share with the kids.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the of cilantro. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. (If you're not a fan of cilantro try this recipe with mint basil or any soft herb.).
Ingredients: Fresh cilantro sprigs;Water;Lemon juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water)

Name: Colony Records
About: This fruity and spiced concoction is perfect for holiday entertaining.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Cruzan single-barrel rum;Fresh grapefruit juice;Cranberry syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Holiday at the Hive
About: This citrus and honey elixir is a perfectly refreshing way to kick off a party.
HowToMake: Add honey and 3/4 oz hot water into a shaker and stir to dissolve. Add remaining ingredients shake vigorously and strain into a coupe.
Ingredients: Honey;Triple sec or Grand Marnier;Lemon juice;Orange juice;Star anise powder

Name: The Dead Rabbit Irish Coffee Recip
About: We got famed New York bar The Dead Rabbit to share its recipe for delicious hot Irish Coffee.
HowToMake: Fill an Irish Coffee glass with hot water and let stand for a few minutes to warm. Pour out the water and add the Demerara syrup whiskey and coffee. Stir to combine and top with a layer of heavy cream the width of your thumb. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Demerara syrup (one part demerara sugar one part water);Clontarf Irish whiskey;Brewed coffee hot;Heavy cream lightly whipped

Name: Hearn
About: This complex Irish whiskey-based spin on the Manhattan won’t fail to impress.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a slice of orange peel over the drink to release the oils and discard the peel.
Ingredients: Knappogue Castle 12 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey;Dolin Rouge vermouth;Green Chartreuse;The Dead Rabbit Orinoco Bitters;Absinthe;Orange bitters

Name: Bourbon Vanilla & Chocolate Milkshake Recip
About: You’ll never look at ice cream the same way again.
HowToMake: Place 4 heavy pint glasses in the freezer to chill for 30 minutes. Add the ice cream milk ice cubes bourbon and 4 tbsp of the chocolate syrup to a powerful blender. Blend until smooth. (A good milkshake should be eaten with a spoon so if the mixture seems too thin add another .25 to .5 cup ice cream and blend again.). Divide evenly among the prepared glasses and top each with .5 tbsp of the remaining chocolate syrup. Serve immediately.
Ingredients: Premium vanilla ice cream plus more if needed;Whole milk;Ice cubes;Good-quality bourbon;Simple chocolate syrup divided

Name: Magic Hour
About: Celebrate in style with this fizzy aperitif.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the sparkling wine to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine and garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Lillet Rose;Grapefruit juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water);Yellow Chartreuse;Sparkling wine (such as Gruet)

Name: Blushing Lady
About: She may seem demure but she packs a powerful punch.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Pama Pomegranate liqueur;Vodka;Pink grapefruit juice

Name: 1942 Martini
About: A really good tequila can make a really good Martini.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredient to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Don Julio 1942 Tequila;Dry vermouth;Dash orange bitters

Name: Maneki-Tini
About: Enjoy Japanese whisky’s sweeter side.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled Martini glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Ingredients: Sweet vermouth;Cherry brandy

Name: Grand Tea
About: You’ll wish that it was always tea time.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients to a pitcher and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with lemon wheels.
Ingredients: Grand Marnier;Brewed iced tea;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Don Julio Colada
About: You don’t have to drink this out of a coconut shell but…
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a blender and fill with ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into a hollowed-out coconut shell or a mug and garnish with cherries and coconut shavings.
Ingredients: Don Julio Reposado Tequila;Cream of coconut;Pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Bitters

Name: East India Negroni
About: A transatlantic twist on the classic aperitif.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass filled with one large ice cube. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Campari;Lustau East India Solera Sherry

Name: C & B Old Fashioned
About: C for Campari; B for Benedictine.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir very well and strain into an old fashioned glass full of fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Lillet Blanc;Campari;Bénédictine;Cointreau;Club soda

Name: Aperol Flip
About: This Champagne and Aperol combo is frothy fizzy and sophisticated.
HowToMake: Add the Aperol lemon juice simple syrup and egg white to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well-chilled and frothy. Pour the Champagne into a Martini glass. Strain the Aperol mixture into the glass. Pinch the strip of orange zest to release its oil into the glass and then lay it atop the foam.
Ingredients: Aperol;Juice of half a lemon;Simple syrup;Egg white;Brut Champagne

Name: Acai Mojito
About: What’s better than one super-fruit cocktail? A whole pitcher.
HowToMake: In a pitcher muddle the mint. Fill three-quarters of the way with ice and add the VeeV simple syrup lime juice and blueberry puree. Stir well and top with club soda. Garnish with blueberries.
Ingredients: Fresh mint leaves;VeeV Açaí Spirit (half a bottle);Simple syrup;Lime juice;Blueberry puree;Club soda

Name: Irish Coffee
About: The secrets to making a great Irish Coffee are really so simple that they are often overlooked. This hot creamy classic Irish Coffee recipe from legendary bartender Dale DeGroff has all the right ingredients and will warm you to the bone.
HowToMake: Add the whiskey and syrup to an Irish Coffee glass and fill two-thirds of the way with coffee. Top with one inch of whipped cream.
Ingredients: Jameson Irish whiskey;Brown sugar syrup;Coffee freshly brewed;Unsweetened cream lightly whipped

Name: Irish Jack Rose
About: The classic Jack Rose cocktail gets a splash of Irish whiskey.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Irish whiskey;Calvados;Fresh lime juice;Grenadine

Name: Shamrock Sour
About: No leprechauns were hurt in the making of this recipe.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice. Fill with ice and shake again. Strain into a double rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a mint sprig and a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden\'s Bourbon;Green Chartreuse;Lemon juice;Grapefruit juice;Agave syrup (one part agave nectar one part water);Egg white (that is about half of an egg white)

Name: Dry Martini
About: You could stumble down a very deep very dark rabbit hole trying to determine who mixed the world’s first Martini. Was it a California prospector during the 1849 Gold Rush or the barman at a flossy New York City hotel 50 years later? Both stories hold water. Neither will leave you feeling as blissful and content as a well-made Dry Martini.Start with a good London-style gin. From there add a little (not too much!) dry vermouth and dash of orange bitters. And despite the prissy demands of a certain fictional British spy stir (don’t shake!) the hell out of it with ice and strain it into a glass named after the cocktail itself. Twist a lemon peel and there you have it a Dry Martini. It’s a drink worth getting to the bottom of.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until very cold. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Dry vermouth;Orange bitters

Name: Italian Grape Sour
About: This sweet drink makes a strong case for using grape juice in cocktails.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel and two grapes on a cocktail pick or skewer.
Ingredients: Moon Mountain Vodka;Amaretto;White grape juice;Lemon juice

Name: Pony Express
About: Hitch a ride on this rye whiskey lemon juice and white tea liqueur cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake hard and strain the drink into a 12 oz bucket glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Sazerac Rye Whiskey;Qi White Tea Liqueur;Lemon juice;Grade b organic maple syrup

Name: Strawberry Basil Margarita
About: A refreshing twist on the classic.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberries basil lime juice and simple syrup. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Margarita glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel and additional basil leaf.
Ingredients: Medium strawberries;Basil leaves;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Tequila;Cointreau;Maraschino liqueur

Name: Mango Brava Daiquiri
About: Find out what happens when you add mango to an all-time classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Mango-Infused Rum;Lime juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water)

Name: McKinley’s Delight
About: McKinley’s Delight was created in 1896 to celebrate the 25th president’s electionthis lost classic is a spin on the Manhattan. Many presidents had cocktails created in their honor but few have stood the test of time. Created in 1896 during the 25th president’s election the McKinley’s Delight is an exception. It incorporates classic elements from the Manhattan but dresses them up for the special occasion with cherry liqueur and a dash of absinthe.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Cut a thin swatch of lemon peel twist over the drink and discard.
Ingredients: Straight rye whiskey;Italian red vermouth;Cherry liqueur;Absinthe

Name: Cannibal Corpse Reviver No. 2
About: A few dashes of pear brandy and Fernet-Branca make this gin cocktail recipe unique.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the prosecco to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with chilled prosecco and garnish with a lemon half-wheel.
Ingredients: Perry's Tot Navy Strength Gin;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water);Pear brandy;Fernet-Branca;Prosecco

Name: Rusty Nail
About: Bold and brown the Rusty Nail is the kind of cocktail your grandfather might’ve sipped before dinner while leafing through “The Saturday Evening Post.” Invented in 1937 for the British Industries Fair trade show the two-ingredient classic highlights Drambuie a scotch-based liqueur flavored with honey herbs and spices the precise combination of which remains a closely guarded secret. What we do know is that the word Drambuie is derived from Gaelic meaning “the drink that satisfies.” The same could be said about the Rusty Nail itself.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a rocks glass with ice and stir.
Ingredients: Scotch;Drambuie

Name: Antiguo Citrus Mint Squeeze
About: A little sour a little sweet a little fizzy and a lot of tequila.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the grapefruit lime and mint. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge lime wedge and mint sprig.
Ingredients: Grapefruit wedge cut in half;Lime wedges;Mint leaves;Antiguo Reposado Tequila;Agave nectar;Club soda
Garnish: 1 Grapefruit wedge lime wedge and mint sprig

Name: Tom Collins
About: The Tom Collins is such a classic they named the glass after it.
HowToMake: Add the lemon juice simple syrup and gin into a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Top with club soda. Garnish with a lemon wheel and cherry. Serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Gin;Club soda to top

Name: White Sangria
About: All that fruit is good for you; have another glass of this delicious White Sangria.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a pitcher and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours before serving. Serve in wine glasses.
Ingredients: Bottle crisp white wine (pinot gris);Sweet grapes;Ripe peaches pitted and cut into eight wedges;Grand Marnier;Orange thinly sliced (unpeeled);Lime thinly sliced (unpeeled)

Name: Basil Hayden's Apple Bubbly
About: Bourbon apples and bubbles. Oh my!
HowToMake: Add the bourbon to a Champagne flute and fill with sparkling apple juice. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden\'s Bourbon;Sparkling apple juice

Name: Uncle Angelo's Eggnog
About: You’ll be claiming Angelo as your own relative after just one sip of this delightful Eggnog recipe.
HowToMake: In a large bowl beat together the egg yolks and half a cup of sugar until they turn light in color. Stir in the milk heavy cream bourbon and rum. In a separate bowl beat the egg whites with the remaining quarter-cup of sugar until they form soft peaks. Fold about a third of the egg whites into the yolk mixture. Serve in punch or tea cups topped with freshly grated nutmeg folding in more of the egg whites as desired.
Ingredients: Eggs separated;Sugar;Whole milk;Heavy cream;Bourbon;Spiced rum

Name: Pimm's Pony
About: The liqueur pairs beautifully with Hendrick’s Gin.
HowToMake: Add the gin and Pimm's to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a half-pint glass. Top with the Sprite and crown with cucumber foam.
Ingredients: Hendrick's Gin;Pimm's No. 1 Cup;Sprite

Name: Cucumber Basil & Lime Gimlet
About: The classic combination of gin lime juice and simple syrup gets a fresh-produce boost in the Cucumber Basil & Lime Gimlet. Swap out gin for vodka add a little lemonade and you’ve got the ideal warm-weather cocktail.
HowToMake: Muddle the basil and cucumber in a shaker. Add remaining ingredients and ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with a cucumber wheel.
Ingredients: Vodka;Cucumber (1/4-inch slices);Fresh basil leaves;Lemonade;Fresh lime juice

Name: My Spicy Valentin
About: You’ll fall in love with this creamy chocolaty and chile pepper-spiked vodka cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the chile slices. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass.
Ingredients: Red Fresno chile pepper;Crème de cacao;Orange liqueur;Milk;Chocolate bitters

Name: Jamaican Breez
About: It just blew in from Montego Bay.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the ginger. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Fresh ginger;Appleton Estate Reserve Rum;Pineapple juice;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Super Sunday Punch Bowl of Freedom
About: Whether you’re watching football baseball or basketball this bourbon punch goes well with friends and sports.
HowToMake: Wrap the cinnamon sticks cloves and allspice in cheesecloth tie into a bundle and place in a punch bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and stir thoroughly. Fill with ice stir and garnish with apple slices. (If assembling ahead of time refrigerate after stirring together the ingredients and add the ice just before serving.).
Ingredients: Cinnamon sticks;Whole cloves;Allspice;100-proof Bottled in bond bourbon;Laird's Apple Brandy;Ruby red grapefruit juice;honey;Sweet tea

Name: Cherry Bulldog
About: Move over tonic. Gin and cherries may be the perfect combination.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the cherries anise lime and sugar. Add the gin and port and fill with ice. Shake well and double strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with cherries.
Ingredients: Bulldog GIn;Star anise pod;Lime wedges;Demerara sugar;Pitted Bing cherries;Ruby port

Name: Boulevardier
About: Loosely translated a boulevardier is a man-about-town. The cocktail by the same name was created by Erskine Gwynne the publisher of “Boulevardier” a magazine for expats living in Paris in the 1920s. It’s a tidy story just like the drink it inspired. Equal parts whiskey vermouth and Campari the Boulevardier is both adaptable and adored for its balance of bitter boozy and sweet. Choose your ingredients wisely. The best Boulevardier like the best Negroni hinges on a happy marriage between base spirit and vermouth.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Bourbon or rye;Campari;Sweet vermouth

Name: B-52
About: Believed to have originated in the 1970 by a bartender and fan of the iconic band the B-52 is classic guilty pleasure armed with three liqueurs. Make this layered shooter in seconds and impress all your friends.
HowToMake: Layer the three spirits in a shot glass in the order they're listed.
Ingredients: Coffee liqueur;Baileys Irish cream liqueur;Grand Marnier liqueur

Name: East Side Elder
About: You don’t have to be from the east or old to enjoy this St-Germain Plymouth Gin cucumber and mint cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint and cucumber. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a mint leaf and a cucumber slice.
Ingredients: Plymouth gin;St-Germain;Fresh lime juice

Name: The Translucent
About: There’s nothing odorless or tasteless about this cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a Bols Genever-soaked cherry speared on a toothpick.
Ingredients: Bols genever;White crème de cacao;Kirschwasser

Name: No. 3 Gin & Toni
About: You’ll enjoy the classic Gin & Tonic on a hot day a cold day or really any day at all.
HowToMake: Fill a double rocks glass with ice. Add the gin and fill with tonic. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: No. 3 gin;Tonic water

Name: Angel's Face
About: Made from gin applejack and apricot liqueur this cocktail is fruity but powerful.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: No. 3 gin;Applejack;Luxardo apricot liqueur

Name: Adam and VeeV
About: Go ahead: give into temptation.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an apple slice or mint sprig.
Ingredients: VeeV Açaí Spirit;Applejack or calvados;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Apple juice

Name: Dub Treo
About: Jamaica meets Italy in this powerful combination of rum vermouth and Aperol.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir till very cold and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Appleton Estate Reserve Rum;Carpano Antica formula vermouth;Aperol;Whiskey barrel-aged bitters

Name: Samba Breeze
About: This simple cocktail is as refreshing as it sounds.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Leblon cachaça;Orange juice;Cranberry juice

Name: Baileys Velvet Mocha
About: Curl up in front of the fireplace with this mixture of hot chocolate and java.
HowToMake: Pour the Baileys and hot chocolate into a coffee mug. Top with a dollop of whipped cream. Garnish with 3 coffee beans.
Ingredients: Baileys;Hot chocolate;Fresh whipped cream

Name: Finlandia Vodka Helsinki Mule
About: You don’t have to be stubborn to give this cocktail a try.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Finlandia Cranberry Fusion Vodka;Chambord Liqueur;Pineapple juice

Name: Dubious Manhattan
About: Don’t worry about the name; there’s no reason to doubt this classic cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Martini glass. Spear 3 Drunken Plumped Cherries on a cocktail pick and drop into the drink.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Dubonnet Rouge;Sweet red vermouth;Peach bitters

Name: Peanut Butter Cup Martini
About: A cocktail with peanut rum chocolate liqueur and vodka. Take that Reese’s!
HowToMake: Drizzle chocolate syrup along the inside of a chilled Martini glass and place the glass in the refrigerator. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a peanut butter cup.
Ingredients: Van Gogh Dutch Chocolate Vodka;Castries Crème Peanut Rum;Chocolate liqueur;Cream

Name: Maple Old Fashioned
About: Forget pancakes! Use your maple syrup in cocktails.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Dark rum;Maple syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: French Connection
About: The simple two-ingredient French Connection is one of the best ways to enjoy a young cognac.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients into an Old Fashioned glass over ice and stir briefly.
Ingredients: Cognac;Amaretto

Name: Tart n' Sand
About: Warm up with this tasty Scotch cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the cherries. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Luxardo Marasca Cherries;Glenfiddich 12-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky;Solerno Blood Orange Liqueur;Lillet Rouge;Pink grapefruit juice;Fresh lemon juice;Orange bitters

Name: Pom Blanco
About: Sweet tart and ice cold. Plus a big slug of tequila.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Pomegranate juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Alfie's Apple
About: With a mezcal base plus apple cider and a fizzy apple soda this cocktail makes an intriguing fall sipper.
HowToMake: If desired combine equal parts five-spice powder and sugar and use to coat the rim of a tall glass. Fill the glass with ice and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients except the Sidral Mundet to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass. Top with the Sidral Mundet and stir gently. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Chinese five-spice powder (optional);Sugar (optional);Mezcal;St-Germain;Lemon juice;Honey syrup;Fresh apple cider;Peychaud's Bitters;Sidral Mundet (Mexican apple soda)

Name: Coffee
About: The classic Coffee Cocktail is actually caffeine-free.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a port glass. Dust with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Cognac;Ruby port;Egg;Simple syrup

Name: Champagne Dreams
About: Bubbly meets pomegranate in this gorgeous crimson cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Champagne flute. Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Pama Pomegranate liqueur;Orange liqueur;Fresh orange juice;Champagne

Name: Basil Hayden's Last Stand
About: Subtle hints of lemon and absinthe accentuate this bourbon cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the absinthe to a pint glass and swirl to thoroughly coat the glass. Discard any excess absinthe and add the bourbon and bitters. Squeeze the lemon wedge into the glass and drop it in. Fill three-quarters of the way with ice and stir swiftly for 20 seconds. Top with soda.
Ingredients: Absinthe;Basil Hayden\'s Bourbon;Bitters;Lemon wedge;Club soda

Name: Timmy's Brandy Milk Punch
About: Enjoy the classic New Orleans cocktail Brandy Milk Punch with brunch.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a blender and fill with ice. Blend for 20 seconds. Taste and add more sugar if desired. Strain the mixture into four tall glasses filled with crushed ice.
Ingredients: Brandy;Milk;Powdered sugar plus more to taste;Vanilla extract;Grated nutmeg to taste

Name: Banker’s Lunc
About: Ketel One Vodka with grapefruit juice and orange liqueur. Hold the adding machine.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with a grapefruit peel.
Ingredients: Ketel One Vodka;Dry vermouth;Orange liqueur;Grapefruit juice

Name: Stone Sour
About: The icy bourbon Stone Sour is perfect for a hot summer night.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange half-wheel and a cherry.
Ingredients: Bourbon  (such as Wild Turkey 101);Fresh lemon juice;Fresh orange juice;Simple syrup

Name: My Funny Clementine
About: You’ll be smiling after a taste of this gin and citrus cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the prosecco or Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Champagne flute. Top with prosecco or Champagne and garnish with a clementine or orange wedge or twist.
Ingredients: Bulldog GIn;Clementine segments;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Blood orange bitters;Prosecco or dry Champagne
Garnish: 1 Clementine or orange wedge or twist

Name: Naughty or Nice
About: Mix up a big bowl of this morally ambiguous punch.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients and a large block of ice to a punch bowl. Garnish with blood orange slices.
Ingredients: Fat Bastard Pinot Noir Wine;Fat Bastard Chardonnay Wine;Cognac;Maraschino liqueur;Ginger ale

Name: White Bat
About: There is no shame in drinking this guilty pleasure.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with mint leaves if desired.
Ingredients: White rum;Kahlúa;Milk;Cola

Name: The London Sou
About: This bubbly whiskey drink isn’t English but it does have soul.
HowToMake: Add the whiskey lemon juice and syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the club soda and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Gentleman Jack Rare Tennessee Whiskey;Fresh lemon juice;Spiced Tea Agave Syrup;Club soda

Name: Gentleman Bower
About: This tart whiskey cocktail combines orange lemon and pomegranate flavors.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon half-wheel.
Ingredients: Gentleman Jack Rare Tennessee Whiskey;Pomegranate grenadine (one part Pom Wonderful Pomegranate Juice one part sugar);Fresh lemon juice;Fresh orange juice

Name: St Rita
About: One part tequila and one part St-Germain. Simple but elegant.
HowToMake: If desired coat the rim of a rocks or Collins glass with salt and fill with ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Salt (optional);Tequila;St-Germain;Lime

Name: Alabama Slammer
About: The Alabama Slammer might just be the most ’70s of the bright and fruity 1970s cocktails. Its base blend of amaretto sloe gin and SoCo stands in total defiance of what one would expect from a staunch Southern sipper. Yet the drink looms large below the Mason-Dixon line and beyond. Said to have been born at the University of Alabama the Slammer is a go-to at Crimson Tide tailgates where’s it’s often served as a shot. And slamming one back certainly gets the point across. The nutty herbal notes backed by baking spices and citrus come through loud and clear in a single bite. But to truly appreciate the schizophrenia of the Alabama Slammer mix it in a tall glass with lots of ice and freshly squeezed orange juice and allow the mix to dilute for a minute or two. The flavors will loosen up and unfold at a leisurely pace leaving you with a mellower more Southern-tasting drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange wheel and a cherry and serve with a straw.
Ingredients: Southern Comfort;Sloe gin;Amaretto;Fresh orange juice

Name: Jack & Canton
About: Despite his tough reputation Jack actually plays quite well with others.
HowToMake: Add the Jack Daniel's Domaine de Canton and lime juice to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and pour (unstrained) into a tall glass. Top with a splash of tonic water stir briefly and garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Domaine de Canton ginger liqueur;Sweetened lime juice (such as Rose’s);Tonic water

Name: Smoky Martini Recip
About: Replace the vermouth in a classic Martini with scotch and you get something altogether different.
HowToMake: Add both ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Gin;Blended Scotch whisky

Name: Cerise Light
About: A little gin adds the perfect depth to this pomegranate and Champagne cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the gin and the pomegranate juice to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Champagne flute or small coupe. Top with the Champagne.
Ingredients: Bombay Sapphire gin;Pomegranate juice;Brut Champagne

Name: Americano
About: Mix up the Americano on the Fourth of July or anytime the spirit moves you.
HowToMake: Pour the Campari and vermouth into a rocks or highball glass filled with ice. Add the club soda. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Campari;Sweet vermouth;Club soda

Name: El Presidente
About: Hail to the chief and mix up El Presidente cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: White rum;Orange curaçao;Dry vermouth;Grenadine

Name: Paloma
About: Celebrate Cinco de Mayo year-round with the tasty Paloma cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the tequila and lime juice to a highball glass filled with ice. Fill with grapefruit soda and stir briefly.
Ingredients: Tequila;Fresh lime juice;Grapefruit soda to top

Name: No. 3 Gimlet
About: Mix up this deliciously citrusy gin Gimlet.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: No. 3 London Dry Gin;Fresh lime juice;Agave nectar

Name: Last-Minute Mulled Wine
About: For unexpected guests throw together the classic Last-Minute Mulled Wine with ingredients you probably have in the pantry. When unexpected guests arrive at the door there’s no easier party punch than Last-Minute Mulled Wine. Got a bottle of red wine lying around? Spike it with warm pantry spices like cinnamon and star anise then amp up the flavor even further with a splash of bourbon or brandy. That’s how you capture the holidays in a mug.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until warm (do not boil) remove from heat and let stand for 5-10 minutes. Serve in mugs or punch cups. Garnish with cinnamon sticks.
Ingredients: Fruity red wine (such as Beaujolais or syrah);Bourbon or brandy;Star anise pods;Long strip of lemon or orange peel;Sugar

Name: VeeV Holiday Cider
About: Give a warm glass of cider a festive upgrade.
HowToMake: Add the VeeV to a lowball glass and top with cider. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a slice of orange peel.
Ingredients: VeeV Açaí Spirit;Warm apple cider

Name: Forbidden Fruit
About: With apple lemon and ginger flavors it’s like autumn in a glass.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with ginger beer and garnish with a lemon half-wheel.
Ingredients: Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Pimm's No. 1;Laird's Straight Bottled in Bond Apple Brandy;Angostura bitters;Peychaud's Bitters;Ginger beer

Name: Glögg
About: Let this Scandinavian Glögg warm you to the core.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a large saucepan over medium heat. Heat to simmer remove from heat and let stand for 2 hours. Strain and reheat. Serve in a glass mug. Garnish with raisins and sliced blanched almonds.
Ingredients: Red wine;Port;Vodka;Dried figs sliced;Raisins;Oranges (peeled and juiced);Light brown sugar;Star anise pods;Long peppers;Cloves;Cardamom pods;Cinnamon sticks

Name: Baileys Toasted Almond Brittle
About: Enjoy a little crunch with the smooth taste of Baileys.
HowToMake: Mix equal parts honey and warm water in a small bowl and stir until dissolved. Place crushed almonds onto a small plate. Dip the rim of a Martini glass into the honey water and then into the crushed almonds and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: honey;Crushed almonds;Baileys with a Hint of Caramel;Hazelnut liqueur;Vanilla liqueur;Half-and-half

Name: Hot Shot
About: It takes a steady hand to make this layered shot.
HowToMake: Carefully layer the ingredients in a shot glass in the order shown (Galliano on the bottom cream on the top).
Ingredients: Galliano L'Autentico;espresso;Heavy cream

Name: Grape Escape
About: Get away from it all with this fruity cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the kiwi grapes and mint. Add the remaining ingredients fill with ice and shake. Strain into a Martini glass and garnish with a mint leaf and a sliced grape.
Ingredients: Kiwi peeled and quartered;Red grapes;Mint sprig;Bulldog GIn;Lime juice;Simple syrup
Garnish: 1 Mint leaf and a sliced grape

Name: Coquito
About: This rich and creamy rum-spiked Coquito is a classic Puerto Rican holiday cocktail recipe. Our Coquito recipe makes a large batch so it is perfect to serve a large crowd or to individually batch and give as gifts.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients except rum into a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to simmer stirring constantly. Remove from heat let cool and stir in rum. Transfer to bottles (making sure that at least one cinnamon stick goes into each bottle) seal and store in the refrigerator. Serve over ice in rocks glasses. Garnish with 2 cinnamon sticks.
Ingredients: Sweetened condensed milk;Evaporated milk;Cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez);Vanilla extract;Ground cinnamon;Ground nutmeg;White añejo or spiced rum

Name: Stoli Blueberi Fog
About: You’ll want this simple tipple to roll in even on sunny days.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Ingredients: Stoli Blueberi Vodka;Stoli 80 Vodka;Lemon juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water) or agave nectar

Name: Black Ship
About: Set sail on this whisky and pomegranate vessel.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.
Ingredients: Hibiki 12-Year-Old Whisky;Pomegranate juice;Port;Lemon juice

Name: (ri)1 Spiced Rye Punch Recip
About: Spike your iced tea with rye whiskey.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass fill with ice and stir. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with 2 lemon wheels and freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: (ri)1 Rye Whiskey;Fresh lemon juice;Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar one part water);Brewed tea (Kashmiri Spiced Tea) chilled
Garnish: 1 2 Lemon wheels and freshly grated nutmeg
