HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until hot. Pour into a thick-walled mug and garnish with an apple slice and a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Calvados;Rioja wine;Cinnamon Syrup;Lemon juice;Water

Name: Dried Apricot Martini
About: With peach liqueur and apricot this vodka drink is packed with fruit flavor.
HowToMake: Muddle the apricots and simple syrup in a shaker. Add the Crème de Peche Chopin Vodka bitters and ice. Shake and double strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a dried apricot.
Ingredients: Chopin Vodka;apricots;Crème de pêche;Simple syrup;Lemon bitters

Name: Grapefruit Negron
About: Add a brand-new flavor to the classic aperitif.
HowToMake: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with ice curl the grapefruit peel around the inside of the glass and set aside. Squeeze the grapefruit segments into a shaker and drop in the fruit. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Long wide slice of grapefruit peel;Peeled ruby red grapefruit segments (or 1 oz fresh ruby red grapefruit juice);Gin;Sweet vermouth;Campari

Name: Mango Cooler
About: Easy breezy tropical.
HowToMake: Add the ingredients except the soda to a tall glass filled with ice. Top with soda and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Absolut Mango Vodka;Lemon juice;Simple syrup;Lemon-lime soda

Name: Tokyo Sidecar
About: The Land of the Rising Sun transforms this cognac classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Ingredients: Triple sec;Yuzu juice

Name: Las Fresas
About: Complex aged rum makes this easy strawberry cocktail anything but simple.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: Zacapa 23 Rum;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Strawberry purée

Name: Le Sang et Sable
About: A French take on the classic Scottish Blood & Sand.
HowToMake: Serves two. Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled stemmed cordial glass. Garnish with a cocktail cherry and lemon twist.
Ingredients: Dubonnet rouge apéritif;H by Hine cognac;Cherry Heering;Fresh blood orange juice;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Coconut Colada
About: Upgrade this tropical rum cocktail with a scoop of coconut sorbet.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe glass or coconut shell. Garnish with dried coconut flakes.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Fresh pineapple juice;Fresh lime juice;Ciao Bella coconut sorbetto

Name: Frisky Whiskey
About: This Michael Collins Irish Whiskey cocktail has some spunk.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a highball glass over ice.
Ingredients: Michael Collins Irish whiskey;Bärenjäger honey liqueur;Fresh orange juice;Simple syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: The Employees Only Manhattan
About: A pair of famed bartenders created this subtle variation on the classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey;Sweet vermouth;Grand Marnier;Angostura bitters

Name: Whisky Skin
About: If you’re cold (or you have a cold) make this hot Scotch drink.
HowToMake: Rinse a mug or heatproof cup with boiling water to warm it. Add the sugar and a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel. Add 1 oz boiling water and stir to dissolve the sugar. Add the Scotch (see Other information for recommended brands). Finish by adding 1 oz more of boiling water to bring the heat back up.
Ingredients: Boiling water;Demerara sugar;Lemon peel;Scotch (Macallan or Ardbeg)

Name: Baileys Irish Margarita
About: South of the borderIrish-style.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a blender and fill with ice. Blend until smooth and pour into a highball glass.
Ingredients: Baileys with a Hint of Coffee;Don Julio Añejo Tequila;Generous scoop of vanilla ice cream (softened);Half-and-half

Name: Banana Nut Bay
About: With aged Dominican rum and coconut banana peanut and pineapple flavors it’s about as tropical as you can get.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a tall glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a pineapple slice.
Ingredients: Brugal añejo rum;Crème de banane liqueur;Castries peanut rum crème liqueur;Cream of coconut;Pineapple juice

Name: Corpse Reviver No. 2
About: It doesn’t have to be Halloween to enjoy this cocktail.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled coupe or Martini glass with absinthe and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Absinthe to rinse;Gin;Orange liqueur;Lillet blanc;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Born to Be British
About: It’s OK. You can hum “God Save The Queen” to yourself while sipping this cocktail. We won’t tell anyone.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the diced apple and lemon wedges. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Red apple diced;Lemon wedges;Bulldog GIn;Triple sec;Apple juice;Simple syrup

Name: Mount Gay Hot Buttered Rum
About: A mug of this rich drink will fortify you against the cold and snow.
HowToMake: Rinse a coffee mug with boiling water to warm it up. Add the rum and Buttered Rum Batter to the heated mug. Top with boiling water and stir well to combine. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Boiling water;Mount Gay Eclipse Rum;Buttered Rum Batter

Name: Bee Sting
About: The best part? If you like one you can conjure up a whole swarm.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the bitters to a shaker and shake without ice for about 10 seconds. Fill with ice and shake again very well for about 30 seconds. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Top with the bitters.
Ingredients: Bärenjäger honey liqueur;Laphroaig single-malt scotch;Fernet-Branca;Egg white;Fresh tangerine juice

Name: Backyard Iced Tea
About: Drink this easy-to-make rum cocktail on the lawn porch or patio.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
Ingredients: Spiced rum;Unsweetened iced tea;Lemonade

Name: Spicy Grand Margarita
About: Red pepper and chile pepper powder make this Margarita almost too hot to handle.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt fill with ice and set aside. In a shaker muddle the agave nectar or simple syrup red pepper flakes and chile powder. Add the remaining ingredients fill with ice and shake vigorously. Strain through a tea strainer into the prepared glass. Garnish with a jalapeño or red chile pepper.
Ingredients: Salt;Simple syrup or agave nectar;Red pepper flakes;Chipotle chile powder;Reposado tequila;Grand Marnier;Fresh lime juice

Name: Modern Englis
About: Forget that olde tyme English with this cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle all the ingredients except the gin. Add the gin and fill with ice. Shake well and double strain into a Martini or coupe glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Ingredients: Bulldog gIn;Lemon wedges;Maple syrup;a fresh pear

Name: Sunset on the Pacific
About: Expand your citrus horizons with this tangerine drink.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the tangerine. Add the tequila and fill with ice. Shake 20 times and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a kaffir lime leaf.
Ingredients: Tangerine peeled;Cabo Wabo Reposado Tequila

Name: Minted Man
About: It’ll be the Invisible Man after you taste this cool cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the simple syrup cucumber and mint. Add the vodka and lime juice and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Simple syrup;Cucumber slices;Mint leaves;Ketel One Vodka;Fresh lime juice

Name: Bloody Kirby
About: Don’t let the Bloody Mary steal all of the limelight.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the vodka cucumber Tabasco and vermouth. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with the tomato juice and garnish with a Kirby cucumber spear.
Ingredients: Grey Goose Le Citron vodka;Kirby cucumber slice peeled;Tabasco sauce;Dry vermouth;Tomato juice

Name: The Gold Rush
About: Strike it rich with ginger liqueur and bourbon.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Ingredients: Domaine de Canton;Larceny bourbon;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Chi Chi Organico
About: This refreshing coconut and pineapple cocktail is perfect at the beach or for imagining you’re at the beach.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a blender with 10 oz ice and pulse until smooth. Serve in a highball glass. *Pineapple-Infused Square One Organic vodka: Add 1 slice of organic dried pineapple (with no added sugar) to a 750 mL bottle of Square One Organic vodka and let stand for 1 to 2 days. Taste daily until you like the flavor. Strain the liquid into a clean bottle. (Make sure to save the pineapple and purée it for the drink.).
Ingredients: Pineapple-Infused Square One Organic vodka;Pineapple purée;Coco Lopez cream of coconut;Organic heavy cream;Angostura bitters

Name: Bulldog Smash
About: This fruity spin on the classic Whiskey Smash is a real winner.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lemon peach mint and sugar cane syrup. Add the bourbon and Cointreau and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.
Ingredients: Lemon;Peach pitted;Fresh mint leaves;Sugar cane syrup;Premium Bourbon;Cointreau

Name: Kiss
About: Painted face not required.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Gin;Sweet vermouth;Dubonnet Rouge;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur

Name: Vieux Carre
About: The Vieux Carré was first stirred to life at New Orleans’ legendary Carousel Bar at Hotel Monteleone in the 1930s. Like so many classic cocktails from that city the recipe represents the crosscurrents of America at the time: brandy and liqueur from France Italian vermouth rye whiskey from just up the Mississippi and Caribbean bitters. The Vieux Carré is at once boozy sweet bitter and smooth—in other words New Orleans.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry or lemon peel.
Ingredients: Dale DeGroff’s pimento aromatic bitters;Bénédictine;Sweet vermouth;Cognac;George Dickel rye whiskey

Name: Campari Margarita
About: A happy marriage of Italy and Mexico.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Margarita glass.
Ingredients: Campari;Cabo Wabo Reposado Tequila;Cointreau;Fresh lime juice

Name: French 75
About: Feeling a little parched during brunch? The French 75 is a sparkling cocktail that’s perfect before during and after your egg and bacon sandwich. And with the option of rum or gin this is one classic you’ll want to rediscover again and again.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne into a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a Champagne flute. Top with the Champagne. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Gin;Champagne

Name: Knob Creek Sour Ginger
About: Combine ingredients serve chilled and garnish.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Push a piece of candied ginger into the flesh of a lime wedge squeeze over the drink and drop it in as a garnish.
Ingredients: Knob Creek Bourbon;Domaine de Canton;Ruby red grapefruit juice;Lemon juice

Name: Kew Garden
About: Mint and cucumber give this summery sipper a cooling sensation.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint leaves cucumber slices and simple syrup. Add the rum lime juice and St-Germain and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda. Garnish with a mint sprig poked through a cucumber slice.
Ingredients: Mint leaves;Cucumber slices;Simple syrup;Banks 5-Island rum;Fresh lime juice;St-Germain;Club soda

Name: Don Julios Bloody Maria
About: Who says a Bloody Mary needs to be made with vodka? Try this tequila take on the classic.
HowToMake: Rub the lemon wedge along the rim of a highball glass and discard. Coat the rim with black pepper. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Stir and garnish with another lemon wedge and skewered cherry tomatoes.
Ingredients: Lemon wedge;Ground black pepper;Don Julio Reposado Tequila;Tabasco Hot Pepper Sauce;Worcestershire sauce;Celery salt;Ground horseradish;Lime juice;Tomato juice

Name: Tom & Jerry
About: Make any day a holiday by fixing a bowl of decadent Tom & Jerry.
HowToMake: Rinse a small coffee mug (or white ceramic Tom & Jerry cup) with boiling water to warm it and discard the water. Add the batter cognac and rum to the cup and fill with hot milk. Garnish with a mixture of 2 parts freshly grated nutmeg to 1 part each ground clove and ground allspice. *Tom & Jerry batter: Separate 12 egg yolks and whites and set aside. In a nonreactive bowl whip the egg whites with 1 tsp cream of tartar until they form stiff peaks. In a separate bowl beat the yolks with 2 lb sugar 2 oz Jamaican dark rum and 1 tsp vanilla extract. When the mixture is completely liquid fold it into the whites.
Ingredients: Boiling water to rinse;Dark rum;Cognac;Tom & Jerry batter;Whole milk hot to top

Name: 10 Lords-a-Leaping
About: This scotch cocktail will warm you up for a night of caroling or any time.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with grated nutmeg and a Barker & Mills Bourbon Vanilla Cocktail Cherry.
Ingredients: The Macallan Fine Oak 10-year-old single-malt scotch;St. Elizabeth allspice dram;Angostura bitters;Fresh lime juice;Honey syrup (1 part honey 1 part water)
Garnish: Grated nutmeg;Barker &Mills bourbon vanilla cocktail cherry

Name: Hey Bulldog
About: Looking for a way to use up that bottle of peppermint schnapps? Try this holiday gin cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the 7 Up to a highball glass and fill with ice. Top with 7 Up.
Ingredients: Bulldog gIn;Chambord;Peppermint schnapps;7 Up

Name: Holy Smokes
About: This complex cocktail will set your heart aflame.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled small cocktail glass. Garnish with a flamed orange peel.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Cardamaro vino amaro;Bénédictine;The Bitter Truth chocolate bitters;Ardbeg Uigeadail single-malt scotch

Name: Mount Gay Rum Punch
About: This old-timey favorite will keep a whole houseful of guests satisfied.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a punch bowl and stir to combine. Let stand for 2 hours and serve in punch cups filled with ice. Garnish each cup with a cherry.
Ingredients: Mount Gay Eclipse Rum;Water;Grenadine;Simple syrup;Lime juice;Angostura bitters;Freshly grated nutmeg

Name: Peppermint Pattie
About: Candy in a glass. Err on a glass with a real Peppermint Pattie as garnish.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain the mixture into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish it with a Peppermint Pattie.
Ingredients: Van Gogh Dutch Chocolate Vodka;Crème de menthe;Chocolate liqueur;Cream

Name: Presbyterian
About: If you treat scotch like a religion try this simple and classic cocktail. Be sure to use a spicy ginger ale so you get the most out of the three-part combo. Not a fan of Scotch? The Presbyterian is also delicious with a measure of bourbon.
HowToMake: Add the scotch into a Collins glass over ice. Fill with equal amounts of ginger ale and soda.
Ingredients: Scotch bourbon or rye;Ginger ale;Club soda

Name: Cider House Rules
About: Now this is one set of rules that’s not hard to follow.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a highball glass with cinnamon and fill with ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Ingredients: Ground cinnamon;Don Julio blanco tequila;Fresh apple cider;Club soda;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Infused Tom Collin
About: Make this simple drink to show off a fruit- or herb-infused spirit you made yourself.
HowToMake: Add the vodka or tequila lime juice and simple syrup to a highball glass. Fill with ice and top with soda. Garnish with a lime wheel and fresh lemon basil leaf. To serve the drink up add the vodka or tequila lime juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake quickly and strain into a Champagne flute. Top with soda (Do not garnish).
Ingredients: Infused vodka or tequila;Lime squeeze for juice;Simple syrup;Club soda chilled
Garnish: 1 Lime wheel and fresh lemon-basil leaf

Name: Sergeant Pepper
About: Psychedelic marching garb not required.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the apple. Add the blackcurrants peppercorns lime and sugar and muddle again. Add the gin and fill with ice. Shake well and double strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an apple slice.
Ingredients: Macintosh apple cubed;Blackcurrants;Black peppercorns;Lime wedge;Raw sugar;Bulldog gIn

Name: Ginger Rabbit
About: After a couple of these spiced bourbon cocktails you’ll be hopping.
HowToMake: Add the syrup and ginger to a mixing glass. Twist the lemon peel over the glass to extract the oils. Drop the peel into the glass and muddle. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: Star Anise and Black Tea Infused Simple Syrup;Fresh ginger;Lemon peel;Basil Hayden's Bourbon;Crème Yvette;Angostura bitters

Name: An Bodhran
About: Have a taste of the Emerald Isle.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake heavily for about a minute. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with 3 drops of mint bitters.
Ingredients: Bushmills Irish whiskey;Port;Maple sugar;Egg

Name: The Sun Also Rises
About: Toast Papa Hemingway with this citrusy-and-complex rum concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe glass filled with crushed ice.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Fresh lime juice;Fresh grapefruit juice;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur;Vieux Pontarlier Absinthe

Name: The Modern
About: This drink was the new new thingat the turn of the 20th century.
HowToMake: Add the lemon juice and sugar to a shaker and stir. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry if you like.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Sugar;Johnnie Walker Black Label Scotch Whisky;Plymouth Sloe Gin;Absinthe;Orange bitters

Name: Opening Act
About: Start your next meal with this gingery aperitif.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the tonic to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice. Fill with tonic and garnish with fresh mint.
Ingredients: Domaine de Canton;Campari;Fresh lime juice;Tonic water

Name: Chocolate Cheer
About: Cheerleaders would be a lot more entertaining if they practiced this one more often.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Don Julio 1942 Tequila;Chocolate milk;Agave nectar;Cognac;Ground nutmeg

Name: Rusty Compass
About: It won’t help you navigate but it’s delicious.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Drambuie

Name: Chopin Mistletoe Martini
About: This creamy and minty concoction might just be better than a kiss.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a candy cane.
Ingredients: Chopin Vodka;Crème de menthe;Baileys Irish Cream;Milk

Name: Banks Milk Punch
About: Rum cognac and just a dash of vanilla flavor this rich favorite.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into two chilled punch cups. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Whole milk;Banks 5-Island rum;Rémy Martin VSOP Cognac;Honey syrup (two parts clover honey one part water);Madagascar vanilla extract

Name: The Dove
About: Try this fresh spin on the Paloma.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute. Top with Champagne.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Grand Marnier;Fresh lemon juice;Grapefruit juice;Orange bitters;Champagne

Name: Brandy Alexander
About: Lots of cocktails get dubbed “dessert in a glass.” But the Brandy Alexander is one of the few that deserves the accolade. A variation on the largely forgotten gin-based Alexander the Brandy Alexander originated around the turn of the 20th century at Hotel Rector in New York City. During Prohibition drinkers began swapping gin for other spirits and cognac was the one that stuck. Why? Because it blends so perfectly with the combination of cacao cream and nutmeg making the Brandy Alexander the one Alexander people know today.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail or coupe glass. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Cognac;Dark crème de cacao;Cream

Name: Antiguo Refresco
About: A refreshing Margarita with a cucumber twist.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the cucumber and lime wedges. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a cucumber slice and lime wedge.
Ingredients: Cucumber;Lime wedges;Antiguo Blanco Tequila;Agave nectar;Water

Name: Zacapa Perfect Manhattan
About: Rum and honey syrup make an unusual but delicious version of the classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Zacapa 23 Rum;Dry vermouth;Sweet vermouth;dashes Bitters;Honey syrup (one part honey one part water)

Name: Winter Cup
About: A fruity concoction to remind you of warmer times.
HowToMake: In a shaker gently muddle the strawberry lime lemon orange and mint (do not break up the mint). Add the spiced rum and St-Germain and fill with ice. Shake lightly and pour (unstrained) into an Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Strawberry;Lime;Lemon;Orange half-wheel;Fresh mint leaves;Montecristo Spiced Blend Rum (or other spiced rum);St-Germain

Name: Stoli Razpiroska
About: This fizzy fruity refresher has just four ingredients.
HowToMake: In a rocks or Collins glass muddle the raspberries and simple syrup. Add the vodka and fill with ice. Top with club soda and garnish with additional raspberries.
Ingredients: Simple syrup;Stoli Razberi Vodka;Club soda

Name: Harvest Highball
About: This easy cocktail is a good reason to keep a bottle of ginger beer on hand.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the ginger beer and garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Ketel One Citroen Vodka;Lime juice;Simple syrup;Ginger beer

Name: Ginger Sour
About: A tasty mix of ginger vodka lemon juice and maple syrup.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Skyy Infusions Ginger Vodka;Lemon juice;Egg white;Maple syrup

Name: The Jalisco Jasmine
About: This Mexican flower has bite.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Grand Marnier;Bitter aperitif;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Kingston Colada
About: Get transported to Jamaica with this coconut and pineapple concoction.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a rocks glass with ice and stir. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Appleton Estate Reserve rum;Coconut water;Pineapple juice;Angostura bitters;Lime

Name: Apple Irish Coffee
About: You won’t find this caffeinated drink at Starbucks.
HowToMake: Fill a rocks glass with ice and add all the ingredients. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Baileys Original Irish Cream;Coffee chilled;100-proof Apple brandy;Yellow Chartreuse

Name: Teatime Toddy
About: This classic hot cocktail goes tropical with a slug of spiced rum.
HowToMake: Add the rum lemon juice and syrup to a small mug. Add the hot tea and bitters. Stir and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Spiced rum;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Hot brewed red tea;Orange bitters

Name: Dubonnet Cosmopolitan
About: A grown up Cosmo with the refined taste of Dubonnet.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
Ingredients: Dubonnet Rouge;Vodka;Triple sec;Cranberry juice;Lime juice

Name: Pumpkin No
About: Tony Abou-Ganim’s tasty pumpkin and cinnamon cocktail is the perfect drink for a fall party.
HowToMake: Separate the eggs and refrigerate the whites. In a mixing bowl beat the yolks until creamy. Gradually add in .25 lb sugar beating at high speed until thick. Stir in the rum milk vanilla cinnamon and pumpkin and chill for at least two hours. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Add the remaining .25 lb sugar beating to stiff peaks. Fold the chilled rum mixture into the egg whites. Serve in Martini glasses garnished with freshly grated nutmeg and a dollop of whipped cream.
Ingredients: Eggs;Sugar;10 Cane Rum;Whole milk;Vanilla extract;Ground cinnamon;Pumpkin puree
Garnish: 1 Whipped cream and freshly grated nutmeg

Name: Pegu Club
About: This classic cocktail was invented in a British social club in Burma.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Gin;Orange curaçao;Fresh lime juice;Orange bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: Pear Tree Martini
About: Thankfully the partridges aren’t included.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with 3 pear slices.
Ingredients: Hangar One spiced pear vodka;St-Germain;Fresh lime juice;Angostura bitters

Name: Irish Buck
About: A whiskey and ginger ale with a delicious citrus twist.
HowToMake: Add the whiskey and lime juice to a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with the ginger ale and garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Irish whiskey;Fresh lime juice;Ginger ale

Name: Cooperstown
About: Toast baseball’s legends with this minty concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake gently and strain into a cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Tanqueray gin;Martini & Rossi rosso vermouth;Noilly Prat Original Dry Vermouth;The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters;Mint leaves

Name: Absolut Mango Spice
About: Sweet has never tasted so hot.
HowToMake: Add all of the  ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and fine-strain into a Martini glass or tumbler filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a jalapeño slice.
Ingredients: Absolut Mango Vodka;Mango nectar;Agave nectar;Fresh lime juice;Jalapeño slices;Dash orange bitters

Name: Bacardí
About: After Prohibition the Bacardí Cocktail became enormously popular tempting unscrupulous barmen to serve it with whatever rum was on hand. Fortunately the New York Supreme Court stepped in to protect cocktail fans by decreeing it could only be made with Bacardí rum.
HowToMake: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker and stir. Fill the shaker halfway with crushed ice top with cubed ice and shake vigorously until the shaker is frosted. Fine-strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Ingredients: Bacardi Superior Rum;Fresh lime juice;Pomegranate grenadine

Name: Airmail Punch Recip
About: A teacup is the unusual vessel for this Champagne-topped rum drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled teacup filled with one large ice cube. Top with the Champagne and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Fresh lime juice;Honey syrup (two parts honey one part water);Moët & Chandon Imperial Champagne

Name: Hot Gin Punch
About: This fruity punch will keep a large group warm and happy.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a large saucepan and simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes. To serve pour the hot mixture into a punch bowl or teapot and garnish with orange slices studded with cloves. Pair with gingerbread.
Ingredients: Hendrick's gin;Madeira wine;Lemon twists;Orange slice;Pineapple;Honey;Fresh lemon juice;Cloves;Ground nutmeg;Ground cinnamon;Brown sugar

Name: Fruit and Gingerly
About: A cocktail that certainly lives up to its name.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the cranberries and pineapple.  Add the remaining ingredients except the club soda and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a pineapple chunk and/or three cranberries on a toothpick.
Ingredients: Fresh cranberries;Pineapple chunks;Skyy Infusions Ginger Vodka;Orange juice;Fresh grapefruit juice;Fresh lime juice;Club soda

Name: Abuelita
About: Respect your elders.
HowToMake: Rinse a coupe glass with cinnamon liqueur and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with ground cinnamon.
Ingredients: Cinnamon liqueur;Don Julio 1942 Tequila;White crème de cacao

Name: Between the Sheets
About: Add a little rum to the Sidecar and you get this provocatively named classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Flame an orange peel over the glass and discard before serving.
Ingredients: Cognac;Triple sec;Light rum;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Corzo Tequila Snow White
About: The White Russian travels south of the border.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Ingredients: Corzo Silver Tequila;Coffee liqueur;Vanilla cognac;Heavy cream

Name: Greyhound's Tooth
About: Settle down PETA. It’s not what it sounds like.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a thick-cut grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Bénédictine;Russian Standard Platinum Vodka;Grapefruit juice;Lemon juice;Grapefruit bitters;Sugar

Name: Chile Fresca
About: Red bell pepper is an unusual ingredient but it works well in this sweet-and-spicy tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: Combine equal parts of ground chile de arbol and salt on a saucer and coat the rim of a Collins glass. Fill with ice and set aside. In a shaker muddle the cucumber bell pepper and lemon juice. Add the tequila agave nectar bitters and ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass. Top with ginger beer. Garnish with a red bell pepper and cucumber slice.
Ingredients: Cucumber;Red bell pepper;Fresh lemon juice;Herradura reposado tequila;Agave nectar;Angostura bitters;Goslings Stormy ginger beer to top
Garnish: Ground chile de arbol;Salt;Red bell pepper slice;Cucumber slice

Name: Malice in Hollywood No. 1
About: Remember the glamorous days of old Hollywood with this creation of ’40s gossip columnist Hedda Hopper.
HowToMake: Add both the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or tall shot glass. Twist a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel over the top.
Ingredients: Jim Beam Black Bourbon;Apricot brandy (Marie Brizard Apry)

Name: Sidecar
About: The Sidecar is a direct descendant of the Brandy Crusta a long-forgotten New Orleans drink that has enjoyed something of a comeback in the last couple of years. How it got its name is a source of debate: Both a French and English bar claim to have invented the combination of cognac Cointreau and lemon juice for a customer who arrived at the location in the sidecar of a motorcycle. Bar veteran Dale DeGroff however says the drink’s name references the mixture that’s left in the shaker after straining and served in a shot glass on the side. This little treat is called that’s right a sidecar.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a coupe glass with sugar and set aside. Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Cognac;Cointreau;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Raspberry White Chocolate Truffle
About: Pure decadence in cocktail form.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with three raspberries on a pick.
Ingredients: Van Gogh Raspberry Vodka;White chocolate liqueur;White crème de cacao;Raspberry liqueur

Name: The Bottom Line
About: It’s tasty and you should try it.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Highland Park 18-Year-Old Scotch Whisky;Manzanilla sherry;Bärenjäger Honey Liqueur;Amaro CioCiaro;Orange bitters;Angostura bitters

Name: Hellfire
About: This spicy rum-and-beer concoctions is for sinners only.
HowToMake: Squeeze the lime into a pint glass. Fill with ice and add the rum Tabasco and ginger beer. Top with beer.
Ingredients: Lime;Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum;Tabasco sauce;Ginger beer;Pilsner

Name: Baileys Chai Swizzle
About: Creamy and comforting but exotically spiced.
HowToMake: Brew a pot of chai tea. Add 2 tsp of the brown sugar for every cup and stir until dissolved.  Add the Baileys and 3 oz of the tea to a mug and stir with the cinnamon stick. (This drink can also be served cold: Simply chill the tea before mixing and serve in a tall glass filled with ice.).
Ingredients: Chai tea;Raw brown sugar;Baileys Original Irish Cream;Cinnamon stick

Name: Beatnik
About: Bongo drums black beret and Jack Kerouac paperback not included.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Averna amaro;Ferreira tawny port;Hudson Baby bourbon

Name: Sparkling Ginger Daisy
About: The subtle spice of ginger heats up this gin-and-prosecco drink.
HowToMake: If desired coat the rim of a Champagne flute with the sugar and place the cherry in it. Add all the other ingredients except the prosecco to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled and strain into the prepared flute. Top with the prosecco.
Ingredients: Sugar;Maraschino cherry (optional);Gin;Ginger liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Grenadine;Mionetto prosecco brut

Name: Grand Cosmo
About: You have to mix one up to find out why it’s so grand.
HowToMake: Combine all ingredients in a shaker. Fill with ice shake hard and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a thin lime wheel.
Ingredients: Grand Marnier;Belvedere vodka;Cranberry juice;Fresh lime juice

Name: Bobby Burns
About: Practice your couplets and quatrains while sipping this cocktail named for the Scottish poet.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass. Twist a lemon peel over the glass to release its oils and then drop it into the drink.
Ingredients: Blended Scotch whisky  (12-Year Old);Sweet vermouth  (Noilly Prat Rouge);Bénédictine

Name: Fresh Watermelon Margarita
About: No seed-spitting required.
HowToMake: Muddle the watermelon and agave syrup in a shaker. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a watermelon slice.
Ingredients: Seedless watermelon cut into 1-inch cubes;Agave syrup  (1 part agave nectar 1 part water);Don Julio blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice

Name: Moscow Mule
About: This spicy vodka and ginger cocktail bites back. The Moscow Mule marries the clear spirit with ginger for a spicy kick. Lime adds a citrusy touch for a taste that will keep you coming back for more.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Vodka;Ginger beer (preferably organic);Fresh lime juice

Name: Black Russian
About: It takes a good drink to survive a Moscow winter. This recipe renders a fairly dry version of the drink. You can use more Kahlúa  and less vodka to make a sweeter version.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice.
Ingredients: Vodka;Kahlúa

Name: Anejo Old Fashioned
About: This tasty and simple recipe will never go out of style.
HowToMake: In an Old Fashioned glass lightly muddle the agave nectar bitters and orange peel. Fill with ice add the tequila and stir. Garnish with a brandied cherry.
Ingredients: Agave nectar;Angostura bitters;Orange peel;Añejo tequila

Name: Knob Creek Horse's Neck (with a Kick)
About: Extra-spicy ginger beer gives this old favorite new life.
HowToMake: Add the bourbon bitters and lemon peel to a highball glass and fill with ice. Top with the ginger beer and jiggle the glass lightly to combine.
Ingredients: Knob Creek Bourbon;Fee Brothers Old Fashion Bitters;Peel of a whole lemon (preferably in one piece);Ginger beer

Name: Gin and Tonic
About: Gin & Tonic. If you can say it you can make it. Right? Not exactly. The two-ingredient cocktail which got its start in the 19th century as an antimalarial for British soldiers requires your undivided attention. From glassware to garnish to spirit proof—45% ABV and above if you mean business—everything should be carefully considered when mixing a G&T. But perhaps the most important variable is the ratio. A Gin & Tonic made with two-parts tonic to one-part gin is a highball of balance and beauty. Easy. Right?
HowToMake: Add the gin to a highball glass over ice. Top with the tonic water and gently stir. Garnish with 2 lime wheels.
Ingredients: Gin;Tonic water

Name: Pink Flamingo
About: Drink this tart and fizzy rum cooler to escape the heat.
HowToMake: Add the rum and lime juice to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the grapefruit soda and garnish with a lime wheel or long lime twist.
Ingredients: Banks 5-Island rum;Fresh lime juice;Pink grapefruit soda (Ting or Izze)
Garnish: 1 Lime wheel or long lime twist

Name: 55 T-Bird
About: With orange juice orange zest and orange liqueur the vitamin C in this drink will last you for weeks. Not that you’ll want to wait that long to have another.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe or a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Ketel One Vodka;Orange liqueur;Aperol;Orange juice

Name: Gin Rickey
About: The Gin Rickey is one of the few classic cocktails whose origin isn’t muddled by history. The refreshing highball is named after Joe Rickey a Democratic lobbyist living in Washington D.C. during the late 19th century. Favoring zero-sugar drinks Rickey instructed a local bartender to build a Bourbon Rickey and with that a proud line of cocktails was born. Soon people were customizing the drink to their liking with the Gin Rickey eventually becoming the most popular of all Rickeys.
HowToMake: Fill a highball glass with ice and add the gin and lime juice. Top with soda water. Garnish with 2 lime wheels.
Ingredients: Gin;Fresh lime juice;Soda water to top

Name: Wind At Your Back
About: Looking for a taste of summer? Try Allen Katz’s ginger rum and fresh juices cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a thin apple slice.
Ingredients: Tommy Bahama White Sand Rum;Ginger liqueur;Fresh apple juice;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup (one part sugar one part water)

Name: Sloe Gin Fizz
About: This old-timey recipe makes a delicious fruity classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a highball or Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the club soda. Garnish with a lemon half-wheel and cherry.
Ingredients: Sloe gin;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Club soda

Name: Paddington
About: Named for the marmalade-loving bear this drink gets a jolt of fruit flavor from orange preserves.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled coupe glass with absinthe. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: St. George Absinthe Verte;Banks 5-Island rum;Lillet Blanc;Grapefruit juice;Lemon juice;Bonne Maman Orange Marmalade

Name: Ginger Rogers
About: If she was good enough for Fred Astaire she’s good enough for you.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberry and clementine. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an edible pansy.
Ingredients: Strawberry sliced;Clementine segments;Campari;Orange juice;Ground ginger;7UP

Name: Kahlua Espresso Martini
About: A potent mix of strong coffee and sweet liqueur.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Ingredients: Kahlúa;Absolut vodka;Freshly brewed espresso

Name: Marguerite
About: This old-school Martini goes heavy on the vermouth.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon peel and/or a small Spanish olive without pimento.
Ingredients: Plymouth gin;Noilly Prat dry vermouth;Regans Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Michael's Word
About: Mr. Collins promises you’ll love this drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lime twist.
Ingredients: Michael Collins Blended Irish Whiskey;Green Chartreuse;Maraschino liqueur;Fresh lime juice

Name: Agave Ginger Rita
About: The spicy kick of ginger is a welcome addition to this update of the Margarita.
HowToMake: If desired coat the rim of a highball glass with salt fill with ice and set aside. Add  the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Salt;Don Julio blanco tequila;Grand Marnier;Fresh lime juice;Ginger Root Simple Syrup%;Egg white

Name: Romanoff's of Beverly Hills
About: Drink like Bogie Bacall and the Rat Pack: This was the house cocktail of their favorite Hollywood watering hole.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except ginger beer to a tall glass. Fill halfway with cracked ice drop in a juiced lime half fill with ice and top with ginger beer. This was the house cocktail of the Los Angeles restaurant where the Rat Pack was formed and Bogart and Bacall did their drinking.
Ingredients: Plymouth gin;Cherry Heering;Grenadine Fee Brothers;Fresh lime juice;Ginger beer

Name: Last Word
About: The Last Word was one of the first pre-Prohibition drinks to lead the cocktail revival of the early aughts. Murray Stenson of Seattle’s Zig Zag unearthed the equal-parts classic—gin maraschino liqueur Chartreuse and lime juice—in Ted Saucier’s 1962 book “Bottoms Up.” Before long the Last Word was a staple in cocktail bars across the country revered for its heady balance of sweet sour and herbal flavors. Whether you hew to the original recipe or stake out your own variation (mezcal is worthy substitute for gin) one thing is certain: The Last Word will leave you um speechless.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Ingredients: Gin;Green Chartreuse;Maraschino liqueur;Fresh lime juice

Name: Island Voodoo
About: Shrunken head not included.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled wine glass. Garnish with a flamed orange peel.
Ingredients: Averna Limoni;Averna amaro;Rye Whiskey

Name: Bronx
About: It’s not as famous as a Manhattan but it’s just as tasty.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Gin;Dry vermouth;Sweet vermouth;Fresh orange juice;Orange bitters (optional)

Name: The Valentino
About: A tribute to the actor’s Italian birthplace this variation on the Negroni is a modern classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist.This cocktail is on the menu at The Astor Room in Queens New York.
Ingredients: Vodka gin or rye whiskey;Campari;Sweet vermouth

Name: Elderflower Fizz
About: Relax with this bubbly drink from Scottsdale Ariz.’s Camelback Inn Resort & Spa.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the sparkling wine to a Champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine. Slap a thyme sprig once between your palms to release its oils. Use it to stir the drink and leave it in as a garnish.
Ingredients: lime sour (two parts organic lime juice one part organic agave nectar);Square One Organic vodka;St-Germain;Agave nectar;Gruet

Name: Persephone's Elixir
About: Go tropical with this exotic tequila and pomegranate cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass. Add a generous splash of ginger beer.
Ingredients: Pama Pomegranate liqueur;Blanco tequila;Fresh lemon juice;Ginger beer

Name: Nicaraguan Negroni Punch
About: Throw a party South American style.
HowToMake: Add the lemon juice and cloves to a Tupperware container or cake mold and freeze until solid. Add the remaining ingredients to a large punch bowl and add the lemon ice block.
Ingredients: Lemons;Cloves;Campari;Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Rum;Cinzano Rosso vermouth;Grapefruit juice;honey

Name: Pimm’s Cup
About: The Pimm’s Cup started as a health drink in 1840s London. The slow-sipping summer cocktail is the preferred vehicle for its eponymous liqueur a gin-based digestif that spread across the globe and found a loyal fan base in New Orleans. Combined with Sprite/7Up (or ginger ale) cucumber and a medley of fruit garnishes the drink proved to be a welcome relief from the Southern heat. The Pimm’s Cup is also the favorite cooler at Wimbledon where it’s still enjoyed by the pitcher.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a highball glass over ice and stir to combine. Garnish with a mint sprig skewered strawberry and optional lemon and orange wheels. To mix things up a bit you can replace the Sprite 7Up or ginger ale with Champagne.
Ingredients: Pimm’s No. 1 Cup;Sprite 7Up or ginger ale;Cucumber

Name: Frenchie
About: Combine gin grapefruit juice and St-Germain and you’ll have the perfect refreshing cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a grapefruit half-wheel.
Ingredients: Gin;Grapefruit juice;St-Germain

Name: The Ultimat Blueberry Freeze
About: Cool down with this chilly concoction.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients to a tall glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a watermelon slice.
Ingredients: Ultimat vodka;Patrón Citrónge Orange Liqueur;Blueberry juice;Orange juice

Name: Juicy Basil
About: This bourbon orange and cranberry cocktail will get your juices flowing.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir. Garnish with an orange slice.
Ingredients: Basil Hayden's Bourbon;DeKuyper Triple Sec;Orange juice;Cranberry juice;Simple syrup

Name: Macua
About: Named for a Central American bird this fruity tropical sipper was named the national drink of Nicaragua.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 20 to 30 seconds. Strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange slice and a candied cherry.
Ingredients: Flor de Caña 4-Year-Old Rum;Guava juice;Orange juice;Lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Blue Tahoe
About: The shocking color belies a classy Champagne-and-tequila concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a Collins glass and fill with ice. Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange slice mint leaf and cherry.
Ingredients: El Tesoro Platinum Tequila;Blue curaçao;Lime juice;Lemon wheel;Champagne
Garnish: 1 Orange slice mint leaf and cherry

Name: Honey Deuce
About: Raspberry lemonade vodka: the ultimate summer trifecta.
HowToMake: Fill a chilled highball glass with crushed ice and add the vodka. Top with lemonade to just below the rim and then add the Chambord. Garnish with honeydew melon balls.
Ingredients: Grey Goose Vodka;Fresh lemonade;Chambord or premium raspberry liqueur

Name: Stars and Stripes
About: A refreshing and fruity patriotic cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blueberries. Add the vodka absinthe syrup and lemon juice and fill with ice. Shake and pour (unstrained) into a highball glass. Drizzle with brandy and top with ginger beer. Garnish with one sugar cube.
Ingredients: Fresh blueberries;Stoli Blueberi Vodka;Lucid absinthe;Simple syrup;Lemon juice;G.E. Massenez Framboise Sauvage Raspberry Brandy;Ginger beer

Name: Pinata
About: Take a swing at this pineapple-juice-and-aged-tequila combo.
HowToMake: Add the tequila to a Collins glass filled with ice. Fill with pineapple juice and garnish with a pineapple wedge.
Ingredients: El Tesoro Añejo Tequila;Pineapple juice

Name: Moroccopolitan
About: A few drops of spicy bitters heat up this sweet pomegranate cocktail.
HowToMake: Add the bitters to a chilled cocktail glass and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: The Bitter End Moroccan Bitters;Pomegranate-Infused Vodka;Honey syrup;Lemon juice

Name: Encrusted Nail
About: The classic Rusty Nail gets an update.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a Champagne flute.
Ingredients: Drambuie;Lemon juice;Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur;Peychaud's Bitters

Name: Traditional Elderfashion
About: This St-Germain and bourbon drink will always be trendy.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass and fill with ice. Stir and garnish with an orange peel.
Ingredients: Club soda;Angostura bitters;St-Germain;Bourbon

Name: Cruzan Flip
About: With rum cream and egg this drink is the perfect nightcap.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass or 5-ounce juice glass. Garnish with a light dusting of freshly grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Cruzan Single Barrel Rum;Heavy cream;Sugar;Fresh egg

Name: Tequila Furnace
About: Fire up a traditional tequila shot with a little hot sauce.
HowToMake: Pour the tequila into a tall shot glass. Add a few drops of Tabasco Sauce and stir gently. Lick some salt off your hand drink the tequila and then bite the lime wedge.
Ingredients: El Tesoro Platinum Tequila;Tabasco sauce;Salt;Lime wedge

Name: Manuka Mule
About: Ginger ale is the perfect partner for a honey-flavored vodka.
HowToMake: Squeeze the lime wedges into a highball glass and add the mint sprig. Muddle gently and fill with ice. Add the vodka and top with ginger beer or ginger ale. Garnish with a cucumber slice.
Ingredients: Lime wedges;Mint sprig;42Below Honey Vodka;Ginger beer

Name: Pierre Ferrand Ambre
About: Try this cognac cocktail flavored with citrus cucumber and ginger; it’s as sophisticated as it sounds.
HowToMake: Place the lime peel and ginger slices in a short tumbler. Add half of the cognac. Lightly press the lime and ginger 2 or 3 times using a muddler or the back of a spoon. Fill the glass halfway with ice. Stir for 5 seconds. Add the remaining cognac club soda and cucumber peel. Stir for another 5 seconds.
Ingredients: Lime peel;Fresh ginger;Pierre Ferrand Ambre Cognac divided;Lemon-flavored club soda (San Pellegrino Limonata);cucumber peel

Name: Green Acres Punch
About: Rum cocktails are the life for me
HowToMake: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl or other container cover and let stand overnight. Strain and refrigerate until cold. Pour into a wine glass and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Flor de Caña 4-Year-Old Rum;Flor de Caña 18-Year-Old Rum;Demerara simple syrup (two parts Demerara sugar one part water);Lime juice;Green tea

Name: Beach Bum
About: Feel like you’re on permanent vacation with this refreshing vodka cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the grenadine into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Top with the grenadine. Garnish with fresh mint.
Ingredients: Vodka;Pear liqueur;Cointreau;Maraschino liqueur;Grenadine

Name: The Bow Tie
About: No need to get dressed up to enjoy this cognac cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a pineapple leaf.
Ingredients: 1738 Accord Royal Rémy Martin Cognac;Dry vermouth;Pineapple juice

Name: Jockey Club
About: Mix up this distant cousin of the Manhattan.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a brandied cherry on a cocktail pick.
Ingredients: Bourbon;Sweet vermouth;Maraschino liqueur

Name: Pyrat Passion
About: This drink will make you passionate about rum.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a bucket glass filled with ice. Garnish with a peach wedge if desired.
Ingredients: Pyrat XO Reserve Rum;Peach puree;Grenadine

Name: Sea Breeze
About: This light refreshing drink is just the thing for a day at the beach.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a highball glass with ice and stir. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Vodka;Cranberry juice;Grapefruit juice

Name: Golden Cup
About: Take first place with this Beefeater 24 Gin drink.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass bruise the apple and cucumber. Add the gin curaçao and sherry and fill with ice. Stir and pour (unstrained) into a pilsner wine or Collins glass. Top with club soda and garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Granny Smith apple diced;Cucumber diced (1-inch);Beefeater 24 Gin;Orange curaçao;Amontillado sherry;Club soda

Name: Desmo
About: The deep caramel sweetness of a good balsamic vinegar matches beautifully with aged cognac.
HowToMake: Add both ingredients to a brandy snifter or coupe and swirl to combine. If desired garnish with a flamed orange peel.
Ingredients: Well-aged balsamic vinegar;High-quality cognac

Name: Fuzzy Navel
About: The Fuzzy Navel proves that you only need two mere ingredients to create a notorious cocktail. New Jersey bartender and author of “Bartending for Dummies” Ray Foley mixed equal-parts peach schnapps and orange juice to create a fruity highball that has been going strong since the 1980s.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a highball glass over ice. (To make a Hairy Navel substitute vodka for half the peach schnapps.).
Ingredients: Peach schnapps;Orange juice

Name: Black Hawk
About: The gin may be sloe but you’ll drink this cocktail quickly.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with cracked ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a cherry and half an orange slice.
Ingredients: Canadian Club Whisky;Sloe gin;Fresh lemon juice
Garnish: 1 Cherry and half an orange slice

Name: Chairman's Refresher
About: Cooling cucumber and thirst-quenching coconut water contribute to this rum concoction.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass muddle the Frangelico and cucumber. Add remaining ingredients and ice and stir. Fine-strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a cucumber slice.
Ingredients: Frangelico;Cucumber slices;Coconut water;Banks 5 Island rum

Name: Strawberries and Cream
About: The perfect summer cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a strawberry.
Ingredients: Bulldog GIn;Strawberry liqueur;White crème de cacao;half and half

Name: Vanilla Skye
About: Chocolate mint and a big peaty Scotch flavor this drink. Trust us it works.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled coupette glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink to extract the oils and discard. This drink is one of Gary Regan's 101 Best New Cocktails.
Ingredients: Talisker 10-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky;White crème de menthe (the cheaper the better);Oloroso sherry;Chocolate bitters (Scrappy's The Bitter Truth or Fee Brothers)

Name: Garibaldi
About: Challenge your palate with this complex Italian cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass and fill with ice. Garnish with a flamed orange peel.
Ingredients: Averna amaro;Aged Virgin Islands rum;John D. Taylor's Velvet Falernum;Fresh lime juice;Orange bitters;Pellegrino Mineral Water

Name: Remnants of Summer
About: With this cocktail you’ll never forget the season.
HowToMake: In a mixing glass muddle the cucumber lime and maraschino liqueur. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Rock the mixing glass back and forth 18 times and fine-strain into a chilled coupe glass. Float a paper-thin cucumber slice on top.
Ingredients: Cucumber slices;Fresh lime juice;Maraschino liqueur;Tequila;Fernet-Branca;Cava sparkling wine

Name: Agave Drop
About: All the flavors of a Margarita are distilled down into this tasty shot.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a shot glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Agave nectar;Fresh lime juice

Name: Spanish Raindrop
About: If only the precipitation in the United States was this delicious
HowToMake: Add the tequila sherry lime juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a shot glass. Dip the orange zest in agave nectar and then in turbinado sugar. Flame the zest over the glass to release its oils and rub along the rim.
Ingredients: Don Julio Añejo Tequila;Oloroso sherry;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Orange zest;Agave nectar;Turbinado sugar

Name: Cocoa Passion
About: Tropical fruit crème de cacao and fine tequila will please your palate.
HowToMake: Fill a double shot glass three-quarters of the way with crushed ice. Add all the ingredients in the order listed above. If you're going to sip the drink stir to combine. Otherwise shoot it and let it mix in your mouth.
Ingredients: Unsweetened passion fruit purée;Dark crème de cacao;Don Julio Añejo Tequila;Champagne

Name: Mink Coat and No Manners
About: A dressed-up tequila shot that’s ready to go out.
HowToMake: Add the Green Chartreuse to a sherry copita glass. Float the tequila on top and garnish with a pinch of cayenne pepper.
Ingredients: Green Chartreuse chilled in the freezer;Don Julio blanco tequila

Name: 1870 Sour
About: Unexpected flavor combinations abound in this whiskey maple blueberry and wine cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the wine to a shaker. Shake vigorously (without ice) for 10 seconds. Fill with ice and shake for an additional 15 seconds. Fine strain into a chilled 8-ounce Mason jar or a Bordeaux wine glass. Float the wine on top using a spoon.
Ingredients: George Dickel Old No. 8 Tennessee Whisky;Meyer lemon juice;Maple syrup;Egg white;Blueberry jam;Ravenswood Sonoma County Old Vine Zinfandel

Name: White Lady
About: She may look delicate but this is one strong woman.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Gin;Orange liqueur;Fresh lemon juice;Fresh egg white

Name: Kentucky Flyer
About: Make an Aviation using all-American ingredients and you get this down-home cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with 2 brandied cherries and a mint leaf speared on a pick.
Ingredients: Rye whiskey;Luxardo maraschino liqueur;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Sparkler
About: Make any day a celebration with this festive cocktail.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a Champagne flute. Garnish with a strawberry slice.
Ingredients: Don Julio blanco tequila;Simple syrup;Champagne

Name: Forbidden Sour
About: Break the rules by mixing pomegranate and bourbon together.
HowToMake: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange wheel and a cherry.
Ingredients: Pama pomegranate liqueur;Bourbon;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Arwell & Ado
About: This vodka-and-grapefruit concoction is pure old-school.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt and fill with ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Ingredients: Salt;Ketel One Vodka;Dry vermouth;Maraschino liqueur;Grapefruit juice;Lemon bitters

Name: Raspberry Collins
About: Find out what happens when you add raspberries to this classic gin drink.
HowToMake: In a highball glass muddle the raspberries and simple syrup. Add the gin and lemon juice and stir. Fill with ice and top with the club soda. Garnish with a lemon wheel a mint sprig and two raspberries.
Ingredients: Gin;Simple syrup;Raspberries;Fresh lemon juice;Club soda
Garnish: 1 Lemon wheel mint sprig and raspberries

Name: Camus Fresh
About: A little lemon elevates the sophisticated flavor of cognac.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a long strip of lemon peel.
Ingredients: Camus VSOP Cognac;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup

Name: Bulleit Rye Smash
About: Cool down with this simple and classic whiskey drink.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint lemon simple syrup and water. Add the rye and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh crushed ice. Garnish with a sprig of mint.
Ingredients: Fresh mint leaves;Lemon wedges;Stirrings Simple Syrup;Water;Bulleit Rye Whiskey

Name: Bayou Bloody Mar
About: An extra-spicy Bloody Mary gets a crawfish-tail garnish for New Orleans flair.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a pint glass with ice and stir. Garnish with 4 spiced pickled string beans 2 olives and 4 crawfish tails.
Ingredients: Vodka;Tomato juice;Tabasco sauce;Worcestershire sauce;Prepared horseradish;Celery salt;Ground black pepper;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Vanilla Bourbon
About: Exotic tamarind syrup is the secret to the drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with three brandied cherries on a toothpick.
Ingredients: Navan Natural Vanilla Liqueur;Tamarind syrup;Bourbon;Club soda

Name: The Modern
About: This rum drink is up-to-date.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Martini or coupe glass. Garnish with 2 raspberries.
Ingredients: Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Grand Reserve Rum;Monin Rose Syrup;Agave nectar;Lime juice;Apple juice

Name: Dirty Martini
About: In 1901 New York bartender John O’Connor found inspiration for the Dirty Martini in the classic Martini‘s famous olive garnish. First made by muddling the olive into the drink and later by adding a splash of olive brine the Dirty Martini took decades to reach a wide fan base. Today it’s the go-to sipper for salt-craving drinkers.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with 2 olives.
Ingredients: Gin or vodka;Dry vermouth;Olive brine

Name: The Quetzal
About: The distinct flavor of maple syrup turns this tropical drink into something more complex.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with a piece of pineapple leaf.
Ingredients: Zacapa 23 Rum;Angostura bitters;Fresh lime juice;Fresh orange juice;Fresh pineapple juice;Maple syrup

Name: Cowboy Coffee
About: Crushed beans and Colorado whiskey make this tasty concoction fit for even the most grizzled cattle-driver.
HowToMake: In a shaker crush the coffee beans. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into a chilled Champagne flute. Squeeze a lemon peel over the drink and garnish with the peel and an additional coffee bean.
Ingredients: Dark roast coffee beans;Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey;Demerara syrup;Angostura bitters

Name: Tequila Daisy
About: The Spanish word for daisy? Margarita.
HowToMake: In a shaker stir together the lemon juice and sugar. Add the tequila and Grand Marnier and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Top with a small splash of club soda.
Ingredients: Fresh lemon juice;Superfine sugar;Tequila;Grand Marnier;Club soda to top

Name: Greyhound
About: Making a Greyhound goes as quickly as its namesake. The refreshing two-ingredient cocktail—vodka and grapefruit juice—is easy drinking especially if you’re using fresh-squeezed juice. Looking to throw a bone between the citrus and spirit? Add salt to the rim and you’ve got another canine-related classic the Salty Dog.
HowToMake: Add ingredients into a double rocks glass with ice and stir gently. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Vodka;Grapefruit juice to top

Name: The Seersucker
About: Wear this on a hot day.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberry. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a pilsner glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with an additional strawberry.
Ingredients: Flor de Caña White Rum;Cinnamon bark syrup;Lemon juice

Name: Sparkling Acaí Sangria
About: Whip up a pitcher of this bubbly fruity concoction at your next party.
HowToMake: Fill a pitcher three-quarters of the way with ice. Add all the ingredients except the sparkling wine and stir well. Top with sparkling wine and garnish with blueberries sliced strawberries and orange wedges.
Ingredients: 12.5 oz (half a bottle) VeeV Açaí S­­pirit;Elderflower liqueur;Orange juice;Sparkling wine
Garnish: 1 Blueberries sliced strawberries and orange wedges

Name: Another Fine Mes
About: This drink proves that rye and tequila belong together.
HowToMake: Add the maple syrup rye and tequila to a mixing glass and stir until combined. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
Ingredients: Maple syrup;Michter's Single Barrel Rye Whiskey;Don Julio Reposado Tequila;Combier Liqueur d'Orange;Punt e Mes;Fee Brothers Old Fashion Bitters;Regan's Orange Bitters No. 6

Name: Tequila Mockingbird
About: Tequila and watermelon is a woefully underused combination.
HowToMake: Muddle the jalapeño and watermelon in a shaker. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake until well-chilled. Fine-strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Ingredients: Jalapeño pepper slice;Watermelon cubes (about ⅓ cup);Silver tequila;Fresh lime juice;Agave syrup

Name: After-Dinner Sazerac
About: A coffee-liqueur rinse turns the classic whiskey cocktail into a digestive delight.
HowToMake: Rinse a chilled Old Fashioned glass with Galliano Ristretto and set aside. In a mixing glass muddle the bitters and sugar cube. Add the whisky and fill with ice. Stir and strain into the prepared glass. Break a kaffir lime leaf in four places over the drink run along the rim of the glass and discard.
Ingredients: Galliano Ristretto Coffee Liqueur;Angostura bitters;Sugar cube;Yamazaki 12-Year-Old Single Malt Whisky

Name: The LiberTea
About: Feel free to share this bourbon-lemonade punch with your friends.
HowToMake: In a large saucepan bring 2 cups of the water to a boil. Remove from heat and add the tea bags. Steep for 8 minutes and then discard the bags. Add the lemonade and the remaining 2 cups of water. Transfer the mixture to a pitcher and chill. Stir in the basil and crush with a spoon until fragrant. Stir in the bourbon and liqueur. Pour into tall glasses filled with ice and garnish each glass with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Water divided;Black tea bags;Lemonade;Fresh basil;Wild Turkey Bourbon;Wild Turkey American Honey Liqueur

Name: Grand Orange Collins
About: This fizzy citrusy concoction is distantly related to its cousin Tom.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker. Fill with ice and shake hard. Strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice and top with the club soda. Stir with a spoon and garnish with an orange wheel.
Ingredients: Grand Marnier;Orange juice;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Club soda

Name: Açaí Blueberry Mojito
About: Overdose on antioxidants.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint blueberries and simple syrup. Add the vodka and lime juice and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a highball or rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a mint sprig or skewer of additional blueberries.
Ingredients: Mint leaves;Fresh blueberries;Simple syrup;Van Gogh açaí-blueberry vodka;Fresh lime juice;Club soda

Name: Strawberry Cucumber Caipirinha
About: Sweet cooling and perfect for warm weather.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the lemon cucumber strawberries and sugar. Fill with ice and add the cachaça. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with strawberry and cucumber slices.
Ingredients: Lemon;English cucumber;Strawberries;Sugar;Leblon cachaça

Name: Country Thyme
About: You can drink this blueberry cocktail in the city too.
HowToMake: Place the thyme sprig in the palm of your hand and slap it to release its oils. Twist it and place in the bottom of a 10-ounce highball or Old Fashioned glass. Fill with ice and set aside. In a shaker muddle the blueberries and lemon. (If blueberries are out of season use 2 tsp of high-quality blueberry preserves instead. Adjust the amount of agave nectar depending on the sweetness of the preserves.). Add the vodka the agave nectar and ice and shake vigorously for 10 to 20 seconds. Strain into the prepared glass. Slap a sprig of thyme in your hand and use as garnish.
Ingredients: Thyme;Organic blueberries;Organic lemon;Square One Organic vodka;Organic agave nectar

Name: Baldwin Apple
About: This autumnal apple-brandy cocktail gets added depth from three different rich syrups.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker. Shake briefly without ice to combine. Fill with ice hard shake and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with grated nutmeg.
Ingredients: Calvados;Fresh lemon juice;Spice syrup;Fee Brothers Falernum;Fee Brothers Orgeat Cordial Syrup;Egg white

Name: Charrita Margarita
About: Try talented mixologist Junior Merino’s take on the classic tequila cocktail.
HowToMake: Coat the rim of a Margarita or cocktail glass with salt. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Salt;Don Roberto Añejo Tequila;Agave nectar;Orange liqueur;Lime juice;Water

Name: Midnight Smash
About: This blackberry-ginger cocktail is even good in the afternoon.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blackberries. Add the lemon juice Averna and vodka and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with the ginger beer and garnish with a few blackberries.
Ingredients: Meyer lemon;Averna;Orange-flavored vodka;Ginger beer

Name: The Perfect Storm
About: Get your sea legs with this nautical spiced-rum concoction.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except ginger beer to a highball or rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lime wedge. Top with ginger beer.
Ingredients: Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum;Fresh lime juice;Angostura bitters;Ginger beer

Name: Baton Rouge
About: Like the Vieux Carré? Try this rum and pear-cognac liqueur version of the classic.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a long lemon twist.
Ingredients: Peychaud's Bitters;Angostura bitters;Sweet vermouth;Xanté Liqueur;VSOP cognac;Gold rum

Name: Sir Hayden's Smash
About: Cool down with this icy blackberry and bourbon refresher.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blackberries mint and simple syrup. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and fine strain into a wine glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with an additional blackberry.
Ingredients: Blackberries;Mint leaves;Simple syrup;Basil Hayden's Bourbon;Amaro CioCiaro;Fresh lemon juice

Name: Reserve Luxury Daiquiri
About: This twist on the summery classic is rich with antioxidants.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the blackberry. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Blackberry;Appleton Estate Reserve Rum;Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar one part water);Fresh lime juice;Pom Wonderful 100% Pomegranate Juice;Maraschino liqueur

Name: Bitter Lemon Cooler
About: Get a taste of summer with this citrusy gin drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Top with bitter lemon soda or lemon-flavored club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Dry vermouth;Gin;Grenadine;Fresh lemon juice;Bitter lemon soda or lemon-flavored club soda

Name: The Ruby Patch
About: An all-organic strawberry-and-mint cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the strawberries and mint. Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake for 10 seconds and double strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a strawberry.
Ingredients: Medium organic strawberries;Fresh organic mint leaves;Tea-Infused Square One Organic Vodka%;Organic agave nectar;Organic lemon juice

Name: Coral Reef
About: This bitter-and-sweet gin cocktail is named for its lovely orange color.
HowToMake: Add the gin St-Germain and Aperol to a highball glass and fill with ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon twist.
Ingredients: Plymouth gin;St-Germain;Aperol;Club soda

Name: Patrón Pomegranate
About: Find out what happens when premium tequila meets antioxidant-rich fruit juice.
HowToMake: Add the tequila and orange liqueur to a rocks glass filled with ice. Fill with pomegranate juice and finish with a squeeze of lime.
Ingredients: Patrón Silver Tequila;Patrón Citrónge Orange Liqueur;Pomegranate juice;Lime

Name: Cinquecento
About: With Polish vodka and French and Italian liqueurs this aperitif is a grand European tour in a glass.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and double strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Ingredients: Luksusowa Vodka;Bénédictine;Campari;Fresh grapefruit juice;Angostura bitters

Name: NZ Sauvignon Blanc Punch
About: Surprisingly the vibrant white wine pairs nicely with bitter Aperol.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top with soda.
Ingredients: New Zealand sauvignon blanc wine;Aperol;Fresh grapefruit juice;Fresh lemon juice;Simple syrup;Club soda

Name: Moet Golden Glamour
About: This official cocktail of the 2010 Academy Awards is appropriately elegant.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a coupe glass. Garnish with a fresh mint sprig.
Ingredients: Moët & Chandon Imperial Champagne;Navan Vanilla Liqueur;Passion fruit juice

Name: The Complete Irish Meal
About: A whiskey supper from the Emerald Isle.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Ingredients: Bushmills Irish Whiskey;Cherry liqueur;Fresh orange juice;Egg

Name: Cognac Mint Julep Recip
About: Make this classic the old-fashioned way with French brandy.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the mint sugar and a dash of water. Add the cognac and fill with shaved ice. Shake until frosted and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Ingredients: Mint;Sugar;Rémy Martin 1738 Accord Royal Cognac

Name: Grand Margarita
About: Jazz up your ‘rita with a bit of Grand Marnier.
HowToMake: If desired moisten the rim of a rocks or cocktail glass and coat with salt. If using a rocks glass fill with ice. Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Ingredients: Salt (optional);Grand Marnier;Premium tequila;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup

Name: Ruby Chai Appletini
About: Get a double dose of chai.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the apple until the consistency of applesauce. Add remaining ingredients and ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an apple slice. *Chai-infused vodka: Add 1 Numi ruby  chai bag and 6 oz Square One Organic vodka into a Mason jar or other glass container and let infuse for 1-2 hours before removing tea bag. **Chai-infused cider: Add 6 oz organic apple cider into a small saucepan and heat over medium heat until hot but not boiling. Turn off heat and add 1 Numi Ruby chai bag. Let steep for 3-5 minutes and remove tea bag.
Ingredients: Organic gala apple;Chai-infused vodka;Chai-infused cider;Organic agave nectar

Name: Scramble
About: Beat the rush for this drink.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients except the crème de mure to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Drizzle the crème de mure over the top of the drink and garnish with a lemon spiral twist and 3 blackberries.
Ingredients: Partida blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice;Fresh lemon juice;Agave nectar;Crème de mure (French blackberry liqueur)

Name: Riviera
About: This deep-red drink is perfect for a romantic evening.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass. Garnish with a blood orange slice.
Ingredients: Dubonnet Rouge;Grand Marnier;Fresh blood orange juice

Name: Grey Goose Le Citron Asian Mary
About: Spice up this classic with a wasabi-spiked tomato mix.
HowToMake: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a large tumbler filled with fresh ice. Garnish with shiso or cilantro leaves and a lemon wheel.
Ingredients: Grey Goose Le Citron Flavored Vodka;Sake;Asian Mary Mix

Name: Superfruit Margarita
About: Go heavy on the antioxidants.
HowToMake: Fill a pitcher three-quarters of the way with ice. Add all the ingredients and stir well. Garnish with lime wheels.
Ingredients: VeeV Açaí Spirit;Blanco tequila;Fresh lime juice;Simple syrup;Pom Wonderful 100% Pomegranate Juice (optional)

Name: Kiwi Kwencher
About: Mix up this refreshing fresh-and-fruity cocktail.
HowToMake: In a shaker muddle the kiwi. Add the simple syrup and St-Germain and fill with ice. Shake until chilled and add a splash of club soda. Strain into a cocktail glass and top with the sparkling wine. Garnish with a kiwi slice.
Ingredients: Ripe kiwi peeled;St-Germain elderflower liqueur;Simple syrup;Club soda;Brut sparkling wine

Name: Ile Rouge
About: A French name and an exotic flavor.
